Reviews.Title: “Can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: adnill
Reviews.Content: Had a deluxe room with sitting area. Very nice marble bath with double sinks and separate shower and jacuzzi tub. Unfortunately, room also faced the Rambla and despite double doors and electronic shutter, noise occasionally was a problem at night. We were on 3rd floor. Service excellent and done with a smile. Didn't have the breakfast, there's a Starbucks and a supermarket right across the street. Impeccably clean. No fitness center. Location a block from place d'Catalunya, very central.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: JKB1989
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor reviews we stayed here three nights pre-cruise and can see why it was selected as a Travelers' Choice® 2012 Winner. The location is excellent (right on the Ramblas) and the service was absolutely outstanding. The entire staff was genuinely friendly. Those at the front desk spoke excellent English and had excellent city knowledge, recommending restaurants, places to visit, as well as places to avoid. It is about a 5/10 minute walk to the Plaza Catalunya where most of the bus stations are, and just few minutes walk to shopping, restaurants, bars, museums etc. The room we stayed in was excellent, spotlessly clean with a really comfortable electric bed, jacuzzi bathtub, mini stereo system, bathrobe, slippers, a big safe deposit box. Breakfast (9 euro), was served in a very open/airy room and contained both hot and cold dishes with enough variety for just about every taste. Central location, exceptional staff, and excellent value: we will definitely stay at this hotel again when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel right on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Bigal19_2
Reviews.Content: Behind the beautiful historic facade, we had an ultramodeThern European hotel room. Unlike some other updates of old luxury hotels where the rooms are cut up in odd ways, the renovation used the space very efficiently. The bath with jacuzzi had the latest, top quality fixtures and gray stone slabs around the tub/shower. The room was immaculate stark white with shiny wood floors, mini hi-fi, etc. The staff was very helpful and fluent in English; the concierge even recognized my Red Sox cap. And the location was perfect -- right on the Ramblas. The breakfast room was surrounded by (very clean) glass panels looking out onto a little courtyard with a fountain and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pipster37
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo last week. Very nice, in the middle of everything! The desk staff was very helpful. Loved Barcelona! Starbucks right across the street. I would definately consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great value of money”
Reviews.Author: Chung-Sin L
Reviews.Content: The best value of money among the hotels that I've stayed in Spain. For a lower price range of a 4 stars hotel, I get 5 stars service! The room is well equipped with everything that I could ask for, better than 5 star hotel rooms. Electric bed, jacquzzi bathtub, mini hifi system, bathrobe, slippers, a big safe deposit box etc. Above my expectation. And the hotel staff are very helpful. When I ask for a recommendation on a restaurant that serves good paella for one person (as most restaurants serve minimum 2 persons), the hotel staff Quique called up a restaurant specifically to cater for my request. And he gets a taxi to send me there. The service is far better than a lot of hotels that are of same grade. In addtion, the location of the hotel is just perfect. Withn walking distance to Plaza Catalunya where most of the bus stations are. And few minutes walk to shopping centres, restaurants, bars, museums etc. If I go to Barcelona again, I will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “a very good choice to see most of the attractions without a big effort!”
Reviews.Author: aztomla
Reviews.Content: A very central location, right on La Ramblas. Close to the marina, just a minute walk from Plaça de Catalunya. Very well furnished and modern rooms, new equipments, friendly staff, rooms are quite, especially those looking to backyard. All in all, a perfect stay for a reasonable money.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: SeattleShanu
Reviews.Content: Top notch service Great Location Lots of dinning options within a short walk from hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good clean decent hotel in best location”
Reviews.Author: aji
Reviews.Content: I had booked three small single rooms for myself anc my two colleagues, based on the reviews. We were not disappointed with our decision. The location was on Ramblas entrance, close to Aerobus and City Tours. There was a Carrfour opposite to the hotels and several food joints. The reception staff Barcha was very prompt in providing information about the sights and tour. We arrived at 0900am and room numbers were alloted same time, even the rooms were not ready. One room was ready after 02pm. The rooms we booked were small but it was very well arranged. Spotlesly clean, comfortable bed. Clean and large toilet. High pressure shower. Free wifi. Breakfast spl rate of 9Euro. We paid Euro 61 per room. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff, very clean, you will not be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Gillibrand65
Reviews.Content: I have literally just got from the airport after staying at the Hotel Monecarlo in Barcelona. I concur with most reviews which stress the location and friendliness of staff. The Hotel is it cheap but I would say it is value for money and I would certainly recommend it to family and friends. I stayed in room 304' which was a standard double room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: JJMatrixx
Reviews.Content: +ve *Very friendly reception staff, excellent city knowledge for recommending restaurants etc(some TA reviews were not consistent) and excellent English. *Location is A1. If you get the shuttle bus from the airport, it's a 2 minute walk with your luggage. Gothic old town is all within about 10mins, right on La Rambla, which is the place to be. Marina/sea is at the end of La Rambla. *Room decor is fine and functional but not chic boutique. -ve *Bed was not good. Two singles joined together so if there's two of you, one will be falling down a crack. *Shower was in the bath and not separate and had a shower curtain rather than a screen. * Bathroom floor could have been better cleaned - drop marks around the toilet. If I was to rewind the clock, would I book this place again knowing what I know now? YES.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special about it”
Reviews.Author: Honeygatherer
Reviews.Content: This time I stayed in this Hotel because it was no 1 on Tripadvisor at the moment.But I reluctantly came to the conclusion that it does not deserve that . There is nothing special or outstanding about it . The staff is indeed friendly but so are they at the Bagues where I stayed last two times. The location on the Ramblas is excellent but so is that of Bagues and a number of other Hotels . And only a few rooms are Ramblas facing . The rooms are spacious as is the bathroom . But it has no facilities - not a bar, nor a restaurant, gym, spa - nothing. Dont know how it has 4 stars . It only has breakfast and a roof called the Solarium. Even the mini bar just has water and one soft drink

Reviews.Title: “Perfect on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: travlinman42
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night here over Easter weekend following a cruise - absolutely fantastic. Right in the heart of the famous La Rambla boulevard that is the center of activity on Barcelona. Great resoration of an old classic Barcelona home with beautiful, modern room (especially the large modern bath), great front desk staff, very nice breakfast buffet, and reasonably priced. Don't miss Barcelont - a beautiful, vibrant city and the Monte Carlo is the perfect base on La Rambla and just a few blocks from the virtual center of the city at Plaza Cataluna!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, very attentive staff, very good location”
Reviews.Author: OlegVostrikov
Reviews.Content: Everytjing was of the very high standart. The food, the interior, the staff, the location. I liked most of all: 1) The old wooden stairs, that look like it came from the films about the Spanish Golden Age (it's polished, deep brown, and has very strong wooden scent - thus creating the immediate feeling of teleporting to that old good times). 2) The bed had the automatic mechanism, that raised the upper part of the bed, so after raising - you're like in the chair (not laying, but rather sitting). (not very usual, but very unique). 3) Location - I didn't realise this before: how it's critical to leave in the CENTER of such beautiful city like Barcelona: - you walk and enjoy the architecture of the city, cannot get enough of the gorgeous views, get completely exhausted - and (what a luck!) in the end - you don't have to have a long drive to your hotel - you just come in and fall down the bed! It surely cost some extra money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: Landyman4x4
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to all the reviews on Trip Advisor. The location is excellent and despite being on LaRambla was very quiet. It is only a 5/10 minute walk from the airport bus drop off at Place Catalunya and very central for tourists, especially for Barra Gotic.The staff are very helpful and friendly, nothing is too much trouble. The hotel is exceptionally well kept and rooms are serviced twice a day. Our room was quiet with electric shutters, a really comfortable bed and a super Jacuzzi bath. The only downside was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room but there are lots of places nearby to have coffee including La Boqueria Market.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel -- Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne F
Reviews.Content: My second time at this hotel and I will use it whenever I am in Barcelona. The rooms are exceptional and each seems a little different. It is quite fun playing with the electrical gadgets! Should you choose this hotel you will see what I mean. Quiet and directly on La Rambla is a great combo. There are excellent restaurants close by for tapas, a complete meal or anything in between. It is very close to the Gothic area and an easy walk to wonderful shopping whether you are looking for a department store or a small specialty shop. The staff is wonderful! They go out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, and Quiet Rooms In Spite of That”
Reviews.Author: Morpheus1041
Reviews.Content: We broke up our trip to Spain by staying first in Barcelona, traveling to Andalucia and then back to Barcelona for a few more days before heading home. When we booked the Hotel Montecarlo, we did so based solely on the reviews and the map. After spending time in the city on our first leg, we were nervous that the noise from La Rambla would make sleeping impossible, particularly given the heavy amount of political protest going on in the city. Not to worry. The rooms were surprisingly quiet, insulated by double paned windows, and the location impossible to beat. The rooms themselves were spacious and comfortable, and the service excellent (the front desk kindly tolerated our abominable Spanish). The only complaint we had was the internet service would wink in and out at inopportune moments. So, if you need reliable access for work, this may be an issue. Otherwise, we'd be back in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel...EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: justjnl
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 star hotel with 3 stars...sadly. Do NOT hesitate to stay here, you will never have any regrets. I have never been treated so royally in ANY hotel. My granddaughter and i stayed in 5 different hotels in Europe, and this one by far was superior in every way. Every person had a great attitude, and genuinely wanted to make our stay special. The service was outstanding, always available, friendly, helpful and actually happy! In the morning the server would be humming as she attended to the bountiful buffet. The night crew was no different, always smiling and going above and beyond to help. When employees are happy, it says so much about the management. My hats off to Fernando the manager for caring so much about your guests and employees. I'm sure it is part of the reason Fabio & Nelson do such outstanding work. To address the facility itself, it was beautifully kept. Very clean, neat and cared for. Nothing battered or marked, every corner cleaned to perfection. In Italy we were told there is no air conditioning because it was not April yet. (who cares that it was HOT) Being from MN, we were thrilled that hotel Montecarlo catered to everyone...and DID have A/C. Whew!! The room darkening curtains, were REALLY room darkening. Perfect when we wanted to sleep in a bit. Excellent WiFi reception...that was also included in the room. This was truly the best value hotel also, the jacuzzi was so great after walking all day. Do not be at all concerned that they don't have a full time restaurant...they are so perfectly located that there are restaurants all around them. Perfect location for tourists and close to everything. This hotel was not only the icing on the cake...but the cherry on top!! They made our entire stay in Barcelona memorable. We were so comfortable we really did feel special, like we were the only ones to care for.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Guillermo_Uno
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 3 night stay (22 - 25 March) at this marvellous hotel. I booked it last October (through Agodo) as a wedding anniversary surprise for my wife after reading so many good reviews on Tripadvisor. I was not disappointed ! A week or so before our arrival I e-mailed them explaining that my wife and I would be celebrating our anniversary during our stay, and asked them for a room with a nice aspect. They replied soon after, congratulating us and saying that they had noted our request. When we arrived they greeted us really warmly and then proceeded to upgrade our room at no extra cost ! How about that for customer service ! As many previous reviewers have said, the Montecarlo's staff are excellent. They made us feel exceptionally welcome from the moment we arrived, and throughout our stay nothing was too much trouble for them. About the hotel itself ? - Well, I can truly say that I could not find fault with anything! One last comment - their breakfast buffet is a must at only 9 euros per person - their scrambled eggs are second to none ! Go ahead - book a stay - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very serviceminded and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ARP_11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and very good breakfast buffet. We also enjoyed the sunny and very nice roof terrace. Excellent comfortable adjustable beds. Only one suggestion: It would have been nice to have been able to prepare coffe/ tea in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hotel, you get what you expect”
Reviews.Author: shuszczo
Reviews.Content: This is not the most luxurious hotel in Spain, but it is definitely above average. This is europe people, the rooms are going to be small regardless. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff was very very helpful in our trip. They helped us plan everything and were around the clock. the rooftop terrace is beautiful. the beds were comfortable. and this was a great deal price wise. This is my type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Barcelona - 1st class”
Reviews.Author: TrotterBath
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Montecarlo for 4 nights in March 2012. Wow. Superb. The staff were very very friendly. Our room was very clean, modern, and quiet considering our window was on the 4th floor overlooking La Rambla (2 sets of double glazing sliding doors). The room was air-conditioned, comfortable clean bed, lovely shower and jacuzzi, tv and internet if you wished but we didn't bother as wanted to get out and explore the city. The rooms were cleaned twice a day (morning and evening). The breakfast at 9 euros per person per day was delicious with cereals, cold meats, scrambled egg, bacon and sausages, fresh orange juice, lovely coffee, fruit, pastries and plenty of fresh bread and great friendly service. Another good restaurant for traditional paella is on the sea front down by the docks. El Merendero de la Mari. We had a delicious shell sea food paella. Mmmm. Not cheap but worth it. The staff behind the counter were very helpful and polite. We ended up going to the Nou Camp to watch a Barcelona game and they showed us where to get tickets. Also, gave us lots of advice on the trips, best tourist sites to visit, bus tours, how to get there, best restaurants (try Senyor Parellada which is a 10 minute walk away) and also advice about keeping safe in Barcelona with regards to handbag snatchers which are apparent in all cities unfortunately. We had some good banter with the staff and on our last day, we decided to get the metro to the airport. The helpful staff pointed us in the direction on the bus which is a 10 minute walk away in La Catalunya and costs euros 5:30 each. Perfect. Easy ride to the airport and cheap. A very good stay and an excellent hotel. I will definitely be going back. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tripmeister
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, excellent hotel, excellent staff. highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: clarkdjc
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights recently while visiting our daughter who is studying in Barcelona for the semester. Having never been to Barcelona before, we chose the hotel based on it being 10 minutes walking distance from where she was staying....once she got to the city and saw the Montecarlo from the outside she told me... "Nicest looking hotel on La Rambla"!! And indeed it is, especially at night! The staff was wonderful, rooms are beautifully done and cleaned twice a day, even though we never even caught sight of the cleaning staff! There is a beautiful lounge on the first floor which was apparently the ballroom of the house that is breathtaking. The breakfast was a great deal..and there is a small bar for pre-dinner cocktails that the front desk staff also mans...we had some great conversation with the guys working there while waiting for our daughter to join us. We loved the city and especially loved this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheeser73
Reviews.Content: Perfect combination of historic building with a modern makeover. Location is great and the price is very fair. The room I have is a bit small but it doesn't feel cramped at all and has everything I need. It is very clean and has a rooftop deck. There is even a remote shutter on the window to bloack out the light.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: wigan1992
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel on La Rambla. We stayed for four nights in March. The hotel staff are very friendly and the service was excellent. The room was spacious and very clean. The hotel offers a decent breakfast for 9 Euro. The hotel is centrally located and easy to access from the Airport Bus service on foot. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: TRWGlobal
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monte Carlo in Barcelona is for sure a hidden gem among 5 star expensive hotels. Directly across from Starbucks and The Le Meridien, the location is perfect. The rooms are exactly as they advertise, all modern, spotless, they have two pane glass and remote shutters for total quiet and darkness. We paid 99 Euro for single rooms and they were better than our next stop in Rome at the Cavalieri Hotel in Rome that was 360 Euro per night or more. The staff was excellent and new us by name after one day, breakfast was 9 euro and internet was free. As a travel agent this property gets my highest recommendation if you are not looking for the flash and spending extra cash. My only recommendation if traveling from the USA and have an early arrival book the night before you arrive so they hold the room and you can get check in at 8am, shower, close the shutter and get rid of the jet leg in one day. Also great Italian restaurant just past the Cathedral, look for the two story Starbucks it’s just next door. La Perla Nera, Tel. 933-105-646

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LisaKOntario
Reviews.Content: After searching all the reviews on tripadvisor to find the perfect hotel to start our Europe trip with I am SO HAPPY we chose Montecarlo Barcelona! Everything about our stay was fantastic. The location is top notch, our room was great - very clean, and the staff are so accommodating! I couldn't get over how quiet it was even though we were there during La Merce festival with music and crowds out all night. Don't look any further - just book it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellenet Service Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: mschneider
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the Hotel Montecarlo, and I can't say enough good things about my experience. The entire facility appears to be recently remodeled, and has the look and feel of a boutique hotel. I booked the "small single room" for only 65 Euros a night. The price seemed a bit too good to be true for a four star hotel located in the middle of the Ramblas. My fear was that the room would be the size of a closet:) In the end the room was small, but has more than enough room for just one person, and it has a full size bathroom with shower-tub/toilet/sink/bidet; the photos of the room on the hotel's website were very accurate. All the staff were very friendly, and professional.....especially the woman running the breakfast room. Each morning she remembered my preference for tea and fresh squeezed O.J. I normally don't pay extra for hotel breakfast buffets, but they had a 9 euro special, and it was too good a deal to pass up. This was a full hot buffet, and all the items were tasty. Barcelona was amazing and when I return one day, I will not hesitate to stay in this hotel again. A couple quick tips: behind the hotel there is an archeological site from the Roman era that has been turned into a nice park. To access it go through the public passageway at the hotel next door....it's a great place to enjoy your gelato;) Across the street is a large Careffour supermarket. They have cash registers in the front and back of the store.....if you use the ones in the back you can avoid the long lines for the ones in the front.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: Graham l
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, very well located but not so much that we were disturbed by any external noise! Breakfast was great, loved the fact we could have room service at no extra charge!! Rooms were lovely, very goo service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rachelopps
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights over a weekend to explore Barcelona, before moving elsewhere for a business trip. The hotel is perfectly situated, in the heart of La Ramblas which is the main street to explore shops, restaurants and market stalls. The staff were very helpful at all times, I could not fault them. I had a single room which was very small. Having found the hotel on TripAdvisor (and being impressed by the great ratings), I was prepared for a small room but it was somehow even a little smaller than I had expected. I would describe the size as the kind of space you'd imagine for a budget accommodation. Of course I didn't book the hotel to get a large room, so it was not of utmost importance, but there was not much room to move around. Despite being small, the room was very clean and tidy. Basic but modern, it had a nice bathroom and shower, and a mini bar. The bed was comfortable however my main gripe was that the hotel was extremely noisy. I was woken up several times each night by people walking along outside my room (not even talking particularly loudly). This was a real shame as it disturbed my sleep and I would have expected better sound proofing. Overall, I think this is a great place to stay if you're looking for somewhere moderately priced, in a great central location (very near Placa De Catalunya) and you are not worried about a bit of noise or having a large room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel: great location, friendly staff, clean clean clean!! All at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Gigi L
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write reviews online but I made the exception for Montecarlo Barcelona! We were in Barcelona for a business trip and a few of us extended our trip to see the city. The first hotel we stayed at (for business) was the Rivoli Ramblas next door to the Montecarlo and were terribly disappointed at the Rivoli (heat wasn't working, stolen jacket from conference room, stolen passport from guest room, terribly unreliable wifi, and the cleaning staff constantly hiding the extra blankets) so had fairly low expectations for the Montecarlo but boy were we wrong! We checked in to the Montecarlo right after the business portion of our trip ended and we couldn't have been happier! The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were small but efficient and had all of the necessities for our needs (at least the heating worked!) The rooms were very clean and the furnishings looked fairly new! I would stay there again in a heartbeat! At a price of 61EU per night for the single room, how could you beat that?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macclad1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo at the end of January and it was really great. The hotel was clean well looked after and the staff were really friendly, helpful and attentive. Really a super hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a City Break”
Reviews.Author: postcolonialist
Reviews.Content: I headed to Barcelona to meet up with my sister for a weekend, and I was delighted to discover that, once again, TripAdvisor didn't steer me wrong! Hotel Montecarlo is a cute boutique hotel right on La Rambla, which was a perfect location for me. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the Aerobus, which provides cheap transport from the airport. It is also near a subway stop, so you can easily get anywhere. I arrived in the early morning after a red-eye and headed to Hotel Montecarlo, hoping to store my luggage before heading out to explore Barca. To my surprise and delight, the hotel had taken my early check-in request seriously and my room was ready - at 8 in the morning. This set the tone of very good service at the hotel. The room itself was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the bathroom had a jacuzzi. The room was also very quite at night. Because of the location, between the hotel and everything around it, you will have everything you need to enjoy Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location.....”
Reviews.Author: NorwayJan
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location on La Rambla, just in the middle of everything. On one side there is Barry Gotic and on the other side of the street El Raval. The beds are comfortable and every room has a jacuzzi in the bathroom - very relaxing after a day of walking. The staff is very kind and polite and does everything to make your stay as good as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: MMG2010
Reviews.Content: Stay here regularly through wok as always found it friendly and offered all I need. Stayed before and will stay again. Great location for me for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Policies and Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaTraveler750
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Montecarlo for four nights last week. I did not enjoy the experience. My room was incredibly small. The bed was a twin and a half. The room was listed as having an area of 12 meters. I did not bring a tape measure, but this appeared to be an overestimation. I had just enough room for my suitcase beside the bed. I could not even sit comfortably at the desk because the chair could not be pushed back from the desk without hitting the bed. There wasn't even room for a chest of drawers. In addition, the room's only window looked out on an interior shaft that did not appear to be well-cared for. My biggest issue was with the hotel's visitation policy. The hotel does not allow any outside guests into rooms. This policy was explained to me at check-in, well after I could have changed my mind about my booking. A friend I haven't seen in several years traveled from Italy to meet up with me for a few days while I was in the city. He was unable to secure a room in the hotel. At 11 PM, the majority of the bars shut down in the city. The hotel would not let us go upstairs to hang out for a bit longer. In addition, early one afternoon, I asked one desk worker if we might be able to sit in the lounge and drink a bottle of wine I purchased from a local wine shop. I explained that we wanted to do this after 11 PM when the bars and restaurants closed. He said this would be fine. After returning to the hotel that night, however, the gentleman at the front desk turned us away. He said we could not use the lounge for this purpose. I explained to him that I had been given permission earlier in the day and explained that we just wanted to sit and relax a bit longer. Again, he said no. I am sure that hotel's prohibition on outside visitors has its reasons. Maybe they are trying to keep out the ridiculous number of prostitutes and drug dealers that walk that end of La Rambla at night. However, the policy goes a bit too far when it prohibits old friends from talking in the lounge area before midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling Manager and service.”
Reviews.Author: River08
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from three night stay. No issue with Hotel only wiyh the staff behaviour. Location good. Rooms fine but dark as only small window in room 210. At checkout it was a business trip so my husband wanted to pay with his work credit card. Unfortunately there was a problem paying with it. Instead of trying to help resolve the issue and assist my husband in finding an alternative method of payment the female Manager was threatening and inflammatory and told my husband she was calling the Police. My husband said fine and in the meantime he paid the bill with his personal credit card. It is my understanding that a Managers role is to assist and resolve. Certainly not to threaten. Don't stay here. Plenty of other Hotels on La Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MGHeating
Reviews.Content: Booked after reading Trip Advisor reviews, and was not disappointed! Arrived late at night, using the Aerobus which was easy to use, cheap and stopped in Plaza Catalunya just a few minuites walk fro the hotel on Las Ramblas. We were greeted by the fantastic staff, including Fernando who was hilarious! Our roms were standard ones but were large, spotlessly clean with a sleek bathroom, and adjustable beds! Not luxurious, but we just wanted somewhere to sleep that was central and it was perfect for us!!! Didnt eat breakfast at the hotel as we wanted to try the local cafes, but it was on offer for 9Euros which seemed fair. The front desk staff recommened several restaurants to try which were excellent, and also booked us a dinner/Flamenco show at short notice which I would reccomend too. Our flight was not leaving till evening, and the hotel happily looked after our suitcases and stored our passports in their safe until we needed to leave which was great. All in all we would highly recommend the MonteCarlo to anyone wanting to stay on Las Ramblas, right in the centre of everything> we will definitley be back for another visit!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Effortless - everything was done without asking.....fabulous no hassle place to chill out after the hustle & bustle of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: gdg84
Reviews.Content: Friendly service .... Always willing to help. Hotel quiet and relaxing. Will definitely stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel on la rambla”
Reviews.Author: denverrjd
Reviews.Content: while la rambla can be rather cheesy in part, rather noisy, and very busy, the montecarlo was serene and lovely. we came in at 8am after an all night flight, and were greeted kindly by a remarkable front desk staff. Professional, courteous to a fault, considerate, and fully english speaking we checked into an upgraded superior small suite, which fronted on la rambla. the room had a luxurious bath, 2 flat screen tv (which we never turned on), a balcony, double glass floor to ceiling (12') whch insulated us from the noisy streets several floors below. whatever our need, there was always a staff member with a smile and excellent english to help us with navigation, a reservation, or a simple courtesy. the location was perfect for our two day visit to barcelona, midway on the rambla between the place de catalunya and the harbor. a short walk to the awesome metro, which is safe clean and efficient, or the boceria market which is an absolute kick. i have certainly stayed in more luxurious hotels, but this one had what we needed: great location, electric blackout curtains, deep whirlpool bathtub, a remarkable bed, and a staff which was superb. we would come back here in an instant, it was much nicer than the other hotels we saw on la rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: swissdiving
Reviews.Content: Staff: Extremly friendly and helpful Rooms: Nice, functional, clean. Loved the spa bath Two slight drawbacks: 1. Even with double glazing, if you are a light sleeper, insist on a room out the back. 2. For tech heads: the wifi log in works only on the device originally logged in . So if you have several devices you want to connect, you need a seperate log in for each device.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ananEastSussex
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in perfect location for strolling in La Rambla and surrounding areas, the airport bus to Placa de Catalunya made it so easy as only 5 mins walk from bus stop to hotel.This was our second stay here and did not disappoint, the staff were extremely friendly, we had booked with friends for a surprise birthday and we were treated to a bottle of Cava on the house on their arrival. Lovely comfortable quiet rooms and breakfast has been reduced in price making it a good option as there was plenty of choice. No tea & coffee facilities in the room sadly, but room service for morning tea was very efficient. Would definitely return. General note - Please be careful - pick pockets are rife, our friend had his wallet stolen when someone tripped him up and within 15 mins his bank had called to say there was attempted use on his card.

Reviews.Title: “very spacious and modern in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: Yuan_12
Reviews.Content: Its location really beats all! The staff were super friendly and all speak great English. The rooms have very modern decor and are very spacious. Right on La Rambla. Close to execellent tapas place (remember to ask front desk for suggestion). Walking distance to lots of main attractions and two subway stations. Will definitely come back on my next visit to the city!

Reviews.Title: “Smack-bang in the middle!”
Reviews.Author: experience_addicted
Reviews.Content: Superior room facing La Rambla and despite this surprisingly quiet. Room small i.e. only place to be for two people was in bed as very tight seating arrangements. Bathroom compensated for this and Jacuzzi bath was an interesting experience when trying to take a shower – a non-slippery bath math would have been great. Fantastic balcony for evening drinks whilst doing some people watching – an added bonus would have been two chairs. I would recommend you to have your breakfast at some gorge outside café instead as 17€ was a bit on the wild side. Regardless of these comments it was a fantastic hotel, safe, clean and quiet with great staff – very attentive and helpful. Hence, when back in Barca this would be the place to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful oasis”
Reviews.Author: Kirstey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband for our anniversary and it was an excellent choice. Despite being on such a busy street with a balcony overlooking Las Ramblas it was surprisingly quiet. This was due to a double patio door system. I do not tolerate noise on a night as I am not used to it, so the peace was a pleasant surprise. It was just as lovely to open the doors and feel part of the outside atmosphere, especially with such beautiful sunny weather for January. The bed was not as comfortable as I would have liked but it is unusual to get a hard bed which I like. The bedding were nevertheless nice quality and the whole room spotless clean. Plenty of space in the room which had a seperate seating area which we did not really use. The jacuzzi bath and shower were nice with all of the expected toiletries including bath salts. Robes and slippers too. No tea and coffee facilities in the room, which being british, I would have liked. However there are plenty of places around to buy coffee (tea would have been more complicated i think!) to take back on your way "home". Large supermarket over the road to buy everything you may have forgotten and plenty of cafes/places to eat in the immediate vicinty. Staff were charming and didnt see the cleaning lady although she seemed to visit our room twice daily. Good tip - we got the aerobus from the airport for 5.20 euros each way and this takes you to Plaza de Catalunya which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Very pleased with this hotel and fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, spectacular rooftop view”
Reviews.Author: Bav20
Reviews.Content: Great central location, very safe for solo travellers. Room had free wifi, safe, fridge, tv, single bed. The rooftop terrace is a must see spectacular 270 degree view of Barcelona and several of it's landmarks. My only disappointment with the hotel is that the roof is not open for sunrise/sunset (I believe the hours are 10am-5pm) I booked my room early, getting a very good rate (61 Euros for a single), not sure what the standard rates are for this hotel. I don't advise to get breakfast for this or any other hotel in Spain, although I didn't try it. As long as you're in a central location there are many other cheaper options just outside your door.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Nancy N
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Hotel Montecarlo in January. The location is excellent between the waterfron, Gothic Quartert and Placa de Catalunya. I found the best deal directly with the hotel online with breakfast included. I reserved a suite to assure comfort for me and my son. We had two huge bathrooms and though it faced the Rambla noise was not an issue with the shutters down. Most of the staff was extremely helpful and friendly except one. When my other son arrived in Barcelona at 2AM and could not locate the friends he was going to stay with, he came to the hotel. The man at the desk insisted that since the room was reserved for 2 people, my son would not be allowed upstairs at all, even for a short time, to sit on the sofa until he could locate his friends. I offered to pay to add him, but he would not allow it since no one was available to set up a cot though I offered to do so. He was most unhelpful in resolving this situation and I had to pay for a separate room for a few hours use.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JandJWestSussex
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona for a short city break earlier this month and chose this hotel due to the reviews posted on Trip Advisor. We were really pleased with the position of the hotel which was close to the bus tour pick up points, the air port bus and all the sights that we wanted to see. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful particularly Sarah on reception. We chose not to eat in the hotel as there are plenty of coffee shops around which offer a continental breakfast. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for others like us who just want a comfortable, well positioned base to be able to explore such a delightful city. Going in January was perfect - lovely weather and no queues!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Melinda73
Reviews.Content: After reading the positive reviews on Trip Advisor, booked a standard double room for 4 nights including NYE. The room was spacious and quiet as it was not facing Las Ramblas. The bed was comfortable and you could adjust the height of the bed. Hotel staff were friendly and spoke good english and recommended some good restaurants to eat. The only downside was that there was no tea or coffee making facilities in the room nor in the communal lounge on the first floor. The roof terrace was a bonus but pity there was no swimming pool. The hotel is 5 minutes walk to Placa de Catalunya (tourist info centre and where you take the airport bus) and minutes to Liceu metro station and the Market. Overall a good stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Resting Place in buzzing City”
Reviews.Author: lhm-artworks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo as a lone traveller, the room was clean bed extremely comfortable and very quiet, It did not have a view but I had my eyes closed most of the time so this didn't concern me. Having a tea break, between a hectic day out and evening meals, it was great even in January to sit on the roof terrace and look down on the La Rambla and across to Mont junc. The reception staff were polite friendly and very helpful. I didn't try breakfast, I went out to watch the city come alive, all the main attractions and transport links were very handy. Previous comments about hearing the metro, there was a slight rumble I've felt worse and always travel with ear plugs. I also always take my travel kettle and a mug for teas & coffee. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: RStevens6011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the busiest road and close to everything. Restaurants, sight-seeing places, market and tube stations are all nearby. Hotel room and bed tend to be small. It's quiet most of the time though. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We had got good recommendations on good tapas restaurant and flemingo show. However, the reception area lacked the atmosphere and you could hardly meet other room guests most of the time. Anyway, we enjoyed all stay especially after the busy business' meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday on the La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: lkscotti
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I very much enjoyed our stay in Barcelona during the Christmas Holidays 2011. The Hotel Montecarlo more than met our needs and was in a beautiful location, right on La Rambla and just a short block from Plaza Catalonia. The Metro was very accessible from the Hotel and the shopping and strolling was just great. We enjoyed the tourist off/on bus and took a two day pass to first get an overview and then to go back to the places of interest. Sagrada Familia and Picasso Museum were favorites. We took a day trip to Figueres to visit the Salvador Dali Museum and we highly recommend it. The Metro, Trains and Airport in Barcelona are very clean and modern. This is a beautiful city and we plan on returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel with a unique staff just wanting to assist and help plan your visit in the city. nice, clean, modern and lovely rooms. staff speak excellent english

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jude J
Reviews.Content: Hotel Montecarlo was highly recommended to us and didn't disappoint. Superb location on Las Ramblas, close to tube station and within walking distance of shops, marina and beach. We had room with balcony overlooking Las Ramblas which was entertaining all hours of day and night. There was no noise from the street heard in the room because balcony had 2 sets of sliding doors from the balcony. Bathroom was luxurous with good sized jacuzzi (comfortably fits 2 people) with lighting. Rooms were comfortable, beds had separate electric controls. Reception staff were very helpful. Hotel Montecarlo isn't cheap but well worth paying that bit extra!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: micleroi
Reviews.Content: A great mid-range hotel, recently remodeled with a clear, clean line interior modern motif. Staff were without exception helpful and friendly at all times, many speaking two or three languages. Hotel location a huge advantage to those wanting to enjoy the old city. Nearby access to very efficient and easy to navigate metro stations for distant venues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, v good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simon E
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Oct 2010 - superb location on las ramblas; easy access to everything including the beach; easy access to the tourist bus service (excellent). We ate out, not in the hotel - breakfast was adequate but not great. Rooms smart and clean; staff polite and helpful; service good.

Reviews.Title: “Saved the best for last!”
Reviews.Author: A2DL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in three separate hotels in Barcelona this past summer and this was our favorite. It was a little more expensive than the others but it also felt the most special. It is centrally located on Las Ramblas, a nice walk from other Barcelona areas, and very close to "Platha" de Catalunya. The best restaurants are not in this area! For a memorable meal, walk to the Eixample neighborhood! The next time we go, that's where we will stay since it's less touristy. The staff will make you feel like you are coming home each time you enter the hotel; they truely are the icing on the cake. If it will be your first time in Barcelona, the Hotel Montecarlo is a great choice! There was one teeny thing missing, and that was a pool on the rooftop. The views were nice but it would have been nice to take a dip!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Montecarlo!”
Reviews.Author: Federica T
Reviews.Content: I'm an Italian travel agent and I travel a lot for business all over the world. This was my first time at the Hotel Montecarlo in Barcelona and I loved it. Location is perfect (on the Ramblas) and staff was outstanding. The staff at the reception was most helpful with us whatever we needed and asked for. They also offered to send me back my sunglasses that I forgot in the room at their own expense! I did not expect this special treatment and it was much appreciated. Breakfast was very good and the lady who is in charge is particularly friendly and professional too. Rooms have all the comforts you need with lots of amenities. I would definitively stay there again should I go back to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value in BCN”
Reviews.Author: Flyu2themoon
Reviews.Content: I visited Barcelona for the first time this week and chose this hotel from the recommendations on Trip Advisor. An outstanding choice, great location, great value, totally renovated and unbelievably friendly staff. Highly recommend this to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Safe and sound in Barceleno.”
Reviews.Author: Irene760
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend a stay at this hotel is you need a central room in Barcelona. The position was wonderful but what made it a great place to stay was the staff who all spoke very good English, were very professional and yet friendly with a great sense of humour at the same time. This was very refreshing after weeks of travel and we appreciated all the information they were happy to provide. The breakfast was also very good and all amenities were well maintained. Our room came with adjustable beds - a good way to rest after a hectic day seeing the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a Fabulous City”
Reviews.Author: MrsHone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo during our honeymoon. We stayed there for 6 days/5 nights. First of all, this amazingly beautiful hotel is located right in the heart of La Rambla, a fun and exciting tree-lined pedestrian street. When walking up to the hotel you are immediately enamored by the beauty of the architecture of the hotel. One word: stunning. We were greeted with champagne in our hotel room and the staff was super friendly and accommodated our every need. They were incredibly helpful when it came to providing us with directions and recommendations for dinner, shopping, drinking, etc. Everyone was so nice and such a pleasure to be around. Our room was fantastic as well. A perfect size for two people complete with a balcony overlooking La Rambla. Everything was modern and up-to-date without loosing the authentic feel of being in historic Barcelona. Every request we had was more than met throughout our stay – whether we needed an iron, champagne at 2 am, American outlet adaptors, or an umbrella as we went to dinner and rain started to fall. We couldn’t have asked for a better experience than what we received at the Montecarlo and will be sure to return the next time our travels take us to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent 4-star B and B”
Reviews.Author: DWHughes
Reviews.Content: Fine 'modernist' hotel right at the heart of what's most attractive and exciting in Barcelona. Rather austerely furnished, especially in the rooms though this is compensated by vast jacuzzi in the bathroom - a considerable gymnastic challenge for sexagenarians who want a quick shower. And a fantastic electric toilet which will provide hours of puzzlement. Actually I would have preferred lots more places to put things, both here and in the bedroom. Staff are unfailingly smiling, helpful and friendly and there is an excellent breakfast; but no other meals. And the bar seemed always to be closed. Really this is a top-of-the-range b and b , but that's probably fine in view of all the bars and restaurants in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “We would choose it again!”
Reviews.Author: recreationaltraveler
Reviews.Content: No need to say more--great location and very professional, courteous staff. They made excellent recommendations so we could make the most of our time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch European Boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynnesstuff
Reviews.Content: We hit it just right for our first stay in Barcelona, planning 5 days before a cruise of the Mediterranean. Their staff was outstanding, the hotel rooms clean and comfortable, with a breakfast available for a reasonable price and to die for!!. The Rambla is the Rambla-touristy and busy but fun. We did the red bus tour which is highly recommended and well worth it. The architecture and the market on Rambla is not to be missed

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: headoftheclass
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here. If you're coming in from the airport it's very very easy to get to. (It's a 5 minute walk from the bus which goes from directly outside the airport to the top of La Rambla). The staff are incredibly helpful and made fantastic recommendations for places to eat and things to do. The room was very nice and the continental breakfasts were great. I'd absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel - room, staff, location!!”
Reviews.Author: 20New2Travel11
Reviews.Content: Great location, very comfortable for a single American traveling to Barcelona for the first time. Everything was just right - room, staff, location etc. You are in the heart of Las Ramblas and steps from endless sidestreets with local charm, restaurants, shops etc. Airport shuttle bus drops you off a couple blocks from the hotel and is very easy and affordable. Great first visit to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room and great service”
Reviews.Author: TGN_50
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here. I selected the hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. I took a chance and paid the whole amount in advance for a non-refundable stay because of the substantial cost savings. From the moment I booked the reservation online, the service was perfect. My US credit card company denied the charges as a security precaution at first and the hotel swiftly helped me sort that out. When we arrived at the hotel 2 months later, the front desk immediately had our bags taken up and showed us a lovely, spacious room with a separate small sitting room and a deluxe bathroom with a giant shower and separate jacuzzi tub for 2. The room did not have a view - it faced an interior courtyard - but was sparkling clean and quiet (no street noise). We had hoped to try several of the cutting edge Barcelona restaurants and the front desk gladly assisted with the reservations. The staff were friendly and professional at every interaction. The central location is perfect - right across the street from the Mercat de la Boqueria. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always Our Choice in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: cadeaugratuit
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monte Carlo is one of our favorites in all of Europe! We have been fortunate to enjoy a suite overlooking La Rambla on each occasion. A bit frustrating that when booking, a view room cannot be guaranteed at any price, but we have always had our request fulfilled. I could spend hours just watching the sights on La Rambla-mimes, the bird market, flower vendors- a fascinating, lively scene. The hotel is classic old world, but the rooms are actually sleek and modern. Plenty of outlets, storage, bidet etc. But should I go on about the bathrooms? You must know that they are among the most beautiful I've experienced. Marble throughout, enormous jetted tub, robe, slippers, even a scale! Hardwoods used in the bedrooms/suites are quite striking. The hotel is always very clean! The multi lingual front desk staff efficiently wears many hats-excellent team work evidenced by personal attention to each guest. Location is ideal for shopping, strolling, dining. We have always been given excellent recommendations for restaurants that did not disappoint. PARKING- can be an issue in Barcelona. Even if I didn't already love the hotel, the valet parking in an attached underground garage is a huge plus! There is no other hotel choice for us in Barcelona. We've often recommended it to friends who were equally delighted.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: andyhofer
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, the exterior is from a fabulous era with great architecture, but the inside is modern, just how we like it. Right in the centre of things and the rooms are exceptionally quite. The bathroom in our room was larger than we expected with a double jacuzzi bath. The only thing that wasn't in the room was tea and coffee facilities, but beyond this, we couldn't fault it. Would definitely visit again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: marbles67
Reviews.Content: I didn't need to use my rusty Spanish at all as the staff spoke excellent English. We had room 504 which had a jacuzzi bath and was very clean although the bathroom smelt a little damp (no mould to be seen, though). The pillows were great too and the bed was comfy. The room overlooked an outside space with terracotta tiling and a fish pond but there was some noise from air conditioning units outside. The roof terrace was lovely and had views of nearly 360 degrees but was only open from 10 - 17:00 so no night caps up there! It was my husband's birthday and the hotel gave him a little bottle of cava to celebrate. I contacted the hotel in advance and they booked a restaurant for the night of our arrival - Igueldo - which I would highly recommend. One of the reception staff also recommended and then booked a restaurant for us to have paella - Can Manel. If you want any other eating or excursion recommendations, just let me know. Aerobus from the airport took 30 mins and is 5 mins away from the hotel. 5,30 each way single.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Loriintheburgh
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo one night pre-cruise and one night post-cruise. (October 22 and November 4) The hotel was in a perfect location. It was easy to get to using the airport bus (a great value and convenience). The staff were great and helped us to find things that we wanted to see. They sell a discount voucher for the Hop On Hop Off bus - which is perfect for seeing the whole city. The rooms are big - very big by European standards. The beds are ultra comfortable. The windows have room darkening shades. We were in rooms 209 and 210. Both were great. Quiet, comfortable, and very clean. Recommendations - for some fabulous pastries and hot chocolate that is like melted chocolate in a cup - go to Escriba (83 La Rambla).

Reviews.Title: “The service, impeccable”
Reviews.Author: jacobsrdjr
Reviews.Content: Found Hotel Monecarlo on Tripadvisor and what a pleasant surprise. It's all about the location, the service, and the STAFF!! Our "superior room" (for 2 people) was very spacious and the bathroom was remarkable (really, who comments on the bathroom but this one was worth mentioning). Adrian and Gonzalo at the hotel's front desk were very friendly and helpful in every sense of the word, and even made hotel reservations on our last night at El Pintor (don't miss this one, too!) about 10 mins walk in the Barri Gotic near the Cathedral. We'll definitely book again at the this hotel on our return trip to Barcelona. Thank you to everyone at the Hotel Montecarlo for a wonderful visit!!! I forgot to mention the woman in the breakfast room . . I forgot her name but she was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!! Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: 49david17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our 20th anniversay. The hotel is located on La Rambla, right in the middle of all the action. I thought the noise from the street below would be very loud but our room was very quite. (double doors to the balcony kept the noise out) The hotel is within walking distance to all the Gaudi sights and very near the Gothic quarter. The room was very modern and comfortable.The staff was very friendly and helpful. We are going back to Spain next summer and will book this hotel again! Loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION, NICE PEOPLE, MODERN AND BIG ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: Canard78
Reviews.Content: We have spent 2 days in Barcelona. Montecarlo Hotel is very well located along the Ramblas and near Catalogna place. All visits can be done by walk or with subway (clean and air condionned). Our Standard Room at the 5th floor, at the rear of the hotel was big, very quiet, beautiful, with a big bed, with a lot of storage spaces. Bathroom is clean, with bathrobes, and spabath. The staff has been very kind. Possible to have a breakfast (quiet seldom in Barcelon hotels), but not included in room price. Well, it was perfect ! I have no negative point

Reviews.Title: “Great little visit”
Reviews.Author: Cindyline
Reviews.Content: We only spent a few nights in Barcelona; fantastic city! The hotel is in the middle of the action, within walking distance to many of the sights and along the busiest walking boulevard 'La Rambla' with lots of restaurants and street performances. - Great location, friendly service. The room was modern and comfortable, the hotel has 'totally renovated insides in an old edifice'. Car parking space in the basement. - Price is very reasonable, but instead of hotel breakfast I would recommend breakfast at a nearby open air market. It is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: AlanVet29
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel located in once of the main streets of Barcelona. Helpful staff and clean rooms complete with electronically adjustable beds and jacuzzi! The only minor complaints were the building works going on just above us and the double bed was 2 single beds pushed together. Overall, I'd thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A walking distance to the Liceu Opera Theatre”
Reviews.Author: MariaCB
Reviews.Content: Deciding for Hotel Montecarlo had essentially to do with two things: the Trip Advisor’s ranking as Travelers' Choice® 2011 Winner and one of the Top 25 | Europeans' Favorites, coupled with its location close to the Liceu Opera Theatre in Las Ramblas. I had tickets for the February/March Opera Festival, so the location was very convenient and at a 5 minute walking distance to the theatre. I fully subscribe to all the positive reviews of the hotel. My room was amazing, tastefully decorated with light colours, a double adjustable bed and a bathroom with jacuzzi. The room was separated from the bathroom by and small entrance hall with a wardrobe including a free safety box. Although I booked a single room, the design was conceived in a way that you had the impression of being in a self-contained apartment. There was also a writing-desk, TV, CD player and complimentary high speed internet. The room was very quiet although overlooking the bustling Ramblas. The staff were very friendly, helpful and polite. The hotel rightfully deserves the recognition that meets the standards of top Europeans’ Favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the best location!”
Reviews.Author: Linda4172
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, after a long overseas flight. The beds were adjustable and super comfortable, perfect for getting over jetlag. The bathroom was very nice and modern. The location couldn't have been better, right on Las Rambla and within walking distance to catch the Aerobus to/from the airport, as well as the Hop On, Hop Off bus tours. PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller18
Reviews.Content: Reserved based on the Tripadvisor reviews and it was an OK stay. Location of the hotel is special - so nice to step out directly to the buzz of La Rambla - but the rest is pretty basic. Good but basic. Room was clean but relatively small. Beds are very nice and room is very quiet. Breakfast was OK with good service. The guys at the reception are friendly (must say that leaving room key in the reception is a bit old-fashioned...). There is a lounge with a bar that we never saw anybody in, either customers or bartender for that matter. Sort of a quiet place in general. Visited the H1898 (almost opposite to Montecarlo) lounge bar and it was very trendy and buzzing. Would go back if got a good deal because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “HYGIENE DISASTER”
Reviews.Author: 8002reverse
Reviews.Content: I caught the maid cleaning the glass in which my toothbrush was placed with the same cleaning items as the lavatory, floor and everything else. The manager was a good listener. I showed him the iPhone video and 'photos. The culture won't change. The effort will be to make sure the bathroom door is locked when the cleaner is at work. Despite quadruple glazing there's still street noise. The subway that runs under the hotel is audible. The shower needs non-slip applied. Other than the above, it is a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: teabrewer1
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to have a deluxe room with a balcony overlooking La Rambla and we made use of it during the evenings, sitting in the October sunshine. We liked the spacious bathroom and the little seating area, with its own TV! Breakfast had a selection of nice quality items, with the offer of freshly squeezed orange juice and freshly brewed coffee, upon your arrival in the breakfast room. As stated before, the blackout blinds worked well and the air conditioning was very quiet, Brilliant! All in all, an excellent hotel, in the perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Not Amazing”
Reviews.Author: fltmazzola
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews, I thought that this hotel would have something more. The location is great. Our room was not at all loud. But we barely had a window. It was very tiny and looked onto an internal courtyard. The room was very modern, but nothing special. Overall, I was not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “When the Best Gets Even Better”
Reviews.Author: gpizzy
Reviews.Content: We chose the Montecarlo after reading dozens of reviews on Trip Advisor. Our trip was the first time in Barcelona. We stayed two nights in September and again overnight after cruising the Mediteranian for 12 days. This was to be our "Dream Vacation" after raising a family and spending these years having fun. The Montecarlo is at the top of the lodging food chain... Our rooms were both a standard and a superior, and they both exceeded our expectations. The standard was perfect overlooking a a quiet courtyard. The hardwood floors, corner combination of a shower, tub and spa was exceptional. The bathroom also was equipted with a bidet, spectacular tile and marble and satinless steel. We haven't seen many better(Perhaps the Omni Berkshire in New York City and this was the standard... The hotel is immaculate and the staff very helpful as other reviews indicated. We loved the location, just up La Rambla you will find the La Boqueria (City Famous Market) where one could spend hours admiring the food displays. A short walk up to the Placa de Catalunya will get you on the jump on and off buses for amazing tours of the city and it's culture, history and architecture. Folks... don't walk, run to Barcelona and the Hotel Montecarlo. The second stay, post cruise.. we were upgraded to a superior room. We had a balcony on La Rambla to people watch and enjoy the flavor of this VERY SPECIAL CITY. This time we had a suite.... imagine, we actually tried to talk the staff into assigning is the same room we occupied two weeks earlier, they insisted we were paying for a superior and wanted us to experience that level. Well, we were blown away !! The first stay was at a peak period, the second, was not. However, forget the price... if you want an extrordinary hospitality experience... You will get it at the Montecarlo. We will be returning again. Two minor issues... one we were advised to use the Red "On and Off" Tour Buses and pre-purchased 2 day tickets. We eventually had to stand in long lines and had difficulty boarding the buses on when we wished. A competitor bus company appeared to be much better equipped and staffed. The second happened at check-in, the fornt desk has a peculliar method of providing a safe for valuables. There was a mix up but quickly fixed. In all, we found we could trust the staff and their sincere effort to excel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 23sarah72
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break and stayed at this fabulous hotel. The staff are the most helpful, polite and welcoming we have ever come across. The hotel is ideally located and is spotless. Would definitely recommend this hotel, and we will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis on La Rambla!”
Reviews.Author: LoisOttawa
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, and agree with all the positive comments. We had a deluxe room overlooking La Rambla. Very spacious and,yes, it was quiet! I was concerned, given how lively the street is at all hours. Make sure the door to the sitting room is closed and you won't hear a thing. The black-out shades are great. Staff were friendly, and helpful. Our room was spotless and with the turn-down service,towels were always fresh. The one thing I would have appreciated was a kettle,but they had everything else we could possibly want. We will stay here again on our next trip to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Cubist288
Reviews.Content: I am of European descent living in Asia since 30 years, being spoilt from Asian hospitality, I was extremely positive surprised when I entered the Hotel Monte Carlo. My wife and I could not believe we arrived in a Hotel in the middle of Barcelona, getting a reception which was unbelievable pleasant. The welcome of the receptionists was absolutely fantastic, one could really feel they meant you are welcomed. You get this feeling being treated like a welcomed guest throughout all hotel service levels, just wonderful. I don't want to repeat all the excellent reviews in regard to rooms, location, etc., you cannot praise this hotel with words you have to experience it, out of this world. I can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch small hotel”
Reviews.Author: BuntzB
Reviews.Content: Just want to reinforce what others have said which led us to Montecarlo in the first place. Best small hotel we have ever stayed in. Can't say enough about the helpful, friendly,staff, cleanliness, breakfast, excellent location, quiet refuge in the midst of La Rambla chaos, on and on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mount30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before a a cruise. Great location. Wonderful staff. Very friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and good size. We were overlooking the courtyard. There was no noise from the street. Great rooftop solarium. Breakfast very good for 12 euros. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SunnyDebbie
Reviews.Content: Located right on La Rambla, 5 min walk to Placa Catalunia, where you will find the metro, hop-on hop off bus, and the aerobus. Closed to Barri Gotic and many Gaudi sites. Lots of people around on La Rambla all the time, felt safe here - but beware of pickpockets. Very comfortable hotel, good beds that electronically adjust, jacuzzi tub, free wifi, bathrobes, and toiletries. Silent rooms. We were on the fourth floor - this floor seems to be the budget floor - tired old warn-out carpet, rooms with nicks in the plaster in need of painting. But still clean and comfortable. Our window faced the wall of the next building - that didn't matter to us, but some would prefer a view. Electronic shutters made the room totally dark at night.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: keepdancin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights before our Mediterranean cruise and had a fabulous time. The location is great, with major attractions a short walk away. I was concerned because it is right on the bustling La Rambla, but other reviewers said that noise didn't bother them and it didn't bother us either. The hotel is gorgeous - small and stylish. We loved our junior suite which was spacious and bright with a small patio. The bathroom was fantastic with a whirlpool bath and a shower/spa. When we wanted to view the street action, we sat in the gorgeous parlor in the front of the hotel. We took wine to the rooftop terrace to enjoy the city view at sunset. Breakfast was a beautiful and delicious buffet with many choices and there was also a computer for the use of guests. The very best feature of the hotel is the staff -- friendly, helpful and fun. When it began to rain one day, they went to get umbrellas for everyone. Got some great recommendations for touring and dining that were perfect. We are already making plans to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel. A definate No Brainer”
Reviews.Author: cathy h
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We had a balcony facing Las Ramblas so that we could stand on our balcony and watch the action. However, when we closed the doors, it was completely silent. I read that in previous reviews, but didn't believe it. Well, its true. I suppose that you can have your cake and eat it too. The location to all of the attractions is perfect for walking and the hotel staff were so nice. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poppie08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here April 2007, on our Marbella-Rome-Barcelona Trip. We had booked way in advance and requested for he room facing La Ramblas and we got it. The room was well sized with a jacuzzi bath in it and it had a glass partition that allows you into the room. The staff are very friendly and ready to help with directions and suggestions of sights and places to visit. Staying on La Ramblas and walking up and own had loads of activities in the evening into the night. You only had to open the window/balcony door, step out and take in the sights. Our room was on the 2nd floor but once you closed the door... Silence. The hotel is excellent and well located, and the high street is just at the top of La Ramblas, on the other side you have beautiful church, like an amphi theater, a jetty and we went a boat trip to see Barcelona by the water.

Reviews.Title: “Hope Nothing Goes Wrong”
Reviews.Author: Randalljay
Reviews.Content: While we were very pleased with the room, the location and the breakfast, we were very disappointed on how the hotel handled a minor crisis. We were woken up at 5 AM by water dripping (then pouring) from the ceiling. We did what we could to minimize the damage and were given another room. They did not offer us any compensation for our disturbance or our efforts and only gave a trivial discount upon being asked for one. Upon return home, after registering our dissatisfaction, we were offered a free night the next time we're in Barcelona. Nevertheless this is a well located hotel with excellent rooms - when they're dry.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Todd R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in awful condition. Our room was dirty: stained carpeting, I found dirt in our sheets, ratty bath towels, etc. While the front desk staff was excellent and very helpful, the hotel itself was a dump to put it nicely. Also, it is about a 45 minute walk to the beach from this hotel - so if you're coming to Barcelona to hit up the beach, I'd recommend staying elsewhere. Also, our room was right above a restaurant - so it was extremely noisy until late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: shipster
Reviews.Content: Went a little upscale for us retired folks but it was worth it, Great location, quiet, luxurious feeling, spacious, great staff. We took the hop on hop off bus - got ticket off the main square (Catalunya) - the line at the hop on hop off (HOHO) there were long, got on early. their are HOHOs in Barcelona- we took the less crowded one (the one with the ampersand as a logo - not the eye logo) and were glad. There were two routes and we did both, Never got off just looked this trip. We just strolled along for the most part and enjoy it. We only had two musts. La Boqueria - a covered market - where we ate a breakfast and had two lunches and got stuff to eat in the hotel on one evening- the best meals we had in Barcelona. The other must was Gaudi's SAGRADA FAMILIA - which was also worth it. When we went by on the HOHO it looked so crowded we just stayed on HOHO, We then went late in afternoon and it was not very crowded at all . Wonderful - what a genius. Took airport bus from catalunya square - no sweat. Make sure you know what terminal you are going to - there are two, he

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: SandCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We are staying at our second night in the hotel, in our first time in Barcelona. From the moment we arrived, we have been delighted with the excellent and friendly service at the hotel. From an excellent recommendation for dinner, to the right bus to get to the beach, to a refreshing gin and tonic in the hotel bar, these guys do it very well. Great location, great service and the team speak English well and enjoy their guests trying their best with Spanish. If you are looking for a hotel in Barcelona, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a very nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: mellisa m
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel due to it's location and the level it seemed to have- we were right in doing so. it's perfectly located right on Ramblas and it's a nice hotel all around. I would come back and stay here. Wasn't crazy about the breakfast but it was still good. I would reccommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Destination: Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Marcmarc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Barcelona and my stay at Hotel Montecarlo, all in all, a very pleasant experience. The folks who work there at the hotel could not have been nicer or more helpful, their English was very good as was their eagerness to please. The hurricane that hit the East Coast caused me to cancel and re book several times and they were very understanding and slid my reservations a few times, no problem. A lovely building converted into a hotel several years ago it is in the thick of things on Las Ramblas, which is always a hive of activity. My room was very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and equipped with a good sized bathtub and a shower hose. As a 4 Star rated hotel it may not be for the economy minded traveller, but I am always willing to spend extra if it is worth it and in the case of the Montecarlo, it's money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel = Best holiday”
Reviews.Author: PaulaSydneyNSW
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, right in the middle of things on La Rambla, the hotel staff are wonderful, so helpful and friendly. The whole hotel is uncluttered and elegant, spotlessly clean, and whisper quiet. The beds are so comfortable and the spa bath is a treat at the end of a busy day looking at the wonders of Barcelona. I spent 20 days in this hotel and every day thanked my lucky stars I had found this perfect holiday destination. The price is more than reasonable, the room size is adequate, but being in the realm of good taste and quality is priceless. The breakfast was delightful, delicious and unhurried, and the suggestions of the staff regarding restaurants, and how to get about were always very good. There's a very good reason Hotel Montecarlo is rated "Number 1" of the hotels in Barcelona!!! They ARE the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: PDWells
Reviews.Content: We just returned after spending three nights here in August and we actually cancelled a later reservation at another four star hotel so we could return to the Montecarlo and the main reason for that was because of the wonderful staff. They were always friendly and helpful to us and we had a great rapport with many of them. The amenities were great and the location fantastic. We found the hotel to be quiet even with all the traffic on the Rambalas. We would definitely recommend and would not consider another hotel if we returned to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - All Reviews Quite Right”
Reviews.Author: Gezzerboy
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here in late August with the wife to celebrate a birthday. The hotel is easy to find being right on the main strip and is on the left as you walk down from playa catalunya. Straff were excellent and were more than helpfull whenever called upon. Room was great also, large double electric beds and electric window blinds made the room pitch black when used which really helped when sleeping. No noise from the main road at all. We didnt try the food but when I did ask for 2 coffee's to be bought to our room at 1am the guy clearly didnt really want to do it but said he would see what he could do. 10 mins later they arrived and I was informed they were on the house... Great service and I can see why this is the number one in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Lovel Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mj1westsussex
