Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week in May 2010. Were in Barcelona for the Spanish Grand Prix and a few days sight seeing. The hotel is in a perfect central location on La Ramblas with a tube station very close by. Could not here any noise from outside which is very impressive given how busy La Rambas is. Staff are excellent and cannot do enough to help. Went on room only basis so cannot comment on the hotel's food. Barcelona itself is a beautiful city and there is so much to do. Would highly recommend for anyone thinking of going. I know it has a reputation for pick pockets but we never saw any problems and is no different to any other big city - you just need to be sensible.

Reviews.Title: “Just so easy, so nice, so clean, so well situated and so friendly”
Reviews.Author: LauraCatatude
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. We were lucky enough to get a room with a balcony facing the Ramblas. The balcony doors are double glazed so no noise, yet the wonderful views when needed. The aerobus airport shuttle, the hop on hop off bus, all the shopping and entertainment, restaurants are located around this hotel. The location is outstanding. The rooms are spacious and clean and the staff are exceptionally helpful and speak perfect english. Highly recommend. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Second time - as great as the first”
Reviews.Author: fjbuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three years ago. Chose it because of good reviews on Trip Advisor, its location and price. Now back with our adult children just before taking a cruise out of Barcelona. Location is ideal - near the top of La Rambla (directly across from Le Meridien). Smaller hotel with friendly staff who went out of their way to be helpful both times we stayed there. Rooms are large. clean and the jacuzzi is an added bonus. I did note some areas that could use a little sprucing up - some fresh paint or wallpaper, but those are minor cosmetic things. And who cares when the price is so much more reasonable that similarly located hotels. We will definitely stay here again should we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Talita_Cordeiro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location, in La Rambla, really close to the metro, to the sea and to great restaurants, stores and the gothic neighborhood (old city). It keeps the facade from an old palace but the interior is all refurbished and new. The room has a great space and it is very beautiful, modern and comfortable, specially the beds that can be ajusted by a remote control... The staff is very helpful and gentle. It is worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have wished for and more besides!”
Reviews.Author: Clare M
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on Las Ramblas, right in the heart of the city and 10 minutes walk from Placa Catalunya, where the airport buses terminate. A very warm welcome from the staff on reception, who were always friendly and helpful and gave excellent advice about which restaurants to eat in, what to see etc.,as well as trying to help us to improve our very inadequate Spanish Spacious and very comfortable room. Very quiet at night, despite it's central location. The automatic blinds made the room so dark that we slept better than we ever do at home! Plenty of storage space, adjustable beds, great bathroom. Towels changed every day and room kept spotlessly clean. Exceeded expectations on all fronts! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: KerininNH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three days prior to taking a cruise. The staff at this hotel is exceptional! They made us feel as though we were staying at a 5 star resort. The location on Las Ramblas is convenient for sightseeing as the tourist buses and many sights are just at short walk away. Despite being in a main thoroughfare our room was quiet. We had no issues with the bathroom. The shower was great and a hair dryer was provided. The room was well appointed and clean. Although there was no coffee/tea making facilities in the room the hotel is very near a Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts. We ordered coffee from room service and the price was quite reasonable. I would definitely stay here again and almost hesitated to write this review as i'd like to keep this gem a secret. Kudos to the staff for making the beginning of our vacation memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Nice Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: WGBHStudioTours
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Montecarlo one night last week and it was, by far, the nicest hotel I've stayed in while resorting in Europe. My room was very well-priced and was huge. In addition to having a large bed and room, it had a separate bathroom while gave the feeling of a small apartment. My hotel became the meeting point with my friends at other hotels because it was so centrally located. Staff was nice too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelPAUSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The hotel is well located, right on La Rambla, but quiet. The staff was very nice and helpful. When we were in Barcelona five years ago, we stayed at Casa Camper. If I were to return, I would stay at Casa Camper. Similar location, but Casa Camper has food included in the room price available most of the day, which is a huge plus, especially with the weak dollar. Plus, it's nice to come back to the room and to be able to have a coffee or snack. The rooms at Casa Camper aren't quite as nice, but it was cleaner and the staff were equally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: hoffland3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights this August. We booked 2 rooms; one for our 2 sons and the other for my wife and myself. We have traveled quite a bit over the years and I have to say that we were very pleased with our stay at Hotel Montecarlo. The hotel is very well kept, updated, very clean, good location, etc. The staff are very accommodating, as they helped in any way requested. I will also point out that there are quite a few staff at the front desk and they were all consistently good. The rooms are minimal in design but nice, roomy and clean. Also, the hotel itself, as well as, our rooms were very quiet despite being located right on the ramblas. It was very pleasant to walk off the hectic ramblas directly into a calm and inviting environment. The morning breakfast was excellent. The food assortment was vast and well done. The dining area was consistent with the hotel in that it was very clean. Although, I will say that the cost of the breakfast would be pricey if you don't eat enough. Overal, a great experience...I wish that the other hotels that we stayed at during this vacation were as good as this one.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mulherin
Reviews.Content: My husband, my sixteen year old daughter and I stayed here for three nights at the end of July. The hotel is in a great location right on La Rambla. I had been a bit worried that this might be noisy, but even though my husband and I were at the front of the hotel and on the second floor it was amazingly quiet. We all enjoyed standing out on the balcony of our room and watching the sights of La Rambla below - particularly the nighttime entertainers.Our room, which was decorated in a modern style, was very spacious. My daughter's single room, which as requested was directly next door was small but adequate. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful and recommended restaurants for us. There was an extensive choice of hot and cold food at the buffet breakfast and again a smiling member of staff to provide tea or coffee. I was slightly disappointed to discover that during August, due to staff holidays there is no room service. One evening we came back just after ten and were unable to get a coffee and the bar was closed as well. I do feel that the hotel should have told us about this during the booking process, especially as they do not have tea/coffee facilities in the rooms. But overall we had a good stay and slept well and would recommend this hotel for a comfortable stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Almac71
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location...in the heart of all the action in this wonderful city, My only negative is that my room had no view. Having said that, as it was at the back of the hotel, at least it was quiet at night...being right in the action means noisy late nights! Great room other than no view, very clean, staff very accommodating, free wifi...the thing that makes this place tho is the location... For my 6 week Europe holiday (2weeks in), that makes it 4 out of 4 winners thanks to trip advisor! Venice next!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: miffe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. PROS: - The hotel staff are polite, helpful and responsive. They recommended restaurants and helped us to make reservations. One of the staff members, Adrian, is also very cute! - Convenient location on La Rambla to visit major sights. - Spacious, clean and quiet room. We had a room facing the back. Slept well every night on twin beds which were pushed together. Each bed was adjustable using a remote. The beds were comfortable. - Spacious marble bathroom with a jacuzzi. - Free wifi in the hotel. - Rooftop terrace. No wifi, pool nor service up there but it was nice to be able to sit on the loungechairs up there for a short while, eg. if you forgot to bring a swimsuit or don't have enough time or energy to go to the beach after a day of sightseeing. CONS: - There are not many interesting channels on the tv in our room, but we didn't mind that too much. - When we took a shower in the jacuzzi bathtub, water leaked onto the floor as the bathtub is poorly designed for showering. It leaked less when one sat down to shower in the tub, so that's what we did. - The only mirror we could find in the room was in the bathroom. It would have been handy to have a mirror somewhere in the room too so that I could more easily put on makeup and get ready while my partner used the bathroom. But this was not a major issue, only a suggestion for the hotel to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a very central location - but still amazingly quiet”
Reviews.Author: Trampers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this fabulous hotel. It is right on the Las Ramblas but is incredibly quiet and is a wonderful place to get away from the busy street outside. The rooms are spacious by European standards and the staff were very helpful. The hotel is exceptionally clean and well maintained. Breakfast was fairly ordinary but perhaps to be expected as the Spanish traditionally do not make breakfast a big event. I am not sure I would choose the hotel breakfast if there were other options but the Spanish have no great love of breakfast so there were not really other viable easy alternatives. Would stay there again without hesitation in the future. Some useful info: The "Aeroport" (shuttle) bus from the Airport drops you at the main plaza (Plaza Catalunya) - about 5.50 euros one way. This is no more than 200m from the hotel. Head towards Las Ramblas from the bus stop at the Plaza and then the hotel is only 1/2 way down the 1st block from the plaza - on the left as you go down Las Ramblas from the plaza.. I don't believe that a taxi could get you much closer and the shuttle bus was absolutely hassle free. An excellent way to get to and from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel - fantastic service and ultra clean - unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: archie027
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from four nights in hotel montecarlo. it is located literally in the middle of las ramblas - we were in room 413 with a balcony overlooking all the activity in the street. it was a fantastic location - you could walk down to the end of las ramblas to the sea, or up to the main square where we caught the airport bus and the sightseeing bus. on the day we checked out there was a massive storm, and the hotel could not have been more accommodating, allowing us to continue to use their free internet, and dispensing free drinks to drenched guests without charge. our room was immaculate featuring a lovely jacuzzi bath and all the staff were ultra helpful - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I did love it and I tried to go back...”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily1
Reviews.Content: I loved this place so much when I was there in 2004, that when I had occasion to visit Barcelona again in 2010, (staying with friends rather than a hotel), and when we were down on Las Ramblas I said oh we have to visit Hotel Montecarlo! I was with 2 girlfriends, one of whom had a broken foot in a cast and needed to sit and put her foot up, I thought it would be the perfect place to sit and have a drink. Not so much. If you are not a hotel guest you are not welcome to have a drink in their bar. It must be charged to your room. Even when a hotel guest offered to buy us a drink they said no. I guess the moral is don't try to visit if you are not a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!!!”
Reviews.Author: yiliam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montecarlo while visited Barcelona this summer. The hotel was very simple and contemporary decor but the location was AMAZING and the guys at the front desk were very nice and extra helpful. A special thanks to Gonzalo

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: restlesshouston
Reviews.Content: Located on La Rambla and very central for walking around the the old town. we had 2 rooms on the fourth floor at the front of the hotel. the rooms were clean with two nice features namely (i) an adjustable bed and (ii) a jacuzzi. The hotel provides a really good value breakfast and the service provided by the front desk staff is outstanding. No downsides nor complaints. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “All that I like in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: nuage123
Reviews.Content: The Montecarlo had everything I am looking for when I travel. The bed was extremely comfortable, the central location is unbeatable but my room wasn't on the street side so it was very quiet, there is free wifi in the room + a PC in the reception to use, the roof terrace is very nice, the shower is great, everything is sparkling clean, there is a big supermarket right across the street (so no need to use the mini-bar), the breakfast was also very nice (with freshly pressed orange juice)... I have really nothing negative to say about this hotel, apart from the fact that it wasn't cheap - but the rate was still reasonable for Barcelona, considering all the positives. I don't like to pay a hefty price if the stay is not good, but I was totally happy with this one...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around- service, location, rooms, clean, etc”
Reviews.Author: RupiD
Reviews.Content: This review is very overdue so it won't be as detailed as I'd like. The location was excellent and we were able to walk to anything we wanted to do. The hotel was fully booked but the concierge truly treated us as though we were their only guests- they provided us with excellent tips everyday, "welcomed us home" after a long day out and happily made the dozens of restaurant reservations we requested. The rooms were clean and very spacious with a great shower, attached but separate sink/mirror area to get ready, etc. The price was reasonable and more than fair for the excellent service we received from each and every member of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with a warm welcome.”
Reviews.Author: travellingsurgeon10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the 21st to 24th July in room 408. We tried this hotel because it was no1 on trip advisor and we found most of the good comments we have read were accurate. The Staff were the best we had ever come across, very helpful and nothing too much trouble without being intrusive. The room was a decent size, secure, comfy electric bed and very, very clean. Not noisy at all but we were out the back with no view. We didnt mind this as it was quiet. Great location, and easy to get to wherever you want to go. It's not a large hotel and there is no restaurant, the breakfast was good, not rushed and plenty to choose from at the buffet. You have to leave your key at the desk when you go out, but we think this is a good idea and quite secure as the staff are excellent. Could'nt find a kettle for making tea, but if this is the worst thing about the hotel who cares. We would only stay here on future trips to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault it.”
Reviews.Author: ClanCannon
Reviews.Content: Despite an exceptionally late check in ( after midnight) the reception staff were very welcoming . In fact , all of the reception and dining room staff could not have been more helpful. We were given great recommendations for meals out and accurate travel instructions. The hotel itself is easy to find on La Ramblas and despite its central location was very quiet at night. Not the most inexpensive hotel around but well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “More than great”
Reviews.Author: Saqar
Reviews.Content: We stayed 11 nights at this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews; thanks tripadvisor reviewers. It was indeed the one we need for our visit to Barcelona. The place is on La Ramblas, in the heart of everything. Staff is so kind and helpful. Room is clean and modern with electrical adjustable latex very comfortable bed. Very quit hotel in a busy place, double glazed windows with electric blackout shades. We loved Barcelona and explore many nice places once we moved to this hotel. The Internet is free and excellent (our stay was on level 3). We hope to stay here again on future visits. Metro stations are nearby so you can go anywhere you want. I do recommend this hotel to Barcelona lovers including myself. Its location is indeed unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful oasis on a bustling street”
Reviews.Author: kittytrips
Reviews.Content: Truly a classy place! The suite so comfortable and clean we wish we could have stayed longer! A loft, 2 desks, big beautiful bathroom. Standard room just as comfy! All very clean. The best beds, adjustable. Quiet, able to make room dark for sleep and lots of sunlight for daytime. The front desk staff very professional and most helpful. Lobby peaceful and private. Room service dinner served in individual boxes fresh and tastier than it sounds. Every request granted in a quick, cheerful manner. Worth every cent! You cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Very Large Rooms For European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: singoutloud
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms in this hotel for our family and both were very large. Large bathrooms with great water pressure in the showers and big soaker jacuzzi tubs. Location is right on the lively street/pedestrian mall called Las Ramblas (we were told several times to beware of pickpockets here), although we were unaware of street noise in the hotel. It is a 10 minute walk down to Port Vell on the waterfront (where the Christopher Columbus monument is) and less than a 5 minute walk up to Placa Catalunya, the central plaza where you can do some shopping, get some tapas or catch a double-decker Barcelona tourist bus (you can buy your ticket right at the hotel at a discount). A simple breakfast is available in the hotel for a charge or as part of your hotel booking package. The lobby was underwhelming on arrival but the rooms were great and the staff is very helpful. Very reasonable rates for what you get here, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely first class!!!”
Reviews.Author: michaella1984
Reviews.Content: Electronically adjustable beds, jacuzzi, living area separate from bedroom, free wireless, clean, friendly staff, great view.... What more could one want?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCgrl23
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip to Spain. Booking the Monte Carlo was strictly based on Trip Advisor's ratings, and what a great choice!! The hotel is amazing in every way. Location, cleanliness, super friendly staff, excellent breakfast food, comfortable, affordable. We're in a regular standard room and the beds are super comfy, there is an open airy jet tub in the marble encased fully updated bathroom, the terrace overlooks Las Ramblas (but has double pane glass doors so it's unbelievably quiet inside). They have a gorgeous rooftop solarium for tanning and relaxing as well. I definitely recommend this hotel over any other one in this area. Also a plus, they all speak English. Trust me, in this country it's a rarity!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: taxatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here pre-cruise. The location could not be better--a 5 minute walk from P. Catalunya at the top of the Ramblas. Even at that very noisy location, with the electric blinds covering the windows, it was completely silent at night--so silent that we overslept by mistake! The room and the beds were very nice and certainly 4* quality, and the wi-fi worked well--a major necessity for me. The buffet breakfast was not included but was well worth the extra euros. The front desk staff spoke good English and was very helpful. To get to our cruise ship, it was a 5 minute metro ride from the nearby P. Catalunya station to Drassanes, a 5 minute walk, and then the 2 euro port bus to the ship--a lot cheaper than a taxi if you don't have a ton of luggage. We would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Montecarlo!”
Reviews.Author: Andymark8
Reviews.Content: Our hotel experience was great! The room was large with a sitting area and bath with marbled floor. Staff was very attentive and eager to make the most of the guest's experience. Our room overlooked La Rambla, but was surprisingly quiet due to the hotel's double paned soundproof windows. Breakfast was excellent with many choices on the buffet. Would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excxellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: maltoronto
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, great room and well situated in the hub of the Ramblas. No noise at all in the hotel from the street .Opposite a supermarket and right near the wonderful Barcelona market.Excellent location . Deserves its #1` rating. For me I would prefer to be on a quieter street to come home to.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug1331
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo with another couple recently, we booked our rooms based solely off TripAdvisor reviews, as we do with all hotel bookings. We all found the location to be absolutely perfect. You walk out the door and are literally right in the middle of the action. Visiting the beach in Barcelona was a must for us so we were a bit hesitant when looking at the map and seeing how far away the hotel was from the beach. However, once we checked in we realized this would not be a problem as there are many metro stops near by. We also found Barcelona's metro system to be superior, shockingly clean and well organized. If you purchase the breakfast be warned; they stick to their hours! The second breakfast hours are over they rope off the room, so don't be late. In addition, the hallways and rooms are all hard laminate material, not a speck of carpet. After coming in late the first night, we received a noise complaint not 3 minutes after shutting the door to our room. We immediately were more mindful of how loud our feet may sound on the floors. The next morning a gentleman at the front desk felt the need to bring the noise complaint to our attention AGAIN, as if the phone call the previous night wasn't enough. Not sure why he felt the need to reprimand us again?! However, later that day another gentleman at the front desk apologized to us and said we weren't the only ones to receive a noise complaint that night and all the complaints came from the same guests so it may have just been some very light sleepers. My husband and I LOVED the automatic shutters on the windows. They allowed us night owls to sleep in peacefully. We also really enjoyed the Flamenco show that the hotel reserved for us!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: caj33
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel right on Las Ramblas. Stayed in Room 204 which was more like a junior suite. Exceptionally quiet hotel even though outside is busy 24/7. Breakfast offers everything you need although would have liked my fruit already sliced up in bowls but thats me just being picky. Staff friendly and helpful in every way. Paid 115 euros per night B&B which we thought was good. Could walk to Cathedral, shops, marina etc. 20 mins taxi ride from airport. Visit Parc Cituadella and the wonderful zoo inside. For the Sagreda go early no need to book in advance. Visit the theatres,we paid 30 Euros each and saw a wonderful opera & flamenco show.

Reviews.Title: “All the reviews were right on the money”
Reviews.Author: wannabetraveller10
Reviews.Content: I am an avid follower of Trip Advisor and have used the info from other travellers to choose hotels across Europe. Every review i read about Hotel Montecarlo was right on the money. The room was lovely (and dark and quiet when we wanted to sleep), the hotel staff was absolutely first class. They answered all our questions and gave great restaurant suggestions. The location is perfect! Walk out the front door and we were in the middle of Las Rambla and all the action! Food, drinks, and small grocery within steps. Access to the terrific hop on hop off tourist bus was just a 5 minute walk (We highly recommend that too). We loved Barcelona and when we return it will be to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Imadilly
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite , room 103 , approximate (60 sqm with a large enclosed terrace. Well designed rooms with every amenity -plenty of space to store suitcases -large bathroom with separate shower and spa bath. Separate lounge. Adjustable twin beds. Good breakfasts. Some of the best front desk staff we have come across over many years of travel. The hotel is quiet with a feeling of grandeur about it. Well located on La Rambla near the Metro. Without question we will stay here on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great value -- we'll stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Dave73y
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, good service, and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: NDpair
Reviews.Content: It was convenient to be staying on La Rambla, with easy subway access and many attractions within walking distance, but our room overlooking La Rambla wasn't quiet enough for sleeping until after 11 pm. The night desk clerk who welcomed us was very kind and helpful. Others seemed irritated by my speaking Spanish (instead of Catalan or English) and were less than kind, less than helpful. (When I asked one clerk about the location of a particular restaurant, he asked me if I knew where the Picasso Museum was, and when I said "no", he seemed irritated and could give me no further direction.)The room was very comfortable: good bed, great pillows, even a jacuzzi tub. There was a really nice breakfast selection and the woman who served us each morning was very pleasant. The Internet service was not reliable on the 5th floor. If I were to return to Barcelona, I think I would stay further out and save a little money. It is easy to get around in Barcelona, so the location didn't matter that much.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on all accounts...”
Reviews.Author: chrisrosa
Reviews.Content: Found the Montecarlo via TripAdvisor, and I have to say it lived up to the hype on all accounts. The location on Las Ramblas allowed for easy walking access to La Boqueria and the Gothic quarter, plus it's in close proximity to the Metro station at Catalunya Plaza. The staff was always super friendly and helpful, but never too invasive. I liked the contrast of our modern, well appointed room, and the historic/museum feeling you get from the rest of the hotel. Extremely comfortable bed, with double windows and blackout shades that did a commendable job of blocking out the outside world when needed. Free WiFi too, which was definitely unexpected considering how expensive it can be elsewhere. We opted for the breakfast which was consistently yummy and included many options to choose from. I can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: elisabeth217
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided that the hotel Montecarlo was to be our big splurge on our Spanish vacation. We were disappointed with the state of our room, which was shabby and a bit dirty (especially the tub and the carpets). We had saved so we could stay a few nights in a nice hotel and felt cheated with what we got. We requested a double bed but got two twin beds pushed together. The bathroom was enormous, but more attention should have been paid to maintaining a nice sleeping area rather then on the complicated, twenty faucet shower and Jacuzzi tub that seemed to be the room's main selling point. Though the service was excellent, the staff very kind and helpful, I cannot recommend this hotel because it is not a good value for your money. If you are looking for a four/five star splurge, this is NOT it.

Reviews.Title: “money minded hotel”
Reviews.Author: puneetmehra
Reviews.Content: i made the reservations at this hotel six months in advance as i was satisfied after seeing so good reviews at tripadvisor site but i realized later that i made a mistake. i had booked a room facing front (la rambla street facing), i got the written confirmation from the hotel about the same and despite of giving then a reminder a week before ,on arrival i was given a room in the last end of the hotel with absolutely no view. when i instead that i want a front view hotel ,firstly for 20 min. they said they don’t have room as all are booked but later they said if you are ready to give 100 euros extra per day we can give you the front room. moreover this hotel is nothing great but just over hyped on trip advisor site i don’t no why , i would juggest to stay at five star hotel le meridian just opposite this hotel on the main la rambla road at almost the same price. there are hardly any t.v channel in English and if there are (except bbc news) all are charged extra. Breakfast is not included in the room price. Very expensive hotel and definitely not a value for money.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for Barcelona stay”
Reviews.Author: newmarket18
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights and considered this to be an excellent choice for our first visit to Barcelona . Very well located on La Rambla , the hotel is close to many of the sites - the Gothic area and cathedral , the market , restaurants and shops as well as close to public transport for the many other important places to visit Our room was quiet well appointed and spacious with excellent bathroom . WiFi at no extra cost always a bonus. . Breakfast adequate . Staff - friendly helpful and nothing too much trouble Not cheap but good value Definitely would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Winelover55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 lovely nights at this hotel. It is in a fantastic position on la Rambla near the metro, markets and port. We were staying in a deluxe room whch was absolutely wonderful. Our room had a small balcony overlooking La Rambla and also a sitting room with large bay window overlooking the street. The bed was so comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The bathroom was very well equipped with large spa bath and separate shower. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience the excitement of Barcelona, it's position is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and well located”
Reviews.Author: Happychap52
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were delighted with our 3 day stay at the Montecarlo. It is well situated on the Rambla and within a few hundred yards of the main Catalunya square from where the tourist buses run. There is much to see within a radius of half a mile or so all around. The hotel staff are very good, keen to help and advise on where to visit and to enjoy local restaurants. Our room was very good indeed; clean, quiet and spacious with a splendid bathroom, including bath and shower. Good selection of buffet breakfast. We would highly recommend the Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestAust48
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews on Tripadvisor I was hoping that my expectations weren't set to high - they weren't! Great hotel in every aspect - location, service, rooms and so clean. The staff gave some great advice on tapas bars in the area and nothing was to much trouble for them. Would definately stay here again next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: cjgraham82
Reviews.Content: The hotel ticks all the boxes: great location, very friendly and helpful staff, pretty decent breakfast and comfortable rooms. The only slight, and it is very slight, complaint would be the double bed - we quite liked the fact it was electric and you could adjust it, but it did mean there was a crack in the middle of the two mattresses in the centre of the bed. But I'm nit-picking, this place is great value for money and I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pucas15-squan
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo last November, after we read wonderful reviews about it on Trip Advisor! All of the reviews were correct! Their staff was very professional and made excellent restaurant recommendations. They also were extremely helpful in assiting us with booking various tours! The location of the hotel is excellent, we were able to walk to all of the main tourist sights! In addition, the hotel is spotless clean and honestly, they have the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, along with black-out shades! I highly recommend this hotel if you are visiting Barcelona! (Also visit the Dali Museum - in Figures - if you can! )

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Joe8181
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in May, 2011. Our room was large, clean, comfortable, quiet, with an excellent bathroom. The hotel is in a great location - most attractions are within easy walking distance (we are keen walkers) and the metro is only 2 minutes away. The airport bus stop is a 5 minute walk. The free internet worked well. Front desk staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast was included and was excellent. Overall, a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As Everyone Says”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesCarol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo for three nights at the beginning of our vacation, which included a 10 day cruise and ended in Rome for a couple days before returning home. The Hotel Montecarlo was a great place to stay in Barcelona. We loved Barcelona and we loved the hotel. The only negative thing I have to say is that when we checked in we were told we did not have breakfast included on the third night of our stay, which was incorrect. It's a good thing I brought copies of my emails and what I had prepaid. They were quite insistent about it at first so it was good I had brought the proof to show them they were incorrect. That was the only negative experience at the hotel. The staff is extremely helpful and we loved the location. They recommended the Tapas bar Cuidad Condal when we first arrived and it was excellent. Due to the time of our arrival we were going out to eat at 11:30 pm and found the place packed! There was even a short wait. We did the hop on, hop off bus, spent time at Segura Familia and Park Guell. We went to a flamenco show one night and visited the Magic Fountain. La Boqueria is practically across the street and a great experience to walk around there. We were in Barcelona during the protests. It was packed in Catalunya Square and on one day the streets were all closed around there and some public transportation was disrupted around the square. Our hotel room was very quiet and comfortable, located on La Rambla which was packed with people at all times. We loved walking around the city and seeing all the Gaudi architecture. The bathroom was especially nice with a jetted tub and nice shower. The bed was fine for us (we have a Temperpedic bed so somewhat used to a bed like this), but we heard others complain. Loved the free wifi. We were prepapred for pick pockets as I use a PacSafe purse, and my husband has a PacSafe neck pouch. Barcelona was definitely one of the highlights of our trip and I know we will be back. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others. It's no wonder it's #1 on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a perfect location for first Barcelona visit”
Reviews.Author: Lesl_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo for 6 nights and loved every minute if it. My room had a tiny balcony facing the Rambla but had very little street noise. The room was spacious and the bathroom enormous with a separate shower and bath. The reception staff were always friendly, helpful and attentive. The hotel is perfectly located and very close to Catalunya Square from where there are excellent tours (I particularly enjoyed the walking tours). Do remember to be careful of pickpockets in Barcelona. I didn't feel unsafe or have any problems but my friend had her bag cut while walking on the Rambla around midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: hondo15
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo for two nights prior to a cruise vacation. The staff was wonderrful, the room was large and comfortable with an amazing bathroom and the location was great - right in the heart of Las Ramblas. We were concerned about the potential for noise at night, but it was quiet and we were able to sleep without a problem. We highly recommend this gem of a hotel and hope to visit it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: rorothman
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel..beautiful old exterior with modern clean rooms.. The staff was incredibly helpful and kind.. We loved the view from the rooftop solarium and the location couldn't be better..

Reviews.Title: “Book it!”
Reviews.Author: brandeetucker11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Montecarlo for 3 days while we took in Barcelona! The hotel is located on the most famous street in Barcelona. So, you're in the heart of the city! Our train arrived in Barcelona around 11:30pm while the locals were celebrating the Barcelona championship soccer game. So, we weren't able to get a taxi to our hotel because none of the drivers would go that way because the streets were blocked off. We were told to take the metro and walk. At first, the idea of getting on a packed subway with chanting soccer fans seemed like a nightmare. But, it was a nice welcoming into Barcelona and so easy! The ride on the subway was very short and the walk to the hotel with our luggage, was even shorter. When we arrived at the hotel it seemed as if the staff was waiting for us, concerned that we would have trouble getting to the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and clean. Even better, there's a huge jacuzzi bath tub in the room. Amazing! Great hotel in Barcelona! Book it!

Reviews.Title: “Are there two Hotel Montecarlo's on Ramblas?”
Reviews.Author: kcrane
Reviews.Content: A good location and polite staff. Small, basic rooms from the 1990's at quite a high price. Nothing terrible about it, but how it gets 5 stars and in a Top 25 I can't understand. It is an ordinary city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly, stylish, well located, clean and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: stripeyshirt
Reviews.Content: Staying on La Rambla was a great way to see Barcelona, it was easy to walk to lots of interesting places and close to the Aerobus stop from the Airport and lots of Metro stations. It was good to be able to come back to the air conditioning for a siesta and to get ready for the evening. The staff were great and most spoke many languages quite well. There is a doorman and they help you with bags etc. The room was generous with a very nice bathroom and everything was nicely decorated and very clean. Our room faced inwards to a courtyard which I think was good because it was probably quieter than those facing La Rambla. There will be very good views of La Rambla from the front rooms though if you prefer. The bed was extremely comfy and was electrically adjustable to allow you to sit up to read or browse the internet and get your pillow height perfect. Wireless internet was free and worked well. We only ate breakfast here but you could eat as much as you wanted of good quality food, fresh orange juice, coffee, cooked breakfast fruit or breads. I cannot think of anything I disliked about it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel right in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ssadow79
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our honeymoon stay at the Hotel Montecarlo. The staff was excellent in getting us checked-in, situated and even brought us up a bottle of cava to celebrate! The breakfasts were great and our superior double room was very comfortable and spacious that included a balcony on La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent size Room, Shower needs attention”
Reviews.Author: davyjonesSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 night, Great Location, Good Size Room, was not satisfied with the shower curtain bath combo, you cant have a shower without the curtain touching your skin constantly, and I have a small frame, apparently, all standard rooms are like this and the more deluxe rooms have stand alone showers, at 200 euros a night, we expect a decent shower, the bath(standard size) has jaccuzzi jets and the beds(confortable) are controlled electronically to your desire, we'd rather have a decent shower instead of these features

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: carmelag
Reviews.Content: I had found this hotel and checked the reviews on trip advisor and was impressed that nearly everyone gave it a 10 or high 9. Since we were meeting our Italian cousin there I knew that she would want a very nice hotel. She went on the site and was very impressed. The rooms were very clean, the bathroom a little high tech, but it was perfect for us. The location was perfect, right on the ramblas. And we had a balcony so we could check out the action all the time. It was very close to catch the hop on hop off bus, and the harbor. The fantastic food market was right down the street. We even had breakfast there. The front desk staff was very accommodating. Valeri, Quique and Fernando were all so nice. They suggested a tapa bar that you can't miss. The Ciudad Condal. A local hang out and everyone there is so friendly. Food is the best. I will definitely suggest this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Quality and Calm in an Exciting City”
Reviews.Author: Catherine_and_Simon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Junior Suite at the Hotel Montecarlo for 6 nights in early April 2011, taking advantage of the buy 2 nights and get 1 free, making it great value overall. This hotel is superbly located towards the top of La Ramblas, providing an oasis of calm from the hustle and noise on the street outside. The staff were very security conscious, making sure that only guests entered the hotel, which felt very reassuring. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly, quickly getting to know us and providing the room key without having to ask our room number. On the first floor there is a wonderfully restored salon overlooking La Ramblas - we spent memorable times people-watching in the evenings, relaxing after a busy day. Our room was very large, providing spotless accommodation to a very high quality. The room was attended twice each day, making it feel very luxurious. Breakfast was a typical continental style, but they provided good variety each day - the food was really tasty and to a very high quality. The staff in the restaurant were very friendly and accommodating. There are many really great restaurants in Barcelona, our favourite being Mariscco, which was well worth the short metro ride for this amazing fish and seafood restaurant – their speciality is the lobster paella, which was fantastic. Barcelona has so much to offer, with all the sites easily accessible by foot or metro from this hotel. The metro station is a stone’s throw away, and the aerobus terminates in Placa de Catalunya, which is about five minutes walk away. There is a Carre Four supermarket across the road, providing everything you would need, including a pharmacy. Overall, Barcelona is a great city, and the Hotel Montecarlo provides a superb base from which to explore. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: texasproud-1545
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. While it was more expensive than we would have liked it turned out to be a great choice. It is right in the heart of Barcelona. If you are a new visitor to the city it's where you need to be. The hotel is modern and some may not appreciate the spare look, but we enjoyed it. The rooms were spotless. The bathroom was wonderful. Our room was on the front of the hotel overlooking all the life that goes on 24/7 and we had a balcony to make watching it even more fun. There is noise all the time, but the room had heavy glass windows and heavy glass sliding doors that worked well to keep down the noise. There was also an electric panel to block out all light if the setting sun bothered us. The hotel has a bar and a restaurant, but there are so many great places to eat in the city that we didn't use the hotel facilities. The bed was good because it was comfortable and adjustable on both sides. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you are coming in from a cruise be sure to have a converter for your electrical items. Barcelona is such a lively city and this hotel puts you right in the center of everything. It's easy to walk to great restaurants and shops. Only a block from the tour busses. If we had stayed anywhere else we would have missed out on so much that the city had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: gramps3421
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was just simply wonderful. The front desk was very informative and very helpful. They suggested a local "Tapas" place where the locals go, made arraingements to see a "Flamenco" dance show, gave us great directions to Montserrat. The hotel was very quiet and near all means of transportation. 5 star all around.

Reviews.Title: “THE PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: bettyh
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on a cruise ship and had to wait for our rooms but it was worth the wait. All 3 rooms were different and each was lovely. The beds are remarkable and the jacuzzi tubs, beautiful showers, soft towels and marble in the baths are perfect. Also, the baths are hugh and each of our rooms had a sitting room complete with large, flat screen TV, stero, VCR, refrigerator, etc. Our only complaint was that we didn't have enough time to spend there to enjoy it all. The location is on Las Ramblas so you are near everything, but with doublepane windows and darkening blinds you never know there is anyone around. There are 3 telephones in the rooms, a bar, a restaurant, and a solarium on top of the building where you can view all sides of Barcelona - lovely views. A couple of doors down is a restaurant called The Attic with excellent food and a nice rooftop garden to eat in if the weather is nice. Don't miss the market which is just a block or 2 down the Las Ramblas and a treat to walk to and view all the mimes. Have lunch at one of the bar/cafes/tapa bars around the edge of the market (Mercat de la Boqueria). Ride the Hop-On Hop-Off bus that you can pick up at the Placa de Catalunya. Ride the Blue line first as it takes you by the La Segrada Familia Church. If you need a car service to pick you up or take you to the airport we found CarsDeluxe (www.carsdeluxe.es) to be excellent and well worth the money as there were 6 of us with plenty of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “AS GOOD AS EXPECTED!!”
Reviews.Author: pudBedale_yorkshire
Reviews.Content: Really there is nothing more to say about this hotel that hasn't been said before! For a first time visitor to Barcelona it is a brilliant choice due to the location and the welcoming and helpful staff. A haven from the hustle and bustle at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: sissy2007l
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in excellent LOCATION close to everything,metro,aerobus.hop on hop off buses,hard rock cafe.Staff was AWESOME with a special thanks to Cristina and another gentleman who worked the front desk for letting us ck. in early.We had just came off a cruise ship and need to go to our rm and they were able to accomadate us.Very helpful with directions and suggestions.Beds were great.Another great thing is that hotel is across the street from a supermarket.Will stay here again if in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “there is a reason this place is number one!”
Reviews.Author: kim81682
Reviews.Content: did a 9 day trip in May: 3 nights stay in 3 different locations. this was by far my favorite hotel. the rooms were clean and large, the location was ideal and the service was the best i've ever found in any hotel i've ever stayed in (and i've stayed in the ritz carlton before). this hotel is what customer service should be. my mother and i were treated like princesses from the moment we walked in the door. actually, before then since there was a door man that brought in our bags. they have free internet, and soaking jet tubs with complimentary bath salts for after a long day of walking. the beds were comfortable and the rooms were quiet. heavy glass around the windows. i couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: LynnCDublin
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent 5 days in Hotel Montecarlo last month. The location couldn't be more central, its less than a 5 minute walk along La Ramble from Placa Catalunya which makes it very handy for buses from and to Barcelona airport. We were on an early flight so we arrived at the hotel around 11am, very tired (having been up all night) and were delighted to find that our room was ready and we didn't have to wait for the official check in time of 4pm. Our room was on the 4th floor at the back of the hotel looking down on a lovely little courtyard (not belonging to the hotel). The room was neither huge nor cramped, a good size room with bed and nightstands up one end and small table, 2 armchairs, flat screen tv, sound system and fridge at the opposite end. There was a very large window (which we could open) which made the room nice and bright. The bathroom was fabulous, jacuzzi bath, good shower and everything else you'ld need including good make up mirror and hairdryer (didn't use the hairdryer,brought my own). The air con worked brilliantly, it was effective and quiet - so many times its the opposite. A free safe was provided. From the minute we arrived a porter rushed out to help us with our cases. The staff at this hotel are really incredable - every single one of them that we met over the 5 days were, without fail, polite, friendly, helpful. Everytime we dropped off our key we were asked " is everything OK". Our deal included breakfast which was served up till 11am (very civilised). The lady who managed the breakfasts was lovely, she would bring us freshly squeezed orange juice (I could see a plastic crate with about a hundred oranges in it), a pot of steaming coffee and another one with hot milk (or tea if you preferred) and you help yourself to everything else - the breakfasts were excellent , there was a huge selection to choose from and you could be as healthy or otherwise as you liked, everything was provided. We slept like babies, not a sound was heard at night and the beds are very comfy. They have a solarium on the roof with fantastic views over the city. Just 1 thing - La Rambla is full of pickpockets. In the 5 days, we were actually being robbed twice but fortunately both times my other half sussed what was happening and stopped it, we were being sized up for a robery another night (guy staring at us like a rat who just spotted a piece of cheese), we got out of there fast and on another occasion we saw a tourist being robbed - all that in 5 days. Having said all that, Barcelona is a magnificient city and i would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great service, good location!”
Reviews.Author: Amandi34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo for 2 nights. After arriving at the airport in Barcelona we took the Aerobus to Placa de Catalunya...then took about a 5 minute walk down La Rambla to reach the hotel! Nelson brought our bags right up and we were checked in quickly...and it was about 10:30 AM. Nelson showed us how to use everything in the room as well. The service was definitely superb. The room we had was absolutely beautiful, spacious, w/ all the amenities necessary for a wonderful stay! To have a bath tub in our room was also very nice. Before departing we took a little time to enjoy the views and quiteness of the Solarium on the rooftop! The hotel is right on La Rambla, which although is great location for subway, transportation and in the middle of everything...it is very touristy and busy w/ people 24/7...including street vendors and people selling pretty much everything... I would stay at the Hotel Montecarlo for sure..however I will look for something off La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Understated luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jenga22
Reviews.Content: Lovely room, great location, incredibly helpful staff and a double jacuzzi bath to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bubble_fairy123
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a stay at the Montecarlo to celebrate my partner's birthday. The hotel was brilliant from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. The staff are excellent, always wanting to help or just to be friendly! We had a room with a lovely balcony overlooking La Rambla and all its business, however thanks to the double doors it was still very quiet at night. My partner and I both found the beds to be very comfortable and slept well. The bathroom was very modern and clean, with a jacuzzi bath as an added bonus! My only slight criticism would be of the hot food at breakfast, bacon was all fat, scrambled eggs were left out so solidified and the sausages tasted very cheap. Having said that, the continental breakfast selection (croissants, fruit, toast, yoghurts etc) was more than adequate. I would definitely recommend the Montecarlo to anyone who wants a great base from which to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “BEST location on La Rambla, right where the action is!”
Reviews.Author: LisaFromLodi
Reviews.Content: This hotel not only was priced right, it was located on La Rambla, right where you want to be for all the action. Our room was quiet and the front desk was so helpful. To get to the red double decker buses (the best way to see Barcelona, in my opinion) is just a walk down the street to the square. There are some reallly dark black out blinds in the room, and my only complaint is that the maids had put them down, (we didn't know it) so we slept until 10:30am! Make sure and enjoy the breakfast there. And the restaurant right next door was great, too.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live there!”
Reviews.Author: FLGRLs
Reviews.Content: The location, exquisite details, and architectural significance of this hotel combined with the superlative service and amenities made our stay a dream come true. If you are looking for subtle elegance in Barcelona, look no further than Hotel Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: Polly-Anna56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Hotel Montecarlo in Barcelona following reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel more than lived up to its reputation. In fact it would be more accurate to say it exceeded our expectations. The accommodation was both attractive and comfortable and very spacious. The hotel provided all the necessary amenities to make our stay a pleasure. But above all the staff were just wonderful. Not only helpful but exceedingly warm and friendly. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Janakii
Reviews.Content: The room itself was fairly average for a hotel of this class; pretty large for its location in La Ramblas, but rather plainly furnished, though the double bed had individual controls (like a hospital bed!). The bathroom had a jacuzzi bath and a really nice, powerful shower. However the stand-out part of the hotel was the service- every single staff member we dealt with went out of their way to be helpful, polite and gracious. The "solarium" on the roof was a nice location from which to gaze down at the hustle and bustle of La Rambla, to grab a quiet moment of the spring sunshine to read, and also afforded a few good photos. Breakfast not included in the room price, but there are so many places to grab food on your doorstep that it would be a shame to eat in the hotel. Wifi Internet access included in the room rate (though signal struggled to reach the far corner room). Would recommend this hotel for its central location and personable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dkhay
Reviews.Content: Right off of Las Ramblas toward the Catalunya end where the airport shuttle and tour bus stops are. Easy walking to Barri Goti area too. Has in-room safe to keep everything except minimal money for the day to limit pickpocket loss potential.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service- Fantastic Location -Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snurby1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Montecarlo with a friend and was impressed with the service and genuine friendliness of staff. Rooms very nice and beds very comfy. This hotel has a great location, near the old historic centre. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Darb1961
Reviews.Content: So much has been said of this wonderful place that it's difficult to add to the accolades. Perhaps I'll focus on some of the things to be aware of: * the exterior is all Spanish palace but the interior is more Mercure - don't expect gilt and Rococco-isms *the staff take guest security seriously - you will NOT be able to show a friend your room and don't even think of taking your room key out of the hotel *breakfast is absolutely adequate but it's not a five star buffet *unbelievably, given the location, the room we stayed in (overlooking Los Ramblas) was totally soundproof. It was also wonderful to be able to open the door and step onto the balcony - both for fresh air and to people watch in the street! *the beds are comfortable but the up-down mechanism is bit weird. I prefer just a straight our comfortable bed. *the staff are incredible knowledgeable, helpful and (as an added extra) good looking! * there is no fitness centre either in the hotel or nearby *I wouldn't think twice about staying at Hotel Montecarlo again. Not for a second.

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful staff I've ever met !”
Reviews.Author: Little_AB
Reviews.Content: The Staff at this hotel is the most helpful staff I've ever met. And they always did the "little extra" even though they didn’t have to. They help me put a bottle of Cava in the room at the arrival for celebrating my dad’s 60: Th birthday. We arrived 2 days ahead, but at his actual birthday all the staff greeted him with Happy Birthday. And they help us arrange a perfect birthday dinner at a Michelin-star restaurant. And the rooms were amazing. Amazing Jacuzzis and big spacious rooms. Fresh and renovated and you could even adjust your bed. Good location and you wasn't at all disturbed by the noise from La Rambla We stayed in one delux room and one suite facing La Rambla and was not disturbed at all. When I go back to Barcelona I would definitely stay at this hotel and I recommend it to all my friends and whoever is asking for an advice.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona is a beautiful city, and the Montecarlo is it's best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katie186605
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Montecarlo hotel on La Rambla, Barcelona with my boyfriend for 3 nights in February 2011. From the moment we arrived we were impressed. The location is perfect, right in the centre of the city. There are plenty of bars, nightclubs, and restaurants within a ten minute walk away, yet the hotel was peaceful and absolutely silent at night. The staff were outstanding, they had perfect english and went beyond the call of duty to be pleasant and helpful. As the hotel does not have a restaurant, the staff recommended a different place for us to eat each night....listen to them, they will not put you wrong! We wined and dined like kings out there! Overall, the hotel was excellent and I hope to go back some day, Barcelona is a beautiful and exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience, right in midst of the action”
Reviews.Author: lakemary1204
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, right on the main pedestrian street in Barcelona, in walking distance from the huge market, right behind the old quarter, down the street from the high end shopping district, near hundreds of restaurants. Hotel staff extremely friendly and rooms are very spacious. Bathrooms were enormous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TWalls_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and were very happy with the hotel - it is well located; very quiet; very helpful and friendly staff; comfortable, large and very clean room - we especially liked the adjustable bed for TV watching and reading; ample buffet breakfast. The only small negative is that the WiFi (free) was very slow. We definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SharonMCleveland
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and then 2 nights in the same two week period. The service was impeccable. The concierge gave us great suggestions for restaurants and other sites. The breakfast was fabulous and well-priced. This hotel is well located on the Rambla. There are all kinds of restaurants within walking distance so no need for a restaurant. It was quiet even though it is located on the Rambla. I can not say enough good stuff about the desk staff. Upon our request, the desk staff made sure we woke up for our early morning airline flights and sightseeing. They were superb!! This is my home away from home in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “The most friendly and helpful staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: barnybert
Reviews.Content: All of the staff we met were so helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble and they were always willing to give good recomendations for trips and restaurants. The hotel was imaculate and clean with a high standard of decor and facilities, it boasts a superb location in the heart of the old city with most attractions witin walking distacnce. I would recomended Hotel Montecarlo with out hesitation and would say a lot of other hotels/restaurants could learn a thing or two about customer service from these guys!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorFromBrazil
Reviews.Content: I and my husband satyed there some days ago during our trip to Portugal and Spain. We really liked it and confirm the previous comments about Hotel Montecarlo.The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SusanLeicester
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and had a great experience. Reception staff were very helpful and friendly. We had a standard room at the back of the hotel which overlooked a lovely courtyard and was very quiet. Room was a good size with a great bathroom. We had a rate that included breakfast, which was good value. Breakfast has all the usual, but importantly, was open til 11am and 11.30 on Sundays! Perfect location for all sightseeing in the city. Would highly recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: michaelt34
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a great location.Very helpful and friendly staff. Breakfast was included with our deal, but would have been worth paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuds75093
Reviews.Content: I am late in reviewing this hotel but feel compelled to do so as we are ready to plan another trip using hotel reviews on Trip Advisor and I must pay it forward! We stayed here for 5 nights at the end of a two week trip through Spain. We were surprisingly given the center front room on the second floor that has a sitting room facing Las Ramblas (complete with crystal chandelier) and it was such a treat. We were able to watch all the crazy happenings on Las Ramblas and it was truly one of the highlights of our trip. The room and bath were huge and updated with a contemporary decor. Don't be afraid to overlook Las Ramblas - the double pane windows and sound shield made it perfectly quiet. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful with referrals for restaurants. We probably spent a total of 3 hours during our stay just talking with them about Barcelona culture. We loved their recommendation of Ciudad Condal for tapas. We ate there three times and could have returned for more. We met another couple from the US in Ronda and met up with them again in Barcelona. Once they saw the Montecarlo they moved there too! Can't say enough great things about it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Barcelona /especially with a car”
Reviews.Author: Gabriela53
Reviews.Content: we choose this Hotel because we were driving to Barcelona and it had a garage. We could park right in front of the Hotel at the Rambla and were immediately greeted and the garage opened up for us. The stuff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful, the room very big and spacious with everything one needs (even free Wifi) and thanks to double (openable) windows absolutely quiet (we had a room facing back). Also the breakfast was (for mediterranean standards) very good. We certainly would stay there anytime again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but let down by overzealous staff!”
Reviews.Author: kernalsanders
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to it's reviews on trip advisor. The staff are attentive and welcoming but I have to question the behaviour that I received. On the morning of my second day (I had arrived at 17:00 the previous day) my family and myself left the hotel to sightsee. My husband and daughter returned before me, obtained the keys and went to the rooms. On my arrival I went into the lift to go to my 4th floor room. To my astonishment a member of staff had ran up the stairs, believe they are steep, and as I exited the lift asked for my keys and if I was a resident of the hotel? In all my time of staying at hotels all over the world I can honestly say this has never happened before. When I questioned this at the front desk, obviously with my key, I was told that it was for my own saftey. I question is security an issue at this hotel?, there are extensive security cameras and the staff make an exception of mentioning that non residents are not allowed in the rooms. One final point re this hotel the 4th floor clearly has not been refurbished, the other 4 floors have. My room on the the 4th was tired and in need of attention. However the beds were comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed after very favourable reviews and listing as top 25 Europe”
Reviews.Author: flo_joBelfast
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great location on La Rambla and reception staff are very friendly and helpful. However, I found rooms very basic although they were clean. We stayed on the 3rd floor and the rooms were not as good as photos on Booking.com. There is nowhere really to relax in the hotel. There is a bar but it was empty. Staff were lovely but the restaurants they recommended for both evenings we stayed in Barcelona were not good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: GRV13
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located hotel. Great breakfast plus staffs were friendly and hospitable. Rooms were surprisingly not noisy eventhough hotel was located in the city centre. Also close to airport buses, metro and shopping mall which is a huge bonus. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - memorable - No 1 status truly justified”
Reviews.Author: roddy52
Reviews.Content: The room,breakfast and service was excellent. It is in a great location and fantastic quality for a reasonable price - The staff are all very helpful and i would not even consider anywhere else on any future trip to Barcelona.It made our stay memorable.It fully deserves it's no1 ranking

Reviews.Title: “A hotel we really liked!”
Reviews.Author: lovetraveling92
Reviews.Content: Im not much for writing reviews, but in Barcelona we had a very nice experience. Part of it was our stay at this hotel. It was greta. An ideal location and well worth the value. I recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, stylish bedrooms and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: BJMJ
Reviews.Content: I could not recommend this hotel highly enough. When the staff realised it was my partner's 50th birthday they could not have done more to make us feel welcome and comfortable. Our room was lovely (rm 201) with a luxurious bathroom and a wonderful view of the lively La Ramba. Double glazed windows ensured that we enjoyed a peaceful and uninterrupted night's sleep but from our balcony we could also enjoy the view of the many interesting characters on the street below! The hotel is ideally situated between the winding streets of the old town and the Pl. Catalunya where you can catch the open topped tourist bus. The friendly and helpful hotel staff made some excellent restaurant recommendations and were very well informed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SharonRutts
Reviews.Content: Thanks again Trip Advisor - booked this hotel based on the reports on your web site and was not disappointed in any way, Great location, great breakfast and super rooms.

Reviews.Title: “lovely lovely people and hotel”
Reviews.Author: annajustine
Reviews.Content: We just had a lovely week at the montecarlo hotel. First we had a deluxe room, on the Ramblas but quiet anyway, with a small sitting room in a bay window. Then, I stayed on alone and went into a simple room. Both were comfortable and quiet. The bathrooms very new, the breakfast was great, and the staff wonderful. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in central Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel and its service was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Wanderingrose
Reviews.Content: We came to Barcelona to celebrate my birthday. From the moment the three of us walked into the hotel, I knew this was going to be a birthday I will never forget. The room I shared with my daughter was spacious and spotless. The adjustable bed, just too comfortable to get out of. The bath had a jacuzzi and there was an incredible shower. Breakfast was plentiful with a choice of hot and cold dishes, delicious pastries, a choice of freshly brewed teas and coffee. The hotel staff presented me with a bottle of champagne which helped make my day perfect. We had to extend our stay due to the problems caused by the snow in the UK. They helped us by checking the flight situation each day and gave us a triple room for the last night at a reduced rate. The hotel is run very professionally but the warm and friendly staff make this hotel feel more staying with a family. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not very good”
Reviews.Author: HerraHuu
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it got such good reviews here. I was dissapointed. Although the hotel certainly is in a good spot right next to Ramblas, otherwise the quality was not what I expected. Here are some points: - The room itself was mostly outdated. The colors and the quality of furniture. The hallways somewhat resembled an old student dorm. Not really a first class hotel. - The "large" bed was a combination of two smaller beds, both of them a bit hard and neither of them very good quality. You could not sleep in the middle of the bed unless you wanted to drop in between the two mattresses. - Wireless did not work at all in the room. And the wired connection only worked in the entrance of the room, so I had to use my computer there. - Bathroom was so cold that they had to use extra heater there. For some reason the cleaner always remembered to close it down. On a more positive note, the service was very nice and professional. Nevertheless, I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: satraveler40
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at the Montecarlo. The rooms and location were great, but the service was amazing. The staff provided excellent restaurant recommendations, good directions, and were always friendly and helpful. We stored our luggage for a few hours after we checked out. The staff found a box of chocolates that our daughters had left behind, and returned it to us with our luggage--first-rate customer service from start to finish. We will definitely visit Barcelona again and stay at the Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for first visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: vistaatraveler
Reviews.Content: First trip to Barcelona this December for 1 week stay here. Great location, friendly and helpful staff. One afternoon servied us cappuccino in our room while we had to work using free wifi. Did this for us gratis thanking us for being their guests. Rooms quiet and good size. Breakfast was included and was good so value was very reasonable. Metro, shopping, market all easy walk. Also easy walk to cathedral and Picasso museum.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: phil80920
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very convenient (unless you need an extra-large cab), on the very busy main tourist street. The shopping isn't all that good (touristy), but it's a fun area near the gothic quarter. The staff is super, very nice; they go out of their way to help. Get the breakfast package - it's good!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff and location, would stay again but beds and pillows are lacking”
Reviews.Author: MTLtravel99
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. The staff is excellent. Courteous and helpful. We did not get 1 of our bags, my girlfriends to be exact, and they made every effort to try and get information and have it retrieved even though there was really nothing they could do given that it was out of their control. The bed, like a lot of European hotels is lacking. 2 single beds pushed together with very lame pillows. This was the only negative to this otherwise excellent hotel. If they change this, the hotel will be close to perfect.

Reviews.Title: “We had the best room!”
Reviews.Author: SusieQTheNorth
Reviews.Content: If you are booking here - ask for 202...excellent large bedroom with second room to relax that overlooks La Rambla - lots of people on the street take photos of the hotel and the chandelier in this room, so excellent for people watching! The hotel is in a great location for shops and restaurants and we could walk to Born in about 10 to 15 mins. Breakfast was also good, particularly the service and staff. If you can get in I really recommend to stay here, it was more than we expected and really added to our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Californiavisitor40
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed at Monte Carlo for 4 days. The hotel is located close to all the amenities, great restaurants, close to metro and shopping areas. We were concerned about the noise from the very popular Ramblas street, but they have double glazed the windows to keep out the street noise. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had room with breakfast, which was fresh, with many healthy choices. And for todays traveller, they have great high speed wireless internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MrsMaytag
Reviews.Content: just came back from another stay in Barcelona at the MonteCarlo. Walked in and felt "like old home week" at the Hotel. The faces are the same and the hotel continue to be the place to stay smack in the heart of LaRambla. The rooms were comfortable as ever and the staff is as helpful as can be. Recommended to us 3 great seafood restaurants that we loved. Don't miss the tour of Montressat and the vineyards. Especially the 45 min walk down the mountainside! Was great to come back and sad to leave the hotel..Nothing negative to report!

Reviews.Title: “Justified its no 1 rating”
Reviews.Author: TheYorksTravellers
Reviews.Content: It was just as others before me reported. Brilliant location, very friendly staff, well appointed roms and we left with the feeling that the hotel went beyond the norm for one of this star rating. We chose not have breakfast but opted for the cafe next door to the left (looking at the hotel), who did a great coffee and croissants. In all a lovely experience, we would recommend this hotel strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place - fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: okiscool
Reviews.Content: So many positive comments have been written about this hotel - and my wife and I would endorse them all. We were given a room at the rear of the hotel - and had no complaints. May be a room at the front - on La Rambla - would be nice for next time. The staff were all friendly and offered advice and suggestions in un-pushy way. Nice touch that we were given small gifts as we left. The city has a charm and many surprises - we enjoyed La Pedrada very much - worth paying a little more for the audioguide. Same goes for La Sagrada Familia - plan for a minimum of 2 hours at each. You'll never see any like either of these buildings anywhere else in the world. Eating out was a lot of fun - we enjoyed the 10 Euro lunches at a couple of Catalan cafes. For a beautiful quiet evening meal we'd recommend Sensi restaurant on Carrer Ample. Pickpockets - we went feeling very concerned having read some reviews. As it happened we took the precautions recommended - didn't interact with anyone on the streets - walked away if anyone spoke to us - saw many policeman "on the beat" - and all in all - felt it was no less safe than any city centre in UK. Could say much more - but by saying that we look forward to returning again soon - tells you how much we enjoyed it. Thanks Hotel MonteCarlo - thanks Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and classy”
Reviews.Author: Birene
Reviews.Content: Our 4 nights here in August were terrific! We took the airport bus to the central square - Placo de Catalunya - and rolled our cases over the cobbles, down the main drag La Rambla, dodging the crowds and easily found Hotel Montecarlo. The very warm welcome at the front steps was repeated at reception by enthusiastic, smiling, positive and professional staff. Our accommodation [Rm 310] is generously sized. It has three separate areas - bedroom with balcony overlooking La Rambla, sitting area and large bathroom.
