The adjustable bed was comfortable and the double glazed windows with lots of curtaining and blinds guaranteed that street noise did not intrude. Breakfast was generous, high quality, varied and very welcome. It was served in a light-filled, marble-floored and glass-walled elegant area by more committed and smiling staff - always cheerful generous with their assistance. The hotel has real character and the conversion has been completed with care and sympathy. A wander around the first floor reveals beautiful areas and underlines the pride the staff has for their hotel. The staff is quite exceptional and they contributed hugely to our memorable stay - just great! Nothing was too difficult for them and their recommendations for trips and restaurants were accurate and appreciated. As travelers to all continents and 75 countries, staying from no star to 5 star plus, we can say with confidence that if every hotel was run like this one, there would be no need for Trip Advisor! This Hotel certainly deserves the reviews it receives. We most definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: peter-xyz
Reviews.Content: Great service, immaculate, good breakfast, super location. Great bed, no noise at all in a side located room. Will go back whenever in the area. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for couples . .fantastic staff and excellent room .. .”
Reviews.Author: pinkythecat
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. We had a beautiful room at the front of the hotel with a large balcony and a view of the Ramblas- it was spacious and modern - the jacussi bath was perfect for relaxing after a day's walking and the beds were also very comfortable. One of the best aspects of the hotel is the staff - probably the most helpful and friendly I have ever experienced travelling. . .we were offered breakfast in bed every day at no extra cost and they remembered us each morning and asked about our plans and offered helpful advice. This hotel is perfect for couples who are interested in sightseeing and who want to be close to lively bars and restaurants - the hotel becomes an oasis of calm to return to. It does not have a restaurant in the evening and as such is not the type of hotel you would go back to for a drink or to meet people. This was perfect for us but may not be for those who want a lively hotel - they want the best for the customers staying there and their priority is that you have everything you need - peace and tranquility especially. Here are some tips .. . take the bus from airport rather than taxi to Plaza Catalunya - it is a 5 min walk to hotel - but on return if you have taken an easyjet plane from uk CHECK your terminal - many many people end up having to get a bus from terminal 1 to 2 then have to run to Easyjet terminal C - very confusing. Take the bus touristica and pay for it from hotel - you get a discount. Dont forget to go up to see the roof garden at top of hotel beautiful views Must sees- Sagrada Familia, Park Guell, Montjuic, la Boqueria market on Las Ramblas Check prices on las ramblas before you sit to order food or drinks - many are overpriced and remember that it is cheaper to eat in tapas bar at bar than outside on terrace although the peoplewatching is probably worth the extra cost. Pickpockets - I was very anxious about this but you simply need to keep your wits about you on Las ramblas - do not take too much money with you at once and leave valuables in hotel - avoid any suspicious people who seem to be innocently asking you to help them look at a map, etc- all scams to distract you . If we return we will definitely book this hotel again- it is classy without pretentiousness and the staff are simply the best you could come across anywhere in the world . . . .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZuzuTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what you'd expect. It is a bit pricy, but there is a reason for that: amazing location, incredible and personal customer service, beautiful rooms and a great night's sleep. We were treated royally all week, and always greeted with smiles. We had several questions, and they answered every one quickly and correctly. They also allowed us to use a superb umbrella when the skies were threatening, which was a nice touch. Our bed was huge and comfortable. The room had all of the amenities you would expect, and more. The bathroom was clean, large, and well-stocked. The free wi-fi was fast and easy to access. We had a room in the back of the hotel, facing a courtyard. We heard absolutely no noise despite our being in the middle of Barcelona. We were amazed at how quiet it was in the hotel, especially in our room. Although this hotel is a bit more expensive than we would usually pay, we are very ahppy we stayed here and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Sanbruce
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from Trip Advisor reviews and we are so happy we did. Whilst others we met complained about their hotels we were able to say that this hotel is fabulous. It is so centrally located on La Rambla, the staff are just so friendly and helpful and the rooms were large, comfortable and functional. If I had to criticise I'd say the bath was a tad narrow for showering comfortably but nothing I'd really worry about. We stayed on 2 separate occasions before and after a cruise. We had 2 different rooms and they were both excellent. We didn't eat here as there are so many places to eat nearby. The markets just down the road are a must to visit - fabulous. Would recommend this highly to anyone travelling to Barcelona. It is isn't the cheapest hotel by far but you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: bridiegirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Montecarlo Hotel for 4 nights and had a great experience! As others have stated this hotel was in a perfect location and the staff was excellent. They couldn't do enough to assist and guide you. Our room was in the front on the 2nd Floor overlooking LasRamblas. The double paned balcony doors and room darkening blinds made you feel like you were off the beaten track..so quiet. Very clean and the mini bar was a convenience also..took the tours that the hotel recommended which brought us to Montserrat, Girona, Sitges (beach town), and Dali Museum..Overall this a great vacation..just wish it could have been longer! Agree that the Autobus was a great way to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated hotel on La Ramblas - excellent room & service”
Reviews.Author: RonJulia
Reviews.Content: We had a long weekend break in Barcelona , Saturday - Wednesday, over the first weekend in October half term. Easyjet whizzed us from Bristol on a convenient lunch time flight....only an hour's delay!...would recommend the Aerobus from the airport to Place de la Catalunya. Make sure to get the return ticket, only 8.50 euros@. It's a really short walk from Place de la Catalunya to Hotel Montecarlo. The staff at the hotel are exceptional in their welcome and all-round service....they speak v. good English...will recommend restaurants, sight and attractions....couldn't do enough for their guests! The room was very comfortable - we liked the electronically controlled beds that will raise the pillows' area or bottom part of the bed. Although the hotel is right on La Ramblas it is an oasis of calm and peacefulness....has a good rooftop solarium open during the day. The location makes it ideal for exploring La Ramblas.....we each took belt wallets which we slung around our neck/arm bandolier style as we had heard the tales about Barcelona pickpockets - we had no problems, but there are lots of warning signs about pickpockets all over La Ramblas. First day, we took the open-topped HOHO Bus Turistic (get a discount voucher from the hotel) from Place de la Catalunya to aquaint ourselves with the tourist-sites layout ....as some of the sights are not easily accessible you might want to consider a 2-day pass, especially as there are 3 routes to travel on. We particularly enjoyed Parc Gruell....strolling along the port to the beaches....the cathedral....all the Gaudi architecture from the top of the bus....the Montjuic area - walk from hotel along Carrer Nou de la Rambla to the Parel-lel Metro stop ...go down to metro and get on the funicular ...at the other end get the cable car up to Montjuic castle....jaw-dropping views!! On the same trip, we visited the Olympic stadium and looked onto the Olympic swimming area as well. None of these places charge an entry fee (at the Cathedral the cloister is free...well worth a visit)....no time to visit the Jean Miro - next time we will! We went late one afternoon to the Picasso museum,,,,not too long a queue....very comprehensive collection of Picasso's early works -up to his blu&rose periods....look out for special expos - we saw Picass&Degas expo....fascinating! Eating places.....on the way back from the Picasso Museum we stopped at Evinia on Placa del Angel - good tapas selection..choose any 6 for 12 euros - try the rose cava to wash it down!....Cafe de L'Opera on the main La Ramblas was OK - lovely building - food nothing special....do try Escriba patisserie - just down from the hotel on the other side of the La Ramblas street ...deliciously tempting cakes,,and Barcelona hot chocolate is like no other - it really is liquid chocolate, puts the thin, machine-made muck we have at home to shame!!! Also, you must go to the wonderful mercat (market) on the Ramblas - La Bocqeria - an amazing market of vegetables, fish, meats (look for the hams!) and home to Pinotxo a small bar/eatery that is a Barcelona institution....presided over by Juanito Bayan ( you'll spot him as the old grey-haired guy in the waistcoat) and his sons, it is legendary in serving up an array of house speciality snacks and larger meals that vary day-to-day and even during the day....try the sugary 'doughnut'...Julia had scambled egg+clams...their cappucino is really good. We also ate one evening in a small restaurant Rincon de Aragon just off the Ramblas....very good oxtail and lamb cutlets, very drinkable Rioja - not touristy. We thoroughly enjoyed our (first time) stay in Barcelona....EasyJet was on time going back to Bristol - Yeh!.....we want to go back (still lots to see) and when we do, we will undoubtedly stay in Hotel Montecarlo!!! Ron&Julia October 2010

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've seen”
Reviews.Author: DeanCutlet
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The hotel is at a perfect location, the hotel itself is gorgeous, and the staff is amazing. Hotel Montecarlo is very modern and has new furnishings. Our room had a large bathroom and a wonderful round jacuzzi practically in the middle of the room. We also had a nice balcony where we could watch people on the street below. We were on the 5th floor, so the noise wasn't a problem. I'm pretty sure the windows were double paned. During the trip, my wife had an allergic reaction and the hotel management helped us locate an emergency room. However, they explained we would end up paying a massive bill and wait for hours. They were right, we went to the ER and checked. After returning to the hotel, the concierge then located a doctor that was able to make a house call for practically half the price of the ER (even during the weekend). The doctor came and gave my wife a quick antihistamine shot and everything was fine. Throughout the whole ordeal, and even before it, the hotel staff was astoundingly friendly and warm. They saved the day and our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent and central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadasnorkelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights (October 1 and 2, 2010) at this nice and clean hotel situated on La Rambla, close from everything (Plaza de Catalunya, Port Vell, Columbus Monument, etc.). We took the tourist bus (blue and red lines) and could admire architecture of the buildings and interesting sites of Barcelona City (Casa Battlo, La Pedrera, Sagrada Familia, Park Guell, Plaza de Espanya, Palau National, Barri Gothic, etc.). The room on the third floor was large with a very comfortable bed, a balcony overlooking La Rambla and a small living room. The modern bathroom includes a large corner bath with a powerful standup shower. The personnel at the reception was very helpful and kind and most of them speak French. The breakfast was particularly good : fresh orange juice, bananas, kiwis, scrambled eggs, cold meats, cheese, yogourt, pastries, bread, excellent coffee. We recommend without hesitation this good hotel to spend a few days in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: alib33_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Staff are attentive and friendly (especially Borja!). Rooms are modern and clean with jacuzzi bath. Our room was at the back of the hotel and overlooked a pleasant garden area and the noise of La Rambla couldn't be heard. I would definitely stay here again! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem. Location, service, comfort. It's got it all!”
Reviews.Author: JakeLat
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, worth the extra few Euros over the competition. Excellent location, great service, awesomely comfortable beds. and QUIET QUIET QUIET!!! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong With This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: geohab
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five days at the Montecarlo and couldn't have picked a better hotel or location to wind up our three week visit to Paris, Provence and Barcelona. The "Superior" room overlooked the Rambla (but was quiet, with double-paned windows), was spacious (with a room separating the bedroom from the bathroom), lots of sitting area; the hotel is across the street from a Starbucks and super market, steps away from an ATM, mailbox, Metro station, and cafes as well as more formal restaurants. Best of all, the hotel does not take tour groups, so you'll see mainly couples and singles coming and going and you don't feel like a stepchild in the hotel. Speaking of service: this staff is the model for guest-friendly service, making calls for us, letting us work with them on their computer when the guest computer was not responding, and even providing aspirins when we ran out! Coffee is brought up to your room and I was told the hotel doesn't even charge for it "if we like you"! (which may have been a facetious remark, although we were not charged at the end). There's a reason this hotel is rated one of the top 25 trip advisor guest choices in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: dolceandsandy
Reviews.Content: Recently spent four nights at The Hotel Monte Carlo during a journey through Rome and Spain with my sister. We were traveling with a group, but being sort of budget travelers, we selected this hotel, when the rest of the group chose Le Meridien across the street. Boy, did we strike it rich. This was a fantastic find! The front desk staff was wonderful, including the fabulous Fabio. They were always warm, friendly, courteous and anxious to please. The rooms were spacious and had those Craftmatic style adjustable beds which I've NEVER seen in a hotel before. Breakfast was not included, but even so, this was a great deal and I would absolutely recommend it anyone who wants to be right where the action is, but happy to escape the craziness of La Rambla when the day is done.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zanarail
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Barcelona for 2 days then drove out of town for 3 days then returned for 3 more days, keeping most of our luggage stored at the hotel. The location was perfect, right on La Rambla, near Catalunya in the Barri Gotic part of Barcelona. The staff spoke close to perfect English and were very helpful. The hotel had been recently renovated and we stayed both in a standard room, and later in a suite. Both rooms were clean, well laid out, roomy and despite the location, quiet! The beds were electric and both rooms had a spa bath. It was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sightseer48009
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is on the Rambles which can border on the not so nice. All of the cruise ships unload and the passengers/tourista walk up from the port. Almost a Venice Beach which made for a skeptical approach to the hotel. But this Hotel is great. Very friendly , helpful staff. Nice, clean rooms at an attractive price. But better yet, It is like a haven from the tumult outside and peaceful, well decorated inside. Near the old town which is a fun place to walk and accessible, close to transportation hubs. Most highly recommended. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel, well located and welcoming staff.”
Reviews.Author: koxxmoxx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Hotel Montecarlo at the start of an epic European trip. For 5 nights, we used Hotel Montecarlo as the base of our exploration of Barcelona. Well located on La Rambla and the Barri Gottic, it is a well preserved little building with nice touches in the corridors and well appointed rooms. We stayed in a Deluxe room, which was huge - it contained a large bedroom, a cosy sitting room for smoking, and a large bathroom with a Jacuzzi bath and shower area. My only (extremely minor) complaint about the room was the rather soft pillows provided. Otherwise, it was large, beautiful and impeccably maintained. But the best part about the hotel was the friendly and efficient service by the staff. They were friendly and helpful. Compared to the usually brusque but efficient service that we received everywhere else in the city, the staff at the Montecarlo were excellent. To sum, we were completely spoiled by Hotel Montecarlo, as the hotels that we stayed in subsequently paled in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel I just cannot wait to come back to”
Reviews.Author: debsy10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in lots of hotels all over the world but this has been an excellent experience on all fronts. The staff are simply outstanding and just cannot do enough for you. We were made to feel so welcome and nothing was a bother. The hotel is situated in an ideal location and yet we had no problem with noise !. The breakfast was delicious and sets one up for a busy day. To sum it all up its just "first class".

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more....”
Reviews.Author: Bronna
Reviews.Content: We are only into our second night of a three night stay here and already wish we were staying longer. The service from the second we started corresponding with the hotel a few months ago was exceptional. Responses were fast, informative and very helpful. We booked the junior suite under the "pay for 2 nights, stay for 3 package" and although it seemed like a splurge, we are so glad we did! The room is beautiful, elegant but so comfortable. There is a completely separate sitting room which is great forth jet lagged and also when one wants to siesta and the other does not. The bathroom is excellent, with a great shower and jaquizzi tub, nice shampoos, soap, etc, and bath towels big enough for people larger than Barbie! The bed is very comfortable, with separate adjustments for each of us. We have breakfast included which is nice and convenient. The location cannot be beat. Have no concern about the noise....it is very quiet indoors. Close to buses, tours, and of course action right outside the door! The staff in person are as great as they were in advance, and have made excellent recommendations. They are also ready and willing to look into anything you are interested in. We have not been inside any other hotels in Barcelona, but no need to look elsewhere. This is a friendly, unpretentious, stunning, boutique hotel. We just hope the rest of our hotels on our trip in Spain come close to this first stop of ours!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: blotta
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, rooms are trendy and spacious with spa like washrooms. Highly recommend staying here, central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: tagusong
Reviews.Content: We checked into one of the hotels in La Ramblas but was disappointed with their terrible service and standard of rooms. Our change to this hotel was a good choice- same price but entirely different in room standard and service quality. Our room was very clean and well maintained. What impressed us most was the service delivered by Fernando and his team. It was excellent! They were very warm and friendly. Very helpful in every way. We have enjoyed our stay in this hotel very much. Thank you very much for making our wedding anniversary so memorable! We would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sib7
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the Merce festival and was right in the hub of everything. Staff friendly and helpful without being over the top. Room was good and overlooked the busy La Rambla street. Everything is within easy reach and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: s0fi62
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel. The staff was really nice and helpful. They gave us excellent advice about sightseeing and restaurants. The room was not fancy but commodious and the bathroom with jacuzzi was lovely. We looked right out onto Las Ramblas, but because of the double-glazed french doors, it was quiet. The location is perfect. After a not-so-great stay at a 5-star hotel on the other end of our cruise, we were very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Kpatton19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location close to all the action. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and our room was very quite (even though the street out front was not)

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but went to a better one afterwards”
Reviews.Author: lover2travel78
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after seeing it on the #1 spot by tripadvisor. The location is excellent, right on La Ramblas. The exterior is gorgeous. The entrance into the hotel is beautiful. The main desk is quite a bare scene, but the staff were very friendly, gave us great advice on what to do and where to go in the area. we requested a room with a view of La Rambla at the time of booking and they accomodated us with room 413, which had a great view! the room was modernly updated. our bathroom had a jacuzzi which was great. their website doesn't do their rooms justice. We stayed in 2 hotels the week we were in barcelona. Montecarlo was the 1st one and Hotel 1898 was the 2nd (a 30 second walk across La Rambla from montecarlo). let's just say we were glad we went from Montecarlo to 1898 and not vice versa. Montecarlo was nice and adequate, the pros were the view/balcony and the jacuzzi. Hotel 1898 was on another level....will write a review for them as well. I would rate montecarlo a 3.5-4 and 1898 a 5.

Reviews.Title: “Most Helpful and genuine Hotel Staff I've ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: amelia9
Reviews.Content: LOCATION On La Rambla at the upper end near Placa de Catalunya. Very convenient location right in the centre of everything. Felt very safe at all times coming & going from hotel. Very close to Metro, Supermarket, and Boqueria fresh food market. There is a taxi rank about 200m from front door- basically you can go anywhere from this location, with many sites easily walkable to. HOTEL The hotel is in a beautiful renovated building with a lovely entrance. The reception is quite sparse, simply a long desk and space for luggage. There is no restaurant other than the breakfast room. There is however a beautiful sitting room on the first floor with full length windows overlooking La Rambla which guests can use at all times. The entire hotel is spotlessly clean and well maintained but not luxurious. There is a roof terrace for guests' use with many sun loungers and great views of the city a nice place to relax with drink. ROOM We stayed in a 4th floor room with balcony overlooking La Rambla. This was a superior room which was a nice size with a seperate sitting area. There was plenty of space for everything.with a wardrobe and shelves, safe, 2 TV's with about 5 english channels, a CD player, excellent Air Con, adjustable lighting and lamps, a minibar with reasonable prices and 2 phones. The decor of the room was basic minimalist, but spotlessly clean. There were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. It was reallly nice to stand out on the balcony and watch the activities in the street below at every hour of the day and night. We also had fantastic views of Montjuic and the Eixample area from our balcony. The beds were craftmatic and fully adjustable to many different positions using a remote control. I found these the most comfortable beds ever and have never slept so well on holiday in my life - I wish I had one of these beds at home. We had no problems with noise from the street, as there were 2 sets of sliding doors for the balcony and once these were shut all noise was blocked out, excellent soundproofing. BATHROOM Plenty of towels and nice amenities replaced everyday. Hairdryer, bidet magnifying mirror and jet bath with salts. My only complaint is that we found the jacussi bath was not user friendly. You had to lean over the bath or climb into the bath to put on the water which was very difficult for my elderly companion. Also there was only a shower curtain which could not cope with the water pressure from the shower therefore the floor was completely flooded each time we used the shower. However the bathroom was cleaned well each day. BREAKFAST A buffet served in a pleasant breakfast room. Freshly squeezed orange juice and a pot of tea and coffee were brought to our table each morning. The buffet selection consisted of cerals, fruit, breads, cakes, eggs, bacon, sausages, cheese, cold meats etc. While not the most extensive selection ever it was all fresh and well presented and certainly enough to keep you going till lunchtime. The hot food selection could be improved upon. STAFF OK so this is really where the Montecarlo beats all other hotels IMO. All of the staff, without exception were so very genuine and pleasant. On arrival our luggage was immediately taken from us and carried up the entrance steps. We were welcomed and shown to our room even though it was only 11am. The reception staff greeted us at all times with a smile, they offered excellent advice on where to eat and the best way to get to certain places. The ladies in the breakfast room were very friendly and efficient, remembering each morning how we liked our coffee etc.!! Other Hotels should send their staff to be trained at the Montecarlo, because they certainly know how to treat their guests, and this makes for a most enjoyable stay. I have stayed in 3 hotels in Barcelona and this would be my number one so far.

Reviews.Title: “Great City,Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELWELLALWAYS
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a wonderful city--vibrant,provocative,exciting.I could go on with the adjectives and superlatives as I can with describing the Montecarlo. Montecarlo is firstly in a prime location on La Rambla in an old historic building that has been tastefuly remodelled. Every area of the building is spotlessly clean with minimalist ,comfortable furnishings so typical of modern Barcelona.Even standard rooms are huge with wonderfully spacious bathrooms! But what makes this hotel so truly special is the very special hotel staff and manager.We have been to many great five star hotels all over the world where the staff has been extremely efficient and professional,but Montecarlo's is truly unique,because there is so much genuine warmth and sincerity in their attentiveness. The staff truly wants you to enjoy their city of which they are extremely--and rightfully-- proud of. You sense that desire almost immediately. I think this could be part of the warmth of the Catalan people which you will experience if you visit Barcelona and stay in this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights pre-cruise. The hotel is fabulous in every respect, location, cost, cleanliness, comfort, wonderful staff. If I were to return to Barcelona, I wouldn't consider staying any where else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - comfy, central, value for money and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Clare002
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Montecarlo in June for our 10th wedding anniversary and found it to be a wonderful hotel - the room we had (facing the courtyard at the side) was very quiet, the beds extremely comfortable and in a very modern style. The hotel itself is lovely and central, and we absolutely loved it! The only fault I could find is that there are no tea and coffee making facilities - but this didn't affect our stay at all (there is a minimarket and a Starbucks across the road).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 5starlou
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 502 on the 5th floor which overlooked LaRambla. The room was extremely clean and spacious considering we were in the middle of the city. The bathroom was lovely, all marble with large jacuzzi bath and seperate power shower. The beds were comfortable and could be adjusted with the remote controls to suit us both which was ideal.....we even want this now at home! Every now and then you could feel the metro train passing underground even though we were on the 5th floor but this didn't disturb or wake us and I only noticed it a couple of times. The staff were very helpful and booked all our meals at our chosen restaurants. The hotel bar was very quiet and in my opinion in needed some interior design attention as the furniture was starting to look a little tired. That said, lovely and relaxing and away from the hustle and bustle. There was also access to the internet in all rooms (for a charge) or this was free in the bar, as well as access to a printer. I would go back as we had such a lovely time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel MonteCarlo - Deservedly Number One!!”
Reviews.Author: andrewnelson735
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, excellent staff, large bathroom, very comfortable spacious room, great beds, very efficient air con. Need I say more? Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “We were booked in room 204 and if this is...”
Reviews.Author: Hoatzin1
Reviews.Content: We were booked in room 204 and if this is a regular room I'd love to see what the deluxe rooms look like. This room is spacious and very modern. The bed has a remote which can raise you to a sitting position and can raise up your legs - perfect after a long day of walking. There are also remote steel shutters outside to block out the sun for late sleepers. The room faces a courtyard which made it very very quiet. The bathroom is large and sports a jacuzzi tub. What I also appreciate are the wooden floors (which keeps the room looking tidy). The staff here are superb - they are friendly, courteous, and very helpful. This hotel is listed as a 4 star but it really should be a 5 star. I would definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: bethrandy
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was perfect right on La Rambla...a few blocks from hop on hop off bus; fabulous shopping; fabulous food with recommendations from the staff at the front desk who - by the way - couldn't have been nicer. I would certaily stay with my family again. My only thought is this was not a cheap hotel...for three of us was 250 euros a night so it was pricey and there could have been more "bang for the buck"....for instance, free internet or a free bottle of water or a free discount for hop on hop off instead of charging us a few Euros a person. It's not a modestly priced hotel so i think there should have been a few more "perks."

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Outstanding Mid-Priced Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LarryFLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Montecarlo was a find! The staff could not possibly have been nicer. Seven languages - including both American and English - are spoken with perfect fluency. Our room was ready at 9:00 AM when we arrived right off the ship. As requested, we got a very quiet room (#508) at the back of the hotel on the top floor. The front of the hotel, 200 yards south of Pg. Catilunya right on the Rambla looks like a palace; people stop to take pictures of the front all the time. The king bedded (with electrical controls) room was huge, as was the bathroom. A shower/tub/whirlpool combination. To be picky, we could have used more towels, a nicer amenity package, more drawers, and double sinks, but at the price, this was a luxury bargain. Free wifi and common computer, 6E p.p. breakfast. Marvelous concierge services.

Reviews.Title: “an excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: keepitupLiverpoolUK
Reviews.Content: hotel is right in the centre of La Rambla, but the room was triple glazed so a very peaceful oasis in the heat of the day. Room excellent. Staff very friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and efficient. Excellent base to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic city.”
Reviews.Author: JulesandSand
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Aug 8-15 in a luxury room to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. From the outset and without exception the staff were very friendly, courteous and helpful. The location near the top of Las Ramblas, close to the Placa de Catalunya is about as central as it is possible to get. Our suite (104) was large (if oddly shaped) with an extremely comfortable king-sized, electrically adjustable bed, an effective aircon system, a little terrace (no outlook) and free wifi, there was also a little lounge area squashed into a corner with a sofa, TV and hifi and a little mezzanine 'library'! The bathroom was spacious and excellently equipped including a large spa bath - excellent for massaging aching feet at the end of a busy day. The hotel services brochure in the room was the most scant of any hotel I've ever stayed in, for example, it states that there is room service available, but no menu! We were on a B&B basis and found the breakfast buffet very limited in selection and had we been on a room only tariff would have breakfasted out. However it was adequate and service was excellent. There is also a roof terrace open from 10am to 7pm (I think) with seats and sun loungers offering excellent views of the city. Oddly we weren't told about it at check-in but we had read about on Trip Advisor before we went. For essential supplies there is a Carrefour Express directly across the street but we MUCH preferred to got to El Corte Ingles on Pl de Catalunya - far superior and a very good dept. store to boot. I'll save my review of the sights for a city review but a few things to watch - personally we hated Las Ramblas - too crowded and a bit grubby, but we appreciate people younger than us may love it. Pickpocketing is rife there and be careful about the pavement cafes, we sat down at one for a drink without noticing that there were no prices on the menu, and for 2 beers and one cake were charged 22 Euros and while nobody would go there twice of course, but there is a fresh supply of mugs like us every day. Also on the day we arrived we bought a bottle of water from a little shop on Las Rambles - 3 Euros. In El Corte Ingles - 30 cents. All in all a very, very good hotel. One of the best features is it's location, unfortunately from our viewpoint also one of the worst.. If we were to return to Barcelona we would certainly stay there again but would possibly prefer to find a hotel nearby in a quieter location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, safe, with good staff!”
Reviews.Author: montereyes
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would rate this hotel as a 4 stars hotel. It lacked the amenities of a fice star hotel. I do remember the hallways were aging and could use a new coat of paint. However, everything else was of good quality. The room was roomy and the bathroom even had a nice jacuzzi. Everything inside was clean and well taken care of. If I go back to Barcelona I will stay here again. This hotel was very safe. Location was just PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry - but not good value - could have tried harder!”
Reviews.Author: alic2
Reviews.Content: For what we were paying and from previous experience of boutique hotels, the hotel was satisfactory but not as good as we would have expected for approx. 200/ night. Had as much thought been put into 'value' as service, the hotel would have scored better. The rooms were very clean - but spartan. A couple of bottles of water and better quality toiletries would not have gone amiss. This room was designed with the businessman in mind. The solarium was basic. Breakfast good - but again cereal would have improved it. Staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Nivlam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo during a two week journey through Spain and Morocco with another couple friend of ours. I must admit that we were a little worried about the hotel prior to our stay because it was the only non-5-star property we were staying with during the trip, but the Trip Advisor reviews seemed good and we got an excellent rate online. The hotel has a very nice front to the street and the front desk staff were extremely nice and helpful. We loved the location, although it is a little hectic in that area of town. The rooms were a bit plain, but very clean and fairly spacious and the jacuzzi tubs were a big plus for our sore feet! Overall the hotel was a good value as long as you're not expecting 5-star. We were very happy with our stay and would recommend the Montecarlo to others.

Reviews.Title: “Added sparkle to our stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: tessrob
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Montecarlo we were welcomed and assisted by the staff who made us feel as though we were their only guests, giving us their complete attention. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable with an excellent bathroom. The hotel is very central with excellent restaurants and shopping nearby. Thank you to the wonderful staff and we hope to return to Barcelona one day and would definitely stay again at the Montecarlo!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, perfect location, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: steveffc
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the monte carlo and i do not do reviews. we asked for a room with balcony which was provided with no trouble at all, rooms are spacious, clean and tidy, cant wait to go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge comfortable rooms, would definitely come back.”
Reviews.Author: NG_2007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on la ramblas, which for a first time visitor is a definite plus. All the major sights are within walking distance and in addition you can hang out on your balcony and watch the action on the rambla! I loved the hotel - the staff were great very helpful with suggestions. The room was amazingly comfortable, we had a sitting area and a huge bedroom, and a really luxurious bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. We are definitely coming back here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and a fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: smcdermot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of hotels and have never had such consistently friendly and helpful staff than those at the Hotel Montecarlo. Not once did I see a staff member looking like they didn't want to be there or who looked away when I approached them for help. The location is excellent; directly on La Ramblas and the bus from the airport stops at Placa de Catalunya, which is a 5 minute walk away. The hotel is clean and modern. The beds are large and very comfortable. Room service was unobtrusive and excellent. There are a good selection of channels in multiple languages on the flat panel screens in the rooms. Car parking is available at €25 per night, which sounds expensive until you look at prices for nearby parking which are from €33 to €45 per night. The only criticism I would raise is that the internet connection is poor. Wireless signal is fine but the Internet speed was consistently slow (25 mins to download a 50mb file) and secure VPN connections were not possible, probably due to unnecessary port blocking. Hotels (or their providers) need to recognise that allowing VPN connections INCREASES security for their guests. This drawback won't be a problem for many but it is an issue for me as I need good internet access for work. Despite this small criticism, I would still wholeheartedly recommend Hotel Montecarlo and would definitely return, primarily for their excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: bandpc
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a three night stay for my birthday at this wonderful hotel. The room was great (101), huge bathroom, electrically operated beds, very clean and whilst we had originally thought it would be nice to have a room facing La Rambla, this one is at the back of the hotel and therefore a welcome oasis from the hustle and bustle. Every member of staff was so pleasant , nothing was too much trouble and they helped to make my birthday very special. The hotel is very conveniently situated for exploring the city. Having eaten twice at restaurants on La Rambla our advice would be to avoid them, as it is expensive and food not particularly good quality. I am vegetarian and found it quite difficult to find something suitable but luckily we found a brilliant place. It is called Biocenter 43 Calle Pintor Fontenay which is the first street opposite the entrance to the hotel, to the left. Well worth a visit, my husband is not vegetarian but he loved it too and it's good value at 15 euros for a four course dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights while we looked round Barcelona. The room was more than adequate with a balcony overlooking La Rambla. The staff could not have been more helpful. They recommended some good restaurants and advised us how to get to certain places of interest. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: wowlookatthat
Reviews.Content: Location was fantastic, 2 minute walk from the bus from the airport, 2 minute walk to hop on off bus stop and the metro. Las Ramblas out the front door. Great shopping.Staff were so friendly. Room was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Yes!”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: The remarkable thing about this hotel is that it is top rated on TripAdvisor but does not appear at all in any of the well known travel guides to Barcelona. We therefore booked with some trepidation and very nearly changed to another hotel at the last minute as none of our friends who had visited Barcelona had heard of it. Having just returned from a four night stay, coinciding with the World Cup Final which Spain won (cause for great celebration in La Rambla that night), we can confrim that it is all the things that other contributors have said. Staff are exceptionally charming and helpful and our de-luxe room (308) was just what we wanted, plenty of space, quiet, lovely large bathroom, polished wood floors etc. Breakfasts were simple yet very good and there are plenty of restaurants in the nearby old town with it's narrow pedestrianised streets and varied shops. There is so much to see and do in Barcelona and three full days was not enough so we will return. Not difficult to guess where we will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Character”
Reviews.Author: eprVancouver
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege to stay at the Montecarlo during a recent trip to Europe, before and after a cruise. The hotel is centrally located on La Rambla, walking distance to many sites. The staff is courteous and helpful. On the second stay they even managed to arrange a room with a balcony overlooking La Rambla where we could watch the action and the "human statues". I would definitely stay there next time I am in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel at a perfect place”
Reviews.Author: ersintan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights- very nice hotel with perfect location, very kind staff. We liked it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: dmbRJR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for two nights prior to boarding a Royal Carribean cruise. The hotel is located right in the heart of the Las Ramblas strip and is steps to great shops and food. Overall the hotel staff was extremely helpful and curteous and even assisted me with tracking down my lost luggage. The hotel is clean with comfortable rooms and was exactly what we were looking for to accomodate our sightseeing stay. If you are looking for a great fitness center, bar, pool, restaurant and other ammenities in the hotel, this is not your place. We were not interested in these things so it did not impact our trip. The hotel is very simple in nature and has a reception area, a small area to check e-mail, free wi-fi, a small area for continental breakfast, the rooms, and a roof top solarium. If you are looking for a great hotel with good service and a place to rest your head, this place will be more than accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and style right on The Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: TheBargers
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in this hotel in May 2010...and celebrated a milestone birthday with the help of the staff. Upon our checkin, they noted my birthday (middle of the visit) and I was surprised to receive champagne and strawberries from the hotel to add to my birthday celebration. They also assisted my husband in planning a fabulous dinner celebration at a wonderful local restaurant. Nothing we asked for was impossible!! They were extremely knowledgeable about the city and very helpful with all our requests. One caution - make sure that you don't need laundry service, or that you are prepared to do it yourself. It is very expensive. I'm not sure that this is a hotel issue. I would recommend having these services performed in other locations if possible!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: GSGRiverForest_IL
Reviews.Content: With one day in Barcelona after a cruise, we sought out a good hotel in a great location. Done! The hotel is well located on La Rambla, in walking distance to many sights, and well placed for the Metro. The room was enormous, the service and staff lovely, and it was an excellent value. We'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel With Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EWLTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at this hotel in a lovely small suite (# 412) overlooking Las Ramblas in late May of 2010. Attractive, comfortable rooms made our stay a delight and surprisingly quiet. The location was wonderful for walking just about everywhere we wanted to go. Taxis were also easily available and the subway is just a short stroll away. The Mercat de la Boqueria (food market) is across the street for those who like to pick up dinner for an en-room picnic. The hotel staff is the establishment’s greatest asset! They are fluent in English, friendly and attentive. Upon leaving the hotel, we needed to arrange for a driver to take us to a small town about an hour away. Fernando, one of the hotel’s front desk staff, was nice enough to offer to drive us at a cost much less than a taxi would have been. If you are at all interested in classical music I suggest taking in a concert at the whimsically decorated Palau de la Musica. We booked seats in the choir, which is directly above the orchestra and has breathtaking views out over the theater. We also spent a wonderful day visiting Gaudi sites with Miriam Noguera as a guide (arranged through foreverbarcelona@gmail.com).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Poppy49Reading
Reviews.Content: I returned a few weeks ago from a city break in Barcelona with a group of 12 girlfriends. Hotel Montecarlo made a fantastic base for us and is a really lovely hotel.,The front desk staff are wonderfully friendly and helpful, nothing ever seemed to be too much trouble. The rooms are spotlessly clean and modern - maid service twice a day, once in the morning and then again at night to 'turn the bed down'. Whilst there are no amenities as such (there is a sun terrace on the roof with sun loungers whch is very pleasant), who needs them when you're in Barcelona? The hotel is situated towards the top end of La Rambla (near Placa Catalunya). My cousin and I shared a twin room at the front of the hotel and were fortunate enough to have a small balcony overlooking the street. Surprisingly, we were not disturbed at all at night by any noise from the street (not that it was particularly noisy) and the wonderfully comfortable beds (remote controlled so you can raise the head end and/or feet end!!) ensured a good night's sleep. I would highly recommend the bus tours and DEFINATELY buy a two day pass - there's so much to see you will realise you need to take more than one tour. Despite there being so many of us in our party, there was 'something for everyone'. Plenty of shops, bars, cafes, fantastic architecture, museums, olympic village and a beautiful beach. A word of warning though, be very vigilant regarding bags, purses etc. and do not in any circumstances allow a gypsy woman to give you a red carnation and then request a small coin - one of our group had nearly 200 euros stolen this way whilst 2 of our group were looking on. How that gypsy woman took that money out of her purse under our noses is anybody's guess, but take it she did. Having said that, Barcelona is a fascinating place, I would definately go again (there's only so much you can see in 3 days) and without hesitation I would stay at Hotel Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: swcjlc1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the MonteCarlo one night after disembarking cruise ship. The staff was friendly and helpful. We checked in early(about 10 AM) and our room was ready within 30 minutes. We were given room 201-a room overlooking La Ramblas.The room was the epitome of understated elegance. It had obviously been refurbished and the beautiful touches(wood floors, granite bath tile, jacuzzi tub) made it a wonderful place to relax. There was no noise from the crowds walking outside because of the first class slider doors. There was a slight sound of the subway which apparently runs underground near the hotel. Upon check-in the staff determined that we wanted to see the sights in Barcelona and offered discounted tickets to the double decker buses that stopped just down the street. The hotel had a brunch that looked okay(we didnt eat there). There was also free computer access just off the lobby of the hotel. The location of the hotel was perfect and La Ramblas is a must see. Be advised that a trip to the airport by cab will cost between 35 and 40 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “A little late .... but EXCELLENT experience and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: MMSATX
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel from the reviews on trip advisor, and couldn't have been happier with our decision. We stayed in Barcelona for two nights before leaving for a cruise. There were 14 family members (ages 20's - 80's) in seven rooms. There were some of us that arrived very early in the morning, and hotel staff couldn't have been more accommodating. The location is fantastic, service and cleanliness are top notch. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service and quality !”
Reviews.Author: Coppya
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and attention to detail in all aspects of the hotel. We got an exceptional welcome, we booked a standard room direct with the hotel and receievd an excellent room with balcony looking over the Rambla RM 201.Bathroom was huge with jacuzzi bath, plus walk in shower etc. Every service offered was just so well done. All staff were helpful and polite , a reflection of this is with so many positive reviews for a hotel without it's own restaurant and just a small understated bar area. there is a lovely roof terrace with shower for you to use, you can ring for towels to use. Free access internet in lobby with print facility. They've just got it right and we would definately return and recommend. Thanks for a relaxed stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, the staff are the best.”
Reviews.Author: JEDBH
Reviews.Content: We are 7 days into our 10 day stay here in the Montecarlo and I can already say that this is one of the best "hotel experiences" I've had. The staff at the front desk are always happy and helpful which really makes are difference. Our standard double room was very comfortable. It was spacious and had a good sized bathroom. Everything seems to be recently renovated to a high spec. The location for this hotel is simply ideal. Breakfast is straight-forward and tasty. Again, the staff are great here and I would highly this hotel to anybody visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous - attention to detail A1”
Reviews.Author: Titus01
Reviews.Content: I have just spent three nights at this hotel with friends and as I wasn't the person who booked the trip, plus we got a great deal, so I had no great expectations. However I was really impressed!! Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and it was the cleanest hotel I have stayed at for many years. The rooms revealed a real attention to detail and although I'm used to a Tempur mattress I found there beds really comfy. The location is spot on and we all had a first class experience. I'm sorry to sound so english but I personally would have loved a kettle in the room, other than that perfection. When I am looking to book a hotel I always check trip advisor and ensure I subsequently submit a review on my own experience to assist other travellers. This hotel will not disappoint and I intend to return with my family despite the fact they have no family rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Everything they said it would be.”
Reviews.Author: jqe1
Reviews.Content: We were happy with our choice to stay at this lovely hotel. Room 310, superior room with balcony facing La Rambla. Great comfortable beds, very large room for an europe hotel, large bathroom with jacuzzi. Staff were beyond great - always a smile and ready to help. One tip, across the street at the 1898 hotel, go up to the roof top bar for early evening drinks and tapas on their great lounge couches - this was one of the hilites of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location & exceptional customer service!”
Reviews.Author: travelingterps
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel Montecarlo prior to a cruise in April. From the moment we walked through the doors and up the marble steps to the reception desk, until the day we departed in a taxi to the port, we were treated like royalty. No request was too much for the staff and they were happy to share recommendations on things to do and places to eat in Barcelona. The room was delightful, the bed extremely comfortable and the bathroom absolutely amazing with a rain shower with body jets as well as a separate whirlpool tub. And the morning breakfast was peaceful and delicious - a great way to start each day before heading out to the bustling La Rambla. Two things to be aware of: first, if you arrive on a day that La Rambla is closed to vehicular traffic, as we did on Sant Jordi Day April 25th, ask your taxi driver to let you out at the top of La Rambla so you can walk a short way downhill with your luggage. Unfortunately we were dropped 2 blocks over and about midway down La Rambla and had quite a hike uphill pulling and carrying our luggage through the crowds on La Rambla on that festive day. Second, be aware that in rooms facing La Rambla, dark metal blinds are lowered across the windows/doors at night, and these so effectively block out light and sound that we awoke mid morning and thought it was the middle of the night! It took us by surprise the first morning, but after learning where the controls were we realized how very necessary they were on a busy street like La Rambla. We absolutely loved our stay - and loved Barcelona - and when we return to Barcelona we will definitely return to the Hotel Montecarlo!

Reviews.Title: “One to definitely recommend don't bother looking any further”
Reviews.Author: Fuggman
Reviews.Content: I did loads of research checking what would be a nice place to stay in Barcelona as it was for my hubbys 40th the Montecarlo was the one that seemed to come out on top. On arrival in Barcelona we caught a taxi but do check the cost before hand though as we think we were conned slightly should only be about 30 euros. But you can also get a bus which drops you off at the top of Las Ramblas and is only 2 minute walk down to hotel which will be on your left hand side. On checkin we were too early but were able to drop off bags etc very professional staff who could not do enough to help us out. When we got back to hotel after we had got our bearings we were taken to our room 402 it was fab bathroom as big as front room at home had bath with jacuzzi and massive shower double basins toilet and bidet. The rooms were checked everytime we left and if needed wet towels immediately replaced and bins emptied. We also had sitting room and balcony which overlooked Las Ramblas fab! Um even though double windows first night seemed noisy but not unbearable just new setting noises! beds were divine. No drawers to put undies in but mini fridge and air con if needed. I would defo recommend bus rides there are three routes one to Port Olympic which is the business part of Barcelona and also where beach is second round takes in buildings such as Sagrada Familia and third to Camp Nou Stadium you can hop on and off to your hearts content and it's a great way to get your bearings as I naively did not realise how massive Barcelona is. If you get tickets from hotel you get discount and money off voucher book inside too every little helps! We went on cable car up to Castell de Montjic fantastic views of the city. Two fab restaurants to recommend The Gavina which was by Port Vell just by Museu d'Historia de Catalunya about 150 euros with wine but delicious and overlooking port the other one was the Dali which is on the road just behind The Montecarlo its like a mini castle and you can sit out on the roof and that was about 80 euros for two with jug of Sangria but both places we had lovely relaxing meal and were not rushed out of our seats. Breakfast at the Montecarlo is mediteranian we got ours in with the price of rooms but have read it was 15 euros each if I had had to pay would have gone elsewhere only coz I dont eat a great deal of breakfast and would have been expensive coffee! but my hubby had eggs bacon sausage etc which is all help yourself and kept fresh, there was also croissants, toast, cakes, fruit, yoghurts and cereals etc so you could really fill up and not need lunch. Staff were really helpful at all times. If you choose this hotel you can't go far wrong and if you do I hope you have as many happy memories as we have left with. Oh make sure you pay a visit to the rooftop solarium views are fab up there too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Barcelona city break - service and style”
Reviews.Author: tonyhilliard
Reviews.Content: The Montecarlo was recommended by some discerning friends who stayed there last spring and they invited me to join them on their return this year. From the moment of booking the high level of service became apparent, with an immediate and friendly response to my booking enquiry. Prompted by my friends I asked for a 2nd floor room as these have been recently modernised to a very high contemporary standard. My friends requested the same room they had the previous year. Our requests were met, and on arrival the efficient and courteous staff immediately engaged in conversation as if we were old friends. The standard of the 2nd floor rooms is very high. I cannot speak for the other floors as we didn't see them. The only reason for 'knocking off' a mark for rooms and sleep quality is that my room (203) only had a very small window looking into a narrow internal lightwell and as a result no natural light came into the room. Also it is located next door to a service area and the housekeeping staff start fairly early so I was woken a little sooner than I would have liked. My friends' room (202) however was a very spacious suite with a living area overlooking La Rambla and a vast bathroom/wetroom. It should be said however that I only paid for a single room, so in real terms I had no complaints at all. I will definitely stay here again next time I am in Barcelona. The quality of the rooms, the style of the hotel, it's location and impeccable service make it hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved EVERYTHING about this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Danawheatley
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this amazing hotel. Perfect location, informed helpful staff, great price and FABULOUS ROOMS! When I got to my room I figured there must have been a mistake and they gave me a upgraded room. It was very large by European standards, nice balcony overlooking La Ramblas and soundproof door as well. The beds have self adjusting levels which are great for relaxing the feet after walking all day. The bathroom is exceptional, brand new big jacuzzi bath tub, shower with massage jets, luxury towels, amazing. Hotel Monte Carlo is another hot find from Trip Advisor!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Anniversary Holiday Location”
Reviews.Author: rubydex
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Montecarlo is on a central location on La Rambla. It is a short walk to Port Vell ,La Boqueria market, the Cathedral of the Holy Cross and Saint Eulalia (with the 13 geese, great story). For our visit to Hotel Montecarlo we had a deluxe room overlooking La Rambla with all the facilities you could wish for. The staff at the hotel were excellent and could not do enough for you. Breakfast time was between 07:30 and 11:00 allowing real freedom to start early or to lie in. The breakfast menu was varried enough to suit all tastes and healthy options. If you are arriving at Barcelona's main airport, El Pratt, take the conecting bus into Placa de Catalunya which is only 10 mins away from the hotel and cheaper than a taxi. We arrived at Girona airport and the 75 min transfer via the Barcelona Bus (every 15 mins) cost 24 euros return. This bus takes you to the bus station, use the lift to take you to the taxi rank. If you are staying at Hotel Montecarlo it is situated on the lower part of La Rambla, although we had the directions to the hotel our taxi driver was confused over its location. The returning Girona airport bus is parked on the oposite side of the bus station. To see the city make use of the tourist buses. We used the Barcelona Bus Turistic which can be found in the Placa De Catalunya. The Hotel Montecarlo provide tickets for the bus at a discounted rate, i would advise you to have 2 days. If are going to see Sagrada Familia i would advise you go around lunch time. We went at this time after visiting Casa Batllo and LaPedrera. Along with Park Guell these are the main Gaudi attractions and are a must see for any visitor to Barcelona. Along the length of La Rambla you will see numerous live statues ,they range from the fantastic to the average but are great to see. If you are taking pictures they will expect a small tip. Towards the lower end of La Rambla there are artists and craft stalls and along each side of La Rambla there are tapas bars, restaurants and shops. We went to the Montiel Restaurant (www.restaurantmontiel.com) for an excellent romantic meal . It was on the expensive side but well worth it. We picked the taster menu which consisted of 7-8 small courses that gave an insight into the main menu. We visted Ciudad Condal 18-08007 on upper La Rambla for tapas. Always busy with locals, a good sign, with great food we went 3 nights out of our 6 day stay, brilliant. We shall return to Hotel Montecarlo it is a fantastic chic place to stay and essential to a visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: USAGunners
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5-day stay in Barcelona after a wk in Madrid. The Monte Carlo Hotel was such a wonderful place to call home for those 5 days! From the moment we checked in to the time we left, the staff has been exceptionally nice, friendly and helpful. They even gave us a special room w/ a jacuzzi and La Ramblas view since we informed them that the trip was for our anniversary. We arrived at the hotel quite early, before the room was ready. The staff helped storing our luggages, even keeping our passports in the safe while we were out sightseeing. By the time we came back at 1pm, our luggages were already up in our room! Our room was surprising very spacious for European standards. The jacuzzi was wonderful, especially after a long, hot day sightseeing! They also have free internet access, so you can bring your laptop or a simple iTouch would do. The breakfast was good w/ the typical hams, eggs, sausages, cereals, pastries, a variety of fruits. You can easily buy breakfast cheaply along the Ramblas, however, our breakfast was included w/ the hotel deal since we booked early and chose the "nonrefundable" option (which can be a good deal if you know for sure that you'll go and have no last minute changes). The hotel is located in the heart of La Ramblas, so it was very easy to get to all major attractions. You can pretty much walk everywhere , or if you want to use the bus or the Metro, Plaza Cataluyna is just a few steps away. If we ever come back to Barcelona again, we'll definitely stay at the Monte Carlo for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Barcelona, Great service, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelBradley
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, right on La Rambla, 2 blocks from Placa Catalunya. Service is great/. Rooms are good sized, clean but fairly ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine and Caring Staff”
Reviews.Author: DFHS
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of the location and great reviews on TripAdvisor. We never expected to have much interaction with the staff but were impressed from the first moment we arrived by the friendliness and desire to make us feel welcome to the hotel and Barcelona. Our first night in Barcelona I had an accident and required a hospital visit. I cannot express how much the staff helped us to work through the issues involved and make sure we were taken care of. On top of that - the room was fabulous, the location can't be beat and the breakfast was wonderful. Thank you to the staff for taking such good care of us. If you're going to Barcelona - the Hotel Montecarlo is the best the city has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room!!!”
Reviews.Author: SilBrasil
Reviews.Content: Room very clean, confortable bed, very good location and excellent reception people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel. It is a pleasure to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Peckisher
Reviews.Content: ThIs is the second time we have stayed at this wonderful Hotel and we would not consider staying anywhere else. We had a wonderful comfortable room overlooking Las Ramblas. The staff were friendly and polite. The room was spotless. Breakfast lovely. Nice roof terrace.Towels changed regularly. Comfortable Beds. Quality TV. Everything we could wish for to make our stay a pleasant one. The Hotel really is an Oasis of Calm in this bustling city And "Thank You" Montecarlo staff for changing our booking when our planned April Holiday was cancelled because of the Ash Cloud.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: Greco-L
Reviews.Content: We chose this particular hotel based solely on tripadvisor member's comments. Boy, were they RIGHT !!! Great hotel, nice although confined space for breakfast, very clean room. Teo major advantages. Firstly its staff. Especially Sara who guided us on what to do and what not. Secondly, its location. On La Rambla close to the bus stations located in Placa de Catalunya that took us around the city and from/to the airport. All the action takes place on La Rambla and for those who want to go shopping it has a great number of shops around it. For more options and less €, we would suggest to avoid the Cort de Ingles (their shopping centers) and head towards the little streets between La Rambla and the Cathedral of Barcelona. The only pitty is that we missed Sagrada Familia, on purpose though, because of the thousands waiting to get in. Lastly, Barcelona is a great city, with people and traffic all around the clock and there is no better place than Montecarlo to get you started. We recommend it without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: amco13
Reviews.Content: I researched fairly extensively for a hotel that would suit my family with 2 small children. this one worked out better than hoped for. The hotel gave us a room with a baby crib for our 10 mo old. our 2 rooms were at the end of a hall way with a maid's room next to them so we were slightly isolated from other guests - a fact that the other guests appreciated as well as we did since it made us worry less about any noise the kids made. the staff was excellent and very friendly and helpful. the hotel has a street entrance for luggage /storage which allowed us to park our baby stroller there and retireve it easily when we left for a day of walking and sightseeing. the staff were helpful for finding routes on the metro and suggestions for eating and were very accomodating to our children. The restaurant breakfast was very good and the staff their also very helpful (and patient) to the kids. It rained a lot off and on th days we were there so the only thing I would have rather had is the lobby bar be open and more of an atmosphere htere for having snacks and/or drinks while we waiting out rain or didn't want to venture out in rain. this was only a minor aspect though. the rooms were good (carpets could have been cleaner though - not something I ordinarily notice until we travel with a 10 mo old crawling/walking baby), but bathrooms were spacious and the beds were nice (adjustable type beds were a nice addition). for european standard rooms the size was above average. at the end of the day, the staff is more what made the stay as enjoyable as it was. they definitely went out of their way to help us and that is what makes this hotel a great one.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice In Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: EWKSeattle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Montecarlo on a whirlwind trip to Barcelona. We were very pleased with our room, which was spacious, luxurious and modern. Our room was very quiet at night, despite the location in a lively area, as the soundproofing on the windows worked exceptionally well. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast buffet was very good. The location is superb. The atmosphere of the lobby is a bit chilly, and I wouldn't say this hotel is a great value for the money, but we were happy we chose it and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Monte”
Reviews.Author: touchwood81
Reviews.Content: Having just got back from our trip to Barcelona we found the Montecarlo an ideal Hotel. Its location is perfect for all forms of transport from the metro to the bus and the sight seeing coaches of course, not to mention being bang in the middle of La Rambla. We found the staff to be very helpful for any information we needed and just as important "smiley" too. Our room was on the fifth floor and was spot on for what we required it was clean and fresh with THE most comfortable bed and very quiet with electric shutters on the windows which gave us the perfect sleep after walking all day. When we used the metro for the first time to go to Barcelona,s football match the staff on the ticket machines were polite and showed us what to do and the trains have a lighting route method in the carriages to show were you are on your journey. As for getting a ticket at the ground for the game this proved to be difficult as you could only pay by card (no cash sales !!) 41 euros each is the minimum ticket price by the way.We did,nt want to take a card for fear of pick pockets on the train which proved to be right as the train driver announced over the tannoy " pick pockets on train " on our way. We ended up after asking the hotel staff about tickets going to a Barcelona fc shop off La Rambla and were able to use cash? but it was worth it even though it poured down on the night and we both got soaked. There is a supermarket.over the road from the hotel which was handy for snacks etc. There are any amount of eating places nearby for all tastes. A BIG THANK YOU to the staff for making our stay so great as they even surprised me on my birthday with a bottle of sparkly without even telling them how good is that. cannot wait to return sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “It felt like the staff were our new best friends”
Reviews.Author: Fergie69
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay for the reasons outlined in previous reviews - location, cleanliness, service, facilities and most of all the outstanding friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff. Volcanic ash added two days to our stay and the staff ensured that this was a stress free experience.Their assistance was above and beyond the call of duty. There have been some negative comments about the breakfast but we found it to be excellent with great hot and cold options right up to the end. There are many very good eating establishments within walking distance of the hotel at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough, just not much atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: groggery1
Reviews.Content: The Montecarlo is a pleasant enough hotel, but I can't quite subscribe to the enthusiasm of some of its fans here on Tripadvisor. I was there for three nights in May '10 for a brief break for myself and my wife. I had an executive room, which included a massive bathroom with jacuzzi, a small sitting room and a bedroom with a quirky electric bed (bit silly, I thought, but the room has been modified for disabled use, and I suspect this is part of that). The decor is stuck between refurbishments, so plenty of 80's beech combines with restored plasterwork and antique furniture. Small balcony looking out over La Ramblas (the weather was too bad to use this much, and the Montecarlo can hardly be held responsible for that). Effective blackout curtains and double glazing means the noise and light impact is minimised. The location is undeniably excellent, even if La Rambla palls after a day or two, but undermined by its position directly above the Metro line. This means wondering if you are being chased by a herd of bulls as you are roused from unconsciousness in the early hours (I was sure I was in Pamploma!). Must be worse further down, and I was on the third floor... The staff are genuinely friendly and helpful, recommended restaurants and potential places we might like to visit. The breakfasts were very good, but the general ambience of the hotel is fairly dead, with few public spaces and not much atmosphere. Some of the hotels across the street looked more exciting, with their own restaurants, thriving bars and better decor. As Barcelona is full of these things, perhaps this is not so relevant, but I might cross La Rambla on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “meets your expectations if you've read these reviews”
Reviews.Author: joe57
Reviews.Content: There's a lot of positive feedback about the hotel here. In our opinion, yes, the hotel is very well located for the turist, the rooms and the public areas are very clean and well-kept, the beds are a little extra and the jacuzzi great, especially, if you don't own one at home (that's us)! But overall, the room didn't impress that much. There's no restaurant, but plenty just out the door. But what really makes this hotel above the rest is the personnel. Everyone we met spoke English more than on average in Barna and were very helpful indeed. And finally, yes, it's not a bargain but not that bad at all. I'm happy I read the reviews and booked here.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: love2travel4242
Reviews.Content: the location was right in the centre of things tho beware of pickpockets just outside and all along la ramlas especially in the evenings or in crowds, what really separates this hotel from the rest was the outstanding desk staff who would do anything within reason for guests. the rooms were just soso for the price

Reviews.Title: “Best in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: QueenMimi
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel for 3 days, I can see why it is rated so highly. First of all is the location. We took the airport bus to the Placa de Catalunya and then walked a block and a half to get to the hotel. It was very early in the morning, but they said that the would hold our luggage for us until they could clean our room. The man at the front desk said they would clean the room as soon as they could and we could get into the room between 10:00 and 11:00 a.m. Perfect! We had a room on the front part of our hotel with a small balcony. I stood out on the balcony watching all the activity on Las Ramblas. However, when the double sets of glass doors were closed, you could not hear the noise outside. The room itself was very clean and contemporary. The bathroom was huge and looked like a spa. My husband said it was the best bathroom of any hotel that we have been in during our various trips throughout Europe. At night, I would sit in one of the chairs in the lobby overlooking the beautiful fountain outside and read the paper while my husband used the free computer access to follow the NCAA basketball scores. But the best part of this hotel was the front desk staff. These were the most concerned, caring and helpful front desk staff that we have ever had. This will be the hotel where we stay when we return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: browney99
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based upon the reviews we had seen on trip advisor. For various reasons we had to change the tiiming of our booking and each time we made changes the staff were just so obliging so it was no surprise when we arrived that the quality of the service was just FIRST CLASS! We had a Deluxe Room which was modern, spotless, and light. The bathroom was really big with separate shower and bath. We requested a room over Las Ramblas and received it. Great view and you felt like you were in the street even from your room but close the windows which we did because it snowed(!) and the noise is largely gone. All in all a fabulous room which we used as our base for 4 nights. We asked for restaurant recommendations and all of them were just great whether for Tapas or a meal. The breakfast in the hotel isn't fantastic but OK however if you ask where to go for Churros you won't be disappointed by their recommendation or if you want the best breakfast go to the Pintoxa Bar in the market just a couple of minutes walk away. If I had one criticsm and it is only minor the hotel has a wonderful bar area which is hardly used and seems only to be open if you ask.
