Perhaps this is because there are about a thousand bars just outside the door but as it was so cold when we were in Barcelona we weren't that keen on wandering the streets on each night. This is a really great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: Pressure_Drop
Reviews.Content: Hard to disagree with any of the other recent reviewers. My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in this quality hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. Booked direct with the hotel quite a while back and got a decent deal compared with the prices at the moment. The location is spot on, just a few minutes down the Ramblas from Playa Catalunya (easy direct bus from the airport for 5 euros each). Desk staff are very friendly, efficient and helpful (strangely all men, didn't see any female staff at all apart from the cleaners?). We had room 402, at the front overlooking the Ramblas with a small balcony - this was a superior room, absolutely huge, 3 separate rooms - bedroom, study and bathroom - the rooms as well documented are well equipped (2 TVs) although the furniture is a little on the 'cheap' side - very comfortable adjustable beds and amazing jacuzzi bath and power shower. As stated by some people the hotel does lack a bit of character and charm, it's not really a 'boutique' hotel but then again it's not trying to be, the bar is lacking in atmosphere admittedly but it's difficult to know how to improve that, maybe if it was at the front of the building overlooking the Ramblas it would get a bit more custom but that's not possible so there's not much the hotel can do I guess - we visited the rooftop which offered great views over this amazing city, not warm enough to sunbathe but I guess in the summer must be a nice place to relax - now this would be a great place to have a bar, we've enjoyed rooftop bars in hotels in Palma and Rome and they are a great attraction, perhaps this is something the Montecarlo could explore? Couple of other points - I'm a light sleeper but the air con worked well and was probably the quietest I've ever experienced and despite the hustle and bustle of the busy street below, can't say I heard a thing all night because of the high quality double glazing. So yes, would highly recommend the Montecarlo but take notice of the warnings of pickpockets in Barcelona, someone attempted to lift my wallet the first night on the Ramblas and there's a lot of shady characters about - perhaps further down towards the port - and we witnessed and heard of other unsavoury incidents, just have your wits about you. You will also get mugged in some of the bars - beware asking for a large beer - they served me up a 'stein' sized one - all 12 euros of it! And as much as I like tapas, it's easy to rack up a large bill as often they are not priced but are very tempting. It's still odd I think for us British ordering beers and food without having a clue of the cost, that's why we like paying for a drink straight away at the bar I guess, something the continentals just don't do. We didn't bother with the breakfast by the way, we just went for coffee and a pastrie in the nearby market, there's loads of other cafes around although if you're after a full English you will be disappointed. Anyway, enjoy your stay - we did.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but there's better in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: headfortheborder
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona several times in 2009 while we were buying an apartment, so we took the opportunity to stay in different hotels. Montecarlo was not what we were expecting in view of the rave reviews, but it was fine, Certainly not, in our view, best for quality:value but OK and good value for a city centre hotel. The hotel is, like several others, on La Rambla - this is not the nicest part of Barca, though an important place to visit and central (like Oxford St in London or Champs Elysees in Paris) - lots of street artists, tourist stuff along the centre, shops nearby, McDonalds, Starbucks and tourist restaurants (fun area but watch you're belongings as rife with pickpockets - that goes for most tourist spots). Good secure car parking, friendly staff, decent breakfast at the Montecarlo. Nice clean room, pretty spacious, with beds that can be adjusted (as per hospital beds, not esp comfortable) ; clean bathroom but the whole ambience is of the room is like a good quality motel. There is a bar but it's like an extension of the lobby, and not somewhere one would want to sit for long. We preferred Hotel 1898 (tho quite a bit more more expensive than Montecarlo), Pulitzer for value and fab bar, Duquesa de la Cordona nearby, but most of all we liked the the MurMuri. Most places in the city that you'd want to go are in walking distance of all these hotels. I suppose we've reached an age where we'd rather (and can afford) to pay a bit more for quality. However, if you're young and want to be at the centre of nightlife, Montecarlo is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Central location yet peaceful inside and out”
Reviews.Author: wildrover66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located towards the top of La Ramblas within an easy walk of Placa Catalunya from where you can catch the tour buses and the airport buses. I travelled with a friend and we were very pleased with the quality of the room - loved the adjustable beds which had extremely comfortable mattresses. I had asked at the time of booking if we could have a room overlooking La Ramblas and was told they would try but couldn't guarantee it. When we arrived we found we did have a lovely room with a round jacuzzi bath (glass door from bathroom into hall meant you had to close the hall door for privacy so not so good for the shy or casual companions!) and a balcony overlooking the famous street. It was lovely to be able to stand on the balcony and watch the world go by yet when we closed the (3!) double glazed doors we could hear no noise from the street at all. There was a great big floodlight on our balcony but that went off at 11 or 11.30 so that was ok! There was also no noise from other guests, partly I think due to the layout of the rooms and partly due to the type of guests the hotel attracts. We were told they do not take groups and that was a bonus for us or anyone who wants a peaceful hotel yet still in a fantastically central location. The hotel was full but we saw only a few other guests on the stairs and then again at breakfast. Breakfast is maybe a little expensive at 12 euros but you can eat as much as you want so on that basis it's not so bad. However, there are plenty of places to eat round about if you wanted to scout out a cheaper breakfast. The bar was a little lacking in atmosphere I agree. We came back one evening at about 11.15 and the bar was closed, for example, and when we had a pre-dinner drink one night (dinner out of the hotel as there is no restaurant) it was only us two in there. However that didn't really bother us as we two ladies were there to catch up with each other's news and weren't looking for the company of others. If you are looking for a hotel where you can mingle and chat with other guests then this hotel is probably not for you but I wouldn't agree that the whole hotel was soul-less. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and of course all spoke excellent English. Reception was always well-manned and the staff were very polite and discrete but always available if needed. Both of us said we would definitely return to this hotel if we ever go back to Barcelona. Ideal for small groups of friends, couples and very independent singles. Not for large groups, anyone wanting a bustling, busy hotel with lots going on and probably not for young families who might be worried about their little ones disturbing the tranquility!

Reviews.Title: “Does not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: janice67
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect for a sightseeing break. We had a room at the back of the hotel overlooking the courtyard. It was modern, clean, quiet and spacious. It had all the essentials, plus quiet a few treats, such as a jacuzzi bath. Breakfast was good - not the best ever, but there's plenty of choice and you won't go hungry. We found the staff freindly and helpful too. Overall we thought it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quiet considering!”
Reviews.Author: Ifo
Reviews.Content: Got a free upgrade to a suite on arrival without even asking so this review can only be positive! Gtreat location in the heart of the ramblas but very quiet considering this.... nothing bad to say about this one - maybe a tad expensive but the location and qauilty is there

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overated by other contributors”
Reviews.Author: flossie1946
Reviews.Content: We have just returned having spent 3 nights at this hotel. The comments from other contributors strongly influenced our decision to stay here. Unfortunately I don’t feel we can be quite as glowing in our comments as many of the other contributors. Firstly, the plus points, many of which have been mentioned previously. The location is superb, right on La Rambla with its shops bars restaurants, markets and street entertainment just a step from the front door of the hotel. The hotel looks terrific externally and even better after dark when the outside is illuminated. It is immaculately clean and very well maintained and the staff are without a doubt courteous, friendly and knowledgeable and keen to help in whatever way they can with restaurant recommendations, maps to help you get around and get the most out of your visit. Needless to say they all spoke perfect English. The hotel is so easy to get to from Barcelona airport, don’t waste money on a cab, especially if there are only two of you, the Aerobus from just outside the airport will get you to Placa Catalunya within 30 minutes and it’s only a 5 minute walk to the hotel. Current cost is 5€ each for a single. I believe you can get a discount for a return ticket but I don’t know how much it is. We had a standard room which was modern and nicely furnished but with no views or balcony which was fine as we were not expecting these in a standard room. We had a small fridge and a 26 inch flat screen TV. Limited programmes in English but you don’t come to Barcelona to watch TV!! A great feature was the electric bed, fully adjustable, head, feet, middle, you can adjust it any way you like, really comfy!! We also had a spa bath but didn’t use it preferring to shower, and boy, was that powerful!! No tea or coffee making facilities so best to take a travel kettle, mugs, teabags etc. if you like a brew. Free internet access in reception is a welcome facility. There is a beautiful lounge on the 2nd floor overlooking La Rambla, you can people watch in tranquil comfort, very nice indeed! We ate breakfast in the hotel, this is 12€ a head which was a bit of a shock as we hadn’t realised that it wasn’t included. Having said that however, there is an adequate choice of hot and cold items but they do need a plate warmer and the keeping hot facilities for the scrambled egg sausage and bacon were woefully inadequate. Unless you got to it within a couple of minutes of it being brought out it was luke warm to cold, a great shame and so easily rectified. Great coffee! The best we had anywhere during our stay. Now the downsides, an earlier contributor said that he felt the hotel had “no soul” and we know exactly what he meant. There is no restaurant, we never saw a soul in the bar and there are no public areas where you might bump into fellow guests and strike up a conversation etc. There is no buzz, little movement; pool, gym, in house enterrtainment ? No. This hotel is not so much a hotel as rented rooms with a reception and on that basis we considered it expensive at 160€ a night. You are paying for the location which is great and is the sort of place I would stay in if I were spending a few days in Barcelona on business, it has that sort of feel to it. We would not return here due to this and the fact that 3 days for a Barcelona city break is quite sufficient. In summary, if you are looking for a room for a couple of nights, great but if you want a proper hotel feel, we don't think this will be for you.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kataine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in a deluxe room at this Hotel after having read the reviews and chose it as it has been so highky recommended. We were not disappointed. The location on the ramblas it ideal as all the main sites are close by. The room was lovely - it was at the front but quiet, had a balcony and a fabulous bathroom with a double jacuzi bath, walk in shower and twin sinks. The staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious. There are plenty of good restuarants nearby - one that was recommended to us called Quo Vadis was expensive, strange, and we would not recommend it although the food was OK it did not justify the very high price.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: hotlips11
Reviews.Content: WOW - We just loved this hotel.. Located at the top of Las Ramblas, which was great as we'd got the aerobus into the centre (Placa de Catalunya).. 17.45 euro return for both of us.. So we had a short walk & found our hotel easily.. On arrival at the front doors of the hotel, a member of staff came straight out took our bags and took us to reception.. We got checked in, he took us to the room to make sure we liked it and talked us through everythin it had.. As this was booked for my surprise 30th.. I didn't know what room we had.. My other half had booked a Deluxe suite... It was beauitful!! So much room.. We had a living room with two chairs, tv & telephone, bathroom which included a corner jacuzzi bath.. Heaven after a days walking!! Good size bedroom with electric beds, tv, radio, mini bar, safe also a blacony looking on to the busy Las Ramblas street below - Let me point out the street is very busy.. but we had two double sliding doors which blocked all noise when closed.. but you just had to have the doors opened every now and again to get the whole feeling of the hustle and bustle of Barcelona City.. Also we thought was nice, each night we came home they had the bed pulled back and our night wear sitting waiting.. very pampered weekend!! Breakfast was being served till 11am.. which was great.. Continental Breakfast, very nice.. The staff were amazing.. So friendly, so helpful.. We booked the bus tour through reception which offered the bus tour of the city for 2 euro cheaper.. Any information you want.. they'll give you it!!! We also when to the Barcelona Football Match.. We pre-booked our seats, but you still had to collect tickets outside the gates.. you and two other thousand!! Make sure you go and pick your tickets up first thing that morning.. Enjoy your day sight seeing.. and walk in with no worries half an hour before the match.. We stood for 50 mins to get the tickets!! Crowds were massive.. but we got the tickets.. great seats.. and they won 4-0.. so was worth every minute :) We got the metro from the hotel to the grounds.. we found this really clean, quick and easy.. Food - We ate one night in The Attic - which is just next door to the hotel.. lovely.. great prices and also staff very friendly and helpful.. We pre-booked the table as we'd heard it got busy.. and they were right!! :) Hard Rock Cafe got a few visits... food was great.. be prepared to wait.. plenty to look and see around you to pass the time.. Always buzzing!!.. Cocktails quite dear.. but good.. Maybe alittle to good.. :) If you want a great locate, clean, helpful staff you've come to the right place!! One thing my partner did mention, there wasn't much soul to the hotel.. no one using the bar etc.. but like i said.. we're in Barcelona to enjoy whats outside the door.. but could see his point. All in All an amazing break - We'll be back........... :) Hope my info helped alittle.. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JaneUKSussex
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of the ramblers. Place could do with a makeover - feels that it has seen better times - but room good size and very quite for the centre of Barcelona. Very clean - in fact probably the cleanest hotel we have ever stayed in! A good deal for this city. Only downside is the smoking issues - which for those that do not can be a problem when it comes to eating out etc - remember barcelona is a costly city!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Premium location”
Reviews.Author: MaBoyOmar
Reviews.Content: I have been to Hotel Montecarlo for my first visit to Barcelona (which is a very nice city by the way). The hotel staff was very helpful and discrete. The bedroom was superb, big, with flat screen and jacuzzi, electric bed, view on la Rambla, free wireless access to the internet. There is a parking within the hotel which is quite handy. Next time I go to Barcelona, I will definitely return there and would highly recommend it. But there is a little but. They should make an effort on the breakfast. Don't get me wrong, there is plenty to eat, but the choice is limited . But it is certainly not a show stopper for this great hotel, just a small area for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my expectations”
Reviews.Author: PAinVegas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our Spain trip in Barcelona. I booked the hotel based upon trip advisor reviews. I booked thru booking.com which had amazing deals. We were not disappointed. Montecarlo does deserve the #1 rating. The hotel acommodated our early arrival around 10am. The facade is beautiful just as well as the inside. A historical building in the best location-walking distance to many places. The Cathedral is only 5 minute walk. Couldn't believe the size of the deluxe room. Huge bathroom, nice sitting area (my husband's place of relaxation), and extremely large bedroom. The bed had a niced added feature of adjusting the head of bed. I loved the jacuzzi tub which we used every night after a long day of walking in the cold weather. Room was extremely quiet despite the hotel location on La Rambla. The staff is wonderful and very helpful. Roger showed us the rooftop before we departed. Breath taking views from there. We had breakfast included. We enjoyed eating "European style" breakfast of cheese, meats, yogurt, pastries, fresh squeezed OJ and cafe con leche. Yummy...... Without hesitation, this is probably one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. Highly recommend it. We would definitely stay there again if we went back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent clean modern rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DublinFjk
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in Feb 2010, all good. Glad to recommend. Staff helpful. Only quibble was noise from aircon on the room of an adjacent building but not their fault

Reviews.Title: “Really good value”
Reviews.Author: allthingsgood
Reviews.Content: This hotel came recommended as #1 here on Tripadvisor and we can only agree. Location, value for money, helpfulnessand friendliness by the staff, good room standard with very comfortable bathroom facility. Great experience. We like hotels that are comfortable and not noisy, and this was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: vadnu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at the Hotel Montecarlo, and it's the only hotel, I want to stay at, when I visit Barcelona from now on. The hotel is top quality from rooms over amenities to the service attitude of the staff. And the location is absolutely spot on making it very easy to move around in the city with Placa Catalunya as the starting point.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirlboston
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent just under a week staying in Barcelona and after reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to stay here....we are so happy we did! The hotel is right in the middle of everything. You can walk outside your door and be within minutes of major attractions, plenty of restaurants, and constant activity. The best part was that you are in the middle of it all yet very safe and relaxed. The hotel itself is very nice, you can tell the staff takes pride in taking care of their hotel and it shows. Everything was clean and the room was very nice. We had huge suite with a seperate sitting area, great ameneties, and our own balcony overlooking las ramblas. The glass doors block out the noise so if you shut them you can't hear the hustle and bustle outside which is fantastic. It was great to people watch from our room. The staff was outstanding. They were very friendly and accomodating. They were ready to help with recommendations and gave us some great advice and tips to get around the city. No matter who was at the front desk they were top notch. We ended up taking a day trip to Montserrat which I highly recommend and that is where we got engaged! The hotel sent us champagne and the staff was amazing. We will be back to stay at the Montecarlo should we be lucky enough to venture back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff make Montecarlo the perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: admiringwig
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are very professional and helpful in every way. The hotel is in a perfect location, has extremely comfy beds and a hearty breakfast that makes for a great start to your day. We stayed in a standard double room but had a glimpse into a more superior one that looked very luxurious! Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay of our lives”
Reviews.Author: WorldTracer
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the Winter Offer and it was an A-MA-ZI-NG stay indeed! We would stay easily again even if we had to pay double money, seriously!!! Everything was perfect as described, rooms were magnificent and full of comfortable accessories, evrything very clean, big rooms, jacuzzi, great breakfast, ambience and class in everything. But the most fantastic experience was the very very well-trained personnel, which is so relaxing, smiling and warm that you feel like friends with them from the very first time! I've never experienced something like this before. At the same time these guys are so professional and so good-willing when you ask for something. We really miss them now, truly! From the first moment we arrived we started to understand why this hotel is rated No 1 in Barcelona. After 5 days of stay, we know first hand! Don't book enywhere else before you check Hotel Barcelona. It's No 1!!!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: CRNYC
Reviews.Content: Researching Paris hotels on TripAdvisor reminded me that I never posted a review of my perfect stay at the Montecarlo. The rooms (we had a double and a single) were cool and simple in a Scandinavian way, the bathrooms American-style in size and amenities, and it was COMPLETELY QUIET despite being right on La Rambla...even the night FC Barcelona beat real Madrid 5-0 we could not hear a thing from inside. Most of all, however, the staff was so lovely and helpful - with directions, local advice, and reservations. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fully deserving of its no.1 spot!!”
Reviews.Author: mdailey1977
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Montecarlo for the weekend to celebrate our anniversary and also my birthday. We had a fantastic time. The staff there are so friendly and accomodating. We were able to check in earlier than the stated 3pm and everyone is polite and helpful. We were given excellent advice on attractions and the restaurant recommended to us on Saturday night was excellent. We were also provided a pack of maps and guides on arrival. The hotel is beautiful and wonderfully decorated. We were staying is a standard double room but it felt anything but standard. Impeccably clean and beutifully decorated, with a fantastic bathroom with a jacuzzi bath!! This was great after long days pounding the pavements. The hotel is not the cheapest at 120 euro per night when we stayed but you most certainly get what you pay for and with the Montecarlo this is certainly true. It has a fantastic location on the Rambla Estudis but with no street noise thanks to the double glazing and outside metal shutters that can be pulled down at nighT Would absolutely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Montecarlo = Great location, best in class service!”
Reviews.Author: Katiesmygirl
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a long awaited trip w/my niece to the city she most wanted to visit. We could not have been more pleased with this hotel. The staff was not only friendly, but genuinely concerned regarding our needs and providing the best service possible. Located steps from the Barri Gotic and great shopping, excellent restaurants and all that Barcelona has to offer. I will definitely stay in the Hotel Montecarlo when visiting Barcelona in the future. Many thanks to the staff for a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel which I highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: misswaldingfield
Reviews.Content: I was taken to Barcelona as a 50th birthday surprise and it could not have been more perfect! The staff were very helpful, friendly and efficient! The Deluxe room, overlooking La Rambla was beautiful and had anything you could possibly wish for during your stay. Despite it's location, the room was remarkably quiet and the adjustable beds helped me have the best sleep ever experienced in a hotel! The airconditioning was nice and quiet, which meant we could leave it on at night. Breakfast, both by room service and in the breakfast area was nice and fresh and had plenty to choose from. To top it all off: we were presented with a complimentary small bottle of Cava in the room, in honour of my birthday! I can honestly say that it was one of the best hotel experiences I ever had ! (and I used to be a receptionist/desk manager, in 5 star hotels myself for many years, so I know what it is like). Thumbs up for this one!

Reviews.Title: “Always return to a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lover-of-Travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in early Nov. 2009.....originally I booked a nearby hotel as it had good reviews and was a little cheaper - weak American currency had me looking for a great value. Well, what a mistake!!!! Had visited the Montecarlo in the evening after arriving , realized our mistake, and prepaid for the next three nights.......it was like going home to mother!!! We checked out of "brand x" after one night and walked to the Montecarlo. Everything was perfect - front desk help, room, breakfast and the rate that we received! Never again will I go to another hotel in Barcelona. Location, comfort and friendly staff made for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - couldnt have asked for anything better”
Reviews.Author: magicsmiler
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Barcelona. Having heard the many negative comments about pick pocketers etc, I have to say we encountered nothing of this sort - If your sensible and look after yourself you cant go wrong!! The hotel is bang on the famous rambalas, you cant get any more central if you tried - the most we paid for a taxi anywhere was 10 euros!!! We got a great deal by booking straight from the hotel website - we booked a junior suite and were not dissapointed! Excellent room size with a great spa and shower!! The staff were so so helfpul as soon as we arrived they could not do enough for us - from getting our luggage from the car, to always asking us how we were and was there anything else they could do - I cant speak highly enough for these guys, and the number one rating is justified! Great stay cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Kristy_May
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the Monte Carlo hotel. We had just gotten married and were greeted with a bottle of good Cava sparkling wine. The room was wonderful and we had a great view overlooking the Rambla from our balcony. The hotel staff was nothing but helpful and polite, no complaints on the service! The hotel is a beautiful building located by the Rambla which makes it very easy to go shopping, sightseeing and for a good meal. The restaurants by the Rambla are often quite over prized (and not that good) and we found many better restaurants a bit away from the Rambla. We would recommend the Julivert Meu restaurant (at C/ Bonsucces 7) and the famous Els Quatre Gats (at C/ Montsio 3). We stayed one week in Barcelona in October. The city is nice in autumn but I think we'll go back some day in summertime to enjoy the sun and the beaches near Barcelona. And we'll definitely stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoseandPeterontour
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a superb location. We had a room with a balcony overlooking La Rambla. The rooms were spotless and the staff spoke perfect English. Use the Autobus transfer from the airport which was great value and dropped you off nearby. My only slight grumble was the free WiFi did not work during our stay and it would have been nice to have had tea & coffee making facilities in the room. But I would highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Lovely Staff, fab location”
Reviews.Author: purplefishz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November, for my partners birthday weekend. The staff were very helpful and friendly from the moment we arrived, the room was lovely. It was clean, comfortable and large. The bathroom had a great jacuzzi bath. The hotel is positioned in an excellent spot for walking to a lot of the tourist areas. The hotel reception staff recommended some excellent places to eat. All in all a great hotel, great people and made a brilliant weekend. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Montecarlo - exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: zzdianne
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on T.A. reviews, booked our stay with booking.com and were thrilled with our choice. The hotel is in the best location we think in Barcelona. Most of the major tourist attractions within walking distance. For those further out tourist pick up points just up the road 200 odd meters. We received a warm welcome by friendly staff who all spoke perfect english and were eager to assist with any of the usual queries. We were escorted to our room and shown how to operate the facilities in the room. The room was spacious and spotlessly clean, as was the large bathroom. We had a nice breakfast at the hotel one morning of our 3 night stay. The other 2 we had at the Cafe Le Opera, further down La Rambla. We had 2 excellent dinners at Attica, right next door to the hotel. The hotel Montecarlo exceeded our expectations, and we highly recommed this hotel if you want to be close to the action in Barcelona. Thank you hotel Montecarlo staff for a wonderful stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “An Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KentPalaceman
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Barcelona and I went to this hotel having read the advice on Trip Advisor. How right they all were. A fabulous hotel with superb, helpful staff. A great position on La Rambla, so handy for everything. Our superior room was great with an amazing jacuzzi bath and a vast shower room as well!!! Will definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: Brave1Norway
Reviews.Content: After a very stressful autumn, my husband and I were looking forward to a quick getaway in Barcelona. I had chosen Hotel Montecarlo based on reviews, and I was not disappointed. We truly had a perfect stay. The hotel and staff deserve 5 stars on all aspects, the staff were especially helpful, knowledgable, friendly and very professional. 4 days was not enough to see 1/10th of Barcelona, so we will be back and definately stay at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid1
Reviews.Content: Normally when I'm in Barcelona I stay in the the Exiample but on this most recent occasion I decided to try the Montecarlo based on the consistently good reviews on TA. let me say that I am one of those people who does NOT have any difficulty staying near or on Las Ramblas because I figure that it is, like Sagrada Familia, a real PART of Barcelona. The Montecarlo was in a word, outstanding. I arrived early after an overnight rail trip from Zurich and not only was the room ready but I had also been upgraded to the junior suite on the first floor and that "room" is absolutely wonderful. Nicely furnished with an outside enclosed patio area; HUGE bath with separate power shower which can also be used as a sauna as well as a jetted separate tub. Immaculate housekeeping throughout and absolutely no sound whatsoever from the swirl of humanity on Las Ramblas itself. The location is right in the middle of that action and the hotel is directly across the street from the LeMeridien. The hotel staff were excellent and extremely helpful from getting an early cab to the airport for me to answering questions about local events, etc. I thought the breakfast including the hot offerings were worth the money (I had pre-paid and taken the discount). I've definitely found a new hotel for my next Barcelona stay. Absolutely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “brillant”
Reviews.Author: hannahmuirhead
Reviews.Content: really great hotel serivce the staff could not have been more helpful, rooms were lovely and big and very clean. the location is fantastic right on the la ramblas would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “great location, fantastic service and lovely people”
Reviews.Author: visitor_from_Bath
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the year before after good reviews on here and found it perfectly located, loved the room and the service excellent - it's like walking into a centre of excellence for tourist information when you check in. Everyone is friendly and helpful. Easy choice to stay again the following year - we love barcelona There is a starbucks over the road for breakfast - people recommended using that and as we stayed there for 3 nights, we tried the hotel breakfast for morning 1, starbucks for monring 2 - we were back in the hotel for the final one - much nicer - hey you are holiday why pay for a lovely hotel and then rough it with everyone off the streets to save a few euros when you have a posh hotel with good food in a relaxing environment.

Reviews.Title: “Something special”
Reviews.Author: anniwhere
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Located right by the Ramblas with a smiling and helpful staff who treated me like I was a regular. Fabulous room. Never been much for jacuzzis but it was great to take a bath in one after walking non-stop all day. The special bed was a marvel. An amazing hotel that I would definately stay in again and recommend to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel - for a wonderful break”
Reviews.Author: Sasdax
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after a 3 day break and was very pleased with our choice of the Hotel Montecarlo. The front staff were all very charming and always a smile. Never needed to ask for the room key as they remembered us every time we returned to the hotel. The room was amazing with a large bathroom fitted with a shower and separate jacuzzi bath. The bed was extremely comfortable and loved the the luxury of being able to raise and lower the individual bed as desired. The room also had a small sitting area with 2 chairs, table, DVD player, minibar, which was great so you did not feel you were sitting in the bedroom. The one minor issue was there was no view from the bedroom window at all, looking onto an apartment wall. A better view from the sitting room looking onto a small courtyard. Having said that, as it was November we die not see much daylight at the hotel being away first thing in the morning and not returning after six pm. I would have liked a view of the Ramblas as it was a superior room. One thing we noticed was we never saw a member of the household cleaning staff! normally you are tripping over the hoover and maneuvering around their trolleys!! We had a great stay and will definitely return to this hotel should we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Now I know why it's Numero Uno”
Reviews.Author: Zangetsu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic value. I almost can't fault anything with it. From the moment we checked in they surprised us with their level of service and the room kept revealing little surprises that made the stay all the more wonderful. For example, our room was massive, the beds were huge and comfortable, our beds had motor operated lifts to adjust the angle of the beds, windows were double glazed and had motorised shutters to completely block out noise and light, the shower head and water pressure is fabulous, free internet, wifi, printing etc etc. We stayed for 6 nights and it passed by just like that because it was just so comfortable. We didn't bother with the hotel breakfast cause we never do. It's much better to experience what the locals eat and I would definitely reccomend Bar Pinotxo at the nearby La Bouqueria Market. The old man there making the best coffes is an institution! The best XuXo's in town and great service. I guess if I were to fault the hotel I would say that the weighing scale did not work properly and there was occasional plumbing noise at night. But that would be really nit-picking wouldn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: IrishMimi
Reviews.Content: We have just been to Barcelona for a short break and stayed at this totally fantastic hotel for three nights. Why do we rate it so highly? Well, it is fabulous value for money, squeeky clean without feeling clinical, has some of the most helpful staff either of us have ever encountered, is central to almost everything we wanted to see and do and the amenities (bathroom particularly) are top notch. We are both agreed that we absolutely will go back there when we return to Barcelona - and we commend it highly to you.

Reviews.Title: “As lovely on the inside as the facade on the outside”
Reviews.Author: timetravellerswife2
Reviews.Content: We were greeted on arrival by very friendly reception staff who all spoke very good English. The traditional exterior of the hotel does not tell the whole story. The interior has been modernised to a good standard but has managed to keep an air of the granduer of the original building. The renovation only took place about three years ago so there is still a feel of 'newness' about the place. During our 4 day stay we found all the staff to be very helpful and pleasant. I was a little suprised to find that the hotel could not cash our travellers cheques and could only change american dollars, whilst a little annoying, due to the superb location of the hotel on 'La Rambla' there were plenty of other places for us to use. Overall the reviews you will find on tripadvisor for this hotel give an accurate description of what we found ourselves. (With the odd exception, as we certainly didn't find any of the staff rude!) and we were pleased to have chosen 'Hotel monte Carlo' as our base whilst celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm318
Reviews.Content: This was every bit as good as we expected from the other reviews. The location on The Rambla is perfect for a real Barcelona experience. The staff were very friendly and welcoming and our room was great. The decor was a bit minimalist, but the room was very comfortable and quiet. Use the Metro - it's very easy. Visit the underground Roman remains in the Historical Museum - they're amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with great service and in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Scoperta17
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. I travelled with my husband, sister and brother in law for two days for my sister's 30th birthday. The hotel was beautifully clean and stylish, the staff were all very friendly, spoke excellent English and couldn't do enough to help us and make our stay comfortable. It was a shame breakfast wasn't included in the price of the room, however we only paid 12euros each for breakfast each morning and there was a lovely selection of hot and cold foods, fruit and pastries. The rooms were well decorated, with luxurious bathrooms with jacuzzi baths. We had pre-requested quiet rooms at the back and were allocated these instantly on arrival. We all had excellent nights' sleeps, which is rare in a hotel, particularly one located on the busiest street in such a big city. The location on La Rambla is perfect for sight-seeing. This was our second time in Barcelona, and I can recommend La Fonda restaurant just off La Rambla for good value, well-cooked traditional Catalan meat and fish.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: klutz1Toronto_ON
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the MonteCarlo hotel and thought it was wonderful. We took the Aerobus from the airport that dropped us off at Placa Catalunya. Then, just a 2 minute walk down Las Ramblas to the hotel. Our room was ready early and the staff were friendly and very helpful. We got a very good rate by paying for the full stay ahead of time. The room looked out on a back courtyard (I think all of the rooms face the back of the hotel) and was very quiet. The location is great, right near the top end of Las Ramblas. You can walk everywhere. There is a very nice lounge/bar in the hotel for a quiet drink, but our favourite spot was the rooftop terrace where we would take our wine and watch the sun go down over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: DublinHank
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, fantastic room (cool jacuzi), exremely friendly and helpful staff, excellent breakfast with a great range and overall definitely one to recommend and to go back to......

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, modern hotel with friendly, helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: DPS8
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location right on La Rambla, staff couldnt be more helpful even providing umbrellas for the torrential rain. Room was modern and up to date containing everything you needed. Pity there was no sun for us to see from the sun terrace, maybe next time when we are staying here. We would definiately recommend Montecarlo to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: GutUpAndGo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Montecarlo was absolutely wonderful. We booked it based in TA reviews and were not the least bit disappointed. Stayed with a second party who had a larger room with jacuzzi while our room was smaller but both were immaculately clean. From the moment we arrived and were shown to the parking garage until the day we left the staff were as polite as could be. The location was perfect with tons of restaurants and market shops within walking distance. We particularly enjoyed "the attic" which is literally a 30 second walk from the front entrance of the hotel and rooftop seating overlooks La Rambla. Food was excellent and the prices were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, in the heart of the city. Very helpful and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: AnotherAussieExpat
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others. It was a haven of cool and peace in the heart of a very busy and hot city! Our room was nicely appointed, thankfully it had air conditioning (which worked effectively), the spa bath was worth trying out and all the staff did their best to ensure we had a lovely time in Barcelona. The hotel is on Las Ramblas, so there is easy access to many restaurants and shops as soon as you walk out the door. It is also worth walking further afield to visit other areas of Barcelona city to appreciate the architecture, food and culture it has to offer. Ask the staff at the door for restaurant tips - they were full of ideas when we were there. One thing to be aware of in Barcelona generally (and this is by no means a reflection on our hotel): there is not much to do on Sundays when literally everything (many restaurants and all shops) is closed and most shops (except the food markets) open late in the morning (10/11am) although they are often open until 10pm at night, so plan your holidays carefully so you can make the most of it. (E.g. We'd recommend leaving Barcelona on a Sunday rather than waiting for Monday which we did, sightsee by day, shop by night and dine with the locals at 10pm).

Reviews.Title: “Whisper quiet in the midst of the action”
Reviews.Author: travelhagPerth
Reviews.Content: We really LOVED this hotel. Spotlessly clean, elegantly (albeit sparesly) decorated and perfectly situated on La Rambla as well as two blocks from Place de Catalynya- AND very friendly and professional staff ( particularly Fernando and his colleague on the late afternoon/evening shift).Rooms are not huge but big enough; decor is a little bare; beds were adjustable; pillows perfect and the bathroom had a huge spa. We chose a room facing the street- this is a MUST! Because of the double glazing the was not a sound from below but with the balcony door open one could take in all the atmosphere/ the 24/7 buzz of La Rambla below. breakfast was very reasonable at EUR12- the freshly squeezed orange juice alone was worth that.

Reviews.Title: “Art is to Barcelona, what coffee is to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: dtanoury
Reviews.Content: We are fussy travelers and we have travelled widely, yet we found that the Hotel Montecarlo exceeded all of our expectations. The hotel was superb and located right on La Rambla. We expected to hear the street noise, but thanks to special double glass doors and windows our room was as quiet as a chapel. The services were great and the staff was helpful and pleasant. Everyone at the hotel went above and beyond to make our stay very enjoyable. Don't leave the hotel without getting their recommendation for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Marianora
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is on the noisy Las Ramblas, once inside the nicely appointed room, you really do not hear bustle. The hotel staff were terrific, providing excellent service with a smile. The hotel is within walking distance to most of the city's attractions in the Gothic area, Born district and Barceloneta. Best of all, it is an easy walk (with luggage in tow) from Plaza Catalunya to catch the bus to the airport. If you want to be mostly in the Gothic quarter (not everyone does), then this a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Location and a Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: PMTexas
Reviews.Content: Simple enough, fancy just right, spotless clean, awesome customer service (completely unusual for Spain in any level), located in the most vibrant point in Barcelona and about US $ 100/night. That's Montecarlo Hotel. The building itself is a jewel and the room surprisingly cozy and modern. When I come back to Barcelona, this is the place I'll stay again. There is no parking lot, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bifm
Reviews.Content: We booked this for a long weekend (Fri-Mon) in Barcelona at the start of October. We had a standard room, but it was very good quality, with enough space, a balcony and a large bath/jacuzzi. It overlooked La Rambla from the 4th floor - no problems with noise. We didn't use any of the public facilities - we got our breakfast along La Rambla or from La Boqueria market. We liked the mango and coconut smoothies from La Boqueria! However, the staff were friendly and helpful when we asked about restaurants - we just didn't need to ask them for very much. As well as the market, we would recommend the tourist bus - we used the Bus Touristic - but expect to wait around quite a bit, especially if you want to sit upstairs. We found it was busiest at Placa de Catalunya and it would have been better to get on at the stop before - if we'd bought a ticket beforehand. Given my time again, I'd have taken a 1-day trip around on the bus, then returned to the places we liked on the metro or taxi. We loved the Gaudi architecture - the rooftop of La Pedrera is worth queueing for. Parc Guell was great, although a bit too busy, but we found a small quiet area with picnic tables to have our ham, cheese and fruit from La Boqueria. No problems with pickpockets, but we were careful wtih our valuables and left most of our credit cards in the hotel safe. The only danger we came close to was when a helpful waiter warned my wife to hold my bag when we were seated outside - I had left it under the table when I went inside to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: jersey1977
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of Las Ramblas. The hotel service was friendly, though we didnt use them for much. The room itself was unremarkable but clean and decent. Overall, highly recommended because of its A+ location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service, Perfect Location, Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xxx123
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room and requested a balcony overlooking La Rambla, which we received. The room was very spacious for Europe and the bathroom was gigantic, with a very nice jacuzzi tub and stand alone shower with excellent water pressure. The location was ideal and many of the city's attractions are closeby or accessible via public transportation. What really made our stay memorable though was the front desk staff. Every one was very helpful and spoke very good English. They made excellent recommendations for restaurants and stores and also helped my wife with her wireless internet connection connection. The numerous glowing reviews on Trip Advisor are spot on and they deserve all the accolades.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy and great location”
Reviews.Author: brucegator
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 days on a business trip in September 09. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean with a modern decor. Maybe a little too modern as there is not much storage space but enought to get by. Overall a very nice property. Not luxury but still quite nice. Location is great. On the Ramblas and not far from the metro stops, eating, drinking, etc. The breakfast is fine for a day or two but nothing special. There is a lobby bar but I never saw it open. Internet service worked great. My room was in the back and I never had any noise problems at all. They use regular keys so I did not like having to stop at the front desk every time to drop off/pick up my key but this is relatively minor. Overall an excellent choice in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Nearly Spoiled By One Bad Apple”
Reviews.Author: CityWendy
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was the third stop of my honeymoon as we couldn't have been more pleased with our hotel...until our first morning when Valeri, one of the front desk employees treated me like absolute garbage. Let me say that the other hotel employees were very professional and friendly, but this bad apply had a rotten attitude which would be unpleasant in daily life, but was downright shocking and inappropriate from someone whose JOB it is to serve the public. When I complained about the hotel's policy to charge guests for ironing privileges (that's something that should be included a 200 euro-a-night room!), he told me I was rude to say such a thing and then actually held his hand up in front of my face and told me he was done talking to me!!! With the exception of Valeri and the ridiculous ironing policy, the hotel was quite lovely with exceptionally clean rooms, very large bathrooms (ours had a wonderful jacuzzi!), a convenient location, and a nice sun deck. Once I spoke with the manager, who was very professional and friendly, and received an apology for Valeri's terrible behavior (not from HIM, of course -- I suspect he wouldn't dream of ever apologizing to a woman), I was happy to remain in the hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, deserves to be no.1”
Reviews.Author: steppes
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel Montecarlo and it really was as great as other reviewers have said. The room was big and very comfortable and quiet, contemporary design, with a big bathroom. We had our 4 month old baby with us and a cot was provided and she was welcomed by all the staff. The staff were all excellent - friendly, knowledgeable and with very good English. We paid e120 a night which we thought was good value for such a good hotel and central location.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously good hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonlass79
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of hotel Montecarlo we thought that it couldn't possibly be as good as they said... but it was every bit as good. We arrived late in the evening to a warm welcome, given maps and tourist information and shown to our room. The room was great, lovely bathroom with huge jacuzzi bath, very modern and light. Everywhere was immaculate. The only downside could have been the breakfast price, we didnt see anyone having breakfast in the hotel during our stay. There are lots of places within walking distance though. Having said that if you are enjoying the delights of Barcelona night life, chances are you'll be missing breakfast anyway! Great value hotel you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFULL OASIS ON RAMBLAS”
Reviews.Author: ZINHO_Rochester_Ny
Reviews.Content: From the moment we got t the reception and were greeted by the personnel we knew we ad made the right choice. The room was spacious and quiet considering that you are Ramblas. The bathroom alone was bigger than he room we had just gotten in Paris. Ramblas could be a noisy street even late at night, but as soon as you get to the Hotel lobby you are in a different world of safe, friendly and efficient service. The location could not be better, right at the center of everything turistic in Barcelona. Do not miss the Boqueria market two blocks away. For places to see, ask at the desk, they are very reliable and always right. YOU CAN'T GO WRONG IF YOU STAY AT THE MONTECARLO!!!

Reviews.Title: “best find in European trips this year”
Reviews.Author: widetraveler5
Reviews.Content: What a great find. Location is perfect (on Las Ramblas). You can get there from the airport on the shuttle to Cataluyna. Centrally located. Just about everything is walkable. Room very modern and relatively spacious. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless oasis”
Reviews.Author: FriendsOfDorothy
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 2-night stay in this hotel. Our suite on the second floor was a beautifully fitted modern example of how hotels rooms should look and function. The bathroom alone was bigger than many hotel rooms elsewhere. The balcony off our bedroom on the Ramblas was the icing on cake. The design all around was so good we took some photos for ideas back at home. The room was very quiet and the sliding door between the bedroom and the sitting room made it easy to work using the Wi-Fi without disturbing others. The reception staff were always cheerful and polite with good suggestions for places to go for lunch and dinner. The breakfast room was a calm oasis facing a somewhat uninspiring inner courtyard, but the water feature and the plants were cleverly positioned to disguise the fact. All together a very successful stay and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: TheFWM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our second stay in the MonteCarlo. This hotel is fantastic - the staff, the location and the rooms. I would recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “TOURIST'S DREAM”
Reviews.Author: LasVegan09
Reviews.Content: Can't thank my self enough for finding this GEM in the epicenter of touristic chaos(through Trip Advisor by the way). Each of 4 nights spent in this hotel was a great garnish perfectly matching the main cours - our first trip to Barcelona. The wood flored room #207 we stayed in was zesty clean and had everything a traveling couple might be in need of both after and before a long "browsing around" day. The staff - oh, those five star service providers. Our applause and special thanks go to Valeri and Fernando. We left Barcelona with holding our fingers crossed and, of course, thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Patsy6
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in centre of BCN. We stayed here for 2 nights for my husband's 40th birthday - it was amazing. The hotel is clean, VERY central - aerobus stop, metro, bus touristic all within mins walk and modern. The staff are very helpful and we were able to leave our luggage on last day to collect later at no extra charge. Will definitely stay here again when we return to BCN.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to the next stay”
Reviews.Author: emmamaria
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Montecarlo, this time stying for 4 nights. The location is excellent and can't be beaten, fully soundproofed rooms, ask for a room overlooking the Ramblas. Rooms have jacuzzi bath and adjustable beds.The staff are very welcoming and helpful, always smiling and pleasant. Breakfast offers plenty of choice at 12 euros with bacon, eggs, cheese and meats, lots of pastries, yoghurt, fruit etc. Barcelona is a fantastic city which we will return to again and again - this was our 3rd visit to the city. Must dos are the tourist bus, the Gaudi buildings including Park Guell, the cable ride, Montjuic fountains at night, sitting in a square sipping Sangria. Can't wait to go again! I fully recommend this hotel, also has secure parking, we were driving the last 2 times and found no problem getting in and out of the city (with TomTom!).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at Hotel Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: DJ75
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay in Hotel Montecarlo and can't say enough good things about the place. The hotel was great, the staff could not have been more friendly and helpful and the room was fantastic. Location is perfect, walking distance to everything and less than five minutes walk from airport bus/train transfer Pl Catalunya. Would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it”
Reviews.Author: tklos1974
Reviews.Content: First time across the pond so I did not know what to expect. I was blown away. Nothing what I thought it would be. The service was superb, the location doesn't get any better and the room was very, very clean. We stayed at a couple other places in Italy after this and this was without a doubt our favorite hotel. I would recommend it for any family/friends. -tk

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Montecarlo is a Fabulous Find on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: flcrews
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research to find a hotel in Barcelona before we found Hotel Montecarlo; and I'm glad we took our time. This property is perfectly situated, right on the famous Las Ramblas and minutes by foot to all the sites, shopping and Plaza Catalunya; but it's a quiet oasis from the hustle of this famous area of town. They have a very friendly English speaking staff who were extremely helpful. And the room (which was really a three room suite) was beautifully designed with great air conditioning. This hotel is quite a find. They also have a charming rooftop sun terrace with lovely views of the city, and the only suggestion to the staff is to extend the hours past 7pm to allow for visits at night. This hotel offers unbelievable value and quality. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Great Location, Rooms a little "sparce"”
Reviews.Author: Grandpuba007
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice hotel with a fantastic location (if you want to be in the heart of things on La Rambla). The building is beautiful and the amenities are all in very good shape (particularly the air condition). The only draw-back I'd say is that the rooms a rather minimalist/stark, which may be more an aesthetic preference than a drawback but it didn't feel very warm or welcoming. The bathrooms though are huge and well appointed. We had a room looking out the back and it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful comfort in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ParisLisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Montecarlo which I chose because of its n° 1 rating with Tripadvisor. I was not disappointed. I always read the reviews of several internet sites before choosing a hotel and book well in advance to get a good rate. Apparently some people complain about the rates which increase the later you book - this is normal - its exactly the same when you make a late plane booking. The Montecarlo is exactly how I expected it to be - quiet with good soundproofing in a very central animated location on the Rambla - perfect for discovering Barcelona. The hotel was a haven of peace when returning from a full day of sightseeing. The bathroom with jacuzzi was great and the bed extremely comfortable. Lots of space in room- mine consisted of an entrance area with good- sized cupboard and area to leave luggage, large bathroom with huge jacuzzi (which I really miss), separate door to bedroom which when closed eliminated any corridor noise. All rooms are good size, but obviously differ in shape and layout. I was in the older part with a small balcony overlooking the Rambla which I had asked for when I booked and got - but at this hotel it is better to book early as they are soon full. Television with good choice of channels in several languages. Air-conditioning silent and adjustable. Reception staff very efficient and helpful. If you like small (50 rooms) well-run hotels without noisy groups this is an excellent choice. If you want animation its right on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful barcelona...”
Reviews.Author: daGPoznan
Reviews.Content: I mean there are nicer places to stay in Barcelona, ones definitely closer to the city center, charmer and cheaper. But all in all when it comes to adding up pros and cons this was very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “extremely comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ananEastSussex
Reviews.Content: the room was simple but clean and quiet, lovely bathroom and beds super comfortable. Staff very helpful when we arrived after a hot walk from the station with our luggage in tow, although too early to check in to room at 10am, looked after our luggage and we were able to use washrooms etc to freshen up, Good tourist advice from very helpful staff. Great central location, not far from anywhere on foot and a definite haven off La Rambla. Breakfast not cheap but beautifully presented , plenty of it to choose from and worth not having to go out in the heat to get first meal of the day. Would definitely use this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Never made it to hotel”
Reviews.Author: dworthmaBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: I use Tripadvisor for all my vacations, doing research and reading these reviews. I emailed the hotel to see if they had any Superior rooms as they only appeared to have the standard rooms during the dates of my trip to Barcelona. However, I was greatly surprised when they quoted me prices HIGHER then listed on their website. When I sent them a screen shot proving the cost difference they said it was a delay and the website would be updated shortly. I monitored their website and a month later they still had not updated their prices, so I pinged the manager. Again, they quoted me prices HIGHER then i could book on the website (my screen shot was on the final confirmation page t book the room). Unfortunately this has soured me to even try this hotel. When you lie to customer before you even get there, prove the cost your being quoted are wrong then have them lie to you again. Well that['s too much for me !! Might be a great palce but be warned, if your from the US they think they can rip you off.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: BURFORDLOVERS
Reviews.Content: What a lovely Hotel - staff friendly and helpful (or at least in the outward appearance - they talk the talk - not always doing the do) but its fine - they are nice. Great location - comfy rooms and nice rooms - GREAT bathroom.....just nice - GO FOR IT.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but ridiculous hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbringman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night before moving onto another city -- I had friends arriving in Barcelona on an overnight flight the next day. In the morning, when my friends arrived, the hotel staff rudely prevented them from coming up to my room to relax and unwind. The hotel may be in a good location (if you like Rambla), but the rooms are not that great. And even though you pay for the room, you can't have people back up to your room. There are many better hotels in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: wine4more
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I recently stayed at this hotel, after reading the reviews. Having never been to Barcelona, we were not certain of the different areas of town and what to expect when we arrived. Location was fabulous by day and a little seedy at one in the morning. We arrived late on a week night and took the Aerobus from the airport to Placa de Catalunya. As it was after midnight, there were all sorts of people milling about.We stopped for a moment to check our map for the street location of the hote, which is only one street from the Placa. A man walked up to ask for a light and as he distracted us, his parnter attempted to steal one of our bags. Luckily we caught sight in time. We then grabbed our bags and got to the hotel. What a wonderful haven in the middle of this place that is not so nice after midnight. We were greeted with such friendliness by the doorman that offered to take our bags. The front desk check in was efficient and helpful. Our room, which was a Deluxe room was very nice. When you walk in to the foyer you can go straight into a small sitting area with chairs, a TV, Minibar and Computer. To the left was a very spacious bedroom with an armoir, safebox, TV and clothes chest. The beds were fantastic. Connected but each with its own adjustments. You can raise and lower the head and foot of each separate bed. The linens were so lovely and you just sink into the bed. In addition, the bedroom had all the lighting options next to each night table, as well as a way to put the window darkening shades down. The bathroom, across the foyer was equally spacious, with a large walk in shower and vanity area. You then go further into an area with a large jacuzzi/ toilet area. The room was overall fabulous. We chose to have breakfast at the hotel and were very happy. The breakfast room is a nice space on the main floor. There were a variety of breads and pastries as well as bacon, eggs, hams, chorizos, cheeses, yougurts and fruits. They also offer fresh squeezed orange juice that was outstanding. The service was also top notch. It was a very satisfying way to start the day. During the day, the street out front has an entirely different atmoshrere. There are people with stall set up, there are people in costumes acting like statues, it is lively and very nice. We were only a few streets from the famous Marcado de San Jose. A very lovely semi covered food market with produce, meats, fish and a great deal more. There are also areas to eat at the counter or at small tables. The tapas and beer and wines were amazing. Everything was very fresh and so tasty. The hotel is in the ideal location for walking, not too far from the water and many alleyways with more shops and restaurants. There is also several metro stations very near. We would most definetly stay here again and I hope we are able to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location only outdone by the excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: FresnoEurophile
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled to Europe about a dozen times over the years. Because we have most often won these trips through my business, we have had the very good fortune to stay at some of the best hotels in Europe. Recently we extended an awards trip with an extra stay at the Hotel Montecarlo in Barcelona. I chose the hotel based upon its excellent location, its very reasonable price and its great reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. It is not possible to find a better location in Barcelona. However, the excellent location was outdone by is extraordinarily courtious and helpful staff. Every member of the staff, both day and evening shifts, could not have been better. The rooms were somewhat dated and not posh but they were clean and well attended. For the price, you can not do better. Our many thanks to the staff of the Hotel Montecarlo. You made our trip a wonderful experience. We look forward to visiting you again soon. You deserve your #1 ranking. Bill and Fae Fresno, California

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all respects”
Reviews.Author: AmyFB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great...the rooms are large and clean (I travelled with a party of 6 in 3 rooms, so I checked out all 3!) with supercomfortable beds and beautiful large bathrooms with jacuzzi tubs (some big enough for 2!). The windows are really sound-proof so the hotel is nice and quiet. There is excellent security, which is nice since the hotel is right on the Ramblas (a great cenral location, near Metro and the bus to the airport at Placa Catalunya). The rooms are cleaned twice a day (once in the A.M and then again before bedtime) and they have heavy-duty light blocking shades to let you sleep in! The staff is fantastic, with lots of helpful info and advice on Barcelona. They were beyond helpful and we often saw the same people working during our 3 night stay. Our "pay ahead, no refunds" rate that we got online of 180 Euros per room per night was pretty reasonable for what you got, I think. I would DEFINITELY stay here again and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in City”
Reviews.Author: CT5kids
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo June 25-30 with husband and 3 girls aged 10, 13 and 15. The hotel and staff were superb. Location near the top of the Ramblas and across from Metro excellent; used airport bus and walked to hotel in 10 minutes. Rooms (one deluxe and one standard) were immaculate, spacious, and well appointed. The deluxe (room 402) had 2 large rooms, a balcony overlooking the Ramblas that was incredibly soundproof, and a large marble, 2 basin bathroom with jacuzzi tub and separate massage shower. The kids loved it and my husband slept well on the thick mattressed roll away we needed to make a triple (which fit easily in the sitting room beside the main bedroom). The deluxe room next door was equally comfortable; I loved the thick mattresses, adjustable beds, and again, shining marble bath. These rooms (double and triple occupancy) were 160 and 220 euros each, a bargain in the city. The staff were all friendly, helpful, and made excellent recommendations re the beach, restaurants, etc. This hotel deserves the rave reviews it has received by other trip advisor reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Accommodation & Excellent Staff & Free Internet”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryRailroader
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located centrally on the popular pedestrian avenue, La Rambla. Our 'Standard Room' was spacious, clean and had most amenities. The bedroom could be closed off with a closet door leaving two rooms with a TV in each. The bed had a remote control to adjust to one's preferred position. The bathroom was clean with tub and shower.. The staff (front desk & bellmen) could not be more courteous and helpful and all spoke excellent English. The Internet in the lobby and in the room was complmentary. We'd most definitely stay there again. The only deficiencies we would list are the need for facial tissues, face cloths and coffeemaker

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Attention to small details!!”
Reviews.Author: Ivyleigh1
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Everyone was very friendly. The hotel was clean and well-maintained. We loved all the special touches.... robes, slippers, scale, toiletries, etc. Both the room and bathroom were large and the jacuzzi tub was a plus. My teenage son loved the retractable blinds on the windows that worked from a switch on the wall. The upstairs solarium offers wonderful view of the city. When you step out the front door, you are in the middle of the action on La Rambla. Turn right, and you aren't too far from the city square, the local bus stop, and the subway. There are many great shops and outdoor cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend it highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiHowes
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and i stayed here June 09 for my 40th birthday - we booked it BECAUSE it was no. 1 on trip advisor and it lived up to it in every way. Service and friendliness of staff - 5 star. Cleanliness and comfort of room - 5 star. Location - 5 star. Our gorgeous room was right overlooking La Rambla with a balcony - when you opened the doors the sounds of Barcelona were everywhere but the fantastic double/double glazing meant that when the doors were closed you could hear a pin drop. Automatic beds were great fun - fabulous large jacuzzi bath, but i do believe the two things that sell this hotel are location and staff. You are 2 minutes walk from La Placa De La Catalunya where all the main shops start and all the buses drop off and pick up including the open top bus - 2 day pass is great value and a wonderful way to see the city ( by the way you must get off the bus at the stop after the olympic stadium at the cable cars and go to the top of the mountain to the castle - the views are breathtaking and so few people seemed to do it?) Turn left out of the hotel and walk down La Rambla straight to the harbour (about 4 mins) which is gorgeous - some lovely restaurants tucked round the back of there and you can sit right on the harbour. Barcelona was lovely and i can't recommend this hotel highly enough as a great base. Don't miss the food market set back on the left side of La Rambla - colours and foods that will amaze you! And don't go up in the lift to the top of Columbus' tower in the harbour unless you are very UNclaustrophobic and don't mind heights! High point - The Sagrada Familia - amazed by the size of it! Lovely holiday - thank you Montecarlo, great value for money x

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: aparnarya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the Ramblas, 5 min.s from the Catalunya Metro station and 7 min.s from the Liceu station... Also in close proximity is the beach, a number of museums and a lot of the shopping and good dining joints as well... A starbucks is conveniently across the street and a Dunkin (Donuts) Coffee is 2 min.s away... I stayed here for 6 nights and had a different experience and adventure each day... Me and my mom got a quite room (206) which overlooks a neighboring cafe in a beautiful garden with a foutain... We heard some fantastic music a couple of days - melodic harp and some spanish guitar... Awesome and soooo relaxing....

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: wowfabgroovy
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves every accolade that TripAdvisor visitors have already given it. The staff are superb, the rooms beautiful, the location second to none and the breakfast a delight! Nothing could have made our first visit to this great city more enjoyable than staying at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hokies_In_Georgia
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from staying at Hotel Montecarlo, and it is a fantastic hotel! Before traveling to Barcelona, we emailed the hotel asking if it would be possible to get into our room as soon as possible. They couldn't promise anything, but said they would do the best they could. After arriving from an all-night transatlantic flight from the United States and a train ride into the city, we were welcomed by the front desk team and told our room would be ready in 30 minutes. We were thrilled because we were able to take a 3 hour nap to recharge our systems! The service at this hotel is fabulous. They gave us maps and brochures of the city when we checked in , and answered any questions we had. Our room was facing the courtyard on the side, and it was very quiet due to the double-paned windows and the pull-down shade. The rooms have been refurbished and are clean, modern, and extremely comfortable. We slept soundly every night due to the comfortable adjustable beds. Just a tip - there were plenty of electrical outlets that we found to be a benefit to charge up our phones, camera, etc. We decided to stay at this hotel based on the location and the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. Wow, what a great choice we made! The location couldn't be better - it is close to everything and directly on Las Ramblas. Placa de Catalunya is a short walk and from there you can access the tourist bus, subway, and commuter train to the airport. The La Boqueria market, the waterfront area, and the Gothic Quarter are all a short walk away. There are plenty of cafes, shops, and restaurants in all of these areas. Here are a few tips on what to see/do/eat: 1. Be sure to go to the La Boqueria market - it is a wonderful site to see as well as buy fruit and snacks. We particularly liked the fresh fruit smoothies. Be sure to walk farther in the market for the better prices on smoothies and food. The stands at the front charge the most. 2. Go to the waterfront area - there are tons of places to eat, shop, rest, and people watch. The view of the Mediterranean is gorgeous as you sip on a sangria! 3. To see the sites around town, be sure to get on the Barcelona Bus Turistic. We found it online on www.barcelonaturisme.com and it is wonderful! There are 3 different routes you can take, and you can get on/off the bus as you like. You can buy a 1 or 2 day pass - it is definitely worth every cent. The buses are double decker with the top deck being open-air. Try to get on the top deck if possible for the best views. You will receive ear phones to plug in at your seat and select the language of your choice. Everything is narrated, informative, and interesting They give you coupon books with each ticket, and the discounts almost pay for the cost of the tour ticket. There are discounts for all of the popular sites, and we used a lot of them. You can buy tickets for the tour bus at Placa de Catalunya. 4. There are plenty of places to eat, but we enjoyed Tapa Tapa which is on Passeig de Gracia which is a short walk north from Placa de Catalunya. It is across the street from Gaudi's Casa Batllo (a must see!). We also enjoyed Ciutat Condal which is 1 block north from Placa de Catalunya. Another tapas restaurant which we enjoyed was Txapela which is a basque-style pintxo bar on Passeig de Gracia. Each of these places provides menus in English as well as in other languages. 5. The hotel offers breakfast, but we never ate there. We were usually up and out early and got something to eat along the way. 6. There is a computer in the lobby area with free internet connection for the hotel guests. If you have your laptop, they will provide you with a card that gives you free wi-fi access. We would absolutely stay here again in the future. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, VERY comfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: rnc99
Reviews.Content: My 24 yr old daughter & I stayed here 1 night post cruise. Location was excellent on Las Ramblas.
