Elegant, but modern hotel with just the right touch of class: the service was excellent- they helped with storing luggage early, calling a taxi, printing boarding passes, giving directions, & assisting with a corkscrew for our wine. Loved the comfort of the bed, as it was adjustable electronically which was great as we were exhausted from our trip. Very quiet room with pleasant view of courtyard. Appreciated the robe, slippers, & room amenities like the fridge. Only downsides we wished they had free wireless internet instead of paying for this service in our room. The step out of the tub was huge & my DD almost fell. Would have been totally perfect if breakfast had been included, otherwise a great hotel & we would not hesitate to stay here again or send our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: coffeegirl247
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on it's location and previous reviews on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed! This hotel is in a great central location. We took the Aerobus from the airport and walked around 5 minutes from the Placa de Catalunya to our hotel. Once at the hotel, we were greeted by a wonderful front desk staff. They were friendly and very knowledgeable. We had a standard room which included a nice jetted tub in the bathroom. The perfect place to unwind after a long day in the sun touring around the city. We chose to skip the breakfast at the hotel and instead walked over to the very close Mercat de la Boqueria. There are lots of places in the market to sit and grab breakfast, or you can buy fresh fruit from the stands. Don't miss out on this hotel, it made our stay in Barcelona very comfortable and memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service makes all the difference”
Reviews.Author: bouldermary56
Reviews.Content: When I recently arrived at the Montecarlo, I was not immediately impressed. Sure the building is beautiful, and the ultra-modern rooms are ultra-efficient, but I was not wowed. However, with each interaction with the front desk staff my appreciation of the Montecarlo grew. Every member of the staff was so helpful and knowledgeable. We got great restaurant, entertainment and touring suggestions. We were never rushed so that they could help the next person in line (which was never long). Did I mention the location? It was really perfect. On the Rambla, near the Plaza Catalunya, a great jumping-off point to see the city. The rooms at the Montecarlo are rather stark, but everything is perfect. The hospital beds (perfect for sitting up to read), the electric roll-down shades which provided complete darkness) and the well-equiped bathroom are exactly what is needed after a long day in the city. I loved the Montecarlo!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in its price range i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: JT888
Reviews.Content: Room was huge, service was excellent, location unbeatable. Stay here when in barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, tranquil hotel with excellent helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: theinncrowd
Reviews.Content: Travel by Aerobus (4.25 euros) from the airport to Pl. Catalunya and it's less than a five minute walk to the hotel. The beautiful Monte Carlo Hotel is cool and inviting after the crowds of La Rambla. The reception staff are the most helpful and friendly you will ever meet. We stayed on the 31st May in a standard room overlooking a small garden and we were pleasantly surprised how spacious and modern it was with a jacuzzi bath and electric adjustable bed. No need to ask for extra pillows for once. After our cruise we stayed again on the 6th June. This time in a superior room. We requested a balcony overlooking La Rambla and were lucky enough to get it. I couldn't understand the comment that one reviewer made that it was noisy. There are two sets of doors and once they are closed there is absolutely no outside noise. The superior room had a large round jucuzzi and the same 6' wide very comfortable beds as the standard. The room is just larger and a little more luxurious. As there is no evening dining we went to The Attic Restaurant a few doors away. The decor and food are excellent and not too expensive. We had the veal fillets and they were delicious. (Look at the photos of each meal at the top of the menu if you can't choose). The house rose wine was reasonably priced and very nice. I recommend booking a table at weekends as it gets busy. Pl. Catalunya has all the city bus tours and El Cortez Ingles department store and at the lower end of La Ramblas across from the Colombus statue is a bridge leading to Mare Magnum shopping centre with some nice cafes. Other places of interest as well as the Cathedral and Football Stadium are Pl Espanya, The Fountains of Monjuic and Tibidabo. if you don't want to take a tour the Red and Green line Metro will take you to most of the sites and a T10 (zone 1) ticket will cost 7.70 euros. Thanks reviewers your hotel recommendations are always worth taking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Great Room, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: travelmg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon, and we had a wonderful time. when we arrived, the hotel staff was very kind and showed us on a map all the city attractions and gave us good advice on things to do while visiting the city. The rooms were recently remodeled and were very nice! we had a room facing the street, and is wasn't loud at all, despite the night life. You can go on the top of the hotel and sit and relax and watch the people down below - it was a great thing to do after a long day of walking. The beach is just down the street, the hotel was in a great location. We didn't get the breakfast offered at the hotel - too expensive for what it was - we decided to go to the little cafe's around and get a much more reasonable priced breakfast each morning. I would recommend this hotel to anyone new or returning to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Well thought boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Funtravel85
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are small but very styled and well designed and clean. The location is perfect. I do not think anyone would be disappointed but if you have a room on La Rambla then do not expect too much sleep. I left after two nights because of the noise and stayed at the Aparthotel Citadines which is literally right next to the Montecarlo - not fancy but same location and half the price.

Reviews.Title: “They're #1 - And here's why......”
Reviews.Author: Sabre4
Reviews.Content: First off - LOCATION: You couldn't ask for a better location. You're right on La Rambla, steps from Placa de Catalunya and all the shopping, and steps from the Metro. SERVICE: From the minute you arrive, you don't have to worry about a thing. Staff is knowledgeable, helpful, and insightful. You'll even get a welcome pack from the hotel containing maps and booklets of Barcelona. Ask them anything about Barcelona, and you'll get a quick and concise answer. Wake-up calls, and scheduled taxis were precisely on time. CLEANLINESS: Hotel is literally spotless! Gleaming marble everywhere. Housekeeping is wonderful, and they'll even come to your room once again in the late afternoon to refresh your towels and stuff. VALUE: Well, like the saying goes....you get what you pay for. Huge comfortable room, outstanding customer service, and prime prime location! La Rambla can get a little noisy, but there's 2 sets of sliding doors on the balcony - and we didn't hear a peep! NEARBY: And when I say nearby, I mean within 2 blocks walking distance: Metro, prime shopping, Placa de Catalunya, Bus Turistic hop on hop off tour bus, 9 floor department store, #1 cafe in Barcelona - the Cafe Zurich, La Boqueria produce/meat market, and much more. OVERALL: You couldn't ask for a better hotel for your stay in Barcelona. With all the attractions nearby, the shopping around the corner, the metro within 150 or so steps.....it's really a no-brainer. Stay here and you won't regret it. This is the number 1 hotel in Barcelona.....they've earned it, and we couldn't agree more!

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel right on Las Ramblas.”
Reviews.Author: archimedes6
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully furnished boutique hotel in a historic building on Las Ramblas. All the rooms (our group used 3), although slightly differing in layout, have modern furnishings and several novel features - eg. electric beds, automatic electric bidet - plus all the luxury features you would expect to find in a modern 5 star hotel - although this is only 3*, probably because it has no restaurant, swimming pool, business centre, etc. However, there is free internet access available in the foyer. There is also a comfortable lounge area with a bar and a spacious breakfast room which serves a comprehensive, delicious breakfast which is well worth the extra charge. They call it "continental" but there are several hot items as well as a cold table and all the usual juices, cereals, breads, cakes, etc. The staff are absolutely outstanding and nothing is too much trouble. This is a beautiful, conveniently located, hotel which thoroughly deserves its No.1 rating in Barcelona on the Trip Advisor website. Just a comfortable, fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel! They have earned their top rating from Trip Advisor”
Reviews.Author: mickeysgal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo for two nights prior to our cruise. Excellent location, right on La Rambla. Hotel staff very friendly and always helpful. Had asked to have a room overlooking La Rambla and although they couldn't guarantee it, they were able to accomodate my request. Room was very nicely appointed, very clean, very upscale bathroom. Beds were individually adjustable and very comfortable. This hotel not only met but exceeded our expectations. Had free internet access from a computer in the lobby which was very useful. Loved the automatic shades. Very quiet room even though it was on La Rambla. Room size was ample - plenty of space. Would not hesitate in the least to stay there again - in fact, if we return, that is exactly where we're staying. Thank you Hotel Montecarlo. There is a reason this hotel is rated #1 on Trip Advisor - they earned it!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel but do not expect champagne on your birthday as with two previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: UkBlackie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Montecarlo for two nights for my 40th birthday and can not fault the hotel very clean, central and the rooms are of a high standard.Unlike previous reviews we did not recieve a bottle of champagne on my birthday but this could be due to us booking a standard double at a cheaper rate so don't expect it if its your birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis on La Rambla ..”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireLewie
Reviews.Content: We can only reiterate previous reviews. We had a De Luxe room - it was huge! Fabulous big bathroom with large circular jacuzzi for two, and walk in shower for four!! Two sinks, bidet, etc. Little sitting room area with TV and large bedroom also with TV, and comfortable beds. Totally soundproof!! Spotlessly clean - helpful staff - ideal location for everything. Would not hesitate to stay there again - but may have to try the 1898 next time - it has a pool on the roof!

Reviews.Title: “Believe Reviews, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaAl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days before the cruise. Staff is excellent and friendly. Fernando in the morning and Sergio in evening were great. They recommended Ciutat Contal for Tapas and was excellent as well. Rooms was small but comfortable, clean and modern. The breakfast was good and if you are like my wife, who has to have something "normal" to eat when she travels, then 12 euros was worth it. It is perfectly located in La Rambla. North side so just 3 minutes away from Placa Catalunya. Hard Rock Cafe around the corner, not too far from Gothic Quarter and great restaurants and shops. Very close to Turistic Bus. Trust me. Take it. Cheap and perfect way to see city via blue and red line. I highly recommend it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with lovely people!”
Reviews.Author: Christinaki
Reviews.Content: A couple of weeks ago friends and I stayed at the Montecarlo hotel in Barcelona. I had read all the good reviews in Tripadvisor about the hotel, so I did expect it to be a nice one. Montecarlo was even better than I expected! I can only mark with the word EXCELLENT all aspects of this hotel. I am talking about location, rooms, cleanliness, service and friendliness of the people, who work there. My friends had very nice standard rooms and we had a deluxe one, which was more like a suite with a lovely view on the Ramblas with triple glazing and no noise, lovely bathroom with both Jaccuzi and shower and lots of amenities! We loved our room, all the people working at the reception desk were wonderful and knowledgable and I would give one extra star to Fernando, as he was the person, with whom I dealed, before and during our stay. Their recommendations for restaurants were excellent and all in all they did all they could, to give us personal service and attention. There is a computer with free Internet connection for the guests and their breakfast for Euro 12 is excellent. When we were leaving the hotel, the Manager accompanied us with the porter to our taxi and personally see us off and say goodbye! I hope to go back to the Montecarlo for another stay soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Best front desk customer service I have seen..”
Reviews.Author: macgonigal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Monte Carlo last Saturday night and loved it. We picked the Monte Carlo based purely on the strength of the TA reviews and were not disappointed. The location was excellent, only 3 minutes walk from Place de la Catalunya and the airport bus and overlooking the main strip of La Rambla. The rooms were fine, modern, nice bedding and enough storage. But the main point that will stick in our memories was the super friendly and helpful front desk staff. From the moment we arrived they explained the local attractions and bus routes, recommended restaurants, bars and clubs and then showed us up the room. Their English is excellent and all of this was done in a non-pushy way and they did not seem to be openly expecting tips in return. We had access to our room early, from 12:00, and then on the day we checked out left our bags all day and used their bathroom facilities to get changed ahead of the return to the cold english weather. Our room overlooked La Rambla but due to the 2 layers of double glazing there was no noise, despite this being the day that Barcelona retained the league football championship and there being a massive celebration in the street below. The other major selling point was the huge jacuzzi bath which really helped us both 'relax'. Overall an excellent hotel with a top location and excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further - Excellent Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: 2worldtravelers2
Reviews.Content: We are world travelers and I do not know what "travel pants" is griping about. All older hotels require the key to be turned in at the desk. I prefer this method as opposed to the "card key'", as the "card" often becomes demagnitized, causing needless annoyance. This is a great hotel, we have stayed here three times. From the airport, you can take the Aeropuerto Bus and walk about three blocks to the hotel. If you have heavy luggage or rain, take a taxi. It is centrally located on Las Rambla, very convenient for those who have booked a cruise. The rooms are beautifully equipped with electric beds, jacuzzi bathtub, and a leather case for toiletries. We had room, I believe 204, which overlooks Las Rambla, with a small veranda and separate sitting room. The shades are electric and there is no street noise. The staff is exceptional and graciously met with all of our inquiries - ask them for directions to Ciutat Condal for tapas, great and fun place to eat. We also had the Jr. Suite with a steam shower, and library, but for view, I prefer the room overlooking Las Rambla. You can have bkfst in your room or the dining room. The breakfast is typical European with cold cuts, croissants, cereals, etc., which we found very satisfactory, as we ate late at night. By the way, most restaurants do not open until 9pm. Enjoy Monte Carlo Hotel and Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: JoJoGi
Reviews.Content: This stunningly beautiful hotel offered everything we wanted, excellent location, clean and comfortable rooms with an extra touch of luxury. The staff were helpful and friendly, breakfast was served in a small but comfortable dining room and the orange juice was freshly squeezed. I wouldn't look anywhere else for a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DumboG
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three day - had the best time. Great location, staff is as friendly as can be. Rooms are comfortable and pleasant and clean. We had free wi-fi and Jacuzzi in the bath. We had a great experience. We cannot overestimate the great service we received. If we come to Barcelona again we will definitely go back to hotel Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “A truly brilliant hotel, beautiful rooms and the most polite staff!”
Reviews.Author: katy254
Reviews.Content: My partner decided to take me to Barcelona to celebrate my Birthday and we decided to stay at this hotel for two nights because of all of the fantastic reviews....and because all rooms have a jacuzzi! We arrived too early to check in properly but the staff at the reception advised us that we could check in, they would take our bags and we could return anytime after 2 o'clock. We'd been informed beforehand that 2pm was the earliest we could access our room so really just wanted to drop off our luggage. On returning to the hotel later in the afternoon we were handed our key and taken up to our room where our bags were already waiting. A member of staff showed us around our room, how to work the jacuzzi, the adjustable beds and the electric blinds etc. His English was fantastic and he was nothing but polite. The room was lovely and absolutely spotless. We had a balcony which looked onto the ramblas and the glass was soundproof so we didnt get any noise at all despite being on the busiest street in Barcelona! The bed's were brilliant and the jacuzzi had plenty room for two people. The minibar wasnt too expensive and the safe was free of charge to use. The only fault I could possibly make was that we were charged 5 euro to use an iron which was located inside a room containing a shower etc also. 5 euro allowed you 1 hours use of the room. It rained quite heavily on one of our days so the staff provided us with umbrella's to take out with us and when we realised we'd came without a travel adaptor, the staff were on hand to provide us with one free of charge! We had a fantastic stay at this hotel and I would recommend it to anyone planning a visit to Barcelona! It really is brilliant! It's quite expensive in comparison to other but I can assure you that it is well worth paying for!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: mannym99
Reviews.Content: First trip to Barcelona and booked it based on Trip Advisor's ranking. Was not disappointed. This hotel is a modern, first class facility with a good size room and a very modern, clean bathroom. It's in a perfect location in the middle of the Rambla, a couple hundred yards from the Plaza de Catalunya. Despite that it's noisy as hell in that area, the hotel in general and my room in particular were silent. The staff were friendly and helpful. I will say that, while I asked them to advise me on a restaurants, I didn't eat at any of the ones they recommended. They pointed me to 3 specific restaurants in the area, which guide books advised were overpriced and generally lacking in service as they catered to tourists. I just felt like they might be getting kickbacks from those places and since they had free internet, I just went to Trip Advisor and looked up my own restaurants. As usual Trip Advisor was dead on. So I can't tell you if their recommended restaurants were good or not. I can only tell you that TA's were great! No complaints at all about this hotel, overall. Clean, great location (although I cannot emphasize enough--beware of pickpockets on the Rambla), friendly helpful staff. Didn't try the breakfast (about 10-12 euros)...stuck with coffee and croissant at any of a number of cafes in the immediate area. One last point: we arrived on April 23 which is the feast day of St. George, the patron saint of Barcelona. Didn't seem like a problem beforehand, but I came to find that the Rambla is closed to traffic that day and the place is flooded with people celebrating the day. That meant the taxi had to drop us at Plaza de Catalunya and we were forced to walk with luggage about 100-200 yards to the hotel. Taxi to the airport runs about 25 euros.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTLY LOCATED AND VERY COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: rosemarymartin
Reviews.Content: The hotel was right on the Ramblas and only 2 mins from main aerobus stop. All the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Cannot fault it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Trig_and_Yuko
Reviews.Content: Our stay in room #310 was amazing! The quality of the room we got for the price we paid was way more than we expected. The staff went absolutely out of their way to be helpful, especially Ferran and Sergio. Yes, the hotel is right in the middle of La Rambla, but our balcony above the street had double sliding glass doors. I didn't hear a thing from outside with both doors closed, and I am a light sleeper. It was very interesting in the mornings to stand out on the balcony and watch the street performers setting up below, and then at night to watch the great mix of people passing along La Rambla beneath us. The bed was extremely comfortable, the jacuzzi tub was luxurious and the location is actually fairly convenient for getting around town. My wife and I both highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: simonrose
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as it was No1 on trip advisor, wasn't disappointed. Right on La Rambla in the heart of Barcelona and was so easy to get to using the airport bus. I have travelled all over the world on business and this is one of nicest hotels I have stayed at. We had a junior suite and it was massive, two bathrooms, living room, juccuzzi for two, electric beds, lovely decor, fantastic. The staff on reception were great, breakfast was good value also. We booked this hotel directly months in advance but i noticed a few days before that the price had dramatically reduced and for a superior room, so cancelled the orginal booking and re-booked at a cheaper price. Two great restaurant recommendations - Les Quinze Nits on Placa Reial of la rambla and Le Fonda also off las rambla, great food. One word of warning - bag snatchers - we were unfortunate to witness this so watch you valuables, especially in the gothic area

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in the heart of Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: indytraveler0308
Reviews.Content: Even though the weather in Barcelona was a little disappointing, our stay at the Montecarlo was fabulous! Staff were available and at the desk 24-7, fluent in various languages, and very accomodating! They answered our questions and provided suggestions when asked. The rooms were modern, neat and clean, with housekeeping doing an excellent job as well. I would highly recommend this to anyone that decides to visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: KotArina
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with my wife for here birthday for 4 nights end of March. Hotel Montecarlo on Las Ramblas absolutely deserves to be #1 on tripadvisor for Barcelona. It is perfectly located in the middle of Las Ramblas, few minutes away from the market, lots of great restaurants and coffeshops around, minutes away from the metro. The room #413 we stayed in was on 4th floor and overlooked Las Ramblas - it was very nice to walk outside on small balcony and enjoy the crowds down below. Yes, their windows are soundproof (3 layers etc) so when close you virtually don't hear anything from the outside. We loved the barhroom - it was like a small spa in your hotel room; quite large jacuzzi for two, rainshower and all that. Their breakfast is great - nice selection of hot stuff (eggs, bacon and things), bread and rolls, good coffee and fresh orange juice. Definately worth the value (was 12 Euro at the time). Their staff is very welcoming and helpful; no glitches on anything. I agree with some reviewers that this hotel is 5star place for 4star money. Oh! And another thing! Do use stairs - on 2nd floor you will be surprised to find old great-looking antique hall with wooden ceiling and floor, paintings and furnishings and all - like it is hall in some palace! We thought with my wife how great it would be to have a wedding there of some birthday barty. Definately recommend it. Konstantin and Arina from Moscow.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: txrob89
Reviews.Content: The best in the heart of the city. The rooms were incredible; roomy and relaxing. I'll stay again. the only thing more I'd like is a gym.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: andilad
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay here this week, and it was great. Very easy to get to... from the airport the bus stops in the square at the north of La Rambla and the hotel is a short walk down the street. The staff were friendly and happy to excuse my lack of Spanish... the room and hotel is very opulent... slightly more luxurious than I am comfortable with, I even felt a little under-dressed in my jeans :-) The room was very contemporary with all modern gadgets, jacuzzi very nice... free safe, and helpful bus boy. The hotel is ideally located for walking to the marina and the Gothic quarter.. near the cathedral and Picasso & Gaudi museums. No problems with smells, like one recent visitor, although coming from the UK with our no-smoking rules it is quite easy to notice that smokers have been in the room before. I am super sensitive to it, and wasn't too upset by it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, obliging staff, great room overlooking La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_1947
Reviews.Content: The ambiance in the hotel is very calm and the staff strike that perfect balance (for me) of being pleasant, helpful, happy and knowledgeable. The location is right on a wide, mainly pedestrian boulevard and there are many many restaurants within a 5 minute walk. We had a superior room with a petite balcony and a small ante room. The bathroom was large with twin basins, large spa bath, multiple nozzle shower and superior fittings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Friendly Staff Loved It”
Reviews.Author: leoSunnyDorset
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a long week-end at the end of February. Chose the hotel from other reviews and were not disappointed. No smells as experienced by a previous reviewer. the room was lovely, bathroom larger than normal in European hotels. Requested a quiet room and that was exactly what we got. No noise whatsoever from within the hotel or outside. Staff were very friendly and helpful. It was my husband's birthday (although we didn't tell the hotel this) but on the day just before we were going out to dinner a bottle of bubbly and chocolates were delivered to our room as they had picked up on the date from my husband's passport. Nice touch. thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “You cant get a better location”
Reviews.Author: Towzer
Reviews.Content: The last reviewer was unlucky as my girlfriend and I stayed there from the 20th to the 24th of february and found it to be lovely and clean with no smells of any sort. Our only problem with the heating was that it got very warm when the AC was off. The location is ideal as it is a short walk to the main areas of interest and if you want to go further there is a Taxi rank round the corner if you cant get one outside. No frills but it is a nice place and the staff are extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, simply one of the best...”
Reviews.Author: matt_from_nottingham
Reviews.Content: This is simply one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in, right on Las Ramblas in the centre of Barcelona. The staff spoke perfect English, better than some of the people we shared the plane with on the way over. We paid a little extra for one of the superior rooms and we were not disappointed, more like a suit there was a separate living room, two TVs, fridge, large walk in shower with massage jets, large jacuzzi and a huge bedroom. Beds were fully automatic and complementary chocolates left on the first night. We didn't eat in the hotel, instead choosing to get breakfast in one of the main cafes close by.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Ramblas, brilliant rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Something-Different!
Reviews.Content: The Montecarlo hotel, from the outside, looks very traditional with a large marble lobby and impressive windows and so we were expecting a bit of a traditional style inside. How wrong we were! the lobby area inside is quite small and very contempory - all dark wood and polished glass. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and directed us to our second floor room at the back of the hotel. The rooms were absolutely fantastic. The bed was made up as a double but was actually two singles set together. this was not a problem as they were moveable - you pressed a button and the head or feet of the bed went up or down to get into the best possible position for you. the floor was laminated wood and very clean and the best bit was the blinds on the windows. It was a full shutter that was elecronically operated and stopped all daylight getting in - fantastic first thing in the morning! Would definately recommend a room at the back of the hotel as the front rooms can get a but noisy at night. the bathroom had a large corner jacuzzi bath, bidet, wc and his and her's sinks. All very clean and comfortable. There is a small bar to the rear of the hotel with a small space outside in a sort of walled courtyard. They have tried to get a bit of atmosphere here by putting in a large pond and running water, which was pretty nice and hid the noise of the city. All in all a very nice hotel, well situated half way up the main street. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: socaltxplant
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. We had a balcony with a great view, but there was THREE layers of glass with the windows so we did not hear anything on the street. The staff is extremely nice and helpful. The room was recently remodeled with high quality materials and high quality work.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joderbyshire
Reviews.Content: My partner left the booking all to me knowing how it takes a lot to impress! I checked on trip advisor to see which hotel came 1st and this one did. After reading the reviews and checking location etc I decided we'd give it a try. The reviews were correct in every way. we had room 301 which over looks La Rambla with a lovely balcony. Although the street is very noisy there is sound proofing and also black out curtains so sleeping was not a problem. The beds had remote control so you lift the head or legs if you wanted to read or watch TV. Our bed was turned down every evening on our return with a very nice chocolate on the pillow.There is a safe in the room which unlike a lot of hotels these days is free! We had a whirlpool bath with rain shower in the bathroom and toiletries which were replaced daily. Breakfast is extra and although you can go a few doors down for cheaper option it is very good. Freshly squeezed orange juice (not that carton rubbish). As much coffee as you can drink and all the usual things to eat, cereal cooked items, toast and pastries. The staff at reception/breakfast were excellent and very very helpful in every way and always willing to help from booking restaurants to checking your well being and comfort in the room. I would certainly return and recommend to anybody young and old.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you TripAdvisor`s once again,”
Reviews.Author: 20tash07
Reviews.Content: This hotel more than lived up to the great reviews all you good people told us about.We can not compare against others on the list as this was our 1st Barcelona trip, we loved the location,room 501 ( a standard room) overlooks the La Rambla.Everything was clean and the staff we meet were very helpfull and made us very welcome.We did not eat in the hotel so can not comment we used the cafe next door for breakfast and if you turn left out of the hotel, cross the road walk for a short distance you find a fantastic market we bought fresh fruit, nuts etc.The airport bus saved us lots of euros no need for taxis. We were celebrating a special birthday it was important that everything went well the selection of this hotel more than ensured that we had a memorable vist. We hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did.Finally, 2 tips,buy a 2 day pass if you are using the tourist bus it`s a great way to see the city you can do the red and blue route over the 2 days, plus when paying to get into Sagrada Familia pay the little extra to get into Parc Guell it gets you into Gaudi `s house.Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nick0007
Reviews.Content: excellent location ,room we stayed in 304 very nice could nt fault it.Dont bother with breakfast option,12 euros as there are loads of cafes nearby,in fact one next door.Moka.The staff on front desk are very nice and friendly,nothing is too much trouble.Other advice I would give would be to use the Aerobus not a taxi between the aiport and city centre.Cost 4.25 euros on bus or 32 euros in taxi.The bus es stop and depart from Plaza Catalunya,outside El Corte Inglais dept store,which is a 5 min walk from hotel.There is a massive selection of places to eat in this city,my favs were the Basque Tapas bars.Here its self service,the Tapas are works of art ,things like stuffed peppers,salmon ontop of small breads,tuna etc.Each cost about 1.6 euros.Try Bilbao Berri,Bar Irrarti,or Taktika Berri...save the sticks,they count them up and charge you accordingly.I would go out of my way to find the three bars I have mentioned.However for visitors from uk,due to exchange rate Barcelona is an expensive city to visit.I thought it would be cheaper to eat at Tapas bars on Boquira Market...they cook them to order average price £10 for a plate of mushrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Really good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: wotabigone
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a weekend in Barcelona after my girlfriend's birthday. Thought I'd push the boat out a bit and stay in what for me was a fairly expensive hotel. Like all say, it's in a great location and the staff were incredibly friendly & helpful & spoke impeccable English. The room was very clean and spacious & the beds were very comfortable & just great because I usually thrash about a bit in my sleep & as the bed is in two halves (joined) I didn't disturb my girlfriend & we both woke up refreshed - unusual for a hotel stay. On the whole it wasn't too noisy but there was a little intrusion from car horns (front bedroom) & the nearby clock chimes hourly through the night. The jacuzzi bath was a real treat and runs for 10 mins then has to have a 20 min rest & the massage shower was fun. Breakfast was pretty good with meats / fruit / cereal / pastries / bread or toast with preserves / fresh coffee (they really can't make a cup of tea) and fresh orange & the dining area was spacious. The Pound was very poor against the Euro at almost 1:1 and at 12 Euros therefore, breakfast was a little pricey for what it was (but that's not a complaint for I knew the price & chose to have it). The only thing lacking was a pool & no tea / coffee making or kettle in the room (you could have coffee via room service til 11pm) but there is a Starbuck's coffee place across the Road). To get to hotel, take the Aerobus from the Terminal B of the airport (4 Euros) & ask for Placa Catalunia - which is the terminus - it stops several times prior to this. It's obvious when to get off. Just walk back a short way and Las Ramblas is the centrally paved road with droves of people walking along. The hotel is only a one or 2 minute walk along from Catalunia and is on the left hand side. The open top bus tour is good and takes you to all the places you'd like to visit - hopping on and off for a one off price of 21 Euros each / per day ( + entry prices). Hope you enjoy it as much as we did !

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferHongKong
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great.... It's right on La Rambla so extremely easy to go anywhere. The service is amazing - every staff is super nice and truly helpful. My husband and I stayed there for 4 nights during X'mas with lots of requests/questions and never felt that we're not getting great service for once! I stayed in many 5-star hotels for business before, but the service level at Montecarlo still impressed me a lot. Special thanks to Sergio!

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: fanofbarcelona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Montecarlo on the basis of its ranking on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The hotel turned out to be far more attractive then it appeared on the photos and it was bliss right from the moment that the doorman/security guy nods his discreet welcome. We were given a room overlooking the Ramblas with our own private balcony. It turned out to be incredibly quiet because of the thoughtfully installed double doors. The bathroom was luxury itself, with an enormous jacuzzi (read small swimming pool), bathrobes, slippers and all the modcons you could wish for. The beds were great for resting after a long day because they could be raised to a seating position or to drain your legs. The staff were incredibly polite and friendly. Quique in particular gave us excellent restaurant recommendations and was very welcoming with a wicked sense of humour. The hotel is perfectly located on the Ramblas (we could people watch from our balcony), close to the Plaza de Catalunya and great for nightlife in the Barri Gotic. Barcelona is culture, culture, culture bursting with museums and incredible gothic, modernista and contemporary architecture. Don't miss the MNAC (museum of Catalunyian art) and its wonderful restaurant with a view called Oleum. The hop-on buses are an excellent way to get to all the top cultural sites. It is worth booking a ticket for two days rather than one. Thank you to all the past reviewers of this hotel for pointing us in the direction of the best hotel possible! It really made our holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Fabulous Hotel Montecarlo In Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: GOLDILOCKS13
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful stay in probably one of the best locations in Barcelona - The Reception and Concierge Ladies and Gentlemen are probably some of the finest professionals we have ever encountered - nothing at all was any trouble throughout our stay - We will most definitely stay with you again - PS Our Christmas shopping was a total success !! Thank you for everything

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great lcoation.....”
Reviews.Author: DR40
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right on The Rambla, perfect central location. The room was spacious and very clean and the bathrooms were huge, fully tiled with a jacuzzi bath and shower. The staff were very friendly and gave some good tips on where to eat. Our friends liked it so much they booked up again for January Barcelona is a great city with so much to see, the hop on hop off buses were great and good value for money. Overall a lovely weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “kindness and availability”
Reviews.Author: vdelisi
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip with our baby (1 year), and the people of the hotel was so kindness with us and with our baby, helping us for everything we needed. The hotel is excellent, the rooms are comnfortables, big and very clean. It is very central, close to the subway and the main place....

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great”
Reviews.Author: goodtool
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here the day before & a day after a cruise that left from Barcelona. The location is great, a 5 minute walk from the airport bus(4 eros) & in the heart of the action on La Rambla. The rooms were modern & clean with nice baths, the workers were very helpful especially Rodger. Also the hotel is very honest, I fogot $200 in the room safe & they wired me the money to Chicago via Western Union the day after I called.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: watercolors08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 3 nights prior to boarding a cruise ship on November 16. We found the service to be excellent- front desk staff very helpful in pointing out the best way to tour Barcelona. The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. We had a sitting room as well as a balcony overlooking Las Rambla. Because of the double doors on the balcony, the room was quiet. The buffet breakfast contained a lot of food but not all to our tastes. It was convenient, as we found no other full breakfast restaurants in the area. The free use of the computer in the hotel lobby was a nice surprise. We would definitely book at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “haven of peace”
Reviews.Author: flying_rugs
Reviews.Content: Having spent 4 nights here, we can only agree with other reviewers on tripadvisor. We asked for a quiet room and were given a room at the back from which nothing else could be heard. The standards of accommodation and service were high and the location perfect. Thanks to the reviewer who pointed us to Moka (2 doors down) for breakfast. It served a croissant and the best coffee in Barcelona for just over €2. We would also recommend the restaurant Santa Anna, just round the corner, for excellent meals and tapas which were very reasonably priced. We would go back to Barcelona and would return to Hotel Montecarlo without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lneary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really central. It is a short walk from all shops, buses to airport, there is 3 metro stations on the street also. The staff especially Queque and Sara were very helpful with directions, recommendations for restaurant, they could not be more helpful. We spent three nights here and didnt see any other guests but the hotel was 80% full. Our room was very quiet and as there was an electric shutter on window it blocked all daylight so when we got in late we slept on as the room was so dark. I would recommend this hotel to anyone because of its location and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Montecarlo Hotel in Barcelona: The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: townvilla
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 glorious days in Barcelona staying at the well situated Montecarlo Hotel on La Rambla. We loved being able to walk to all major historic and cultural sites. The concierge service provided by the friendly front desk staff is the best we've seen in Europe. Our spacious room overlooked a quiet courtyard. Tapas bars and quality restaurants are close-by and of course there is the famous pedestrian boulevard La Rambla. Within 2 blocks there is the large and wondrous La Bouqueria marketplace for all sorts of well displayed and reasonably priced fresh produce. Visit Gaudi's work in progress the Familia Sagrada;it's a must. Enjoy Montecarlo Hotel and Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't break the bank!”
Reviews.Author: Degas
Reviews.Content: As ever chose off Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. the location is ace - right on the Ramblas - letting you walk to nearly everything. We had a 'junior suite' at the back on the first floor - great size with a lobby leading to the bathroom and bedroom and then a lounge off the bedroom. Decor was good - beautiful teak floors and furniture and an electrically adjustable bed ! The 'toys' in the room are good as well - we had a jacuzzi bath and a separate steam bath cabinet - flat screen TVs in both bedroom and lounge - and probably best of all free and efficient wireless internet. Didn't ever make it to breakfast in the hotel - millions of coffee shops around for that - have never stayed in a hotel so well located for access to bars and restaurants - dozens within a few hundred feet. Staff were efficient and friendly. It was pretty chilly when we were in Barcelona - so we didn't make any use of the rooms private terrace - my one criticism would be that it would be pretty dark and not much fun to sit on in the summer with absolutely no view that I could see.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence, but at a price”
Reviews.Author: Robert07
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel excellent in almost every respect. Location could not be bettered, front desk service was good and our superior room was lovely with a Ramblas view. We did though find the hotel a bit soulless as we rarely saw another guest (as we didn't bother with breakfast) and the bar/lounge was deserted throughout our stay. We paid over €200 for our superior room and breakfast would have been €11 each extra had we taken it. For a low season weekend we felt this expensive for UK visitors given recent currency movements although cost and value will always be subjective. Perhaps another time we would stick with a standard room and forgo the view and the sitting area of the superior rooms. Nevertheless highly recommended if price is not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: txhawki
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Quiet. Large and clean rooms. Front desk staff was excellent. Nice private bar to relax. Walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lordys
Reviews.Content: Once again stayed in a hotel based on tripadvisor, and yet again have not been let down. This hotel is in a great location for all the tourist sites in Barcelona, the staff are very helpful from when you first enter the hotel, to when you leave. We had a standard room for four nights, and it was just what we needed, I understand that there are better rooms, but this was above what you normally get in this price range. There was plenty of space, the bathroom was large and the beds large and comfy, Ok you dont get a view of the ramblas, but when its cold and wet, we wouldnt have used a balcony anyway. All in all a great hotel, and will be stopping again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pixiecaroline
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo in October 2008 whilst on a weekend break with my mum to Barcelona. Chose this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor, and I am so glad I did. It was superb. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff were so friendly, but not invasive. The room was large and very well equipped. The building itself stands out on La Rambla as a site to see in itself, and looks wonderful lit up in the evenings. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A sensational hotel in the middle of everywhere”
Reviews.Author: benelong
Reviews.Content: The Montecarlo is a great hotel. Located right on the Rambla and in the middle of everything. A very quiet room, but perfectly equipped (even an automatic bed that adjusts to your reading comfort if you are into that type of thing). Staff very professional, very courteous and very helpful. We didn't pre-book breakfast as we did intend to discover other venues for breakfast but after using the hotel for our first breakfast we just didn't look elsewhere - it was so good - and again the staff so very helpful. (Freshly squeesed orange juice was a very pleasant surprise) For any friends that visit Barcelona we will certainly be highly the Montecarlo as the ONLY place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: ENBB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo in Barcelona for eight days while on vacation in Spain, October 4- 12, 2008. (We also took a couple of side trips to Sitges and to Monteserrat, which I would recommend doing.) We were very pleased with the hotel. Rather than outline everything that we liked about our stay at the Hotel Montecarlo (and there was a lot to like), I suggest that you read the many other positive TripAdviser reviews of this hotel, as they are right on the mark. One item I would like to note is that the hotel staff seemed to go out of their way for us during our stay. For example, one day we got caught in some rain showers without an umbrella while sightseeing and arrived back at the hotel a little wet from the rain. The front desk staff must have noticed because we were back in our room for less than two minutes before there was a knock on our door: it was a hotel staffer who had a couple of towels so that we could dry ourselves off. This made my wife remark to me “Do you think they know that you write reviews to post on TripAdviser?” All in all, we had an absolutely wonderful time in Barcelona and part of the reason for this was the accommodations we had at the Hotel Montecarlo. I highly suggest that you book a larger room with a balcony facing La Rambla. We had room #310 and we loved it! Pricey, but well worth it in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Montecarlo..”
Reviews.Author: bettyboop81
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at the montercarlo for 5 nights and had a fantastic holiday. The hotel is beautiful, rooms large, beds comfy and electronic!! but the bathroom was the highlight for me....a huge shower and jacuzzi....perfect for soaking in after a long days sightseeing. Staff are very friendly and always willing to help.We didnt have breakfast so i cant comment on it but there are plenty of cafes nearby. A wonderful city to visit and with the hotel right on la rambla you have easy access to everything. We will be staying in this hotel on our next visit to barcelona for sure

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Suz00
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor does it again! We selected the Montecarlo based on the reviews here and once again, we were not disappointed. The hotel is located in the middle of everything, right on La Rambla, steps from the metro, bus stops, the port and museums. The airport bus picks up and drops off in the plaza - a 10 minute walk. We had a nice room with a balcony facing La Rambla on the 3rd floor. We would sit out on the balcony each night with wine watching all the action on La Rambla. Street noise was not a problem. Our room was a nice size for European standards. It was very clean and had a huge jacuzzi. The service was excellent. Sergio gave us recommendations on where to eat and have a drink. He also made dinner reservations for us. All of the staff members were friendly and helpful. There is free internet access in the lobby which I used daily. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as there are many places close by for less. We paid 187 Euro per night and I think we got a good value for the price. I would definately stay at the Montecarlo again. Thanks Tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Absoultely Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: BettinaTauro
Reviews.Content: Great location, on the ramblas, absolutely in the middle of everything. Not the kind of place if you like peace and quiet, but we loved it. It was our first trip to Barcelona and what a fantastic introduction to it. The best thing is you walk out of the hotel on to the ramblas and can spend the evening on the ramblas if you are not up to exploring the night life in the rest of the city. We spend most of our evenings here and were never bored. About 30 mins walk to the beach or you can take the metro, which we did, but still had to walk about 20 mins. So on our way back we walked, which was quicker and very pleasant. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast @ 11Euros is well worth it. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Terrific Service”
Reviews.Author: jokero
Reviews.Content: We booked the Montecarlo after reading all the fabulous reviews on tripadvisor and stayed for 3 nights in Aug. Given all we had read, it is fair to say we had pretty high expectations (and we paid 207 euros a night). Overall I would say it lived up to most of these, but having spent 3 weeks travelling around Spain (and staying in many hotels) I'm not sure it deserves the incredibly high praise it seems to get from most (given it is not cheap). There is no doubt, the location is very handy, although we found La Rambla to be very touristy (and a bit tacky). You can walk to many sights and the metro and bus stops are closeby. The hotel staff were excellent. They were all very friendly and incredibly helpful. We got some recommendations from the hotel manager on the day we left (as we were driving north into the Pyrenees) that was fabulous. He went out of his way to assist and even called a hotel and did some searching on the internet for us. The room was very comfortable and quiet. A minor point, our high tech beds squeaked a bit when we rolled over. The internet access in the room was a little expensive but there is a free computer in the lobby. Breakfast was reasonably priced and tasty. Overall, this is still a good choice, but I'm not entirely sure you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaG
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved this hotel. The location is fabulous as it is located right on Las Ramblas. You can walk to most sights. I had a standard room and it was quite large as was the bathroom. My cousin had a junior suite that was gorgeous. (The pictures on their web site does not do it justice.) Also, the adjustable beds were a nice touch as were the toiletries in the bathroom. The staff was quite friendly and gave great recommendations for restaurants and travelling to various sights. I would defintely stay here again. Can't imagine there's a nicer place to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience with managment left a bad taste”
Reviews.Author: motherto3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights prior to a Mediterranean Cruise. I would have given this an Excellent rating except for management. I'll start with our overall experience. The room was very clean overlooking the interior of the building. It was quite lovely. We did upgrade to a superior room which offered a small area with a king size adjustable bed and a small area with a sofa, chair and television. There were only a couple chanels available in English but little time was utilized watching television. The bathroom was large with a tub and separate shower area. Breakfast for 11 euro offered an ample supply of food and feel it was well worth the money. There was internet service in the lobby which I utilized often to keep in touch with home. The hotel was located on La Rambla within easy access to everything. Now for the negative....We had an overnight flight the states. We had been in contact with the hotel prior to our arrival and asked for early check in. We were told that they could not promise but would try to accommodate us. We arrived around 1:30 and requested to check in as soon as possible. The gentlemen at the desk seemed willing to make this accomodation however when they went to management to inquire we were told no...check in was not till 3pm. Not a big deal as we ended up getting something to eat. By the time we were back at 3pm...we had our room and our luggage had already been delivered. The day of our depature we had checked the television to see if our bill was on what we thought was customer services. To our surprise we were told we had accessed the internet for a 30 euro charge for the day of departure. Where this might have been our error we did not utiilize the service. (I'm not totally convinced that this was indeed an error we made) When I started to speak up and argue the point my husband was quickly told that this was not America and he should keep his wife in line. They would not reimbuse us for the 30 euro charge. I believe this was just poor customer service. Unfortunately given this experience I would not stay here again or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: seavers
Reviews.Content: my wife and i booked three nights at this classy hotel with all mod-cons. I can see why it is no.1 with Trip Adviser. It is not cheap but you certainly get what you pay for. Staff are very friendly and will go the extra mile on service. We had a Superier room and it was worth it for the bathroom alone. I would not stay anywhere else in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, but expensive...”
Reviews.Author: PennClaret
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights at the Montecarlo. I chose this hotel because of all the rave reviews on Tripadvisor. It is indeed the perfect location; right on the Ramblas and only 5 minutes walk from the airport bus (4 euros) at Placa Cataluña. The recently modernised room had a flat screen TV and internet access, perfect for the business traveller. I thought the room was ok apart from some small inconveniences (the safe was not working, there was no bottle opener, the sink became blocked). However, my wife absolutely hated it. We arrived in the dark, so it was not a nice surprise to find in the morning that the view from the window was the wall of an adjoining property. This meant there was little natural light in the room. This compounded the problem that there was no dressing table / chair / mirror facility for doing makeup etc.. The staff were very helpful and overall the hotel is great, but it is very expensive, not good value certainly for the room we had. I would recommend it, but make sure you check out the view & facilities in the room you are going to have before confirming.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Hesitate to Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: LaLexi
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time at this hotel and I would definitely stay here again! The location is excellent - right on Las Ramblas - we walked almost everywhere from here (Gaudi's Casa Batllo, La Boqueria, the harbor, the Barri Gothic, and lots of restaurants and shops). La Sagrada Familia and Park Guell were easily accessible by metro and there is a metro stop less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Just a warning though, Park Guell is a bit of a hike from the nearest metro stops. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly. We were especially impressed by Roger and Kique. Our room was excellent - the bathroom was huge and we had a balcony overlooking Las Ramblas. Even though there were lots of people outside until late at night, we never heard them through the balcony's double doors. The bed was very comfortable - they have remotes so that you can adjust them how you like. We also appreciated the free internet at the hotel and the personalized greeting on the TV in our room. I'd definitely recommend staying here - you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “MonteCarlo or Bust!!”
Reviews.Author: Tazmaniac
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this superb hotel after a 3 day break in Barcelona. I stayed here on the back of reading the reviews and was blown away. Like a previous reviewer, we had the priviledge of staying in 402 with it's electrically controlled beds, useful lounge area, a bathroom larger than some rooms I have stayed in and it's birds-eye view of La Ramblas. On closing the balcony doors, the only noise we heard from the streets below was from a police car driving up the road in the late evening. Even the aircon was quiet (something I rarely find in a hotel room). The staff could not have been more helpful. There was someone waiting at the door to take our luggage, the receptionist gave us a pile of tourist literature to browse through when we checked in and on our last day our luggage was securely looked after following our noon checkout. I will be staying here again on my next trip to Barcelona and have already recommended it to loads of people. TIP: if arriving at Barcelona airport, catch the A1 bus just outside terminal B - cost 4 euro per person instaed of the 40 euro for a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalcNRhona
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the excellent reviews already on this site. We were not disappointed at all. In fact our expectations were exceeded. It was our honeymoon, so we booked a deluxe room (402) which had its own small balcony and overlooked La Rambla - so right in the middle of all the action. However, two sets of double glazing meant that we didn't hear a peep from all the noise and bustle. The beds were independent adjustable singles which are pushed together (this is the same in all the rooms) and were incredibly comfortable. We can't praise the staff highly enough. They were so courteous and helpful, with restaurant recommendations and when they found out it was our honeymoon a bottle of cava, a red rose and some chocolates were placed in our room for us when we came back in after a hard day being tourists. The buffet breakfast was also very good with a varied selection and serving up til a civilised 11am! We wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Full Monte!”
Reviews.Author: CRAIG78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Montecarlo for 1 night in August 2008 and had a fantastic experience. The hotel is located right on La Rambla with countless restaurants, bars and take-aways nearby. Catalunya Place and the fantastic harbour area are also just 5mins walk away and if your feeling a little more adventurous there is an underground stop a stones throw away from the hotel doors with links all over the city. Room and hotel facilites and fantastic, especially the spa bath moveble beds! Hotel staff are helpful and friendly. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to those looking for a special experience while visiting the city or a fantasic central location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: Condo1000
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in an amazing location, right on La Rambla. My initial concern was regarding noise levels from the street below (as some people in Barcelona never seem to go to sleep) but there were two double-glazed sliding doors onto the balcony which completely eliminated all noise (Room 301 - classed as a Standard Room ). The air con was perfect for a mid-afternoon snooze when the temperature outside was near 35 degrees C, and the balcony was a nice spot when relaxing in the evening or at night. The staff were completely professional and helpful at all times. The room and the hotel in general was spotless, with the room sometimes cleaned twice a day. The jacuzzi bath also provided a great way of easing the tired leg muscles after a days hard walking. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. It will be top of my list if (and hopefully when) we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at this hotel and didnt disapoint”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: After staying in this hotel in 2007 we revisited it again in 2008 and it did not disappoint. Centrally located on La Ramblas and it was great to see on the front desk Kiki who looked after us in 2007. Whilst this time we were not upgraded we had a lovely room overlooking La Rambla, one of the highlights when we were there was when Spain won the World Cup and it was great to open the balcony and go outside and look down at the celebrations in the street, slightly noisy but it was a very special night. Again the freshly squeezed orange juice for breakfast was as remembered, still free internet and a lovely reasonably priced breakfast. Would stay here again. If you are seeking a nice restaurant for dinner can highly recommned The Attic a couple of doors down from the hotel, very very good food and great service, try and get a window table that overlooks La Rambla or sit up on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: mrtravelNWEngland
Reviews.Content: Hotel is as good as people say. Recently stayed there for 12 nights and the room was much better than other hotels I have stayed at in Barcelona but which cost more. Room had large bathroom, was quiet from external noise, comfortable bed, decent TV and music system plus the staff were excellent. Location is also excellent. Minor quibble is that I was asked to pay for the first week on arrival at the hotel before even seeing the room. Maybe if people are staying for a long period of time and a part payment is required then they should be allowed a day or two before making this payment.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: sg60611
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Spain for 3 nights at this modern 5 star hotel. It is in the center of all of the activity and restaurants. Our room was modern and clean. One of our elderly companions left his passport in the last city we stayed in and the hotel helped us have it courriered to them, re-arranged flights and reassured us that they would help him get to the airport safely since we had to leave. The staff was very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneMichelle
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel Montecarlo is. It has tons of old world charm, but is also very chic with all the modern amenities. Absolutely perfect location, right on La Rambla and two blocks from Catalyuna Square. Staff and service were excellent. Our room (deluxe double) was delightful, quiet, extremely large with all mod cons. We would not dream of staying at any other hotel when re-visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: SueMHinckley_LeicsUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews and certainly weren't disappointed. It is in a fab location, halfway down La Ramblas but is a calm oasis of marble in the middle of the bustle of LR and close to the Gothis Quarter. Lovely, minimalist rooms - and the beds are SO comfortable with very good quality linens and comfy matresses. Our room - 404, had beds which elevated the top and bottom of the beds as required, perfect for my aching feet after a day's walking. Barcelona is a gem of a place to visit - the Sagrada Familia and Park Guell are just stunning. Restaurant suggestion - Alter Ego, just around the corner in Carrer Comtal, gorgeous food/reasonable prices and a lovely atmosphere. Don't be put off by the workings on the building next door.

Reviews.Title: “The fabulous Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: NeuSci
Reviews.Content: Like just about everyone else, we booked the Monte Carlo based upon reviews from here. We were most certainly not disappointed. On our honeymoon, we decided to spend the longest time in Barcelona. The Monte Carlo was phenomenal. The location was absolutely perfect, with a metro line, a tour bus stop, and a major department store that has everything from hardware to underwear within easy walking distance. The hotel is also right on La Rambla and you can walk down to the beach. This is a little farther, but still not a mission. As to the room, we were also very pleased. They upgraded us for our honeymoon and the room was great. The beds were comfortable, the jacuzzi tub was a welcome treat after the tiny, cramped shower we had in Paris, and we had a great view. Finally, they had automatic shutters that were controlled from the bedside! How cool is that? The staff was great. I wish I could remember the names of everyone, but as each person we came across from the housekeeping to the management was very nice and accommodating, I won't try to single anyone out. All in all, it was a great place and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “HIgh end but worth every cent”
Reviews.Author: possiblyaprincess
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel -- location, staff, room(s). Clean, spacious, cool, quiet and all of this on La Rambla. Do yourself a favour. PP

Reviews.Title: “Trust the Reviews for this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Orville_2
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo for two nights at the end of June. It is as good as other reviewers have stated (thank you). We were coming off a cruise so we would arrive at the hotel early in the day so I had emailed the hotel ahead of time to confirm they would have a luggage lock-up we could use (they had replied that they did). However, upon our arrival at about 10:00 am, presumably knowing we were arriving early, they informed us that they had our room ready. Impressive service! We got an updated room which was a little plain (art-deco-ish style) compared with many hotels we've stayed at, but very tastefully done. The bathroom was excellent, which is something that you don't always see in Europe. We had no problem with the dual beds making up the king-size bed that other reviewers have mentioned. The staff were great, explaining the various features of the room like the electric blinds, air conditioning and beds and they handed us some useful tourist books without our even asking. The room was clean, quiet and well maintained. What more could you ask for? We had the 11 Euro breakfast one morning, which was ok but about the only thing I would not rate as "exceptional". This was our first visit to Barcelona and I was amazed at how good a location this hotel has. Besides being on La Ramblas, it is also near Placa Catalunya which is a transportation hub, if not the hub of the city. The Metro, buses, airport bus and city tour buses are just a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. When we sadly left, we took the airport bus from there which only costs 4 Euros and 5 cents each. Overall, this hotel deserves its high rating.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with everyone else. Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hamhem
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Excellent hotel and staff. Only one minor complaint-Slippery fiberglass Jacuzzi tub in Room 209.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Location and service”
Reviews.Author: JackieManchester
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fantastic location. First visit to Barcelona - we would definately go back, and would cetainly stay in the same Hotel again. The staff are all so friendly and couldn't do enough to help. Our room was great - and vey quiet, breakfast was lovely. We would recommend using the barcelona tour bus to get a good overview of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing much to say”
Reviews.Author: Trksh
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the honeymoon after reading all the reviews one by one and I would like to thank all the reviewers as they are right on every detail. It is at a perfect location. Our room was facing to La Rambla and there was no noise at all. The only bad thing I can say is the room that we stayed (room number 413) was not a refurbished one so the carpet on the floor was quite old and worned off. Besides that everything was great. The staff was great. Everytime they saw going back to room or going out they were asking if we need anything or things like that. So I give a 10 to the hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “I will go back to this hotel for all future Barcelona trips”
Reviews.Author: Lutecia
Reviews.Content: I agree to all other good reviews on this hotel. It is excellent. I normally avoid going back to the same hotel so I could try new places, however, this is one of a few places I would actually go back as my regular hotel in this city. The rooms are stylished decorated, yet very functional. Housekeeping standard is very high. The location is simply fantastically convenient to go anywhere. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Only two negatives, if I am to raise: 1. As one of of the previous reviewers commented, King sized bed is actually made of two single beds, which obviously is not ideal. 2. This is probabaly only summer time but just in case some travellers may not like it - The hotel shares its courtyard area with the next door hotel which has a open air restaurant/cafe there. From about 21:00, they have open air cinema, which is quite loud and if your room faces this side (which itself is a good thing as it is quieter than facing La Rambla) you will hear it even with your window closed. It finishes around 23:00 so, if you are out for dinner for these hours, it should not cause you a headache. Also, if you leave your window open overnight, you will be woken up by the strong smell of breakfast preparation from this restaurant in the morning. You may wish to shut the window and leave AC on if you would rather avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Montecarlo - A Gem on La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: LancasterTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 2 friends stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo for 4 nights in June and loved it! This Hotel is small (56 rooms) but has spacious rooms that are modern and excellently equipped, a lovely breakfast area, rooftop terrace and an excellent location. Most importantly the entire staff provides superb service with a smile! I would highly recommend this lovely hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Staying in Barcelona? - Hotel Montecarlo every time !!”
Reviews.Author: suffolkpigpen
Reviews.Content: My grateful thanks to all of the Trip Advisor reviewers for recommending this wonderful, luxurious haven in the heart of Barcelona. I would not have stayed here without you. Just about everything that can be said about this small hotel with every attention to detail and superb staff has been said and I will certainly return. I will just add that I would recommend using the bus from the airport to Placa de Catalunya. They run about every 10 minutes and its just a five minute walk to the hotel from Placa de Catalunya. Just make sure that you leave plenty of time to get back to the airport as, even though the bus may appear to be full, they still pick up at various points and the listed 35 minute journey ends up closer to an hour. But, as the fare is just 4 euros 5 cents there is little to complain about. Go to hotel Montecarlo and have a wonderful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Shhh! Keep this quiet!”
Reviews.Author: mymaruska
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! Gorgeous, ultra clean--trendy without being stiff, and the management is fantastic. We have stayed in 5 star places that do not match the standards of this hotel. Only problem is when the cruise ship people enter the building and use their "outside voices"--but this, of course, can't be avoided. Fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: sybil
Reviews.Content: It was easy to see why this hotel is the top rated one as it has everything you'd want (unless you're incredibly indulgent and need excessive luxury or space). The lobby is fine, they have newspapers for the guests, a terrific location right on the Ramblas yet the rooms are quiet. I'd requested they make dinner reservations and they could not have been more helpful and accommodating as we kept changing nights. The room and bathroom was large enough, nicely done and totally comfortable. We could not have been happier on all counts and were a few minutes away from the market, where we went each morning for breakfast. Staff was pleasant. Everything is well maintained and spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was there now!”
Reviews.Author: boojee
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel I have come to twice because I cannot fault the location, the amenities and the staff. The staff are all knowledgable, friendly and extremely helpful. I dream of returning again. We were able to get recommendations to restaurants, travel itineries and even help with a faulty rental car. The staff were unbelievably understanding and even after we had checked out, took care to see us safely off on our next journey.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: FifiNotts
Reviews.Content: Used Trip Advisor to find a good hotel and were not disappointed. Wanted a central location but were a little concerned about it being on La Rambla because of noise etc. However, once inside the hotel you had no idea you were on one of the busiest streets in Europe. Hotel has retained its lovely exterior and salon whilst providing contemporary bedrooms and bathrooms with very modern facilities. The staff were very courteous and helpful and breakfast was good value. This hotel deserves its high rating on trip advisor - it made my stay in Barcelona even better and well exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “MonteCarlo lives up to its great reviews”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner15
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights (Post Cruise) at the MonteCarlo and loved the hotel. Our room (202) was one of the refurbished rooms. (Staff told us the second and fifth floors had been redone.) The room was large, had a sitting room, a small balcony overlooking Las Ramblas and a large bath. It had new wood floors, quality contemporary furnishings, adjustable bed (fun to sit up and read or watch TV at night), in-room safe, mini-bar, nice closet with storage shelves, a shelf for luggage, two flat screen TVs, nice quality linens and pillows, two bed lights for reading, etc. The sitting room had a wonderful bay window overlooking Las Ramblas. Watching the action on the street is great fun. The noise is NOT an issue since the hotel has used electric rolling shutters, double sets of doors and a heavy door between the sitting room and bedroom to block the sound. We slept great. The bath had high end decor and fixtures - interesting stone counters, walls and surrounds, high-end Grohe fixtures, whirlpool tub, shower, bidet, toilet, a good hair dryer, bath scales and the usual nice toiletries. Everything you could want was provided. The staff speaks English and are outstanding. They willingly make restaurant reservations, provide help with transportation, maps, and other info. The housekeeping is very quiet and "out of sight" but excellent. The room was immaculate always. They never knocked on our door and distrubed us to clean. They simply always came while we were gone. We frequently used the free computer with internet in the lobby and took advantage of the breakfast buffet ($11 euros). We appreciated that it stayed open until 11 a.m. and 11:30 a.m. on weekends. We plan to go again to the MonteCarlo. It is very user-friendly and a great place to stay. It could not be in a more convenient location for everything (metro, bus, taxis, tourist sights, restaurants, grocery store, fun and action), and the staff and service are terrific.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!”
Reviews.Author: Les13
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at the Montecarlo. I chose this hotel for it's location on La Ramblas, it's traditional exterior with wrought iron balconies, and the contrast of a modern interior. We were not disappointed! We had 2 rooms (superior rate) with balconies overlooking La Ramblas. Both had spacious bedroom areas, sitting areas & large modern bathrooms with jacuzzi baths. The breakfast was excellent (11euros) and the staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. First class hotel and worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: kellyincville
Reviews.Content: Pros: The junior suites were very large, up to date and a good value for your euros. The location is excellent- right in the middle of the tourist district of Barcelona but we had a courtyard facing room and we never heard any street noise. The staff was wonderful and were eager to please. The hotel is also very attractive and has a great look. Cons: They are currently doing some work on the upper floors.
