The noise is not loud but it is noticeable. The shower was also a little funky. You had to turn it on and input selections on the digital scene to get it to work. I tried to use it twice and both times received error messages that there was not enough water. I ended up using the tub. But even funkier than the shower was the bed. It was an 'italian' bed with two mattresses and controls that would lift the head and foot ends of the mattresses independently. Pretty neat while watching tv but it ended up being a nightmare to try and sleep on. The two mattresses slid apart from each other very easily and three times during the night I woke up to find myself falling into a foot wide gap and onto the metal framework.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SCreisende
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week long visit and couldn't be more pleased with the Montecarlo.Our standard room was modern,clean and comfortable with a large and well equipped bath.We had a courtyard view which was very quiet. The staff were very polite,attentive and helpful. A great place to stay in the midprice range(150-220E).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay”
Reviews.Author: sssdj
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is fantastic - spotlessly clean, excellent location, quiet and the best staff ever ! - they made our stay so memorable we were celebrating a friends 60th and 50th birthdays and they couldn't do enough for us - it was just wonderful. Sara, Sergio, Quiqui, Gonzalo, Jordi, Tomas and Rosa our maid just to name a few. We will definetely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jijLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked a junior suite for my father's 70th birthday, and was very impressed, as was he. It was huge. He said he hasn't slept so well for ages, even though the hotal is right on La Rambla. Excellent beds. Very friendly helpful staff, would recommend to anyone. Nice roof terrace too, but maybe could have had a bar near the lobby to meet in, but there's lots of other places to meet near by.

Reviews.Title: “Just could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Jeggers
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say! We read the reviews beforehand like you all and booked with a good level of expectation. Those expectations were well and truly exceeded in every way. We were absolutely delighted and thrilled with the hotel. Fabulous room, excellent full-scale breakfast is good value (just about everything you want including full English breakfast so we were not hungry till about 4 p.m!). Reception staff are so approachable, friendly and so helpful. Just can't fault this hotel in any way - the best we have ever stayed in. A great location too, and VERy quiet!. Suggest ask for a room at the back to be sure, but room was very sound-proof particularly at night.

Reviews.Title: “FAB”
Reviews.Author: bagginshobbit
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel we booked it on the reviews from this site and they were all spot on. staff , location , rooms all FAB we asked for a local tapas bar and the staff recommended "Ciudad Condal" it was within easy walking distance and the food was to die for. we went early 6.30 the first time and it wasnt too busy so the staff had time to listen to our phrase book spanish and show us and explain most of the dishes as first timers we found this invaluable! we went later another night ( 9.00ish) and it was very busy with rapid service and little time for novices i was glad we had been earlier and new the score!! all this added to the experience ,it was great place. the roof top of the hotel has spectacular views the touristic bus is well worth the money, we got on at 10.30 no queue. i would go back in an instant - no question

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariasEngland
Reviews.Content: Hotel great, we stayed for a week and had a lovley time. The blackout blinds meant LOTS of sleep which you need after hours and hours of walking in the city. The staff recommended lovely places to eat- ask them about the great place that does suckling pig! Watch out for pickpockets- we were done on our second night despite bieng really careful after warnings. The harbour area does great seafood. Really enjoyed the location of the hotel, right in the middle of all the sights. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Staff so friendly”
Reviews.Author: Candyfloss11
Reviews.Content: All staff were extremely friendly and nothing was too much trouble, we wanted to see from the roof - all you had to do was ask and it was done. Rooms fantastic we had a lovely room with a balcony and able to watch a small parade on Easter Sunday. The hotel made the short break - GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel excellence on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Dantexan
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 28th anniversary with 5 relaxed, satisfying nights at the Montecarlo, March 20-25th, 2008. Wanting to focus on my wife and on our first visit to Barcelona, I was only too happy to leave the details of the 8 restaurant reservations and the excellent daily breakfasts up to the hotel staff. We are also movie buffs, and that need was met by the staff's recommendations and followup with reservations and directions to two English-language showings. The hotel management's attention to detail cannot be overstated. The staff's fluent command of English, both written and verbal, eased our exchanges of e-mail as well as our understanding of the available opportunities for enjoying Barcelona. After several visits to other parts of Spain, we were impressed by the staff's unfailing good humor and by their obvious intelligence. While I had selected most of the restaurants in advance (which were made by hotel staff) from an excellent guidebook (Mary-Ann Gallagher's "Barcelona Handbook"), the best one of all came as a result of a hotel staffer's recommendation, the Quo Vadis. Located just off La Rambla a few hundred meters from the hotel, the Quo Vadis is an elegant, intimate spot for those whom appreciate quality, attentive service and selection. The evening that we chose to eat there was the only one in which it rained, so we were grateful for its proximity to the hotel. Other restaurants we liked were Attic, Can Culleretes (excellent Easter Sunday goose), Elche, L'Olivé, and El Gran Cafe (better for lunch than dinner, lights too bright). Elche and L'Olivé are very good, midpriced seafood/Catalan restaurants catering to local clientele. The Attic is conveniently located a few doors down on La Rambla and was a pleasant surprise, in terms of price and quality, after our late arrival from Copenhagen. The hotel's location is a distinct plus. Some photos are attached of views from the balcony, including those of the Good Friday procession. With the double-insulated doors closed, we could not hear any noise from La Rambla's unceasing activity. After a full day of museum visits, sightseeing and shopping, it was a pleasure to come back to the room's jacuzzi and soak our weary bones, accompanied by cold cava from the minibar. If you stay 3-5 days, and plan to use the Metro to visit several museums & attractions, consider buying the Barcelona Card at the airport, or at Placa Catalunya. Also, try to use the Liceu station just down La Rambla, instead of the vast Catalunya metro station whenever you can. We are already discussing our next visit to this stimulating, historic city and to the Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: haro
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Montecarlo for 3 nights and was extremely pleased. The hotel's location is perfect. It is on the Rambla near Plaza Catalunya, so very near to starting point of airport bus and tourist hop on hop off and located in the Barri Gotico, in short the heart of the city. You can walk to many important sights, and don't need a taxi or metro. But the perfect thing is that the hotel, which is a beautiful building, is a haven of rest and peacefulness inside. We had a room at the back, which was so quiet that you could sleep with the windows open! The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful, and speak perfect english. Roger, the porter, who found that the allocated room smelled of smoke, came back to give us an even nicer room.Room 306, their standard room, but perfect. Good beds and enough space and an extra door before you get to the hallway. So keeps noise down. All rooms have marmbled bathrooms with a jacuzzi, which is nice after having walked for hours.There is also free internet. In short, go for the Montecarlo. I looked at many of the other mentioned hotels, but was happy we decided on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LittleGem”
Reviews.Author: ParisEd
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Montecarlo Hotel with our children in late February. The experience couldn't have been lovelier! The location could not have been beat and the accomodations and service were wonderful. The hotel is right at cross-roads between La Rambla, its shopping, and the Gothic neighborhood. Excellent, convenient access to everything. The Montecarlo, which we learned is a national Barcelona monument , is diagonally across the street from Hotel 1898 and directly across from le Meridien. Staff was wonderful and recommended absolutely the best places to dine. The food in Barcelona is awesome, from tapas to elegant restaurants. The hotel service was excellent. The breakfast waitress couldn't have been nicer and more accomodating. We loved our cafe con leches with our fresh orange juice and she tended to us very attentively. This mid 1850's building has a beautiful 1st floor great room, restored to its original splendor. Yet the bedrooms and bathrooms are all modernized, immmaculately clean and the beds are the most comfortable beds in which we've ever slept. The hotel provides slippers and bathrobes to all guests and in my estimate, represents the best deal in Barcelona. Check out the top floor solarium which provides 360° views of Barcelona's beautiful rooftops, gothic neighborhood and city center. Emphatically recommend and would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveller10
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for a week, and enjoyed the quiet modern elegance. The staff was great, very helpful with directions. The location on La Rambla is very convenient to restaurants, the harbor, and other attractions. The hotel is an art deco - Gaudi like structure with a charming lobby and sitting areas; the rooms are completely modern and well equipped. Cost was reasonable, this was 3.5 star comfort at 2.5 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: joeh76
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Montecarlo for 4 nights in early January this year and were very impressed. We booked one of the deluxe rooms and really believe it was well worth the extra money. First of all the room and the en-suite were huge. The bathroom was easily the biggest we've had and having the jacuzzi bath and seperate walk-in showers after a long day spent sightseeing was a godsend. The bed itself was one of the most comfortable beds I've stayed in. Entertainemnt wise we had a full minibar, mini hifi system and multichannel tv. What was really cool is that the hifi was wired into the bathroom so you could relax in the bath sipping some chilled cava while listing to your favourite tunes. Total bliss. We didnt sample breakfast as we booked room only, however there are plenty of nice places nearby which do lovely reasonably priced meals. All the staff we met during our stay were incredibly helpful. The gave us tips on what to see and do and they were only too happy to book restaurants and taxis. The hotels location is very central, literally 5 mins walk from La Catalunya railway station. However travelling from the airport its not advisable to take the metro, its best to take the bus to Placa Catalunya and walk 5 mins to the hotel. I would definitely recommend the Montecarlo to anyone going to Barcelona and will stay there again next time I go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally placed with relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: CultureVultureCamb
Reviews.Content: A great find near Plaza Catalunya. Easy to reach from the airport ‘bus and good transport connections – not that you really need them much as being right on Las Ramblas means you can enjoy this lovely city on foot. Hotel looks great both inside and outside. Front desk offered good service which was friendly and efficient. Didn’t make use of any of the other facilities but the bar and breakfast room were well appointed. There are plenty of nearby cafés and bars to choose from with breakfast readily available for much less than €11 charged in the hotel. Our room overlooked an inner square with well set out courtyards of neighbouring flats and hotels. It was very quiet inside the hotel. The room had plenty of space in it including in the bathroom and everything was well maintained and subtly decorated. Overall, a feeling of comfort and relaxation. On arrival the porter showed us to the room with no hint of wanting a tip. The features included an adjustable bed, a Jacuzzi bath, a CD player and little extras such as a presentation box of freebie samples. The only minor negative points were that the large looking double bed was in fact made up of two single mattresses and the sun roof was locked and we’d been looking forward to the views. Overall the Hotel Montecarlo shows how it should be done. Simple but elegant presentation (beautiful flowers in reception and candles burning in the evenings). Apparently effortless service and attention to detail. At times it was hard to believe that there were other guests resident as there were never other people waiting around for anything – other than the staff always ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DevaEboracum
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a short break of four nights in February 2008, and I have to say that the hotel was perfect in every respect - I don't think I could find a thing to fault it. I selected this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and after looking at all the top rated hotels for both a central location and price, this seemed to be the perfect combination. We arrived early Friday evening and found the hotel located in a perfect spot on La Rambla just a couple of minutes from Place Catulunya. We were greeted at the door by a hotel porter (although I don't believe he was there all the time during the stay, so it may just be pot luck on whether there is a porter there when you arrive). The porter took our bags to reception where we were swiftly and efficiently checked in by a polite and helpfull receptionist with perfect English. After checking in, the porter went with us to the room, carrying the bags and then showing us the features etc. of the room. The room was great - a good sized room with king size bed, contemporary style and nice and clean. The room had doors which opened to overlook La Rambla - and even though the street outside was busy and bustling, you could close the doors and all was quiet. In fact, the hotel was quiet as a whole - everyday we had a nice long lie in without being woken up by noise. The bathroom was wonderful - a good size, clean and with a nice big jacuzzi - big enough for two :-)) with a good shower over the bath. TV was limited in choice - only BBC World and CNN in English - but we didn't go to Barcelona to watch TV. Reception had free Internet access. Overall this was an excellent hotel that I would definitely recommend. TIP - the tax from the airport to the hotel was about 40 Euros inc. tip. However, the Airport bus stops and starts in Placa Catulunya and is five mins walk to the hotel straight down La Rambla. The airport bus only cost 4 Euros per person.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, friendly with very nice rooms and superbly located”
Reviews.Author: ghacker0
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a three night stay in Barcelona and stayed at the Montecarlo. When we visited the city 7 years ago, my husband fell in love with the outside of the building and vowed he would stay there if he ever went again. For his birthday, I booked this short break and he was delighted that I had managed to book a room there. Despite only having a standard room, when I spoke to the hotel, they said they would do their best to let us have a balcony. When we arrived they confirmed that we did indeed have a balcony overlooking La Rambla. The room, whilst not being the biggest we have stayed in was very good, and the bathroom was magnificent with a huge jacuzzi bath big enough for two. The beds were very comfortable with the usual egyptian cotton sheets you would expect in a good quality hotel - even the pillows were to my taste. A novelty was the electric bed, enabling you to sit up and have a drink whilst watching the tv. Although they had Sat TV, the only english channels were CNN and BBC World, however we probably spent more time either walking round the city, or chilling out in the bath to help our aching muscles. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. All in all, if we went back to that wonderful city, we would always ask for room 301 at the Montecarlo! If you want a good meal, try El Burrito y Yo in the old quarter. Great food and good ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: TimePassages
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice for our first visit to Barcelona in mid-December. Perfect location for exploring the city centre on foot with lots of great restaurants, cafes, bars and shops close at hand. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Our room on the fifth floor was quiet, with a very comfortable bed and a great bathroom. We could have paid more for a fancier room with a view, but we had no complaint. We took breakfast (9E each extra) on a couple of days, but there are plenty of alternatives nearby. In short, a very nice place to stay. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: heyladyDallas
Reviews.Content: After searching high and low for the right hotel for a brief stay in Barcelona, I chose the Hotel Montecarlo based in large part on Tripadvisor reviews. Upon arrival at the airport, I took a taxi to the hotel. I did struggle a bit to get my luggage up the few steps leading into the hotel, as there is no staff waiting to assist. However, once I made it to the reception desk, everything was great. I arrived around 10 in the morning, which was of course earlier than usual for check-in. I was initially told that my room was not yet ready, but a staff member nearby (presumably someone more senior) said to hang on, and then when he finished helping the guest he was with he found me a room that was ready so that I could check in - which was much appreciated after the long flight from the US. A staff member showed me my room and then delivered my luggage for me. The room was lovely, spacious and quiet. I didn't have much of a view, but it didn't really matter to me since I didn't plan on spending much time hanging around in the room. The marble bathroom was especially pretty. I did have a brief problem with the electrical outlet in the bathroom not working, but that was quickly resolved when someone came up to the room and flipped the breaker. The room had everything I needed including a minibar, blow dryer, safe, etc. Prices for drinks from the minibar seemed quite reasonable. The bed was very comfortable - and could even be adjusted so I could sit in an upright position while reading or watching TV. I truly loved the location of this hotel, being able to walk out the door and be on a busy area of Las Ramblas. There are many restaurants, shops, etc. nearby, and it was enjoyable just to walk up and down the streets. You can catch either of the major tourist buses with about a five-minute walk to Placa de Catalunya. There is also a metro station a couple of minutes away. Upon checkout I needed a taxi, and the staff was gracious in telling me just to wait inside while they hailed a taxi for me and got my luggage down the steps to the taxi. Not being very proficient in Spanish or Catalan, I had written down my destination (I was going to the port to catch a cruise) and the hotel staff member was kind enough to relay it to the driver, who spoke no English. In fact, the cab driver I had coming in from the airport did not seem to speak any English either - while most of the hotel staff seemed to have perfect English. This was another plus for me. In summary, the room was nice, the staff was gracious, and the location was perfect. I would love to stay at the Montecarlo again the next time I am in Barcelona (which I hope is soon!).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SCass3680
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon on a cruise through parts of Europe. The final stop on the cruise was Barcelona. We only had two days to explore Barcelona before flying home, so we wanted a hotel in a location that was convenient to most of the attractions. After searching through reviews on TripAdvisor, we came across the Montecarlo and immediately booked it. Upon arrival from the ship at 9 in the morning, we were told that normally check in is at 3 pm, but they would see what they could do. They immediately got us a wonderful room on the top floor overlooking Las Rambla. We had booked a standard room. Our bags were brought up right away. The room was great and very clean. We had a little balcony as well. The bathroom was very nice and had a jetted tub. It even had speakers that brought in the sound of the whatever was on the TV. They provide you with robes and slippers as well and the bed had a control for each side so you could raise or lower the head or foot part. If you are worried about noise from Las Rambla, don't. There are two sliding glass doors that block out 95 percent of the noise. I was shocked at how well it worked. The hotel itself was beautiful and very charming. There are wonderful views of the city from the rooftop. The staff happily went out of their way to make our short stay that much more special. When we asked for a place to eat, they brought out maps and called ahead to get us reservations. They even recommended their favorite dishes there. If you want a great place to eat check out La Gavina. They had the best paella. It's down by the water in Plaza Pau Vila. On the last day the staff was kind enough to hold our bags while we explored the city for one last time. Since our stay was so short, they recommended taking the Barcelona Tourist Bus. That was a wonderful way to see most of the city in only two short days. You pay one price and get on and off the bus at your own pace. The buses travel on a set schedule. You get headphones to listen to the facts of each of the sites as well. We highly recommend the Montecarlo. They treat you like royalty and go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and Best Location”
Reviews.Author: shoppermom
Reviews.Content: After reading all the wonderful reviews on tripadvisor, we decided to book 6 nights at the Hotel Montecarlo. We were not disappointed. We had a beautiful room on the 5th floor overlooking Las Ramblas, balcony with a wonderful view of the city, palatial bathroom with jacuzzi tub, spacious shower, great bathrobes and slippers and even a scale so we could make sure we did not gain too much weight from all the tapas and sangria! The room were very quiet at night, with double pane windows and blackout shades. The bed was extremely comfortable with great bed linens and thick absorbent towels. The location is perfect and the staff were always helpful and accommodating. They spoke great English and the service was just perfect. We felt very safe here and would definitely recommend this hotel to others for the location, great rooms. service, and value for the money. They do have a great breakfast for 9 euros but we choose to go to other small cafes nearby for a little less money and a change of atmosphere. This was a wonderful find and I am so glad to have found this gem through Tripadvisor. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: blooney
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Our taxi drove us right up to the door and someone was out immediately to take our bags in and hold them for the day until our room was ready. We had just the standard room on the fifth floor. It was overlooking the courtyard. It was fine with us that it did not overlook La Rambla. I took a nice jacuzzi to unwind after our long flight and it was wonderful. They provided a very nice assortment of perfumes and bath crystals and goodies. Very nice touch. The beds were nice, except that they separated during the night and I ended up sleeping in between the two mattresses because I was too tired w/ jet lag to get out of it!! The only thing I would say negatively about the room is that though it did have a CD player I was surprised at the quality of it. I don't think I would advertise that. But, it was nice to have in the room. The staff was willing to help and if you asked a question, they quickly pulled out a map to show you. The ATM right outside the Hotel is archaic and we were afraid it was going to take our card. We had no problems w/ pickpocketing, although we could sort of spot them in the Boqueria when we were sittiing on bar stools looking at our pockets. Keep your bag in your lap and across your body ALL THE TIME. We absoluteley loved Barcelona and almost wished we were not going on our cruise to stay there longer. Don't miss Boqueria and Pintoxto Bar!!!!We ate and drank like the locals and they liked us for it! (wine at 9 a.m.!) Also go have lunch at 4 CATS!!!!!! Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmygene
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montecarlo in October 2007. We were very pleased with the hotel. It has been redecorated in a modern theme which we liked and has some nice touches such as adjustable beds, robes and slippers, and electic rollup blalckout shades. The location is super, Even though it is on the La Rambla, it is very quiet and we were never bothered by street noise. The desk staff was most knowledgeable and quite helpful. We did not opt for the breakfast as it was not included in the price of the room. There a several places close by that are cheaper. I don't think you can beat this hotel for its location and price and for what you get for your money. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: Cramers
Reviews.Content: Well, the reviews were great that we read before we booked and we certainly were not disappointed. We stayed in room 209 at the back of the hotel, not much of a view but the room had just been refurbished. Wooden floors, white linen, fluffy towels, slippers and dressing gowns greated us with a beautifully appointed bathroom stocked with all of your essentials. Also had one of the best hairdriers that I have found in a hotel for a long time. There was also a safe (free) and the room was cleaned and turned down every day. Breakfast in the hotel was 9e+tax and was well worth it with the usual continental selection, but cerials, bacon, eggs, fresh fruit and copious amounts of tea. We ate breakfast in other places during our stay, but the hotel offered far the best selection and price. Staff were always on hand to help and provided some great advice about getting around and resteraunts in the area. We also felt that the hotel was secure with the reception manned whenever we were around. The Montecarlo is certainly somewhere we would stay again and it's right in the heart of where you need to be on a break to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “It was just okay”
Reviews.Author: cafoodie2
Reviews.Content: I too read the reviews but wasn't sure about the location. The Ramblas can be rather hectic. Since we had two stays in Barcelona, decided to stay at the Montecarlo on the way home. I was impressed with the desk clerk and the breakfast, but my room was very disappointing. The carpets were stained and the room lacked any ambience. It was not a luxury room, nor was this hotel cheap. The room looked like a motel room. Aside from the fresh orange juice, good coffee and internet access, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I Have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: ninwall
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful week in Barcelona. I booked the Hotel Montecarlo because of the good reviews on TripAdvisor.com, and all I can say is, the hotel was FANTASTIC. We are a family of 4 and booked 2 adjoining rooms on the 5th floor, away from La Rambla. The hotel exceeded our expectations. Everything everybody says in the reviews is true -- large beautiful quiet rooms, wonderful comfortable Craftmatic-type beds, down comforters, great showers and jacuzzis, robes and slippers, chocolates on your pillow, free internet, and the most helpful, friendly staff. We did not opt to pay 9 euros for the breakfast, but instead ate breakfast at the cafe literally next door, Moka Cafe, for a cheaper price. There was a cash machine next door, too, and of course the location on La Rambla couldn't be beat. The hotel is rated 3 stars, which I find puzzling, since it seems at least a 4 star hotel to me. We thought Barcelona was fantastic, and we would stay at the Montecarlo again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, friendly and first class”
Reviews.Author: belladonna01
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is second to none. it is also quiet - especially if you ask for a room at the rear of the property. The delux rooms are very spacious, luxuriously appointed and comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great - especially the coffee - a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very good value for Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: UKVoyagerLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo for three nights in September. It is in a very convenient location, the rooms are nice and functional and the staff is extremely helpful and accommodating. We had no problems whatsoever. The hotel is also a very good value for Barcelona. I booked it after reading some reviews but it still exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service”
Reviews.Author: laureldg
Reviews.Content: After doing considerable research on the internet and in guidebooks, I selected the Hotel Montecarlo for its location and excellent reviews. We were not disappointed. Its location near the top of La Rambla was perfect and central to everything. Its 200 year old facade was gorgeous and our modern room facing the back of the hotel had a huge bathroom with a jacuzzi tub and included bathrobes, slippers, and a hairblower. The breakfasts were wonderful with scrambled eggs, pastries, yogurt, a variety of breads, and fruit. Best of all was the staff - helpful and charming. We would definitely go back there. Barcelona should not be missed. We stayed there for four nights before a Mediterranean cruise and loved every minute of it - the Gaudi masterpieces, Gothic quarter, great restaurants, museums, and fabulous seafront location. We would also recommend a day trip to see the monastery at Montserrat. Great city and great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Everything and More”
Reviews.Author: bucko28
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo for 2 nights prior to our Mediterranean cruise. We requested a view of the Rambla and were accomodated on the 5th floor with a wonderful view. We were surprised how quiet it was considering the number of people strolling the area. The room was large and the bathroom was wonderful and clean. The front desk folks were eager to please and recommended restaurants upon request. There were ATM machines located right outside the hotel entrance which provided Euros at the current rate which saved us a small fortune when exchanging dollars. The location was close to the main plaza where we were able to catch the tour buses for great sightseeing. Our stay provided a tremendous beginning to a spectacular vacation. Our next visit to Barcelona will DEFINITELY include a return to the Hotel Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: SixTopTourMan
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week in Spain. We spent four nights in the Hotel Montecarlo. We had a room on the 5th floor overlooking Las Ramblas. With the double pained glass the room was very quiet. Again, echoing many of the previous sentiments this was an idle location. Right on Las Ramblas near the top. Quick walk up to Platca Catalunya, making it great base for site seeing and going out in the evening. English speaking staff was very accomodating. The only quibble would be the beautiful, Euro style shower was difficult to use without soaking the tiles around the tub.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: SMHazelwood
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from 3 nights at this hotel. What a gem of a place. It's right on Las Ramblas but you can't hear any of the noise. Rooms are more spacious than they look on their website and very clean. Staff were fantastic, excellent English, very polite and helpful. The breakfast at 9 euros was good with excellent fresh orange juice. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: BookWriter2
Reviews.Content: The Montecarlo was fabulous! This was our first trip to Barcelona and we wanted a location that was central to the touristic sites. When we first walked down La Rambla to the hotel, we were apprehensive because La Rambla was SO packed with people and full of activity - we were worried that it would go on all night and that our room would be noisy. We asked for a quiet room and got 206, which turned out to be in the new part of the hotel on a private courtyard (private to other buildings). Even though we kept the window the the courtyard open every night, we slept in complete silence and tranquility. That was the first thing we loved about the hotel: being in the middle of everything and having it be quiet at night. Besides that: the hotel is stunning. It is a beautiful old (Beaux Arts?) building that has been updated with modern design giving it the best of both worlds. We did not see rooms in the old part, but ours, in the new part was simple and lovely. It had a platform bed, a built-in desk with a free internet line, an ample closet, a chair and small table, and a spacious bathroom. In fact, the bathroom was really gorgeous, with chocolate brown slate tiles, a jacuzzi tub, and modern fixtures. The pictures on the website do not do this hotel justice. It is much prettier! On the mezzanine is a beautiful old sitting room with a magnificent fireplace and lots of sitting areas. It has chairs where you can sit and watch all of the activity on the street. The people working at the hotel were extremely helpful and courteous. The hotel is just two blocks from the Plaza Catalunya, which is where the fabulous touristic buses board and where the airport bus stops. Thus, you can get to the hotel from the airport for only 4 Euros (30 minute trip). Every day that we were at the Montecarlo, my husband said to me "Thanks for finding such a great hotel!"

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: TAFriend
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard double room (185 Euro / night). The hotel is located on Las Ramblas near Plaza Catalunya, a great, central location for walking around the city and very near to the subway. The hotel is beautiful and very modern and clean. There is free internet access all day and night. You can also get free wi-fi in the rooms. The hotel offers a great buffet breakfast for 9 Euro per person. The food selection is extensive and of good quality. We ate breakfast at the hotel 2 of the 4 mornings. All of the staff were very friendly to us and helpful. All staff working the front desk spoke very good English. Our room was very spacious, modern and clean. The beds were very comfy and the room came with slippers and house robes for me and my husband. The bathroom was also very spacious and had a jacuzzi tub. Our room overlooked a garden area (not Las Ramblas). If you're sensitive to noise, request a room that overlooks the garden. It was very quiet in our room. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and although it was one of the more expensive hotels we stayed at, we would stay there again. Top 3 things we did in Barcelona: 1. Everything Gaudi - We especially loved the Sagrada Familia and the Casa Milo 2. Shopping on the north end of Las Ramblas (near the Casa Batllo) - NOT on the south end of Las Ramblas where all the street performers are located. 3. Restaurant suggestions: - La Creme Canala: Great food, reasonably priced, service leaves much to be desired - La Poma (for lunch): delicious Italian food - 99.9% Organic: great tapas style restaurant with a VERY desriptive menu in English (with pictures!) - Gelaaati: the best gelato in all of Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vkester
Reviews.Content: After reading the good reviews on Trip Advisor we stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo in Barcelona from the 9th to 12th October 07 and confirm the reviews were correct, it is a fantastic hotel. The Hotel is classed is 3*, but we would class it as a very good 4* Hotel. We were given room 301, which had a nice balcony with great views overlooking La Ramba. The room was excellent and the jacuuzi was great. The location of the hotel is first class and the politeness and helpfulness of the staff was also first rate. Brilliant hotel - we will always stay here when we return to Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wiorst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: dcooper03
Reviews.Content: Stay Away!!!!!! You need to read this if you are thinking of staying at this hotel. Ok, we stayed at this hotel for part of our honeymoon in Barcelona. Location is good and rooms are ok but nothing great for the money. Our last night there after we just went to sleep around 3 AM we hear shouting in the hallway. Then there is this load banging on our door from a girl screaming in some foreign language. Of course we didnt know what to do so we just waited and we heard banging on the door next to us. This goes on for like 5 minutes and I didnt want to open the door because I dont know who is out there and what their issue is, so I call the front desk. Front desk tells me that some crazy lady got on the elevator before they could stop her and they are aware she is in the hotel. I tell the guy well shes is banging as hard as she can on my door and the rooms next to me on the third floor so please have her removed. He says ok and that he also called the police. This baging goes on literally for the next 45 minutes. This lady is crying, screaming, and banging on our door and the rooms next to us so loud that I honestly felt she was going to break the door down. I called the front desk again, same guys there and no action is taken. Finally around 4:14 AM the banging stops and we try to go back to sleep but with all that happening and it being so loud and odd I probably got 1 hour of sleep before I had to wake up and get my plane. So the next morning I go to check out while my wife finishes gathering things in the room. I ask to talk to the owner. A middle aged man downstairs said he is the owner. He spoke some English and I explained to him in English and Spanish about what happened. He said he was aware of it and it was a lady and a husband or boyfriend that have stayed there before that were in a fight, which was very different then the story I heard the night earlier about some random crazy walking in off the street. I explained it was our heoneymoon and we paid a lot for the hotel and I didnt think we should need to pay for the last night becuase of what happened. You dont pay $300/night to stay at a hotel and have that kind of experience. I own 3 different businesses in the US and any other business owner would agree that some sort of action should be taken by the owner of this hotel for his guests. Well this guy flipped out. Came around the desk and started yelling and screaming with his fist in the air that we better pay for all the nights. This guy was crazy. So to wrap this up, he actually grabbed me by the shirt at least three times and tried to shove me, kicked our bags and our $1500 worth or artwork we purchased in Barcelona the day before that was wrapped in a bix that said fragile, tried to have a bell boy take our bags, and just acted like a real ass. I told him we would have the cops come and they could see the videotape of what just happened. he had one of his workers go in the back room and do something (Im pretty sure get rid of the tape). The police came which were little help. I told them to watch the tape. They came back 5 minutes later and told me it was out of order. I filed a police report there becuase they advised me it would take too long to go to the police station. We ended upo missing our flight anyways and now I am disputing the charge for the hotel on my credit card because of all this. What a way to treat your guests after they are put through a night of screaming and yelling by other guests outside of your room. Especially when you know how much they are paying a nigh to stay there and that it is your honeymoon. Stay away from this place. Only thing good about it is the location. Services suck. Cant even get ice unless the bar is open and then you need to walk downstairs and have them go get you some. Not worth it. Trust me. Rest of hte trip was great. Z This place ruined Barcelona for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Barcelona? Yep!”
Reviews.Author: aptbroker1
Reviews.Content: After checking on hotels at Tripadvisor, we picked the Hotel Monte Carlo, staying 3 days from 2-5 October. We booked a deluxe room (#402) for 270 Euros through Venere.com at the last minute. We were shocked and amazed by our room! The bathroom alone was bigger than most of our hotel rooms in Europe, all redone in marble with jacuzzi, separate shower, exercise bike and lots of windows providing mellow light. We had a living room with WiFi and cable TV, and the bedroom was palatial, with an adjustable bed that raised both head and/or feet, with a balcony overlooking Las Ramblas, the best location in Barcelona! The entire staff was super friendly and helpful, and the public areas magnificent. Oh, and the breakfast buffet was the best we've had in Europe; eggs, ham, 5 kinds of sausage, 5 or 6 kinds of bread, with a toaster that actually worked! Plus FRESH squeezed orange juice! Heavenly! A word of caution, the regular rooms cannot be this nice, as they are $70 less money, so if you can spring for the extra $$ it's sooo worth it. We felt like the Duke & Duchess of Windsor!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hamilton44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 2 nights post-cruise and couldn't have been happier with our choice. The hotel has a baroque appearance from the outside (very lovely when illuminated at night) but it's very modern inside. From the moment our taxi pulled up at the door the staff couldn't have been more helpful (and we did have a lot of bags). We had a quiet room at the back of the hotel - furnished in very modern style and with jacuzzi bath (lovely after our cramped shower on the Emerald Princess). Bathrobes were supplied but we didn't use them. One little complaint...the bath was rather slippery and we would have welcomed a bath mat when showering. The hotel is ideally situated right on La Rambla and very near Catalunya Place and a very central spot e.g. for catching the turistic bus which circumnavigates all the main attractions in the city - both routes, north and south are highly recommended. The staff were very helpful in suggesting good eating places...great recommendations for tapas. We ate breakfast both mornings ( 9 euros per person and well worth it). We would certainly stay at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel – privileged location”
Reviews.Author: Nordkvinnen
Reviews.Content: We are just back from spending 7 nights at this wonderful Barcelonan hotel. We had asked for a room overlooking the Ramblas, but got a room facing the backside of the hotel. Considering that the great fiesta la Merce was going on, we at least had no noise! Our room was nice and spacious, and the bathroom was great, with Jacuzzi and bathrobes. The room looked much nicer than the pictures at their website. Breakfast was also very nice, and compared to what you get if you try to buy something similar out in town it was well worth the money. Service from the staff was outstanding, and we found all staff very polite, smiling and always trying to do the best for us. I would love to stay at this hotel if I visit Barcelona again, my only little minus is the price. We found the hotel a bit expensive, though it has a privileged location. Service and accommodation could be a 4 star hotel, but this hotel is only 3 stars - probably because they have no restaurant? Anyway, I really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Yet Another Great Review!!”
Reviews.Author: south-coast-beth
Reviews.Content: well what can i say that hasnt already been said. great location great staff clean & tidy amazing jacuzzi such a brilliant time at a fantastic hotel in the best city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frogwoman
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It was our last spot on our vacation and we could not have asked for more. The rooms were spacious and clean. The bathrooms were huge with a big spa bathtub. You have to turn your room keys in everytime you leave, but then you don't have to worry about losing them. Las Rambles was very busy and crowded, but you couldn't hear anything in the hotel. One of the friends I was traveling with got really sick the last day and the staff did everything they could to make it easier for her. We actually had to check out that day and they made her comfortable in the lobby with blankets and food. The staff went above and beyond. great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the hype!!”
Reviews.Author: r66kmj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Hotel Montecarlo for the Barcelona stretch of our honeymoon. We booked it based on reviews from this website. We were a little nervous because the hotel is not found on very many travel sites. Bottom line: the entire experience was unforgettable - because of the room, the staff, the location and the price. I had written in advance to advise that it was our honeymoon, and they certainly stepped up to the occasion. They placed us in what they referred to as their newest and best suite. 2nd Floor with a private terrace overlooking La Rambla. seperate bedroom and sitting room. Beautiful decor, cozy kingsize bed, and the greatest bathroom you could imagine with a 2 person jacuzzi, huge seperate shower with rainfall, regular detachable showerhead and horizontal hydrotherapy jets! Double-sink vanity, etc, etc. Moments after the staff checked us in and brought up our bags, the hotel manager arrived with a complementary bottle of cava (spanish champagned) and flowers to congratulate us on the occasion. After each long, wonderful day we would sit out on our terrace with a bottle of cava and watch the excitment of La Rambla go by. Then, the moment we closed the well-soundproofed doors lowered the professionally installed black-out blinds, we were in our private villa which could have been miles from any other people. Seriously folks - This hotel was the highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Nyelli
Reviews.Content: I can't praise the Montecarlo enough, it was an absolutely gorgeous hotel, perfect location right on La Rambla, we had a really spacious room, very modern with TV, CD player, minibar etc. I think we were upgraded too as we were given a room with loads of added extras! A jacuzzi bath, complimentary bath robes & slippers, a welcome pack including chocolates, miniature Martini bottles, perfume, sun screen etc. All of the staff were lovely, really friendly & helpful, they just couldn't do enough for you. Once the balcony doors were shut the room was totally sound proof, the roof terrace had some amazing views too. Overall I cannot praise this hotel enough & will not even consider other hotels in Barcelona as the Montecarlo has it all & more.......

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCmember
Reviews.Content: I agree with all of the other good reviews. The location cannot be beat and the hotel is very comfortable. Free wi-fi in the room was very convenient. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaHouse
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the TripAdvisor rating and were very pleased. The interesting 19th Century building is beautifully redecorated to a high standard. We chose a superior room and were given a nice suite. Excellent maintenance. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The location is excellent for walking about the city. No nickle and diming - wifi free, mini bar inexpensive. A great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round!”
Reviews.Author: Zenawio
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - 5 minute walk from the Aerobus (From the airport) stop in Plaza Catalunya. Great staff - Perfect English, plus helpful, friendly and always polite. Right in the middle of everything - On La Rambla, a walk to the beach, a short walk to the Gothic Quarter, a good walk to Sagrada Familia. Great room - Clean, massively comfortable beds, lovely welcome pack, plus a Jacuzzi in the bathroom!!! It was a fantastic place! The breakfast was a little pricey at 9 Euros each, but very, very good....buffet, with a selection of cold and cooked meats, fruit a range of breads and lovely, freshly squeezed orange juice. All in all, it was close to everything - whether that be restaurants, famous sites, bus stops, the beach, culture - way more than a 3 star and for the centre of such a great city as Barcelona, fairly priced.....everything was great! I cannot recommend it enough! One thing to remember is that when you book on your respective websites (I went with Opodo), it didn't detail the 7% Service/VAT Charge......took me by surprise, but it was no fault of the hotel, just something I forgot to take in to account! But, if you go, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and comfortable. You wont be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gordongecko
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4 night stay here in August on the back of the tripadvisor reviews and wasn't dissapointed. The hotel is in a great location on Las Ramblas, 5min from Placa Catalunya where the "aerobus" from the airport stops (last stop). The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room we had on the 2nd floor was great. Very recently renovated with wooden floor, tasteful furnishings and a really nice bathroom with Jacuzzi bath and shower. The matress on the bed was also adjustable via a small control although if I had one complaint it would be the mattress is a bit soft. We had the breakfast once at Eur9 each it wasn't really worth it. you are better off having breakfast on the go by getting something from a local bakery or sitting down at a cafe. As far as hotel breakfasts go though most people will probably be happy. Only thing to check would be to try and get a room on a renovated floor, not sure all have been done yet

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: louise1965
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant hotel, we were on the 2nd floor and there was no noise at all from the street. The room and bathroom were superb, didn't have breakfast so I don't know what the food is like. If you like real Flamenco go to Tarantos, Playa Reial 17, a few minutes walk down Las Ramblas. Everyone should try a Mojito, the best cocktail there is! Barcelona is a fantastic city and this hotel is highly recommended to all! Beware of pickpockets, they are everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyOysters
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a ten week trip to Europe. Five weeks driving around the south of Spain, I chose all our hotel from Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed that's the beauty of this wonderful site. Hotel Montecarlo was the first hotel on our trip through Spain and we loved it. From the minute you check in the staff are amazing,we had requested a La Ramblas view room. We stayed for four nights on the 13th of May, on the 3rd floor and we did hear any renovation noise or any noise. The bathroom was huge and the bed was the best we slept on in Spain. We would sit on the roof terrace in the afternoon and have our wine and nibbles the view is great. The breakfast was very good and a bargain at 9 euros I think this hotel should be 4* and 5* for service. The reception staff recommended a great restaurant called 4cats the street is Montsio I think.. The food was fantastic, it was were poets & writer used to go in by gone times has lots of atmosphere a MUST. This hotel is in a great location we caught the airobus from the airport very quick and a bargain at only 3.75 euro, five minute walk to hotel. If we return to Barcelona, Hotel Montecarlo is were we would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel and superb staff”
Reviews.Author: Jildebeast
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal location if you want to be in the centre of everything in Barcelona and easy to get to on the Areobus from the airport. Our room in the hotel was quiet and peaceful in spite of how busy Las Ramblas is... Air conditioning, jacuzzi bath and adjustable beds were perfect after a hot day doing the tourist bit :) The staff are very helpful and friendly and provided information and advice when asked, and a what's on guide. We found two excellent restaurants we would be happy to recommend, Taxidermista at Placa Reial 8, just off Las Ramblas and Citrus at Paseo Gràcia 44 just up from Placa de Catalunya, but there are plenty of excellent cafe's and cervesaria's too... The tourist bus is an ideal way to see the city and decide what you want to visit and if you get a two day ticket it's very reasonable. The only downside we noticed is that the sewers are occaisionally a bit smelly... but Barcelona is definitely worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: DTommo
Reviews.Content: This 3* hotel is definately under-rated. This should at least be given 4*. The hotel is fantastic. The rooms are boutique size with a jacuzzi bathroom of 5* status. Prior to arrival, informed hotel that three day break was in fact a birthday surprise. To this end, a bottle of chilled champagne was awaiting our arrival in the room. Our room, on the 4th floor, had a balcony looking over La Rambla. This view could only be bettered by the view from the hotels 6th floor sun terrace. The staff, especially those on reception, are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Breakfast was good...both continental and hot available. Fresh orange juice and coffee served directly to your table. The location of the hotel is indeed first class, almost in the centre of La Rambla, with the main square to the right and the port area to the left. All main points of interest within walking distance of the hotel. Just a few traveller tips: Taxi from airport to hotel door 20 euros. Hotel door to airport 30 euros! Be sure to get price prior to leaving hotel. A pint of beer in La Rambla 9 euros. Just round the corner, price drops to 4 euros. Beware conmen with the 'ball under the three matchboxes' routine. They work in a group to produce their own crowd, enticing 'lucky' tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: twosteps
Reviews.Content: For anyone wanting a quiet oasis in a sea of frenetic activity which is Las Ramblas, then this hotel is for you!. Helpful, very able staff constantly on hand to assist any request--where to eat ,trips to organise etc. Very comfortable rooms ,we were on the 3rd floor overlooking Las Ramblas, and not a sound from outside--very well soundproofed! There is some renovation on 2nd floor at present but we were completely unaware of any noise,dust from below. Breakfast is "continental" and 9 euros extra but certainly worth while. Hotel very well situated ,within 200 metres of Catalunya square ,the departure site of tour buses,metro station,and if you like it--Hard Rock Cafe.And of course a short stroll down Las Ramblas takes you to the Marina and beach areas. Would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Delight”
Reviews.Author: holidayprincess
Reviews.Content: Each to their own of course but happily for us our experience couldn't be further removed from a recent review 'a grand disappointment' - it was for us 'a grand delight'. I am an extremely fussy traveller as regards cleanliness, comfort, and luxury, and checked in early and wearily (having been in another hotel in town working at said convention). The room we had requested, balcony overlooking Las Ramblas was unavailable so we were offered an upgrade to their junior suite (104) which more than made up for it. Magnificient - enormous, lots of marble, chandeliers, beautiful furniture, even a small library, and a massage jet shower/sauna, as well as the rugby team sized jacuzzi. Another recent review points out all rooms above 3rd floor are yet to be refurbished, and this was still the case, so we were pleased to be on the 1st floor. No disturbance from the workmen during the week until about 10am by which time we were out or on our way out., and then only light tapping. The staff were unfailingly helpful and chirpy, and made some great restaurant recommendations and reservations for us - even getting us a table on a terrace overlooking the fiesta fireworks on the beach with an hour's notice - impressive! Nice finishing touches like coming in late at night to see tea light candles lit all around the flowers in the lobby, chilling our wine for us, and even lending us their corkscrew. On arriving home there was an e-mail waiting for us to say my husband's mobile had been left in the room (oops), and it arrived here in the UK 3 days later, impressed us further. I believe if you make sure to ask for a refurbed room, you won't stay in a better hotel in Barcelona for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back”
Reviews.Author: steph77andre
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a wonderful trip: Spain, US and Mexico. I must say that starting in Spain was the best idea. They treated us so well, the staff through out the hotel was extremely friendly. Our room did not have a great view at all, but we were not looking for that. The bed, bathroom and little entrance area were so clean and well decorated, not too flashy. I must say the toiletries were excellent. All in all, will definitively go back next time we are in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A grand disappointment”
Reviews.Author: casandy
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel from June 11-14, 2007. We were very disappointed with the quality of this hotel. We booked it based upon the reviews on this site. I expected a high quality boutique hotel and it turned out to be a high- priced (198 euros per night+ tax), run down establishment. The hallways were dimly lighted. The hallways and room carpeting were stretched and stained. The walls were banged up and we had a view of the adjoining buildings' roof tops. The furniture was old. The bed was more like a cot with a pad on the top than a bed. The location is great and the staff is friendly, but the facility is definitely not as advertised. Although it tainted our first visit to Barcelona, we could not change hotels since there was a large convention in town and all of the better hotels were booked. If you're looking for a nice, clean hotel, this is not the one for you!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: taratraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Barcelona in June 2007, and stayed at the Montecarlo. This hotel exceeded our expectations on every level. As we checked in at the front desk, the friendly staff (who spoke perfect english) informed us that we would be upgraded to a nicer room. We booked through a travel site and got a great rate, but our room had a jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The bathroom was marble, and bigger than many rooms I have stayed in while travelling in Europe! Throughout my stay, the Montecarlo front desk staff helped with suggestions (and reservations) for dinner. They suggested a fantastic restaurant for paella that will forever be a memory. This hotel is in an ideal location, but it can be a bit noisy on Las Ramblas. I am a very light sleeper so I brought ear plugs just in case and was pleased to have them. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It made my Barcelona experience!

Reviews.Title: “A truely fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustJames
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The staff were superb - always helpful and friendly. Our room was lovely to return to after a hard day sight seeing, cool, clean, peaceful and serene! The bath was fantastic - great for a long relaxing soak.

Reviews.Title: “Just great!”
Reviews.Author: mar1995
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of it all. It is not just close to La Rambla, when the lobby door opens, you are in La Rambla. There is a metro stop one block to your left, and the big metro and train stop underneathe Plaza Catalunyia one block to your right. The rooms are very large for the european standards and large enough for the american standards, they are also clean, silent and the windows seals all the light out. The staff is very professional, proper, correct and helpful. They have a nice breakfast for a few bucks. The staff told us to call if any noise disturbed us, because they are remodeling the second floor, but we never heard a hammer. For euro 200 per day, this hotel is a bargain. We paid more for another room that does not compare to this. This hotel is underrated, they are missing one or two stars. You want to know if we will stay there again? Yes, definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanFrancisc0
Reviews.Content: Great location and great hotel. We had room with balcony whic is as good as the photographs. Double windows shut out the sound. friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “it depends...”
Reviews.Author: melbguy
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel when I stayed here a year ago with my partner. I thought it was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in, and the price was excellent for Barcelona, the quality of the place, and the location. Now I'm not so sure anymore. I was on the third floor, and the renovations on the second were infernally noisy. Yes, they said they'd stop if it bothered me but surely they wouldn't suspend everything for the 5 days I stayed here. Not a big deal if you're out during the day (the work goes from 9 to 6) but if you're planning to spend quality time inside, not pleasant. Last time we had a room with a view of the Ramblas, which was great and quiet. This time, I had a room with no view whatsoever, only looking across a narrow space at another room, and as an earlier reviewer said, there's very little natural light because the top is covered. This made the room very dark and depressing. I would certainly not want to stay in this kind of room again. It may be that this is only the case for single rooms though, so if you're travelling with a companion, it may not be a problem. The third issue is the one that bothered me the most, and probably means that I will never stay here again. When I wanted to bring a friend, who was staying at another hotel, up to my room so he could check his email, the reception desk staff told me I was not allowed to have visitors. He said the little slip you sign at check-in said so on the back. I went up and checked (with my friend waiting downstairs), and indeed, it said that for security, no visitors were allowed. Many hotels have a similar policy, except it's usually something along the lines of "visitors must be accompanied by guests at all times". I find it completely unacceptable that a hotel would forbid its guests to have visitors, not to mention very embarrassing for the guest who has to make his visitor wait downstairs. But again, whether this is a problem, depends: if you're not going to have visitors, you won't be bothered by this unfriendly policy. Of course, the hotel still has many positive features. The rooms are nice, the breakfast is actually good value at 9 Euros, and most of the people at the reception desk are very friendly and helpful. So altogether, Hotel Montecarlo is a mixed bag and I can certainly no longer recommend it without reservations.

Reviews.Title: “professional staff, quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: atty_busnss_travlr
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in late May, third floor front room on the Ramblas. At the time of the stay the third floor had already been renovated, the second was in the midst of renovation, and then they will renovate the 4th and 5th floors. The first floor has a large conference or public room but no guest rooms. I note that the previous reviewer was required to sign a form stating that he understood renovation was ongoing. On the other hand, we were told that if the work bothered us they would immediately stop all work on the room below us. We were always out of the hotel during the day, so it wasn't a problem, but since renovation is likely to be ongoing for months, I recommend people try to stay on renovated floors away from the ongoing work. I did not see inside any rooms on non-renovated floors, but I walked down the hall way on the fifth floor to reach the solarium, and the carpet was very warn. If this is an example of what the rooms themselves look like on the non-renovated floors, I would again recommend keeping with the renovated rooms. We were a little nervous about possible noise in a room directly above the Ramblas, so asked to see a variety of rooms. I have never in my life had hotel staff so willing to show us so many rooms, all on the 3rd floor. I would say the footprint of the rooms were all about the same square footage, large for a European 4 star hotel, and very large for Barcelona. The main difference is the size of the Jacuzzi, and thus the bathroom. The room we ended up accepting, on the Ramblas (and with double doors, each double paned, noise from the Ramblas is a non-issue), had a vast Jacuzzi, and thus probably a third of the room consisted of the bathroom. Another room we were shown had a bathtub that was so small I couldn't possibly see how to get in, or more importantly, out of it. As a result the bathroom was small and the bedroom thus much larger than the bedroom portion of our room. Why in such a huge room would you have a half-bath tub? Weird. And weird also was our swimming pool of a Jacuzzi. It took an immense amount of water to half-fill the thing, and there was a long, and I mean long, set of instructions explaining how to work the thing. Despite both of us reading the instructions out loud to the other, we couldn't get it to work, and when someone arrived to explain it they couldn't get it to work either. Not a problem, but a tad odd. Also odd was the selection of furnishings which ranged from typical 4 star hotel nice wood head board and side board to a lamp that even Ikea would have found cheap which you turned on by yanking the electrical cord! But these are nits. The temperature controls, window coverings and lighting allowed one complete control over the environment, and housekeeping did a very professional job throughout our stay. The room included a table with nice chairs, plenty of reading lights and even a pocket door that you could close in the hallway between the bathroom and bedroom where you could read without disturbing someone sleeping. There is one computer with not very good free internet access in the lobby and a fair selection of international papers. The common seating area is comfortable though rather corporate. I found the solarium rather odd, since it is just an unfinished portion of the roof with an outdoor shower, and the hours are oddly short, 11:00 AM to 7:00 PM. But the area where this hotel really stood out was the professionalism of the staff. Our demands were limited to seeing endless room at check in, having our boarding passes printed the night before we left, borrowing umbrellas, getting wine bottles opened and chilled and receiving explanations of how to reach a couple of destinations. They handled all of these requests very well, and each time we returned to the hotel they remembered our room number. But what really impressed me was the unbelievable range of requests guests threw at them during our stay. A problem back at the office continued to plague my trip, so I spent way too long at that one computer off the lobby. One simply awful young woman demanded that staff find her a rental car to get to her next destination, some resort a couple of hours away. Loudly announcing in her US english that money was not a concern, merely that they find an agency to deliver the car to her and that would allow her to drop the car at the resort. Cheerfully the front desk wrote down this request and began making calls. Hours later when I again sat myself in front of the computer and the woman returned from her day shopping in Barcelona (huge number of expensive bags in tow) and asked about the arrangements, they were able to assure her that the car would arrive the next morning at the requested time, she merely needed to provide her credit card for the reservation. Upon hearing the price ($275 for a 2 or 3 day car rental) she told them to cancel it, it was way above her budget, and instead get her train reservations. I would have hit her (which is one reason why I'm a lawyer and not in the hospitality industry), but they were as pleasant and professional as could be. Another woman was in tears as I sat at the terminal while the desk explained that they had no reservation under her name and the hotel was full for the night. She then admitted that she had never actually received a confirmation from the hotel, but that since she had sent an email and they hadn't actually said no, she assumed... They couldn't have been nicer. They asked her 20 questions about exactly what she wanted in a hotel, what price she was willing to pay & then called and found her a room. They then called her a cab! It got so that every time I returned to the hotel room from my awful battles at the computer trying to solve the office problems I would have at least one story of the incredible people at the front desk. If only they could have solved my office problems with the same smile & attention to detail they afforded each and every request that came past the front desk!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RodW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MonteCarlo Hotel for two nights May 2 & 3. We have stayed at numerous hotels throughout the world and I must say this was one of the most enjoyable at any price. The decor of the rooms was great, we had a balcony room overlooking La Ramblas which had double glazed windows and heavy curtains so it was silent and dark if you wanted to sleep. In addition we had a separate sitting area with TV and a fantastic usuable bathroom with spa bath. The location of this hotel is ideal for a first time traveller to Barcelona, but what impressed me most was the attention and commitment of the staff to ensure we enjoyed our stay. The breakfast was great value for money at a cost of 9 euros each (i think). We would not hesiate to stay here again and highly recommend this as a hotel of great value for money. It is certainly not 5 start in it's facilities, but it is for service and experience. Don't forget a visit to the roof top terrace where the views are breathtaking and all over Barcelona. If you judge your hotels on pure value, this is it!! I would prefer this hotel to most 5 star hotels I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: jimbauer
Reviews.Content: The Montecarlo is close to public transportation, restaurants, and also within walking distance of enough tourist attractions to keep you busy for at least a day. You could probably spend half a day just people-watching on Las Ramblas where the hotel is located. The staff was friendly and accommodating and efficient. The property was very clean and well maintained. Our room was most comfortable and had many features/amenities that added to the comfort level. Those I can remember: individual reading lamps in bed; internet connection in room; electric window shades; adjustable bed (2 sides); lots of pillows; turndown service; evening chocolate; view of courtyard; room away from street; jacuzzi bath; room safe; digital thermostat to control heating/cooling; CD player; radio; plenty of closet space; shower/tub; magnifying mirror; free Internet service near lobby; bar near lobby; refrigerator in room. Breakfast is available on premises from 7:30 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. at an additional price of 9E. A wide range of items are available from the breakfast buffet and the breakfast waitstaff is friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but beware the single rooms/renovations.....”
Reviews.Author: minkKC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Montecarlo for 5 nights in May 2007. It is a nice hotel, but you are paying for that (135 euro per night for a single room), so as such I had a few complaints: 1) My room had windows on 2 sides, but they were both facing small inner courtyards about 3 feet by 10 feet. At first I was only mildly disappointed because I figured at least I would get some light and it should be quiet. It was quiet, but there was no light because the tops of these courtyards were covered up with a shade. It seems like all the reviews I read mentioned the great view overlooking Las Ramblas - just wanted people to be aware that no view/light is a possibility. I wasn't expecting a Ramblas view but at least thought I might get a room facing the back that got some light. It made it really hard for me to adjust to the time zone change without the morning light as a cue. So, I ended up staying up really late and sleeping late (hated to use an alarm clock on vacation!), which lead to my next problem. 2) They informed me at check-in that they were doing some "minor" renovations and had me sign a disclaimer stating that I was aware of that after telling me that it was just a formality and that I wouldn't notice anything because it was really very minor. The renovations were hardly "minor" but I guess they were hoping that most guests would be out the door bright and early. Around 9 to 10 am the work started, and there was no way to possibly sleep through it. I could see some of the work on the 2nd floor below me out my window and it was totally gutted. I really would have appreciated being informed of this in advance. When I booked a hotel for Italy this fall, they actually had a renovation special advertised for a few months this year. I thought that would have been a better way for Montecarlo to handle it. Having said that, if you are the type to be out the door early, then it wouldn't have been an issue. This was also the same woman who told me I probably wouldn't want to go see the Font Magica at Montjuic because it isn't very popular anymore anyway, plus there are many pickpockets. This, of course, didn't make sense to me, as popularity and pickpockets are generally directly proportional, so I went. It was great (and very popular), and I didn't have any pickpocket trouble. Even took the metro by myself late at night. I think she meant well - she was probably concerned about my safety, but I still thought it was bad advice. I really liked the rooftop "solarium" - especially since the view from my room consisted of walls- but was totally disappointed that it was only open until 7pm. Would have been a perfect place to relax with a glass of wine in the evening. What a shame. So here are the good things: The location towards the top of Las Rambles is ideal. Just a few minute walk from Plaza Catalunya, so the Aerobus is a great transportation option from the airport, and the metro station is practically right out the door. Room was large, bed more comfortable than most but firm, loved the robe and slippers. Jacuzzi tub was really nice after a long day of sightseeing. TV/sound system had a speaker in the bathroom. Thermostat in room, so you could adjust to whatever temp you wanted. Plenty of toiletries in bathroom, hairdryer was powerful. Free internet access in lobby was a nice touch, but the one computer they had was pretty popular during the day and evening, so there was often a wait (and people waiting for you to be done), so only useful for long emails if you got on it late at night. I had the 9 Euro breakfast only one day, but it might have been worth it just for the fresh-squeezed orange juice. Plenty of variety, food was good. The other days I either started with lunch or bought some fruit and/or a pastry at the Boqueria market. So, it is a nice hotel. Next time I would ask some specific questions regarding the room and condition of the hotel at the time before booking, though. In all, an average experience for what I paid. It was probably nicer than some of the other hotels I had considered for around 80 to 100 Euro, but that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel of enduring quality”
Reviews.Author: Cuveus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monte Carlo in 1993 and even back then can echo everything I've read recently. It is rewarding to know that such a great hotel has such consistency providing great accomodations and value over a span of 14 years. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: louford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montecarlo for three nights. We booked directly through the Hotel's website and got a fantastic room with a balcony overlooking Las Ramblas. With the double double-glazed doors closed, almost all street noise was removed so light sleepers shoiuld not be put off. The beds were very comfortable and the jacuzzi bath was great, particularly after a long day of sight-seeing. Breakfast was not included in our deal but it is certainly worth the extra nine euros- the freshly squeezed orange juice is too good to be missed and the selection of hot and cold dishes is excellent. Location is perfect for getting around the Barri Gotic, El Raval, La Ribera etc and Placa Catalunya is only one hundred metres away. Staff were all amazingly helpful and polite- among the best I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly oasis on La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutRoberta
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing--from our first email contact to the enthusiastic desk clerk who hailed a taxi to the airport. The hotel was an oasis in the busiest, most crowded section of town--quiet and convenient. and the breakfast was marvelous--did i mention the chocolate croissants and the cafe con leche? highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic retreat”
Reviews.Author: holl3411
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a thoroughly enjoyable 4 nights at the Hotel Montecarlo and wanted to echo the other positive reviews on this site. We booked the hotel direct via its website and found the prices better than a lot of those offered by generic agency websites. Arrived late on the Friday to a warm welcome and a complimentary bottle of Cava (for our anniversary).
