The room (Gracia/Superior) was great, with comfortable adjustable bed, luxurious marble bathroom with power shower and jacuzzi bath, separate lounge and entrance hall - All the facilities you would expect from a 4 star hotel with a lot of the touches you would associate with a 5 or above. (For example the "proper" hairdryer in the bathroom!) The hotel is very quiet both in terms of not seeing any other guests, but also being well sound proofed from the Rambla. It's a fantastic retreat from the noise and crowds of the street. One minor negative: on checking-in we were advised of building work taking place on the second floor (Pre-season stuff, only in the afternoons) and we were told that should there be any disturbance to call reception and they would move the builders onto another part of the building. Needless to say we were initially very sceptical and assumed the worse, however we didn't get disturbed whatsoever during our stay. (Having sampled the quality of service I have no doubts that the staff would indeed have moved the workers on!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RHEGED
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was a standard double, was very clean, quiet and the beds were sooooo comfortable, also the en-suite was a good size and had everything we needed. Breakfast was excellent value at 9 euros per person, plenty of choice and most diets catered for. The location could not have been better for getting around Barcelona. We would definately stay here next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wen47
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews on this board. Not speaking the language, a great front desk was key. Everyone who worked there was helpful but most of all so pleasant and sweet. They booked restaurant reservations via email from us. They gave us a standard room with a balcony overlooking La Rambla although they only said they'd try for a room like this since it's the more expensive ones that guarantee a balcony. With windows closed, there was no noise from the street. The room was spotless and had a very comfortable bed controlled electronically separately on both sides. The location was perfect. It's near several metro stations, in walking distance to many sites and literally around the corner from the gothic quarter. We found the breakfast very nice and in a lovely setting. It was the perfect hotel experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel spoiled us!”
Reviews.Author: SKEArizona
Reviews.Content: The four nights in this hotel spoiled us. What a great way to start our vacation and I agree with the other reviewers. Quique and the others gave us excellent service, a wonderful introduction to the city and some good meal recommendations. Opening up the patio doors, stepping outside and looking down on Las Ramblas was totally cool. The bed was so comfortable and this was probably the first time in my many European trips where I actually slept through the nights. My family was addicted to the Jacuzzi tub. Trip Advisor comes through again!

Reviews.Title: “Totally lived up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: eliledoll
Reviews.Content: What an excellent hotel! - from the moment we arrived, the staff couldn't do enough for you. We were lucky enough to get a room with a balcony (ask for a high floor so you can get the best view of La Rambla and beyond) and it was luxuriously appointed with a Jacuzzi bath, adjustable beds, mini bar and a sound system. Towelling robes and slippers are also provided for guests comfort, and the bathrooms have hairdryers and a good range of complimentary toiletries. The sheets and towels are changed daily, and although the rate I got did not include breakfast my friend and I decided to treat ourselves; at 9 euros each it was plentiful, delicious and well worth the money. I was sceptical before arriving about the hotel's claim that the rooms were virtually soundproof - being that the hotel is situated on the busiest thoroughfare in Barcelona, but this is certainly the case. I would recommend that even if your room is not on the top floor you should take the lift to the 5th floor and walk up the short flight of stairs to the roof terrace - the views in all directions are stunning. I'm going back to the hotel next year with a larger group of friends, and although you can find cheaper accommodation in the city I feel its certainly worth the extra to stay at the Montecarlo. If you only have a short time to spend in City, I would thoroughly recommend you visit the Sagrada Familia - it's quite simply breathtaking. Also, on the far side of the Plaza de Catalunia is a street called the Passieg de Gracia - the shops are fabulous, and you can see two of Gaudi's famous landmark buildings ( La Pedrera and Casa Batllo). Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGirlAtHeart
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay in Hotel Montecarlo, which had to be one of the best hotels I've stayed in. The location on Las Ramblas was perfect for seeing all the sights. For its location, the prices was more than reasonable (we found a deal on the hotel website). The staff was probably the nicest, most accommodating hotel staff I've ever encountered, from the front desk to the breakfast staff. Speaking of breakfast, extremely delicious, lots of variety, and some of the best coffee I've ever had in my life! Oh, can't forget to mention the fresh squeezed oj they bring to you when you sit down. Free internet access service in the lobby, your beds turned down, large jacuzzi bathtub and chocolates on your pillows....what more could you ask for???

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: DianeandBill
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Montecarlo with another couple as a prelude to a cruise. The hotel was a great value, but what we most appreciated was the great location and the helpful hints from the hotel staff. We really only had a day and a half to see the city - by staying at the Montecarlo we were able to get the most out of our time. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTeleChick
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Montecarlo! Perfect location right on Las Ramblas. I was worried about noise from the street, but it was no problem at all when we shut the windows/doors. We had a terrace and could enjoy a glass of wine while watching the entertaining pedestrians below! The hotel staff was very friendly and every resturant recommendation was perfect. We'll definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fred111
Reviews.Content: The Montecarlo is a great place to stay. It is in the heart of Las Ramblas but is quiet and peaceful. The rooms are clean and modern. The staff is friendly and able to recommend the best way to see the city. I will stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Member1234567890
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in November. The room was very nice, it had a balcony overlooking La Ramba and the bathroom had a jacuzzi and the bed was adjustable. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Can't fault this hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the MonteCarlo”
Reviews.Author: D&G1
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for our first anniversary and stayed at the Monte Carlo. We stayed in a lovely room with our own jacuzzi.. which was great. The room overlooked the "la Ramblas" yet we were never disturbed by the hustle and bustle of the city. There are lots of cafes nearby and the Barcelona market is only 100 metres down the street. The location is great. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “MonteCarlo quiet oasis on a busy street”
Reviews.Author: Whiskerskip
Reviews.Content: Date Oct 28, 2006 We stayed only one night at the Hotel Montecarlo but would certainly be comfortable here for a week or longer. The staff is attentive, helpfull and polite. The rooms were quiet and clean. Even though the hotel is located directly on busy Las Rambles it is very quiet inside. There is an elevator to take you and your luggage to your floor.The Hotel is centrally located within walking distance to many areas of interest. The staff recommended Ciutat Condal located just North of Placa de Catalunya for an evening meal of tapas and it was a wonderful experience. There is a supermarket "Carrefour" located across the street from the hotel that is handy. Even though this was a short stay we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best”
Reviews.Author: Joannecam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Monte Carlo on the northern part of Las Ramblas, and therefore within walking distance of everything. I had splurged on a room with a Jacuzzi because I can get my husband to do almost any amount of shopping and sightseeing if he knows there is a Jacuzzi bath for him at the end of the day (we honestly walked well over 30 miles in three days, the poor guy). The room was lovely and included a bedroom, a small living area and a huge bathroom. As nice as the room was, it was nothing compared to the level of service from the staff who were universally kind and attentive. I usually do not return to the same hotel just because I like to try something different, but when I return to Barcelona, I will go nowhere other than the Hotel Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Regene
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Barcelona on Nov. 04. We stayed in Hotel Montecarlo for three days and felt so welcome and warm from the Hotel every time when we were back to the Hotel after a long stroll in town. The hotel location is excellent, right in the middle of the old town, and there is a big supermarket, Carrefour, right across the Hotel, which makes everything convenient. There are only 3-minute walking distance from Placa De Catalunya. The Hotel staff is rated absolutely 5-star. They are very helpful and warm from the start to the end of our stay. There are only less than 60 rooms in this Hotel so an early reservation is needed. They deserve every penny of the price.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: happydancer
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with the Montecarlo. It is very conveniently located and the entrance and ground floor are charming. The staff at reception were very helpful, particularly when we unexpectedly had to extend our stay from 4 nights to 7 due to an unfortunate accident. The room, although it had no view, was very comfortable and completely quiet, despite the hotel's location on a busy street - La Rambla. There is a charming roof top from which we watched fireworks. The breakfast was excellent, although, at 15 euros, a lttle expensive (as hotel breakfasts often are).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: dawnchorus
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel. I booked it after reading reviews here and have to say was not disappointed. This has got to be the best hotel room we have stayed in. It was huge and our 11 year old daughter loved her platform bed in the sitting area. She had to be dragged out of the jacuzzi bath every afternoon. We had a Sarria room and everything about it was amazing, adjustable beds, jacuzzi bath, bathrobes and slippers, the list goes on. The hotel staff were the friendliest and most helpful of any hotel we have stayed in, nothing was too much trouble for them and we were all quite sad to leave! We would definitely return and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others. This hotel deserves to be far more than a three star. By the way Barcelona is an amazing city and we felt safe at all times. The food, people and sights were first rate.

Reviews.Title: “A big gem of a little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: malousadiua
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from 18-24th of Sept. 2006. We loved the positon of the hotel in Las Ramblas, right in the middle of the action! You could walk to the sights, great shopping at the Passeig de Gracia... a great place from where to explore the city. The hotel facade is so pretty that tourists frequently stop and take pictures, especially at night. The room itself was furnished very well. It was a mini suite, very roomy with a big, comfortable bathroom. It had a jacuzzi tub/shower and a bidet. All is great at this hotel but the greatest thing was our BED!!! It was the most comfortable, the best bed I have ever slept in all my life! That coming from a veritable Princess (as in Princess and the Pea!) This bed was to die for. It was one of those adjustable beds where you could lift the top of the bed, the bottom of the bed, and adjust it to everywhere in between. Each side of the bed is completely adjustable! Not only that, the mattress was not too hard, not too soft, it was just right! The sheets were just the right softness, not too starchy, and the pillows were incredible. I wanted to ship home the whole kit and caboodle! The sheets, the pillows, the adjustable bed, everything! I was ready to trade in my Tempurpedic bed at home to get this particular bed and sheets. I tried to figure out which manufacturer made the sheets but they were unmarked. I did buy the best sheets at El Corte Ingles but they were not as good.(I got to try them out at home later.) I couldn't wait to get into the gloriousness of this bed every night. It was unbelievably good. Needless to say, everything else about Barcelona followed ensuite. The best restaurants-La Barceloneta and Botafumiero. Don't waste your money on Jean Luc Figueras, that was a total waste of 200+ Euros. We couldn't get into Huffman at all. Remember to ask for the adjustable bed when you book! Look no further, this is the best moderately priced hotel in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: grooveo
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel, but that was about it. The service was just ok, and the breakfast is horrible and overpriced. The beds are uncomfortable, but the hydro-therapy is wonderful after long days on Las Ramblas. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: GoWorm
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the Hotel Monte Carlo and it was a wonderful experience. Besides "location, location, location"; it had the most friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful staff. They helped us with our travel arrangements and allowed us to store part of our luggage there while we went to Southern Spain for several days as we realized there would not be enough room for all our luggage. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but the staff made our stay one of the best on our two week trip. I look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: MegP
Reviews.Content: All the reviews say it. Our room was lovely, all needs met, beautiful decor, central location. Good value for money. Definitely will go back and have recommended it already to several people. Tip - go across to the market and have your breakfast at the counter there! Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharrie
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on recommendations from previous reviewers and was not disappointed. As it was our 30th wedding anniversary we treated ourselves to 4 nights in a Sarria de luxe room overlooking La Rambla. Very comfortable room with lovely bathroom. As others have said, La Rambla is very noisy but once double sliding doors are closed it really is very quiet. All of the staff were helpful and courteous. What more can I say - we would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jill_2k6
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Hotel Montecarlo in Barcelona. We went to celebrate my 40th birthday. The hotel was beautiful to look at as we arrived and we were not disappointed with the inside. The hotel staff were very friendly and attentive, after arriving in our room we received a bottle of Cava and chocolate truffles from the management to celebrate my birthday. The room was excellent, we had a balcony overlooking La Rambla, lovely bedroom with comfortable bed, small lounge and fantastic bathroom with jaccuzi and large shower. The hotel was very clean, lovely white fluffy towels, bathrobes and slippers. We really enjoyed Barcelona and would recommend the Tourist Bus, one day costs 18 euros and two days 22 euros. We only had breakfast once in the hotel and there was plenty of choice and the staff were friendly. The other mornings we had breakfast at one of the many street cafes which was just as enjoyable. Thank you to all the staff at Hotel Montecarlo for making my 40th birthday treat so special.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Happytravellers_r_us
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 3 nights at the Montecarlo at the end of June. The hotel was fabulous. The staff were always really friendly and full of advice of places to see and eat. We had a good size room with the most enormous jacuzzi tub, which was brilliant!! Our balcony was right over Las Ramblas, but with the double doors, we didn't hear a peep at night. The location is ideal for those looking to experience the best of Barcelona. It's right in the centre of town and close to the Metro station too. We took siestas in the afternoon because it was so hot - reaching 40 degrees one afternoon. We headed up to the sun terrace at Hotel Montecarlo and made ourselves comfortable on a lounger for an hour or so. The views of the city from up there were beautiful and the sun terrace was lovely. Barcelona was a great city, and despite being warned about pickpockets, had no trouble. This wasn't to say that we weren't careful - we were exceptionally careful over our bags, but this would be the same in any major city. Be warned - nothing really gets going until about 10am there, so don't plan for really early starts as nothing will be open! We got on a hop-on, hop-off bus with a company called Barcelona Tours (big orange buses). These definitely seemed better as the other large bus company because it was one long route, instead of 2 smaller ones, and instead of having a tour guide speaking in 5 languages for every building you pass, you get a pair of headsets and plug into the bus. You can then choose the language that you want to listen to the pre-recorded tourist info in. If you stay here, there is a small Cerveseria on the opposite side of Las Ramblas and a bit closer to Placa Catalunya which did an excellent pain au chocolat and a mean cup of coffee to get you started in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Montecarlo, Barcelona-Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracyq
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my vacation to Barcelona, Spain. After thoroughly researching hotels in the area I decided to book with the Montecarlo, which based on reading other reviews, met my expectations. The hotel lobby was very nice, the room was small but clean and we had a great view of las rambla from our balcony. The location of the hotel was great since we were right in the center of the area, most of what we wanted to do and see was within walking distance. Generally the front desk staff were very helpful with suggestions for where to eat and go out etc. We never ate at the hotel since there were so many options so close by so I can't comment on the food there. The only dissapointment with the hotel was the Internet access which was limited-I was never able to open or send any emails from my hotmail account. Also remember to bring your own travel iron as the hotel does not have one.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dct_toronto
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Great location, great room with a beautiful bathroom and excellent service. Free internet access on a computer in the lobby too!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay! Comfortable, close to the fun!”
Reviews.Author: maw8
Reviews.Content: After touring Spain for a week it was a wonderful treat to stay in such a comfortable, quiet, happening place. The beds were fabulous and so was the bedding! We had a room overlooking Las Ramblas which is a very noisy place. However, the double-paned, double doored sliding doors worked like a charm. We heard no noise coming off the street. Our room was very nicely appointed and the AC was perfect. The weather was over 100 degrees each day so we really needed the relief from the heat. The Front Desk clerks were always super friendly, available, and knowlegible about the places we wanted to visit. There was never a backup. They all spoke English very, very well. The plumbing was quiet and the amenities were definitely four star. They can't get a higher rating because there is no restaurant and no pool but, hey, I was so very, very comfortable and food was VERY available on Las Ramblas that those weren't issues for me. I'd highly recommend staying on Las Ramblas because it's such a happening place. Yes, I held my purse close to me at all times but I did that everywhere in Spain. I loved all the fun street performers at all hours of the day or night. It was the best show in town for just a few euros in tips! We ate at a WONDERFUL tapas place called La Lluna that is about a block away. It is open only for lunch but at about 12 euros a person it is not only a fabulous deal but the BEST meal we had in Spain. The hop-on-hop-off bus was disappointing. It was very, very hot on the top of the bus and the lines were so long you didn't really want to get off. I felt it didn't really go very close to anything but the Gaudi houses which is maybe 1/2 hour of the tour, the rest of the 1.5 hours of the drive on the red line is just driving up and down to drop people at the different stops that are a block or more away so you really couldn't take a peek while you were on the bus. I would say that it was worth doing but do it only for one day. Once the summer lines slow down it might be fine. Due to the location on this busy street the taxi drivers have to drop you off across from the hotel. It wasn't a problem for my friend and I since we only had one bag each. We didn't have to walk far at all. However, if you're traveling with more bags than you can carry yourself you might rethink staying here. I LOVED this hotel and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, horrible location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time to Barcelona for hubby and I. Liked the Hotel Monte Carlo - modern entrance, staff excellent, large rooms. However, I hated the location. La Rambla is filled with pickpockets, theives and gypsies...I hated being on that street. I noticed pickpockets stand outside the doors of the hotel and follow guests out...It was pretty scary. If you like safety, I would highly recommend a hotel on the Gran Via Passieg de la Gracia - the big street with all the expensive stores. My husband and I felt very safe dining and shopping there. No pickpockets in site! Besides the location, I found our washroom not to be cleaned well (hair all over the floor upon arrival!). I didn't like that at all. However, the rooms were large and the adjustable beds were amazing! I want to buy one for home now! So there were some pros and cons. Nice hotel, but next time, I would spend a bit more money to stay in a safer area. I guess it's personal preference...

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel was peaceful and friendly but completely convenient. Staff were always friendly and helpful and all spoke english. We were fortunate enough to get an upgraded room and it had a range of extras from electrically operated beds to a jakuzzi bath. On arrival we were provided with a map and shown how to get to the main points of interest for us, service was discreet but constant. The location was second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: funaway
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with all the positive reviews. From the time of our arrival until the end of our 3 night stay ( 06/14-06/17) in Barcelona could not find anything negative to say about the place. Fantanstic location near the top of La Rambla, near plaza Cataluniya (sorry for the spelling), probably the best location possible, for us. Great room with a little balcony facing La Rambla, more like a suite, really, with a foyer, small living area and a huge bathroom w/ jacuzzi. 4 sets of dual glazed aluminum sliding doors blocking all the noise, not 2 as many reviews stated. In-room safe, minibar, sweet wine and chocolates on our arrival. The room was basic but charming. Everything we needed steps away, including Starbucks. Barcelona is a gorgeous and safe city. Charm and atmosphere at least on par with places like Rome. No purse snatching or pickpocket incidents to report. Great restaurants which are reasonably priced. In smaller shops on La Rambla (basically a tourist center) always ask about the price before you buy, or chances are you will be overcharged. Agree on the price with taxi drivers before you get in. Our cab driver decided to overcharge us 10 euros on a way back to the airport. There were 4 euros on the meter when we got in, plus he wanted 7 euros surcharge for our 3 bags. About 10 euros more than what we paid on the way to the hotel. And no matter what, STAY AWAY from money exchange booths on La Rambla, especially the two which are located to the right of the hotel, on the same side of the street, on the way to Plaza Catalunya. The posted exchange rate in columns 1 and 2, already a little high, is misleading, since it only refers to sums of 6,000 euros or larger. Exchange rate for smaller sums is typically in small hard to see letters which refer to columns (typically 3, 4, or 5) with higher rates. In one of the places I mentioned the lady wanted to charge me 18% commission which she immediately agreed to reduce to 5%. I would not pay 5% and moved on to the one next door, a little closer to the hotel. In that exchange booth I pointed to the column which indicated $1.33 per euro and asked if that is the rate and if it included the commission. The lady at the counter said "yes". The official exchange rate that day was $ 1.259 per 1 euro. But when I handed her $ 300 she exchanged it at $1.42 per 1 euro. After my immediate protests, she refused to return my $300 (she probably already spent $ 30 she ripped off from me in her mind), pointing to the column which indicated $ 1.58 per 1 euro, saying she gave me $1.42 rate instead of $ 1.58 as a favor. Small writing behind her (you couldn't even see it when she was sitting down) indicated that column to apply for exchanges under 6,000 euros. I decided not to get ripped off on principle and was able to get my money back with the help of 2 policemen which were passing by. The only reason I got my money back was that $ 1.42 per 1 euro rate did not appear in any column. The best rate I could get in Barcelona was $ 1.33 per 1 euro, including commission, from a bank. My worst experiences in exchanging currency were in Spain, particularly in Barcelona. Overall, the people are nice and there is plenty to see and do in that beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: campus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect! Our rooms were rooms were a nice size, very quiet, clean and the whirlpool bathtub was an added bonus. The staff at the front desk spoke excellent English and always seemed glad to help you with any problem. The breakfast was delicious and the young lady who waited on us was cheerful and helpful. The location of the hotel was great and near the subway. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Everyone is Royalty at the Hotel Montecarlo”
Reviews.Author: fsayed
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two very short days and nights at the Hotel Montecarlo. It is a beautiful hotel. The front desk personnel were wonderful. They pointed us in the right direction everytime. They even met my request for a restaurant that was not touristy but was a restaurant for Spainards. The room was richly appointed. And because it was our Honeymoon they sweetly placed a congratulatory bottle of champagne in our room. The location was perfect, right on La Rambla and everything was within walking distance. I will definitely stay here again when I visit Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great Location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: otiv711
Reviews.Content: Hotel Montecarlo is a nice hotel located right on Las Ramblas, the main thoroughfare in Barcelona. The rooms are spacious and very clean, with a television, air conditioning and a safe. The staff is very helpful, and all speak excellent English. I would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanLowe
Reviews.Content: The hotel Montecarlo is perfectly positioned for the centre of Baracelona being halfway down the Ramblas, ideal for shopping, sight seeing and Port Vell. We arrived very late as due a thunderstorm we were rerouted to Gerona airport. The hotel upgraded our room as we had had such a bad start to our break! The room was lovely with a jacuzzi bath and motorised bed which could raise your legs or back up. We had a view over a courtyard at the back of the hotel which was lovely and quiet and very pretty. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times (even three in the morning!) and could speak good english. Overall the hotel is modern in style with good facilities, friendly staff all for a very reasonable price (155 euro a night)I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Hotel Montecarlo. I speak Spanish fluently, but most of the staff spoke excellent English. Though we arrived late in the evening, they held a beautiful room with a balcony for us, which we soon thought would be a terrible mistake. Knowing nothing of football, we hadn’t realized that we arrived on the night of the European Cup – promising riotous crowds whether Barcelona won or lost. Once Barcelona did win, La Rambla went absolutely crazy. We watched, amused, from the balcony as 100,000+ fans streamed on the streets below, complete with fireworks, air horns, and drums. We feared a sleepless night, but the second we closed both of the sliding glass doors, the room was silent. The only noise heard was the firework finale, and even that was quite muted. For me, peace and quiet is paramount in a hotel, and I think the Montecarlo passed the ultimate test that night! As a nod towards the city of Barcelona, they seem quiet apt at handling crowd control, and the streets were spotless the next day! The room itself was exceptional, particularly by European standards. It was large and the beds quite comfortable. The bathroom was amazing, with plenty of space and a whirlpool tub which feet incredible on sore walking feet. As already mentioned, the staff was good, as was the restaurant ‘Attic’ (next door) that they recommended. The location could not be better, right in the middle of La Rambla. Both younger women, we never felt apprehensive walking around the area late at night, which was safe and always full of people. Though we didn’t have any problems with pickpocketers, a couple we met at dinner had their wallets stolen in the metro station. As long as you are alert and aware of your belongings, however, don’t let all of the warnings worry you. The hotel is admittedly expensive – the most of the seven we stayed in throughout Spain. There are plenty of other hotels on La Rambla, and many of them looked nice as well, so do your homework. If you don’t mind paying a bit more, however, I doubt you’ll be disappointed with the Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel Thankyou Trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In February I went to trip advisor site to check out some hotels I could book through my Cruise line post cruise. I am so glad I did because all of the hotels got poor reviews and they were all pricey. I found the highest rated hotel on the site was the Montecarlo on La Rambla. I immediately tried to book....3 sites were sold out and I got the last room on a forth site. Pricing was a few Euros less than the other hotels the Cruise line offered. We arrived early staff was lovely and we had a room in less than 20 minutes. The room was more like a mini suite with a huge bathroom and Jaccuzi tub. Since the hotel is on a busy street they have special noiseproof blinds that adjust by remote.. They had excellent security and free internet in the lobby. Location is great. This hotel exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Montecarlo almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: hermitcrabFrance
Reviews.Content: We booked a saria room, and also requested a quiet room.W e were at the side/back and that was fine, wonderful shutters operated from the beds so kept us quiet and dark easily. The saria was a delight, a lovely little sitting area with a sound system so we bought a CD or two to relax too, great bathroom with jacuzzi bath, small dressing area with hanging space etc.And a decent size bedroom with twin beds that elevated at feet and head. This was perfect for my husband who has arthritic ankles, as was the position of the hotel, near everything. The breakfasts were somewhat expensive and disappointing, bad coffee and lack of fresh fruit, breads etc very good and freshly squeezed orange juice was terrific, so it should be in Spain! We sat and read in in the Grand Salon with its overdecorated 19th C style and Corbusier furniture, a pleasing contrast.The bar was neither here nor there, but we had a brandy on the house and good service at all times. The 2 day bus hop- on -and -hop- off ticket is good value and gives you the lie of the land for return individual trips, we didn't hop and off as the queues were very long, an hour for the first bus, because it was the May bank holiday. Ate at the Seven Doors near the harbour, Okish, at two or three local places in the Ramblas, very relaxing and one big treat at the Casa Calvi. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expecting too much?”
Reviews.Author: Chrisandlynne
Reviews.Content: After reading all the eulogistic reviews of the Hotel Montecarlo, perhaps we were expecting a little too much of this good (but not fantastic) hotel. We came away a little deflated but well rested after a 3 night stay. Firstly, the positives - The frontdesk staff were attentive, helpful and knowledgable. The room was clean (but see other comments later), the towels and robes very comfortable and the jacuzzi bath good fun. The adjustable bed was very good for elevating the feet after a long walking day. The hotel's position halfway along La Rambla is perfect. Now the disappointments - The room (403) was very small with no dressing table nor mirror, except in the bathroom where it was regularly steamed up. Tea / coffee making facilities would have been nice also. The carpet was very badly marked and stained including several cigarette burns. The furniture was cheap, shoddy and likewise stained. Our window view was of a blank wall 10m away. We asked to be moved and offered to pay for an upgrade but the hotel was full. We paid 190 Euros for the room per night directly booked with the hotel. The bar was very basic, lacked comfort and atmosphere. It was rarely staffed so you had to interupt the frontdesk for service. Here I admit to being ultra-critical and this probably doesn't matter to most people. However, we like to have a relaxing glass of beer or wine at the end of the day and in the evenings. All in all it was a fairly pleasant place to stay (no better than that) and a deluxe room, rather than basic, is definately recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Just back from a 3 days stay there and could not recommend it more. The staff are so helpful and just make things easy. It's right in the heart of the city on La Rambla where there is always plenty of life around. The rooms are comfortable and very quiet with the double windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robertlb
Reviews.Content: I would agree with the previous reviews, this is the place to stay. Everyone in the hotel tries very hard to please. Excellent location and service. You cannot go wrong staying here. They have even sound proofed the rooms facing the Rambla. We stayed in a room with a balcony facing the Rambla and experienced no noise problems. It was actually nice to see the activity going on below.

Reviews.Title: “First class, STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Area_Local
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights over Easter. Hotel staff wonderful and great location. Our room was on the third floor overlooking La Rambla very quiet with the two sets of double glazed doors closed. Our room was very clean and spacious with a jacuzzi bath. The market of Sant Josep across La Rambla is a must for breakfast, pastries and fresh fruit. Two day pass on the tourist bus for 22 Euros is well worth it. Its well worth reading Tripadvisor reviews for hints and tips before you travel. We did this and saved many hours and Euros. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Everything They Say Is True!”
Reviews.Author: jwb_ireland
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend break in Barcelona and we stayed 3 nights at the Montecarlo. We had a Gracia room on the 4th floor at a rate of 224 euro per night (not including breakfast). The hotel is in a fantastic location - right on Las Ramblas and just a quick walk from the centre of the action - Placa Catalunya. Las Ramblas is a just a continuous sea of people, traders, street entertainers and is, iniitally, a little overwhelming. But, step inside the door of Hotel Montecarlo and it's an oasis of calm and silence. The staff are all incredibly friendly and courteous - and they all speak perfect English. Honestly, I've only experienced a similar level of consistent service at a 5-star hotel. The room was huge - large enough sleeping area and a separate seating/lounge room. Two TVs! A CD/FM unit! A jacuzzi in the bathroom! Is this really a 3-star hotel??? Oh - free internet access from each room and an internet-enabled PC in the lobby! Yes...the crack between the 2 beds can be a little annoying but no big deal to be honest. Las Ramblas is a noisy, bustling street but, from the room, we couldn't hear a thing. If you are going to Barcelona - stay at this hotel! It's as good as all the other reviews say!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Oldskoolskater
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the strength of reviews on this site, and was not disappointed at all. The hotel is every bit as excellent as people say it is, and the staff could not do enough for us when we arrived for a special occasion. Location is perfect for attractions and transport and like other people I wondered how this could possibly be a 3 star hotel?? We were on the 4th floor in a sants room that was facing onto la rambla, so had a balcony to watch the world go by from. There have been comments about noise but the balconies have TWO sets of double glazed doors to shut out noise from the outside world. The only thing we heard was the occasional siren from emergency service vehicles passing by. If I had to find a flaw, the only thing I could come up with is that you may end up in the gap between the two mattresses on the double bed as both sides are adjustable! I also found the night staff to be not as fluent in English as the day staff, but it was better than my Spanish. I will definitely going back as soon as I can..

Reviews.Title: “As good as they all say.”
Reviews.Author: traveller34
Reviews.Content: Has it all been said??? Lovely modern hotel, friendly helpful staff and a great location. Just thought I'd add my agreement to all the previous reviews. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Choice”
Reviews.Author: CattleAnn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short break in Barcelona – the Hotel Montecarlo was indeed an excellent choice. Close to Placa de Catalunya (bus stops etc.) and right on the Ramblas. This must have been the friendliest front desk of any European hotel we’ve used. Booked directly with hotel by e-mail. Asked if we could leave luggage until check in time as we were on an early flight, very pleasantly surprised to find room ready for us on arrival. Especially asked for high floor, Ramblas-facing, and we were given a fabulous front (Sarria) room on the fifth floor. It must have been 40+ft long – two televisions, a table and chairs, very large bathroom with Jacuzzi bath, great shower, double wash-basins and even an exercise bike! Widely spaced double glazing at window combined with blackout linings made for very peaceful nights. Previous reviewers have mentioned the metro noise and I’m sure this is far more noticeable on lower floors, but the trains only run between 5.00am and midnight and the ‘rumbles’ only last for about 4 seconds each time, and not all that frequently. Far less of a problem than noisy traffic would be for example. It is true that you do need to be alert in Barcelona – we were walking along by the beach in the middle of the day and were suddenly more or less surrounded by a small group of young men who appeared from nowhere. They were extending their hands as if to shake hands and were speaking in (poor) English. We assertively moved on and they fortunately did not pursue. If they had, we suspect the best form of defence would have been to yell very loudly to attract the attention of other people. The police are in evidence all over the city on foot, in patrol cars and on motorbikes, but of course they can’t be everywhere all of the time. It is also quite good advice to try not to look too much like a tourist. It is after all a city, so you blend in far more in normal casual clothes than in obvious “holiday” garb. Taxis were excellent – plentiful, and not as expensive as London. Easy to use from the airport and as traffic was not particularly heavy we paid only €22.50. We also used them within the city and found them very reasonably priced and some of the drivers are very happy to point out the sights along the way. Example – Port area to Parc Guell €8.50. Bus Turistic also very easy and great way to see a lot of the city – best value is the 2 day ticket at €22 per person. Lots of quite poor restaurants around, but did especially enjoy a lunch in the Port Vell area – La Gavina, by the sea. Not cheap, but delicious seafood. Should probably have asked hotel for recommendations – they’d almost certainly have been genuine. Many thanks Trip Advisor and reviewers – another great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Montecarlo is outstanding. After taking the overnight train from Seville, we arrived at the hotel around 9:30 am. To our surprise, we were able to get a room immediately. The staff spoke excellent English and were extremely professional and helpful, immediately taking care of any request we had. The location couldn't be better, right on Las Ramblas. The room was very spacious with a large bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. For a great light meal,breakfast or lunch, it was great to wander down to the large market and get beautiful large fresh strawberries and wonderful pastries from the vendors.

Reviews.Title: “Best 3 stars I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: How this hotel is only a 3 stars is beyond me. I would say this is more like a 4 star hotel and certainly the best 3 star hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff are very helpful, professional and friendly. The decor is very tasteful, the location is great, the price is very good value, the mini bar was very reasonably priced, the hotel was exceptionally clean and the rooms were very quiet for such a centrally located hotel. I would certainly return to and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hutchy100
Reviews.Content: Just back froma 3 night stay at this lovely Hotel. On entrance it is cool and calming, with very efficient and helpful staff. We were shown to our room, which was at the back of the hotel, with a brilliant view of the cathedral out of our window! The room was very large and airy, with a beautiful marble bathroom, with jacuzzi bath. They provide you with large white fluffy towels, bathrobes and slipper too! The room has queen size twin beds with electric leavers to elevate your legs back etc, the maids came every day to clean and tidy up and during the evening tturn your beds sheets and leave you chocolates!purfect! The reception staff were very friendly anf helpful with recommendations of restaurants etc. Only down side, there were no tea/coffee making facilities (am I being typically british here to expect that?). but this will not deter us from returning! A perfect stay at alovely and relaxing hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kmainprize
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful short break at the Montecarlo Hotel in Barcelona. The hotel is situated on the Ramblas so you are at the heart of the action instantly. We weren't in a room that faced the Ramblas so we were not affected by any noise from the street. In fact the rooms were so well sound proofed you could think you were the only ones staying there. The room was immaculate. We paid 109 euros a night and were not disappointed by the standard. The bed was a double, extremely comfortable and adjustable at the top and bottom by remote control. All necessary toiletries were provided (soap, shower gel, shampoo/conditioner, body lotion and a shoe shine.) Bathrobes and slippers also provided. The bathroom was spotless with a Jacuzzi bath which was very relaxing after a hard day’s sightseeing. The staff were excellent. Their English was great. They gave good advice on buses, trips etc, and nearby places of interest. They were very friendly with a good sense of humour. The breakfast was simple but very nice. (Hot/cold meats, sausage, eggs, hot/cold breads, toast, yoghurts, fruit, cheese/biscuits, tea, coffee, fruit juice) Plenty shops surround the area as do buildings and statues of interest. The harbour is a 10 minute walk away and worth a visit. The bus station is only 5 minutes away, at the top of the street, along with taxi rank. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. We found the Attic (2 doors down) to be a favourite in the area. The food was excellent and presented very well. The staff were very professional but polite and friendly. You do need to book for an evening meal though as it is very popular. The bar was very quiet and closed at 11. This wasn’t a problem to me but there are plenty of bars around that are open later and are much livelier, for anyone wanting to party into the night. There is an English bar just up the road from the hotel (on the opposite side) which had a great atmosphere and plenty of seating if you wanted to end the night on a few beers. The street artists/ human statues were great; just make sure you take a camera with you as some of them are fantastic. They are well worth the small change you drop into their pot. We were not aware of any pick pocketing going on around us and did not feel threatened walking down the side streets even at night. We hope to return to Barcelona in the Autumn and visit more places of interest. We will definitely stay in the Montecarlo again.

Reviews.Title: “3 Great Nights at this Perfectly Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews from this site, my wife and I spent 3 nights at the Montecarlo at the start of our honeymoon. The hotel was so clean it had an operating room feel to it. Then again, the minimal decoration could lend to this also. The staff was extremely welcoming, friendly, spoke great English and helped us with map questions or resturaunt recommendations. The jucuzzi tub was a great welcome after many hours of sightseeing and with Las Ramblas at your doorstep, one need only step through the door in order to find something to do. The beds were the most comfortable in all of our hotel stays in Spain. We didn't have the trouble of a 'split' mattress, except that ours was a craftmatic adujustable (who knew they still made them!). The hotel's location, cleanliness and great staff make this a perfect place to stay. The metro station (Catalunya) is a short 2 blocks or so and the harbour about 5-8 minutes. And although no one said anything about a rooftop, the stairs up offer a nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: JMThomas
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in Barcelona to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. Choose this hotel after seeing previous, postive, reviews. We booked directly with the hotel so paid 155 euros a night - not particularly cheap but having done some research this did seem a fairly average rate for such a central location. The hotel has nice decor - the photos on the website do not exagerate how nice it is. The room we were given was quiet, as we had requested (not facing Las Ramblas) and very nice - especially the bathroom with the jacuzzi bath. The staff were very helpful and even recommended (and booked) a great restaurant for us on the Sunday evening - many of the places we had been recommended by friends were not open on Sunday so we were especially pleased with this assistance as it was our anniversary on the Sunday night. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel - for its location and ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to our Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before starting a cruise, and it was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and beautiful, and they were able to keep the luggage for our group (45 pieces) secure for the morning while we were out in the city.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is the businness”
Reviews.Author: bonnieIreland
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 day stay at the Montecarlo, picked this hotel based on the reviews of 'TRIPADVISOR', and have to agreed with all the reviewers, you will not be disappointed with this hotel. The reception staff very helpful, trying to trace my missing suitcase, making all the phone calls to the airport. We had a very quite room at the back, very restful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MTL_Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights based on the great reviews here, and was pleasantly surprised...especially considering I booked at a great rate of 109 Euros a night. I really enjoyed my experience at this hotel, and would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to be in the heart of the tourist area. The rooms were quiet except for one night when Barcelona beat Madrid in football, but I guess that's to be expected! I stayed in mid-November though, and would imagine that in the peak tourist months, this hotel would not be ideal for someone wanting to sleep at night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Esqbaby
Reviews.Content: We got a rate of 109 Euros per night at this hotel. The location is wonderful - right on Las Ramblas, in the center of all the action. The people working there were very nice, helpful, etc. The rooms were a great value - the bathroom was huge with a nice jacuzzi in it. All in all, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SHBD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel MonteCarlo from Oct 10 - 13, 2005 for our Honeymoon after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. We took the Aerobus for 3.60 Euros per person to Playa de Catalunya. It was a 5 minute walk to the hotel on La Rambla. The hotel is in a great location and very easy to find after a long day of exploring. We had room 412 facing La Rambla. It was great to open the balcony door and listen to the activity going on below us. Very quiet with the glass door closed. The room was very nice and clean. Bathroom was a good size with jacuzzi tub. We had a little sitting room area. The beds were sooo comfortable. Having the adjustable feature was nice for reading in bed. As many already mentioned it can get a bit uncomfortable if you end up in the crack as the beds are two double beds pushed together. We received a bottle of Champagne for our honeymoon which we enjoyed very much. We did not have breakfast at the Hotel. Instead, there is a supermarket across from the Hotel where we bought fruit and yogurt for breakfast and enjoyed it on the Solarium on the 6th floor. Our only complaint would be that we were charged an additional night as we got bumped on our connecting flight and did not make it in to Barcelona until the following day. I was able to email the Hotel from the airport as soon as we knew we could not make the flight but because we had missed their 24 hour cancellation window by about 6 hours, they charged us anyway and would not budge. We would however, definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! I stayed here last weekend with my 80-year old mother and the staff couldn't have been nicer. They spoke excellent English and recommended and booked restaurants for us (all of which we would go to again). The hotel was spotlessly clean and the bathrooms were fabulous. We had booked 2 single rooms, but were given double rooms (along with two of everything!). View out of the window was a blank wall, but who cares when you don't spend much time in the room? Breakfasts were great - including cooked breakfasts, freshly baked pastries, loads of different breads, freshly squeezed orange juice and excellent coffee. The hotel is situated right on the Ramblas, so you are close to everything. If you are there for only a short time, take a trip on the Tourist Bus - it takes you to all the sights, and you can hop on and off whenever you fancy it. It gives you a really good feel for the city. You also get a book of discount vouchers for all the main sights, so you could even re-coup the cost of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo beautiful family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay at Monte Carlo Hotel in Barcelona was very good. It is on La Ramblas which may not be for everybody, But it's fun and the access is good. Opted for the deluxe room and it was impressive, virtually a suite with a huge whirlpool tub. Did not opt for breakfast so cannot comment on that but public areas are also impressive. Frienldy and helpfull staff. Across from the Meridien to keep the location in perspective. Lot's of nearby dining choices. One negative is European use of twins to make up a double/queen bed. Some do it better than others but it is annoying. Loved this hotel and Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent<< Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MrSnow
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at Hotel Montecarlo, October 3, 2005 through October 9, 2005, for 7 nights. It was absolutely FANTASTIC. We have traveled for many years in Europe, and this hotel, by far, has got to be our best experience. From the minute we saw the beautiful outside of this hotel we knew it had to be wonderful inside as well. From the 1st greeting at the reception desk, it only got better. The hotel staff were of the highest professional team I have encountered in any hotel, both in the USA and Europe. We chose one of the superior rooms, with balcony facing "La Rambla" on the fourth floor. It was HUGE, with large bedroom, private sitting room complete with TV, easy chairs, cocktail table, that could be closed off completely from the bedroom to allow someone the privacy if they choose to rest while others watch the TV. The bathroom was gigantic, with double sink, sunken jacuzzi tub, an extra large shower, with high-tech water massage jets, which offered about 6 different settings for your pleasure. Also, in the bathroom there were amenities such as,, plush bathrobes and slippers, an exercise cycle, scales, bath salts for the jacuzzi, and wonderful , soaps, shampoos, lotions, after shave, and several other "personal items", that were thoughtful for the jet set traveller. The room included 2 TV's, 3 telephones, mini bar, secure safe inside closet for valubles, remote control beds with head and foot adjustments, and a balcony which offered an excellent view of the street below, and of Barcelona. The doors to the balcony are double paned glass, consisting of 2 sets of sliding doors,, offering complete quiet, and solace in your room once they are closed. The bar and breakfast area off of the main lobby are tastefully designed and decorated. We did not take the breakfast on any mornings, however I wished we would have tried it at least once, for I am sure it was equally wonderful. The thing that was most noticeable of all these wonderful assests, was the extreme courtesy, and professional staff, who paid every minute attention to your needs. I will stay at Hotel Montecarlo, again, and again, when returning to Barcelona. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona, that wants to make their visit to this wonderful city, all that more memorable. Feel free to contact me direct , if I may offer any other information. Michael

Reviews.Title: “Refinement, quality and great value”
Reviews.Author: Dmun
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and everything was perfect. Clean, modern, well presented and spacious rooms. It is a hotel with some history that has been tastefully modernised. Perfect. The hotel has real touch of class and is not too big - which means that the staff know who you are and make sure your needs are met fully without being intrusive. The language skills of the staff are excellent - speaking a range of languages. Nothing was ever too much bother for the staff - I cannot praise them enough. Check-in and check-out was very smooth. The sun terrace on the roof was a nice touch and offered a chance to relax outdoors. The public areas/ lifts/ bar etc are immaculate. Free internet access in the lobby is a bonus but you may need to wait as there is only 1 PC. The location is excellent on La Rambla. Right between 2 metro stops and close to Catalunya Square. Some travel reviews of Barcelona paint a grim/ dangerous picture of the marina/ beach area and the bottom end of La Rambla. I guess these journalists have never stepped far outside Kensington on their travels. These areas are also fantastic. Never saw any problems with crime etc and can testify that there has been a high level of investment in these areas and that they are lovely. Sound proofing in the room was excellent as we never heard any noises from the main street. We had a room with a jacuzi, robes, marble floor in the bathroom etc. Although I did not see the next room down in price I would probably not pay the extra £35 per night next time as I'm sure the other rooms are also great. I would definitely go back to Barcelona and would definitely recomend the Montecarlo. Loads of great places to eat in Barcelona but it does pay to get away from La Rambla if possible as the quality seems to improve for the same prices. Went to see FC Barcelona play in the Champions league - it was easy to get tickets even on the day of the game by buying them at the stadium (pices from 28 euros per seat - we bought excellent seat fro 46 euros each).

Reviews.Title: “this is the one!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: spent the last part of the vacation in Barcelona. Monte Carlo was the place to cap off a perfect trip. The staff were helpful and very polite. Ask for room 308, it was very quiet and deluxe from the moment you step in the room. And it's hard to beat the location. Just two doors down is a fantastic restaurant (The Attic), a recommendation from the friendly staff, Fabio, at the front desk. R&K

Reviews.Title: “Good value !”
Reviews.Author: Members
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the beginning of October after reading the previous reviews. Well presented building from the front which looks good at night. Stayed in Pedralbes Room (room 104) which exceeded our expectations for a 3* hotel. Very clean & spacious, good bathroom, a little tight on wardrobe space but okay for short stays. The room has a nice little private decked terrace at the rear of the hotel so is away from Ramblas and quiet, good for some fresh air ! Very good staff. The room could do with its own tea / coffee making facilities. The hotel is about two thirds of the way up Ramblas (right opposite Le Meridien) so not as much hustle and bustle as the bottom end near the marina. The hotel has no restaurant but when in Barcelona your probably going to be out and about anyway and there is plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: becxy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day trip to Barcelona, for our 25th Wedding Anniversary, and we couldn`t have chosen a nicer, more convenient hotel to stay in. Our room was on the 4th floor and had a small balcony with views over La Ramblas. The hotel sent us a big bottle of Cava which, unfortunately, I didn`t have time to finish !! (My husband doesn`t drink). The room was always beautifully cleaned and re stocked with toiletries every day, and was a dream to return to after a long day sightseeing. A very big thank you to all the staff at the Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Montecarlo for four nights in mid September and found it to be very well located, nicely appointed, clean, spacious, and to have very friendly and helpful employees. Upon noticing on our arrival that our luggage had not arrived on our flight, they took the initiative to take a copy of our reference documents and look into it for us. We received the luggage the next day. The staff was in a word, excellent, and they all spoke great English. They recommended great restaurants too! I agree with others' comments that the hotel should have a higher rating than 3 stars. We felt it was an excellent value for the price. The staff made a nice gesture to me as I celebrated my birthday while staying there, which they discovered from my passport, it was a lovely touch. This has absolutely nothing to do with the hotel, but please watch your purses/wallets extremely closely while in Barcelona, I had my purse stolen while sitting at Farga cafe (just down the street and around the corner) having a cappucino about 11:00 one evening, and in retrospect am fairly sure that the waiter there was in on it. Also, if you have time and transportation, I highly recommend a side trip to Roses and/or Cadeques, two charming coastal towns north of Barcelona. Sign me thrilled in Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for the buck!”
Reviews.Author: mwleejr
Reviews.Content: Based on all the outstanding reviews and moderate pricing, my wife and I booked the Hotel Monte Carlo for 3 nights before our cruise left from Barcelona. All the great reviews were right on. The biggest asset of the hotel is location. It is literally in the center of the city on La Rambla (the main street) and one block away from Catalunya Plaza (Center Plaza). The beach/pier is about a 15 minute walk south and you are in the middle of all the shops, restaurants and tourist sites. The staff was extremely friendly and knowledgable and gave us good restaurant suggestions every night. Like most of the hotels in Barcelona, the Monte Carlo is a smaller boutique hotels in a renovated building. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Although the carpeting and furniture in our room could stand to be updated, the hotel was a great value given the price. We stayed on the 2nd floor facing the street. The front balcony does have 2 layers of double paned glass which cut down on most street noise, but we did hear a little street noise, especially in the morning (ask for a higher floor). We were usually so exchausted from travelling that street noise hardly bothered us. The bathroom was newly remodeled and large for European standards complete with a Jacuzzi. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Montecarlo - Muy Bueno!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo for two nights in September 2005. It's located right on Las Ramblas - which is where you want to be. It's a five minute walk to the Gothic District - a great place to shop, drink and eat! The department store - El Corte Ingles is a few blocks away too. The hotel was very clean - we had a room facing the courtyard on the fifth floor. The hotel has a Solarium on the rooftop (the sixth floor, if you will) which basically consists of a bunch of lounge chairs and a great view of the city. The weather was about 78 degrees F. when we were there, but we'd rather tour the city then spend it overlooking it. The hotel staff was WONDERFUL. They all spoke really good English and were very helpful and informative about the city. I'd like to send a special thank you to Quique (short for Enrique) who gave us a few ideas about how to see the city in two days. He recommended the self-bus tour that goes around the city in loops - red line, blue line, and green line. You can get off and on the bus as much as you'd like all day long. It's 17 euro. per person per day, but I'll tell you it's worth it!! Definitely do the tour, it'll save you time and money. As far as the hotel restaurant, we didn't eat there. It looked very nice though. The hotel has internet connectivity in the room, but you have to have your own computer (laptop) and ethernet cable to connect. The bathroom was spacious and clean. If you want a good hotel at an affordable price in Barcelona - by the sites and sounds - and close to the airport (22 euro. from BCN), then the Hotel Montecarlo is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Eurpoe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Hotel Montecarlo for four nights. We stayed in seven hotels in Europe and Hotel Montecarlo was our favorite. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. They greeted us with maps and brochures about events in the city. The location is wonderful, walking distance to most site and the metro. When you step out of the hotel's front door you land in the middle of La Rambla. The energy on La Rambla makes it one of the most successful urban streets in the world. It is a great place for people watching, shopping and sipping sangria. The hotel room was spacious, clean and quiet. I love the crisp, clean, white, soft bed linens and the modern well designed bathroom. Breakfast was wonderful but a little pricy at 14 eruos each. I can not wait to return to Barcelona and stay at Hotel Montecarlo!

Reviews.Title: “The lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous046
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as the 5* hotel we had booked with were unable to house us for the night due to refurbishment. We were told that this was a "lower class" hotel so they booked us in to a suite. I am now astonished to read that Montecarlo is only a 3* hotel, as it was head and shoulders above the 5* hotel we had booked. The service was impeccable. The doorman came up to show us how all the mod cons worked, and we were handed a map and various leaflets about events and attractions in the city upon arrival. We were also recommended several restaurants (she wrote all the names on the map for us), and the Tapas restaurant that she said was her favourite turned out to be a treat. The room was utterly fantastic. It was cool and spacious, with no street noise whatsoever, despite the location on the bustling La Rambla. The room was stylish and sophisticated, with plenty of storage, and overlooked a pretty courtyard. We had electrically adjustable beds and electric blinds that were operated from the bedside. The small living room area was comfortable, and the mini bar was extremely good value (around 1.5 euros for a soft drink - as opposed to 5 euros in the 5* hotel we were in for the rest of our stay!). The best feature was the fantastic jacuzzi, a wonderful touch and very relaxing. The hydrotherapy shower was a little baffling but I wish we had stayed there a little longer so that I could have worked it out! I felt like we had our own little paradise amongst the heat and mania of the city, and if I were to return to Barcelona, I would without a doubt stay here. Great location, wonderful staff, fabulous rooms.... Book now!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Shelby Township, Michigan temporarily residing in Shanghai China
Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, just as the reviews indicate!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyDi95
Reviews.Content: From our first contact with the staff upon check in, our visit to the Hotel Montecarlo was nothing but the best. We stayed in Barcelona for 5 days after visiting Rome. I was in charge of picking our hotels for our trip and after leaving Rome, my husband told me I was "0 for 1". I hoped the reviewers were more accurate this time around. When we checked in at the desk, we were handed a nice map of Barcelona and several booklets on What's Happening in Barcelona. Both helped provide great ideas for our first visit to Spain. The lady at the desk also told us about other places to see (like Citges) if we had the time. She gave us just enough information to get us started, but not enough to overwhelm us. We asked for help with dinner reservations at a nice restaurant. We were not disappointed. The front desk staff was always friendly, very helpful and very responsive. Our room was very nice, decent size too. I was worried the La Rambla traffic and noise would carry upstairs to our room on the street. Not so. The windows are double paned glass so no need to worry about losing any sleep at night. The beds are very comfortable, offering a split, adjustable mattress. We used hotel laundry once and found our clothes were done nicely. This hotel is located right in the heart of La Rambla. It was a great location for all the sightseeing we did. It's close to the subway, just a few blocks up the road, and within walking distance to most of the sites. Don't forget to venture into the open air fruit/veggie/meat market called St. Josep La Boqueria across the street. We went there for a late breakfast and ended up at the Pinnochio bar for 3 hours. Great city, great hotel!! If you stay here, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Bang On”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 13 to15 2005. The staff especially SARA were very helpful by recommending tapas bars and resturants as well as going over the maps they gave us on tourist sites,The room was right on Las Ramblas and when you closed the sliding doors it was very quiet. The bathroom had a large jacuzzi tub with robes and slippers.The bed was top notch, and the room very clean and tastefully decorated.Icannot believe this is a three star hotel,Ihave stayed ingood4 and 5 star hotels that do not even come close to this.The price is very good for the quality you get. Just keepdoing what your doing well done

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest of staff , made our stay in Spain”
Reviews.Author: Carolannolan
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. Airy, spacious rooms. Everyone we met ( staff) were friendly, helpful and knowledagble of the area. They made our stay in Spain a very enjoyable and memorable one. The location is excellent, on Las Ramblas. For the price the standard is superb. Beware of restaurants on the ramblas as pricey and found to be a bit of a rip off eg charge extra for sitting outside, deliver beautiful tomato bread that you presume is complimentary and then charge for, would be ok if this happened once but all the time so so check your bill before paying. Back to the hotel, recommended gorgeus places for tapas etc and even surpised us with champagne in our room for our honeymoon. As a hotel manager myself , hats off to you all you are doing a great job keep it up. Muchas Gracias para todo! Maria Carolan and Martin Nolan

Reviews.Title: “Great Locale & Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with a friend for a week in June. We found the location superb and the staff to be professional and very helpful. The room was very clean and functional. While the bathroom was a bit small, the jet-tub made up for it and was great after a long day of walking about. On the otherhand, while the adjustamatic bed is also a neat touch, we found the mattress that went with it to be a bit too soft for a comfortable nights rest. There is a great breakfast place right next door, so probably best to forego the hotel breakfast. Overall I would highly recommend the Montecarlo.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo for two nights before departing on a cruise from Barcelona. This hotel is wonderful! The rooms were excellent, spotless clean, beautiful bathrooms. The location in the heart of Las Ramblas is fantastic. We would not stay anywhere else if returning to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: KohalaGal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo overnight, pre-cruise. We arrived frazzled after a harrowing day of cancelled and rearanged flights, unknown whereabouts of our luggage, and close connections, having started the day before in Hawaii. The Hotel Montecarlo was a welcoming haven from the moment we walked in the door. We were greeted courteously, and in English, given a brochure on attractions in Barclona and a good street map, shown to our upgraded (complimentary) room, which fronted on Las Ramblas, and were oriented to all the gadgets, switches and operating systems in our well equiped and comfortable room. While we appreciated the clean lined modern decor, the polished hardwood floors, and the excellent soundproofing, we adored the huge, luxurious bath. The round jacuzzi tub was plenty big for two, the appointments were lovely with lots of marble and very high end fixtures, and the toiletries were great. Towels were huge, fluffy, and plentiful. After a nice soak, we were ready to see a bit of Barcelona before bedtime, and were given some good suggestions by the front desk staff on restaurants and cafes in walking distance, the location (secure, well lighted, and very close to the front door) of an ATM, and sent on our way. After a quick, but very tasty dinner in a nearby cafe, we returned to our room for some much needed sleep. The beds were extremely comfortable. All the linens were very high quality, and the craftmatic adjustable beds (in perfect working order) had down pillows. The only problem was keeping the beds together - they were made up as a king, but were actually two singles and kept sliding apart. There were individual reading lights and plenty of storage space. My biggest regret was that we were only there for one night. The staff was uniformly gracious and helpful, going so far as to find out, on the internet, which pier our ship was docked at, finding us a cab, negotiating the price, directing the driver to the correct pier, and loading our luggage. In addition, they had secured our luggage for several hours after check out time in order to allow us to do some additional sightseeing in beautiful Barcelona. If we ever go back to Barcelona, we would certainly return to the Hotel Montecarlo for the comfortable, well appointed rooms, and most of all for the helpful, caring, gracious service and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Jonce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent her 30th Birthday at the Hotel Montecarlo and we cannot recommend it enough. We were so well looked after by the staff and nothing was too much trouble. The solarium on the 6th floor (hardly used by guests) provided a lovely view of the Barcelona skyline. So many little touches helped to make our 3 night break perfect. Thanks again for the cava for my wifes birthday!

Reviews.Title: “If in Bacelona, you must stay in hotel Monte Carlo!! ”
Reviews.Author: carlosi_h
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to the Caribbean, Mexico, London, Paris and extensively in Spain, and we have never been so impressed with a hotel. This hotel is rated 3 stars but their huge rooms (even by American standards) have features of 4 and some 5 stars. Located in the heart of the city "Las Ramblas" you will get a GREAT VALUE for your money!!! ALL THANKS TO TRIPADVISOR REVIEWS!! This was our very first time using this reviewer’s service. Our double room was modern and spacious. It had as comfortable a bed with dual remote controls allowed either of us to raise or lower head and foot positions for sleeping, reading, or television viewing. The bath featured attractive salmon-colored marble tile, a wood veneer ceiling, full size tub with shower and whirlpool, and bidet. Matching bathrobes and slippers added an accent of luxury. There’s also a rooftop “solarium” with chaise lounges and a view of Las Ramblas below. Free Internet access is available at a computer just off the reception area adjacent to the lounge. More extraordinary than the amenities, however, was the service. Everyone we met was pleasant, friendly, and quick to smile. They provided excellent dining, and tourist planning suggestions. While we were able to handle most matters in Spanish, every one of their staff was able to switch to English easily and spoke it exceptionally well, they all speak Spanish, French, English and local 'Catalan' as you will find out in most places of this impressive city. If you stay here make sure to go to nearby Ciudat Comtal (Bar and Restaurant) for great Mediterranean food, fresh seafood and tapas. Also, take the tourist tour bus and make your visit Poble Espanyol and most of architect Antonio Gaudí's landmarks (Sagrada Familia, Casa Batllo, La Pedrera, Parc Güell, etc.). We will make sure that all of our friends, co-workers and relatives that want to travel to Spain go to the unbelievable Barcelona and ONLY stay in this incredible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KimandMartin
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our honeymoon in Spain. Our first 2 nights were in Barcelona at the Montecarlo. I must say that this is an outstanding hotel. I travel alot in the States on business and have traveled enough in Europe to know that the room we stayed in was unbelievable. A jacuzzi tub that REALLY IS large enough for two people. The waitstaff was pleasant and helpful on our questions about the city. The location is great. Just west of the cathedral. This is worth every single penny I spent and highly recommend the hotel!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: karenire
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel at the start of my honeymoon this May based on what I had read in Tripadvisor. Having looked at the website I e-mailed the hotel to find out about making a booking and mentioned we were starting our honeymoon... I received an e-mail giving me a discount on their top room -Making it cheaper than the one I was going to book! When we checked in, we received champagne and strawberries and a congratulatory note from the staff.
