The hotel itself is at the top of Las Ramblas which is a perfect location - there are lots of shops, restaurants and bars nearby. The open top tour bus routes both run from the top of the road and there are about three metro stations on this street. Our room was a suite which had a jacuzzi bath and a steam and sauna shower - It was great when we worked out how to use it! The beds are remote control comfort beds and were amazingly comfortable! The staff were friendly and very honest - I actually received a call having left the hotel about a top I had left behind beside the bin in a plastic bag to throw away... I would definitely recommend this hotel to any one...

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: gibbscr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights prior to a cruise. Excellent location with great security. The front entrance doesn't open unless the front desk sees you on closed circuit TV. As with most US tourists, we arived in the morning before 10am expecting a wait for our room. Not the case here, we immediately were shown to a very clean comfortable room in the back (quiet) section of the hotel. Push a button next to the bed and the room is instantly blacked out. What a great feature for tired travelers. Good price and excellent helpful front desk staff. I'd recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: booked the hotel after reading up on it in tripadvisor.com. I booked direct with hotel who answered e mails quickly. I asked for a quiet room and was given one. It was at back of hotel and the view was of a wall - however we got the peace and quiet we asked for. There was a bit of noise on our first night May 29th from other guests but for the rest of the week the room was pretty peaceful. There was a quiet rumble from the Metro trains every few minutes but with aircon on it was not that noticeable although did take a little getting used to. We had a Gracia room on Floor 1. Gracia rooms have a small sitting room attached with armchairs, CD player and TV. Beds were comfortable and the bathroom was luxury with a superb shower and separate jacuzzi bath. The front desk staff were friendly, polite and more than helpful. They spent ages helping my son find a skateboard shop in Barcelona! We were careful and had no problems with pickpockets. They are around but then so are the police who were constantly patrolling Las Ramblas/Catalunya. We walked miles and travelled daily on Metro and had no problems. Just keep on guard. For a 3 star in a super location this hotel is to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best 3 Star Hotel in Barcelona, Spain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple who are our friends stayed at the Hotel Montecarlo, 124 La Rambla, Barcelona, Spain in May 2005. This is absolutely the best of the three star hotels we have stayed at. The rooms were spotless, and more spacious than we expected. The staff was very friendly and helpful which helped to ensure that our stay in Barcelona was exceptional. I personally would have rated this a four star hotel. It was better than some of the four star hotels we have stayed at in the U.S.A. The hotel is located in the upper section of La Rambla which put us in just about the center for attractions and activities. We definitely will stay at the Monte Carlo on our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Montecarlo is Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: KJP_52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montecarlo May 22, 2005. I chose this hotel after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor. I must say they were right on! The location of the hotel can't be beat if you want to be in the heart of LaRambla with convenient access to the metro and buses, as well as walking distance to major tourist sites. The room was excellent, very modern (well suited for business travelers as well as vacationers), very quiet, and I absolutely loved the plush, adjustable bed. The jetted bath was heavenly after a long day of sightseeing, and I especially liked the bath products (including premium bath salts for the tub). I was somewhat worried about the room because the hotel could not guarantee non-smoking. The room was free of any trace of cigarette odor. The bi-lingual staff was extremely accommodating, friendly, and knowledgeable. To top it off, the room rate was reasonable compared to other properties in the area. This was a very good find, and I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels we have stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: wolfatlga
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay before our cruise to adjust to the new time zone and was very impressed. Our room overlooked Las Ramblas, very comfortable and quiet, there were two glass sliding doors to block out the noise and the beds were adjustable for a great nights rest. The bathroom we took pictures of, a two person whirlpool and was divine after a long flight. The staff was great, free internet to send our emails, the morning breakfast was not to be missed, the location was great and we even found a restaurant called the Attic, a couple of doors down on the same side of the hotel that had early supper times...for us Americans...the menu was in English. The hotel is owned by a family for 60 years as we were told and you could really tell the pride they have in this great jewel of a hotel...the staff made us feel very welcomed...will be there again if we are ever in Barcelona...

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Finish To Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravellers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have used this website to plan several trips and I have never taken the time to write a review but have to share our experience at the Hotel Montecarlo in Barcelona. After a long day of traveling from Costa Brava, a hike around Montserrat and the adventure of returning a rental car into downtown Barcelona during Friday rush hour we arrived at the Hotel Montecarlo. We had our backpacks on and looked quite disheveled from the day to say the least when we arrived at the Hotel. The Hotel staff from the moment we stepped in until we had to leave on Sunday morning treated us better than any of the previous Hotel stops where my wife has "Diamond" status. They were aware that it was the last couple of nights of our Honeymoon and after we returned from a walk of La Rambla we were surprised by a bottle of Champaign in our room. We were given room #311 facing La Rambla with a great balcony with virtually sound proof doors to close out La Rambla or let it in, an incredible Jacuzzi tub, and a soft, comfortable, individually adjustable bed. Great Location, Perfect Hotel, Perfect Staff! Thank you so much for the best end to our two week European Honeymoon! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine, service and location are not fine”
Reviews.Author: lbagot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and first, you need to know that La Rambla is kind of grungy - it's like a street fair and not quaint at all. Our room was fine albeit small and the common space is rather nice, but the service was lacking, if not plain rude. Our room was next to very loud tourists who were screaming and what sounded like running around the hallway at 4am. When I called the front desk the next day to request a room change, they reprimanded us for not calling in the middle of the night and reporting the incident, when in fact, we had. I was genuinely surprised by the abrupt and impatient tone of the front desk staff. They were not particularly sympathetic, apologetic or accommodating. I would never stay at Hotel Montecarlo again and would discourage any one I know to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Montecarlo is located in the heart of where the action is - La Rambla. Easy walk to many places. The staff of the hotel were superb during our stay, and the room was modern, clean, well appointed and very quiet. I can highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Alligro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a whirlwind trip in Europe that started in Barcelona and ended in Rome. The Montecarlo was our first stop and was outstanding. The location is perfect and the staff is the nicest in Europe. In fact, much nicer than the staff of our SilverSeas cruise that we met in Barcelona. The rooms were simply lovely and very clean. We had room 301 with a balcony overlooking Le Rambla...spectacular! The staff helped us with our quest to see all of Barcelona in 3 days and did a great job in getting us to fall in love with this beautiful city. Every recommendation was perfect. We want to return to Barcelona soon and when we do, we will definately stay at the Montecarlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Where not to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel Montecarlo is very comfortable with a big jacuzzi bath and if you are lucky to get a view a good view of Las Ramblas. It´s a shame the same cannot be said of some of the staff. I booked a stay of 4 days in the hotel and discovered late on the second night that my pyjamas had disappeared. Apparently they had been scooped up when they changed the sheets. When I asked when they might find them the next morning they said they would send them on to me and there was no apology, implying it was my fault for having pyjamas. They obviously thought I should make do without when it was hardly my fault that they had disappeared! When they hadn´t appeared that evening I said that that was not good enough so they eventually gave me 30 euros to buy some more. It took them 48 hours to find them (I got them as I was leaving). The pyjamas were returned without apology, unlaundered and the pair that I had bought were taken off me! If you add that experience to fact I had to request refills of soap and tissues, the bed didn´t work (it was supposed to move like a hospital bed) and the water that came out of the taps was brown, it´s hardly the kind of service one would expect for paying 200 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Simply great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Montecarlo was centrally located, on the Ramblas and within easy walking distance of all central areas. We got the airport bus service to Place de Catalunya, and it was a short walk to the Ramblas and the Montecarlo is situated near the top end of the Ramblas. The room was large with a balcony overlooking Ramblas. Bathroom in particular was spacious with hydrobath and double sinks, toilet and bidet etc. The bed was electrically adjustable - perfect for sitting up to read or watch TV. Hotel staff were very helpful and polite. Gave us good recommendations for eating out and directions etc. If I was going back to Barcelona the only thing I would change is I would pre-book certain restaurants. The better restaurants are always booked, although you can get served later in the evening, ie around 10.45pm. We loved Barcelona and everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaHug54
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weekend break. The hotel staff were without exception, welcoming and very helpful. The room was spotless, spacious and had an extremely comfortable bed, We were not disturbed by any noise from outside. The hotel is ideally placed in the middle of Las Ramblas, 2 Metro stations a few minutes walk in either direction. 15 minutes from airport in a taxi. Didn't opt for breakfast at 14 Euro, there is so much choice and cheaper on the doorstep. Only minor grumble , no tea/ coffee facilies in the bedroom. Room service reasonably priced. Would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: Elke1171
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in February 2005 for a weekend city break after reading other TripAidvsor reviews. The location is ideal - only a two/three minute walk from the main bus and underground stations at Placa de Catalunya and centrally located on La Ramblas. The staff were very friendly and inviting on arrival and could not have done more to help. They even remembered our room number when we returned from our day out on the second day to hand us our room key. Our room was very comfortable and clean, not especially spacious, but they seem to have thought of everything as far as amenities are concerned (adjustomatic beds, jacuzzi bath, bidet, mini-bar etc.). We did not have a view from our room window, but we spent most of our time exploring Barcelona anyway. Breakfast was very nice with a good self-service selection and the staff would bring freshly-squeezed orange juice to your table and your choice of tea (they had a huge selection of teas) or coffee. Overall it was an excellent base to explore this beautiful city and we could not have asked for more for the price we paid. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LondonMichele
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean, quiet hotel with very friendly staff right in the centre of Las Ramlas. Couldn't have been a better location and good price too.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After all the good review, I was disappointed. Room was on small size, could hear elevator all night, loud group down the hall, great view of blank wall. Expected more for the money.
